REVIEW_TEXT: The staf and manager were very friendly. The property is very well located. The food was excellent and the spa was very clean. Also the guests were very friendly. It is a perfect place to stay and we will certainly came again!

Charming comfortable property located amidst vineyards on a ridge above Lake Constance providing a wonderfully relaxing stay, after driving through extreme snow and rain weather for several hours. An excellent experience and worth the stay, even on days when the Michelin starred restaurant is closed. When open, enjoying the restaurant further enhances the experience, as we know from prior stays

The hotel is in a magical setting, amongst apple orchards. The property is beautiful, and the owners are very gracious. The spa, for a smaller property, is extensive. I only wish that we had more time to stay there. Lindau, and Lake Constance, offer so much to explore.

Luxurious, beautifully decorated hotel with perfectly manicured gardens.  This hotel is larger than it appears.  The various wings are separated by assorted seating and dining areas.  It’s always easy to find a quiet spot all to yourself to relax. The gardens are exquisite.  An assortment of garden rooms with lots of seating areas including lots of chaise lounges.    Mrs. Fisher greets you warmly and your luggage is whisked away to your room.  We had flown in that day and drove a couple of hours and were hungry and tired.  Gorgeous weather, so we sat outside and enjoyed the best  charcuterie platter we’ve ever had.  After settling into our room, took our books outside to read on the lounges and ended up enjoying a lovely nap outside.  Dinner, be sure to reserve in advance, is…

This charming hotel breaths elegance and hospitality thanks to the personal attention of the owner and caring staff. Surrounded by orchards this hotel invites relaxation and peace.   Our room/suite was spacious and magnificent thanks to a lucky upgrade. Perhaps the upgrade was because our luggage was too heavy to cart to the second floor room we were initially assigned!  Regardless, we did not suffer with a small room & bath as another guest had complained about earlier.  Our room was quite the opposite.   The restaurant cuisine is excellent. Enjoy up to 6 beautifully presented courses for dinner.  The country breakfast is extensive with several egg selections, lovely cheeses & ham, smoked salmon and fruits.

This was a wonderful experience. It was our break between after the romantic route and continuing onto Switzerland.  The rooms are nicely appointed. The views are beautiful of the countryside. You look and just relax. The gardens at the hotel are superb.  The staff could not have been more helpful. The rooms were very clean. The food at the restaurant was the best of our 3 weeks in Europe.  I would return and recommend it to friends.

We have stayed in a lot of hotels, and the longer we stay in this one, the more I love it and that is saying a lot, considering that it doesn’t have air conditioning. When we checked in, they apologized for our room being small for two people, but it is very spacious. We have a lovely patio where you can sit and hear the fountain gurgling and the birds chirping. Breakfast is included in our room rate and it has been so incredibly delicious. It truly tastes like they pick the berries and serve them to your table. Every morning someone at the front desk helps me plan my day. The entire hotel is comfortable as well as beautiful. We have stayed all over the world, and I can say without hesitation that this is my favorite hotel. Just a 15 euro taxi to the island or a pleasant 45…

A lovely place near Lindau/Bodensee. the grounds were beautiful and inviting, surrounded by apple and pear orchards. The restaurant was excellent. Note that this is 'fine dining', and prices reflect this fact. But if you are in the mood or economics are of no concern, prepare to be delighted. We recommend!

We stayed here one night as part of a European road trip to celebrate getting married.  As soon as we arrived at the hotel we were blown away.  It is situated a short walk away from Lake Constance among the apple orchards.  We were greeted by Sonja who was very welcoming and friendly.  The room was very pretty but a little small especially as we had two suitcases so had to re-arrange the furniture to make sure we did not trip over in the night!  In the room there was a card with directions for a walk around the area which was lovely to do in the afternoon.  Food was excellent cannot fault it.  Very sad we only had one night here would love to go back.

This is a wonderful hotel.  Our room was beautifully decorated and very comfortable.  The restaurant is fantastic with a great creative chef.  Service was top-notch.  Loved the magical gardens —so peaceful.

Location in the heart of the city right next to Alster Lake and walking distance to major shopping & eateries. Stayed 13 nights in Deluxe Room which was large with walk in robe & luxury bathroom, separate bath & Walk in shower. Beds were very comfortable & the room was spotless I would rate this as a 10 star Hotel, if there was such a rating. My only request would be to also add drinking chocolate sachets as not everyone drinks either tea or coffee. All staff were amazing, courteous, friendly & always greeting with a smile from Reception to room servicing staff & the front porters. The room has individually controlled air-conditioning, which was beneficial in the heat wave & humidity experienced in July 2022. When staying for a longer period, try to negotiate a better than standard room charge as it is a high class Hotel with room charges accordingly. It is definitely worth treating yourself to some luxury.…

I have never felt more welcome at a hotel/restaurant. From the greeter and security at the front door, to the maître D, to wait staff. The service was spectacular and a dinner we will never forget. Even though we were casual and underdressed, we received a welcome like kings. The food was excellent, best filet mignon e I have ever had, perfectly grilled, crispy yet medium on the inside. Can’t wait to go back. Thank you from the bottom of our hearts!

we stayed at this Hotel at the end of July,2022 we enjoyed it, the rooms very clean, the housekeeper always there when we needed them, the front desk offered the help we asked for, the only remarks will be concerning the variety of the room service menu but we can understand it and always has something to do with COVID-19 but still the Hotel it the middle of the city and there is a plenty of restaurants in that area, definitely we will stay at this hotel in the future,

Best hotel in Hamburg. From front desk to room service, from doorman to restaurant metre. Fantastic people. Best products used such as olive oil, lavatory amenities etc, nice room sizes and categories, the best location, I just love this hotel and use it for more than 10 years. German excellence and durability

Great attention from the team, the location is fantastic with a wonderful view. The room was lovely, very comfortable and clean. The food was great, and we had a tight agenda that was perfectly managed. If you have time, you should visit the terrasse.  All was perfect !

The Fairmont Four Seasons(Vier Jahreszeiten) is a stunning hotel in a perfect location to explor Hamburg. Our room overlooked the internal lake and was easy walking to all the shopping areas. Beautifully maintained and huge! Breakfasts were a treat! The public areas are stunning and the floral arrangements are Instagram material! We ate in the Bistro twice as the meals were so good. Perfect schnitzels! Staff 1st class

Good experience in general. However my taxi was stolen. The doorman did not engage with the taxi drivers called by the hotel and left the guests to organise themselves. I waited in a queue while others pushed in. I had to call an UBER which was stressful as I needed to catch a flight from the airport.

It is Germany’s Number 1 Hotel and also my “go-to” hotel in Germany and in all of Europe for exquisite service, attention to detail, excellent food & drink, and sheer beauty of the Hotel and it’s locale.This American and also German gives a 10

This was a one night stay for the two of us, between short cruises.   We arrived far too early for our room to be ready, and were delighted to be welcomed so warmly by Herr Esposito at the front desk, who not only assured us it was no problem, but also immediately invited us to the breakfast restaurant to start our day.   I must mention what was probably the best breakfast I have enjoyed at any hotel: the food and the outstanding service there set the tone for the rest of our short stay... Superb.   We were lucky, as our junior suite was upgraded to a beautiful full suite, which, together with the exceptional personal and friendly service made us feel that we were treated like royalty.   Some examples of the great service from various members of staff: happily offering to clean some marks from my wife's shoes, providing advice tailored to our interests for walking around the parks and the locality, the restaurant staff with their brilliant anticipation and their recommendations and offering to "find anything not seen on the menu" at breakfast and dinner, and some maids who were happy to guide us to where we needed to be in the hotel. All of this was delivered with a smile and in impeccable English (my German is not as good as it should be!)   Being brought a bowl of strawberries with with our drinks on the rooftop terrace was an unexpected treat, too.   Our suite, the restaurants, bars and the public areas were all extremely clean, tidy and well-presented. The ambience was that of traditional refined luxury in a truly grand hotel.  Overall, a most impressive hotel, in a very well located and beautiful building, staffed with with delightful people who care about their guests.   Vielen Dank to all of those who looked after us so well. We have recommended you to our family and friends, and we shall make a point of returning when we are next in Hamburg.…

Wonderful and attentive staff who were very helpful and engaging. Very clean and attractive hotel located in the downtown area near the lake  Evething was a great place . and many activities and restaurants

Fabulous service. With such attention to detail and full respect for clients. They really do everything to make our stay memorable.  Once you stay there, you realize what is a real luxury hotel with a royal service.

Attentive staff and a classy atmosphere in a superb location. One of the few remaining hotels that deserve the title Grand Hotel. Starting with attentive doormen through to every room-service member serving with pride

A truly fabulous hotel with a superb choice of restaurants excellent cuisine and friendly staff who all went out of their way to make our stay more comfortable and enjoyable. The rooms have been refurbished and stylish making or stay really enjoyable.

We greatly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Vier Jahreszeiten and will definitely be back. Location is superb, staff is attentive and the hotel beautifully kept. In this hotel they certainly are mindfull of all details, which in my opinion the luxury lies in, and the rooms are very tidy. Breakfast in the room and downstairs at Condi were both equally delicious, which is not always the case with in-room breakfast. This hotel also has great restaurants and you can have a beautiful evening tea at the lobby bar. We greatly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Vier Jahreszeiten and will definitely be back. Location is superb, staff is attentive and the hotel beautifully kept. In this hotel they certainly are mindfull of all details, which in my opinion the luxury lies in, and the rooms are very tidy.…

Great staff and attentive staff that were very helpful and engaging.  Very clean and quaint hotel that is located in downtown area close to  lake and many activities and restaurants.   I did not use the bar or  restaurants during my overnight stay.

We know this excellent hotel well and utterly enjoyed it in the past. This time was different. Allready when booking (we speak native german) misunderstandings and a not so capable nor motivated lady on the phone. Well we booked a QUIET (our request) junior suite. But they gave us the worst possible room on the third floor above a big marriage celebration. Until 2 o'clock in the morning bouncing in our beds. Night and day reception and guest relations manager apoligized, since they admitted the mistake, our requets was in the reservation. How is this possible we asked oourselves, there was no answer.....Damage management; first a bottle of champagne, then some refunding but offcourse all too late. And a bit like a 'protocol', we would have liked a more personal approach and an…

Spent some wonderful days over Christmas at this beautiful hotel.  It’s an amazing hotel in a great location that also offers some excellent dining options.  The staff had a great eye for detail and was very friendly and attentive throughout our stay.  Highly recommended!

Loved this hotel, the service, the spa treatment, the food, the Christmas decorations, like a fairytale! Perfect locations, good restaurants, very sweet parkering service staff.  The best hotel experience ever.  We will som be back, that’s for sure:)

I had a great experience in such a lovely hotel. It was amazing to stay in these two nights in there. From the first moment I had the phone call with the reservation guy until the last second l left this hotel with the help of valid guy to get my car ready Was all amazing And perfectly managed. Thank you so much for the great hospitality.

Returning to HVJ after a very long time (last time with my parents as a child). Lovely 2 night stay over very busy weekend. Hotel is superbly located in the heart of the city overlooking Inner Alster Lake, with walking distance to upscale shopping, Laeizhalle concert hall and many sights which is very convenient. Very old-worldly elegant (not stuffy), but cozy decor, hotel really has a sense of place and is spotlessly clean. Front desk, concierge, room service, breakfast team, all super efficient and super nice despite very busy weekend and full occupancy. Only little point for criticism: doorman could have been a little bit more proactive in helping with unloading car/luggage. We will return for sure when in Hamburg next time.

Fantastic modern hotel in an amazing location. The staff are exceptionally friendly, helpful and kind. The room and facilities are fantastic with lots of lovely little touches.  We were greeted with a bottle of champagne in our suite. The food without exception was superb, down to the fruit provided in the room. Despite the hotel appearing very busy, service was always exceptional in all areas with a smile.  The location at the lakeside was stunning with just a few minutes walk to the city centre. We couldn’t recommend more highly and will definitely be back.

i visited fontenay many times and i would say they sre best hotel in germany and hamburg i am really happy always to stay in this property  everything is perfect in this hotel nice spa big rooms  and very friendly staff

When we booked for this modern hotel near the lake, I was under the impression we would be getting a lake view.  I'm still not sure why it didn't happen: guess we were not "high enough" priority. The room itself was nice, clean; had complementary mini bar which was a nice touch. Reception people were friendly and showed us to the room.  Floor to ceiling windows for what view there was.

love the architecture the spa the pool roomservice. there is nothing to complain about this property. Fascinating interiors all with the best materials. High tech but easy to understand. love the wooden floors- no smelly carpets.... cant wait to return

Although my husband and I decided to stay at the Atlantic during our Hamburg trip, we went to the Fontenay for a tea break. It was just lovely to sit on the terrace, overlooking the Alster, having our tea and a very good crème brûlée. HOWEVER, when it came to paying, we struggled to get the waiting staff's attention, and then, after 15 minutes have passed, we just lost patience, left money on the table and left.  The tables were about 50% occupied.

A contemporary hotel in a perfect location. The rooms are spacious, well-decorated with all necessary comfort. If the welcoming wasn’t of the warmest, the bar’s food was delicious with a special mention for the vegetable bowls. However, one of the main problems, was the spider overpopulation. There were hundreds of them wandering on the balconies, moving through their spiderwebs while customers were eating and drinking. Corona measures were well-respected and the fitness center had a wonderful equipment. Professional but failed to create a welcoming and heartwarming atmosphere. Breakfast was a huge disappointment as microscopic portions were served. As a conclusion, the Fontenay hôtel is great place which stills need a few improvements.

We had to leave one day early for good reasons. The hotel management insisted that we should pay the full amount for the cancelled day - including breakfast - and explained that it was all because of booking.com who forced them to act this way?. Overall - a cold, sterile and rigid hotel experience. Hotel first and guest second. There are much better places in Hamburg

A relatively new hotel in Hamburg, just next to the Alster. No less than EUR 100m should have been spent on the hotel, and this definitely shows. Naturally, the hotel is also part of the LHW group and with good reason. The rooms are high standard and equipped with facilities we have not seen before (such as a special light setting in case of a cosy drink in the hotel room). What has stood out for us as a family is the pool on the 6. floor with stunning view of the city and the Alster. Also the coctail bar on the same floor is certainly worth a visit. Lastly, the hotel is located in a part of the city where it is relatively quiet, so although being in the center of the city, it is very relaxing to stay here. Highly recommendable.

Hamburg is a true gem. The people, the vibe, the beautiful architecture and water combine to create a marvel of North Europe.   I thought it could not get better and I was happy to find how wrong I was.   Situated on Lake Alster, the Fontenay is an architectural marvel that is underscored due to its beautiful neighbors. Luxurious with a comfortable interior, the Fontenay is a must when it comes to visiting Hamburg.   Thank you to the kind and professional staff for making my stay as pleasant as possible and I look forward to my return.

We spent a long weekend at the Fontenay for my birthday and consider it really first class.  Beautiful suite, very fair family offer for an additional connecting room. Service is great, top concierge and we loved the pool at the rooftop.   Only the service at the rooftop bar was not that good...

Stayed for two nights on a recent business trip to Hamburg  An all round first class experience, beginning at the check in and continuing throughout our stay. Rooms are very well equipped, and very comfortable. Buffet breakfast on ground floor is superb, dare I say, one of the best I have experienced. Bar area on 6th floor also great. Highly recommended for business or pleasure.

Really a top of the line hotel with a great location, staff that give you the feeling that they care and take time for you.  A short walk to the city.  The spa area is relaxing and a good intro to the day.    A great choice

Wonderful weekend break - visited the 6th floor bar for a super chicken Caesar salad in sunshine. Great views across the lake with all the yachts busy on the Saturday. Can see the fountain from here as well - good first place to orientate from.

Excellent stay with dog, nice rooms (lucky to get an upgrade to suite), nice surroundings and perfect location in Neustadt, nice staff, very good restaurant with delicious food and good wines, very good breakfast buffet.

Warm and welcoming! Situated in a quiet part of the City with all the great sites in walking distance. Everything was wonderful. The hotel had bags of charm and it was full of character, The Easter decorations were beautiful and fun. All services and amenities were perfectly in line with the status of the hotel and at no point did we feel any fuss was being made. We felt immediately at home and relaxed. The staff was wonderful, including in the Bar, Restaurant and Spa. Nothing was too much trouble.

we were in Dresden several times, this visit was the best mainly due to stay at Bulow Palace. Quiet location near to centre, service in hotel was just excellent, great breakfast, very good staff. Thanks a lot!

We stoped there (with a reservation) for the night while driving further for our holidays. The hotel, which is part of the Relais & Châteaux brand, is nice enough. However, I am not sure I would warrant is the Palais title: the outside, while nice, doesn't look exceptional in any way when compared with the surrounding: it looks like a big house - while the inside is modern and doesn't make you think of a Palais. However, it was nice, clean and well kept.  Regarding the service however, this is where my biggest issue lie. I've had the opportunity to visit several 5 star hotels so far, and this one was not was not on paar with most previous experiences - while they advertised valet parking, they did not provide this service for us - rather than offering to help us with our luggage, we had to ask for their help. No welcome drink either, and we're not asking for much: a simple glass of water offered during check-in would have been enough.  I've seen better in 4 stars.  The hotel restaurant however was very nice, and their tasting menu lovely. I would eat there again.…

A nice beautiful hotel close to Old town bit still quiet, very nice hauptstrasse by the hotel. Restaurant menu a little average and overpricy. Nice warm staff clean hotel and big rooms. Would love a more ekstensive room service I recommend the hotel

We stayed at the Bulow Palais in August of 2021.  It's a nice hotel but it's not really a five star hotel.    First, no one opened the door for us at our arrival and helped with the luggage (it would be unthinkable at a Four Seasons).  Second, the room was disappointing.   And when I thought of canceling my stay, they told me they would charge a 90% canceling fee: not for one night but the whole stay.  The general rule in the hotel world of "canceling 24hours Prior To Checkin To Avoid One Night Fee" does not apply to the Bulow.  So be certain of your choice.   I must add that they really tried to please us and move us to another larger room.  It was nice and quiet.  Nothing really luxury but it was fine.  Again, just not of a five star caliber.  On the other hand, the restaurant is very very good. Finally, the location is great not far from the old town (just a walk to cross the Elbe).…

We were lured into this hotel by Relais & Chateaux brand, but there are better options in Dresden. Charm of the old building is spoiled by oversized plastic toys allocated across lobby. Service is unfriendly – there is no concierge, waiters are not communicating in English, front desk is not helpful. We asked for booking at the hotel restaurant and were told, that restaurant is fully booked for the evening of our arrival and day later. Coming back from the dinner outside at 8:30 we found that the restaurant is empty, and fully booked only for early dinners. Nobody took care to check it and explain it for us. Breakfast was a disaster. No buffet, which can be explained by covid situation. But also no information what can be expected. Staff informed us on available options in German – and as we don’t speak German, it was the worst breakfast ever. We were given only one set of cosmetics in tiny containers on the day of arrival. Next day used cosmetics were not replaced. When asked, front desk sent us again one tiny set. Frustrated, I had to find the drugstore and buy shampoo and shower gel.  Next time in Dresden I will look for other options.…

A very charming hotel with professional service, nice rooms, delicious food, and a bar with a wine and cocktail list. Located near City sites and in a nabourhood with several restaurants. We are looking forward to revisit this hotel another time in the future.

It was a very agreable experience to stay at the Bülow Palais, in Dresde (Germany)! The breakfast was a party  ... ! The room very well kept; clean and cozy. Spaceous, also. Ans, Dresden was a wonderful surprise! One of the most beautiful places I have seen in Europe.  Unforgattable. Obs.: The Italian Restaurant just crossing the street  is excellent! ENJOY!

The hotel was conveniently located, quiet and fairly luxurious, if somewhat faded. We did not bother with breakfast as it was too expensive at 18 euros, but found a local bakery instead. Toiletries and fruit/water were provided, which were nice touches.  It was really unfortunate that during our time at the hotel the Covid-19 situation in Germany became quite serious,  which was quite stressful, and we felt we had to check out  a day early to get to Berlin to be nearer the airport in case our flight was cancelled. So our stay was tainted somewhat by this.  The staff were courteous and businesslike. Please, if guests say they have not taken anything from the minibar, can you take them at their word, rather than checking the computer? We were not likely to defraud the hotel in this way, given that we had paid, without complaint, for a night we didn't use.…

Our three days in Dresden were filled with exploration of the Atlmarkt, sites of WWII devastation, rebuilt classical sites that brought back the splendor of this baroque gem and trips to Meisen and the countryside just beyond the city limits.. We truly enjoyed our stay in the Buelow Palais Hotel and enjoyed top notch service, a good fitness center, and fantastic dining at the Michelin star restaurant on site.

We stayed at the Bulow Palais for 2 nights. It is an outstanding hotel in all aspects, including having a Michelin-starred restaurant. The location was excellent and the staff could not do enough to make your stay enjoyable. Our Jr Suite was very large, with nice, tasteful furnishings and the room, and the entire hotel, was immaculate.  The only downside was the very high cost of breakfast which, for its cost, could/should have been much more extensive. What was there, however, was very good. I would stay at the Bulow Palais again without a doubt.

My wife and I have stayed at some excellent hotels across the world and our experience at Bulow Palais was first rate - from the service and room accommodations, everything.  Given the price, it was a complete bargain.  Location from the city square is only a short walk and some of the restaurants within a block or two of the hotel are fabulous.  We can't recommend Bulow Palais highly enough.  I also want to thank the staff (young brunette lady) who promptly fetched a room-service menu for me - we ultimately weren't able to squeeze breakfast in the next morning, but the attentiveness and speed of service was quite notable - we didn't thank her appropriately enough on our hasty departure, October 6.

Spent just one night in Dresden at the Bulow Palais.  It is a true five star hotel with service and food to match.  The rooms and bathroom are beautiful and spacious.  Just a short walk over the bridge to the old city and with a number of restaurants in the area surrounding it, I also thought the location was perfect.  They also had AC in the rooms and windows that open, so your choice on creating a comfortable environment.  Parking is a challenge generally in Dresden, and the parking garage below the hotel with valet service was a welcome benefit (though it does cost 20. Euros).  Overall, it was among the better hotel experiences I have had.  Highly recommend this place.

The Bulow Palais styles itself as high-end, Baroque-style, romantic hotel – and it succeeds.  Considering how high-end the hotel – in its appearance, services, and amenities – it is an excellent value if you book at one of its special rates.  The hotel is located in the historic Inner Neustadt. The underground car park is 20 Euros, whether you use valet or not; street pricing is less expensive  My comments are on a Comfort Double room:  The bathroom lighting is rather dim.  The hairdryer is attached in a drawer. Toiletries are: 2 kinds of body wash, shampoo (no conditioner), lotion, shower cap, cotton tips/pads.  Make sure the shower doors are completely closed as water will flow out easily onto the floor since there’s no lip.  It’s nice to see there’s a grab bar in the shower. …

My wife and I had the benefit of spending three nights in beautiful Dresden, and our travel agency suggested a stay at the Bulow Palais.  No surprise that is rated number one of hotels in Dresden per prior TA reviews.  Relais & Châteaux Hotels are always nice, and the Bulow is no exception.  We arrived by train from Prague at about 2 pm.  Our room was not ready, so we were given glasses of champagne while we waited in comfortable seating in the nicely decorated and quiet lobby area.  Shortly thereafter, our bags had already been brought to our room, and we settled in.  Our double deluxe room 315 was quite large, with a spacious (to say the least) bedroom and beautiful large bathroom with double sinks and loads of shelf space, separate bath and walk in shower.  The shower…

The hotel's location is great. Close to the historical centre (15 min walk), with opportunities for calm walks by the river. The hotel is spotlessly clean, the room is quiet, with high quality pillows, duvet and bedding. We stayed in junior suite, which was large, with nice sofa and working table. Traveling in pair I would definitely appreciate one king size bed to two separate mattresses.   The staff at the reception was very kind, helpful and professional. 5star service without any doubt. We experienced the same professional approach in the bar.   The biggest disappointment is the breakfast. The service was very bad and the breakfast itself was one of the worst we have ever experienced in 4-5star hotels. The eggs benedict were definitely the worst we have ever eaten in our…

It is located in a quiet residential area, a 15-minute walk to the Old Town. Apart from its own restaurant, there are a lot of other options in the area. Because it was very hot, we preferred to eat at some local terraces, but next time, we have to try the restaurant as well. The personalised and friendly service was impressive. This is one of the few hotels that offers a secure Wi-Fi with a trusty password. Why others are lazy and offer either an obvious or no password at all, I don’t understand. The floral, upbeat decoration gives an optimistic, sunny feeling to the ambient. The bed and the bathroom were excellent. Exquisite breakfast.

An outstanding, family-owned hotel with 5-star luxury delivered by a very happy, helpful staff - the manager has apparently been there since the hotel re-opened a decade ago, and the whole ambience feels so much more personal and caring than a chain hotel. A fine building, superbly furnished and appointed in a mix of baroque and modern styles, it offers everything one needs for a comfortable, elegant stay - and it's not as expensive as equivalent hotels in more touristy cities in Germany. It's well located in a quiet street in the historic Neustadt area, but an easy walk in one direction over the bridge to the old town and city centre, and in the other to the younger, hipper quarter. And the hotel restaurant is Michelin-starred and deservedly so.

This is a small 70+ room family hotel of the highest quality  The rooms are comfortable and well equipped The staff are friendly and efficient It has been meticulously restored to emulate its former glory in an area that is being renovated to reflect to old pre war Dresden

We have stayed at The Adlon before but it has been a few years since our last visit. My husbands favourite hotel in the city, so chose for his 60th Birthday.  Our stay could not have been better. The main thing that stands out (apart from,location and hotel standard) are the magnificent staff. Everyone we encountered from arrival to departure were excellent. The friendliness and professionalism we would hope for in a top class hotel but rarely  find.  Certainly in Europe they are the best team of staff we have met.   Huge thank-you to the team in the lobby bar (wish I had taken more note of names but all fantastic) and the breakfast team, all helped to make our stay memorable.

Whilst definitely not the best hotel in Berlin the Adlon is certainly a classic and the celebs continue staying for a reason (the Rolling Stones where staying whilst we were there)  The pool was much smaller than we expected, the gym was very small with no windows, there were no in-house movies and very limited English language TV, but all those little inconveniences fade because the location, the building, food and staff are all amazing - we loved it.

We have stayed at this hotel before pre Covid and we were not disappointed on our return. Up graded to a street view of the Brandenburg gate was worth the wait. Room was beautifully appointed as usual. Breakfasts was outstanding each morning and we ate in the rooms overlooking the Brandenburg.A real treat. Staff were spot on. Great recommendations for meals Staff we dealt with were 1st class. For those who want the best go no further!

The room was fabulous. The service was great. The hotel lobby lounge was an excellent place to end or start the night with drinks and a snack. Obviously, the location is perfect right next to the Brandenburg Gate. And finally, the daily breakfast was one of the best buffets I have had in a long time. From my experience, the room for a 5-star hotel cost 1/3 of what it would cost in another major city.    Oh yeah, almost forgot the spa is amazing. Used the sauna, plunge pool, and hot tub almost daily.

We were visiting our son at University and spent two nights at this beautiful hotel. The service we received was impeccable,  everyone was friendly and accommodating.  The breakfast buffet was outstanding and delicious! We would love to return next time we are in Berlin!

I stayed here five nights as part of an organized tour, in a spacious room with daily breakfast included. The double room was spacious and immaculately clean; we particularly appreciated the separate shower and bathtub as well as the seat in the former (hardly any stand-alone showers in the US have seats). The bel étage breakfast area and meeting rooms are luxuriously appointed.   As nice as the physical surroundings were, what I'll most remember this place for is the fantastic location, right next to the Pariser Platz and the famed Brandenburg Gate on the Unter des Lindens grand avenue, lined with historic buildings, shops, restaurants and food kiosks. Public transportation is easy to get to, should one require it. Many superb historic and cultural sights are within walking…

The hotel sits in a prime spot in Berlin. I booked a room overlooking the Brandeburg gate and the views did not disappoint.  The room was spacious and well decorated, though did show its age in some aspects, such as the carpeting and the wood drawers. The bed was surprisingly lumpy and the linen not as soft as I had hoped.  Breakfast had a large spread of high quality ingredients, but quite chaotic and full, which is unsurprising for such a large property.  The service in the hotel does feel very German, for better or worse. No major flaws occurred, but it did feel a bit assembly-line like most of the time. No porter to help with the luggage when I arrived, check-in and check-out was quick yet impersonal.   Overall it was a decent experience, though far from a real 5 star…

Brilliant from start to finish. Fantastic location with underground station just outside, next to the Brandenberg gate. We had a lovely room very spacious. All very clean and well presented. Breakfast was brilliant. There was just one waitress who let the side down by ignoring my partner completely. Other than than all staff attentive, friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay again

Superb hotel - invited to hotel rather bizarrely by bluetooth! Cannot say in public if I stayed, but as far as to say - this is the best of Berlin. Keep up the good work entertaining guests and providing service second to none.

We enjoyed 3 nights at the Adlon. We had our adult daughter with us and we were lucky to have a connecting room on the 4th floor. The room was  really lovely with a  slight view of the Brandenburg gate.  Beds were comfortable and room well appointed. The breakfast buffet is one of the best I’ve seen. The concierge helped us with our dinner reservations every night and we enjoyed the lobby bar several times for drinks, coffee or a mid day snack. Location is great and everyone made us feel welcome. Extra special was our waitress at breakfast remembering us and our food/drink preferences!

HOTEL_LOCATION: Wilhelmstr. 34, 18586 Sellin, Rugen Island, Mecklenburg-West Pomerania Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: On 17/07 we had a booking for a night; we booked the suite that was show available on Booking.com We arrived around 23:00pm and discovered that the hotel didn’t find our booking and they were blaming us that we booked by booking.com why didn’t we book through their own website. We were driving all day and night just to reach the hotel to found out that the hotel didn’t have our booking?  We did the reservation for the room like 17:00 and if you didn’t have available room why open up for booking anyway? The old guy at the reception couldn’t speak English and we were trying to help them and he just said I don’t speak English then another lady showed up said why we look so serious/stress to us which unacceptable since we been driving 7-8 hours to get to the hotel that didn’t even have our booking by we had all confirmation and everything. After a while they said they had a standard room or something for us instead but we said we didn’t book that room why do we have to pay for that so we decided to leave.   Today 19/07 we got the email reply back that they admitted it was they failed that it was such a short notice. BUT that was long distance driving; burning fuel and waste of time and seems like the hotel don’t have empathy for us.…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Wilhelmstr. 34, 18586 Sellin, Rugen Island, Mecklenburg-West Pomerania Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: Spent 5 nights at this wonderful hotel in early April 2022 with my longtime friend - we try to meet once a year indulge in good food, wellness and good company This place is excellent - it's beautiful special architecture from times gone by has been carefully restored and made up to speed comfortwise. The food is absolutely to die for, which Michelin has noticed. The Spa area is delightful and just misses the "Dämpfbäder" due to Covid-19 The Beauty- and wellness department is a must. The professional staff offers a wide range of treatments and massages and is strongly and warmly recommended The staff is a bunch of kind, humourous, helpful and very professional people - and they make you feel welcome any time of day or night. I loved my stay and I will be back.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Wilhelmstr. 34, 18586 Sellin, Rugen Island, Mecklenburg-West Pomerania Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: - staff with excellent manners and very helpful - buldings with lovely views from all rooms (we had a balcony) - we had no time for the wellness but the areas looked very promising - breakfast was delicious with freshly made eggs or pancakes etc - nice bar with live music - overall a lovely place that we would like to visit again for longer and for using all the hiking options etc

HOTEL_LOCATION: Wilhelmstr. 34, 18586 Sellin, Rugen Island, Mecklenburg-West Pomerania Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: The hotel is absolute a five star hotel. Top professional employees, picked up our car and bring our luggage to the room, then parked the car at the private parking place. Lovely suite, clean and comfortable. The German breakfast buffet is top class. The swimming pool at the top roof is the best I ever have seen. The host came and asked us in the evening, if every thing was all right and asked what we have done to day. Nice, but the hotel kitchen for dinner is absolutely not a five star hotel worth. Chose other local restaurants and pay the half for the same quality. Sad because the hotel is absolute a hotel you should try.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Wilhelmstr. 34, 18586 Sellin, Rugen Island, Mecklenburg-West Pomerania Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: Ruegen is a beautiful island on the Baltic coast  about the size of the UK's Isle of Wight. Visitors to the island are still overwhelmingly from Germany but it deserves much wider attention with its beaches and facilities for walking and cycling. We were welcomed at the hotel with a glass of prosecco whilst the receptionist valet parked our car and took our luggage to the room.  We found that breakfast was a really good German buffet with a short-order chef to prepare egg and other dishes to order. Dinner was very good and is probably the best hotel dinner on the island with a good wine list to match. Service at breakfast and dinner was both friendly and efficient ( though one course was inexplicably delayed one evening). The pool, wellness and spa areas are very new and really excellent. It was just surprising that more guests weren't using them especially as the weather was wet on a couple of days. The room unfortunately was less good. It was a split level room with a comfortable bed and plenty of hanging space but the bathroom was minute  and the shower was micro- sized with doors that only half opened before jamming against the WC. There was a kettle and cups in a kind of kitchenette but no tea or coffee provided and the mini bar was not serviced for the last 2 days of our stay. We didn't have time to make a call to reception and wait for it to be sorted. WiFi is available in room. It is a strange system which we've never seen before but the main thing is it works. Overall, we liked the hotel and would go back there though I think I'd be more demanding in respect of the room…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Wilhelmstr. 34, 18586 Sellin, Rugen Island, Mecklenburg-West Pomerania Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: We arrived with small expectations, but ended up in a small paradise. The arrival was warm and welcoming. A fantastic hotel with nice rooms and fantastic beds. The SPA was great, I had a massage and that was heavenly. The pool was nice, you also have several areas for relaxing, both inside and outside.  I recomend this hotel to everyone that goes to Sellin, it's just perfect!

HOTEL_LOCATION: Wilhelmstr. 34, 18586 Sellin, Rugen Island, Mecklenburg-West Pomerania Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: On arrival at Binz train station we were collected by taxi to Roewers. Upon arrival at Roewers we were offered a welcome drink which was appricated after a train journey from Hamburg. Check in was fast and efficient and our luggage was taken to our room. We were then shown to our room ( Delux Double) and all was explained regarding hotel services and facilities.      Our room was excellent with a separate TV room and also a balcony. Bathroom was very modern with an excellent shower with Clarins products supplied.  The toilet was separate which is good.    The hotel is a true 5 Star experience on Rugen Island.    Roewers is an exceptional well run hotel. The staff are always helpful and courteous and help with all requests.      After each day experiencing Rugen Island we always made a visit to the Bar and were we had drinks. A big thank you too the Bar Girl who each evening served us with a smile and made our drinks.  The  Whisky Sour was fantastic    Thank You.    We arrived on July 6th and checked out on July 13th and what a wonderful experience We had at Roewers.   Upon check out we were driven back to Binz train station by there courtesy car.   Ps. We had our small dog with us as the hotel is Pet Friendly.   Fantastic Fantastic Fantastic …

HOTEL_LOCATION: Wilhelmstr. 34, 18586 Sellin, Rugen Island, Mecklenburg-West Pomerania Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: My brother, who has a vacation home on the island of Rugen, put us up at Roewers Privathotel in Sellin. Thank you, bro! What a wonderful stay, from the first welcoming drink to wonderful dinners and breakfasts.  Being located at the preferred Eastern area of the island, it is easy to get around the sights and beaches, of which there are many.  The island is connected by bridge to the mainland, so it is easy to get to.  Bicycling and hiking are the preferred modes of transportation and the beautiful landscape is made for it. And don't miss stopping at the many small restaurants around the island and eat fish in the many ways it is prepared here.  Our thanks to the wonderful staff at the hotel, from reception to kitchen staff to wait staff: Frau Roewers can be proud of these wonderful people. And on a funny note: the English translation of the dinner menu can make you smile, as the island was in (communist) East Germany until reunification, so English was not widely taught.  An example of a translation which made me smile: "Into brown butter preserved perch fillet and Fennelvegetables, to this cream of the cauliflower".…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Wilhelmstr. 34, 18586 Sellin, Rugen Island, Mecklenburg-West Pomerania Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: If we visit Rügen again we will live in Sellin, and well stay at Roewers.  The beautiful hotel sits perfect by the main street of Sellin. The welcoming when we arrived was very nice, and they followed us to the room, helping us with our luggade - which gives a pleasant arrival to the hotel.  The room is nicely set, and well decorated, the beds are comfortable. The bathroom is fresh and everything is clean. A nice touch is that, apart from cleaning and making the beds, they do a little extra preparing of the beds for night in the late afternoon which adds to the pleasant experience. The only thing missing would be an air conditioning system in the room. But fortunately it wasn't that hot when we where here.  The garden, where we spend our mornings after breakfast, is beautiful and calm. Wasting away in the sunbeds for a few hours, only to get up for a dip in the indoor pool, is very relaxing. The staff comes and serves you whatever you desire.  The pool area is just perfect. The pool itself has a swim SPA, several options for water massage. The sauna and show area below has everything you could desire - Finish Sauna, steam sauna, IR-sauna. A small cold pool and for some reason a plethora of different shower heads.  Breakfast has everything you could desire. Scrambled eggs, bacon and/or omelets are freshly prepared at your order. The outside breakfast area is very relaxing to sit in, and to listen to the main street wakening up.…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Wilhelmstr. 34, 18586 Sellin, Rugen Island, Mecklenburg-West Pomerania Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: Ostsee - Rügen was on the list since years to be discovered and we picked Sellin for the amazing Seebrücke. Rather used to the typical see - promenade - big buildings and flat afterland structure, Rügen was quite a surprise with its hills ending often on the seaside, green pastures and large corn fields. And Roewers fitted completely in the surprise aspect: 4 neatly restored villa's from start of the 20th centry with the typical and adorable Kaiserbäder architecture, decent and well fitted rooms, a service just to die for (this friendliness, hospitality and readiness to serve, I never thought this was possible in Germany). Add to this the fact that the nice weather permitted us most of the time to have breakfast AND dinner outside and an absolutely 1st class spa and pool environment. Personally, the icing on the cake for us were the dinners from chef that could beat Anatole from P.G. Wodehouse's stories in quality vs the asked price and the individual contact that Mrs. Roewers took the time to establish with her guests practically every evening. When we return to the Ostsee, it will be to Roewers.…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Wilhelmstr. 34, 18586 Sellin, Rugen Island, Mecklenburg-West Pomerania Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: I stayed for two nights in Roewers Privathotel. The room (or rooms) were large and convenient. Fixtures and fittings were not of the highest quality but very decent.  Service was friendly. The gentleman at the reception was outstanding. He gets the award for the best service in German hospitality industry during the 21st century so far.  We had one dinner in the hotel restaurant. It was a pleasant surprise. The food in Ruegen tends to be so and so but Roewers kitchen offered quality food. Breakfast is good too.  Overall, Roewers is worth a recommendation.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Wilhelmstr. 34, 18586 Sellin, Rugen Island, Mecklenburg-West Pomerania Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: we stayed here end of june 2013. our room was a superior room park-facing. the staff is very well trained and didnt fail to make our stay exceptional at any point. the rooms are clean and of great building quality.  location of the hotel is well within the enter of small town sellin. just 5 minutes walk to the sea and landing bridge.  gastronomy in the hotel is great. very highly recommended is the breakfast. overall we had a great stay and would recommend the hotel at any time.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Wilhelmstr. 34, 18586 Sellin, Rugen Island, Mecklenburg-West Pomerania Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: There are 3 or 4 stylish (beginning of the XX century) houses, perfectly renovated. Located near the main boulevard of Sellin, but with its own big garden and full serenity. Inside the garden there is a spa and wellness buildings, not very big but luxurious and quite sufficient as for this hotel. Breakfast is just standard as in 4 stars hotel, nothing special but robust and tasty.  So if you like to spend the romantic spa weekend near the center of picturesque and stylish Sellin - it's a a good choice. But if you prefer a big modern hotel resort or you like just the village or you are with kids - take something else. There was only one thing we didn't like - completely lack of tourist information in english, as it's almost everywhere in Germany. Though staff in this hotel speaks…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Wilhelmstr. 34, 18586 Sellin, Rugen Island, Mecklenburg-West Pomerania Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: Quaint and beautiful hotel on the island of Rugen in the baltic sea. 5 mansions from the turn of the century have been restored by the owner family into this truly beautiful hotel situarted in its own parc and facing the main Boulevard towards the beach front with the famous pier. The hotel features 3 Restaurants - funny thing was that guests can order from the 3 different menues in all 3 places... never seen that before! The tip is although to go for the half board menu that really is value for money - the chef only uses freh local products - they call it the "best of Rugen" Service in the Restaurant as well as the Hotel is very familiar and personal... what more can we say - we surely will go there again!

HOTEL_LOCATION: Koenigsallee 11 Entrance Theodor-Körner-Strasse 1-7, 40212 Düsseldorf, North Rhine-Westphalia Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: I was for business in Duesseldorf and decided to dine here. What an experience, the staff is friendly and super professional.   The food is excellent, healthy and tasty. Defenitely try the Lobster soup!

HOTEL_LOCATION: Koenigsallee 11 Entrance Theodor-Körner-Strasse 1-7, 40212 Düsseldorf, North Rhine-Westphalia Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: My wife and I visited around Mid-may. The hotel is very central, excellent location. The staff were very friendly and helpful,  and the rooms were amazing. We really enjoyed our stay  The only draw back is that it's quite an Expensive hotel, but it was worth every penny.  Highly recommend

HOTEL_LOCATION: Koenigsallee 11 Entrance Theodor-Körner-Strasse 1-7, 40212 Düsseldorf, North Rhine-Westphalia Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: I Spent 5 wonderful days there.  The first 2 days was through Amex fine hotels.   While I could not get an upgrade the room elegant and spacious.  The checkin was seamless and they combined the next 3 night stay seamlessly. They apologized for me having to change rooms for the last 3 days but hotel was full, i booked on points and the room as close by.  Except for the difference between a couch and chaise the rooms were identical.   I never walked around without being addressed by my name.  The maitre'd by the second day had my juice and coffee on my table before I could blink.  The dinner at the Duchy restaurant was superb.  I also enjoyed the little touches, where the minibar was filled during the day and no charges for the soft drinks consumed.  The living room downstairs just past the checkin always had coffee etc available to guests and their friends.   During my stay the tram line broke down and after a 4 km walk to hotel, exhausted, I found a plate of fresh fruit and pastries waiting.  I have stayed at other 5 star hotels in Dusseldorf, but this will become my go to hotel.  Lastly, it was a bit nostalgic as my late father who used to come to this city on a regular basis 50 and 60 years ago used to stay here to.   BRAVO…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Koenigsallee 11 Entrance Theodor-Körner-Strasse 1-7, 40212 Düsseldorf, North Rhine-Westphalia Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: My wife, who is confined to a wheelchair, just called (on a Sunday morning), the Breidenbacher Hof to ask if the shower in a deluxe room has a step. She was transferred three times and no one could answer her question. She was told that on weekends there is no one who could give this information, only on Monday from 10 am. And this is supposed to be a deluxe hotel? Ridiculous and shameful. We are looking for another hotel.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Koenigsallee 11 Entrance Theodor-Körner-Strasse 1-7, 40212 Düsseldorf, North Rhine-Westphalia Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: I was here for one night, visiting a friend, after a holiday and before returning home. Arrival was very smooth: left the car at the entrance, it was parked by the valet service. Smooth! Room: nice, nothing spectacular though, but good! Public places: well, very classic, but ok. Not outdated (yet).  Spa: very small, this is a city hotel, you don't spend much time in the spa, you use it after returning form a shopping trip, have a quick steam and a short swim and go for dinner. When i got in the steam room (late afternoon) it was not warm at all... Another client told me they had to switch it on... I understand keeping everything on, consumes a lot of energy, but: this is a 5 star hotel. When I go wanna have a steam, I don't want to wait an hour until the the room has reached the temperature... Bar: ended up in the bar with my friend. Had a lovely night here! Cosy atmosphere, and the blond waiter was so incredibly sexy. Had a gorgeous smile, even behind his mask... We hoped he was gay, but no such luck :-)) I hope they keep the place 'up to date' and don't wait too long with updating (was in the Steigenberger Frankfurt the night before, and that place really looked outdated...).  The 'living room' for instance, is a nice concept, but: that place didn't look very 2022.... Urgent need for a makeover. Breakfast: loved it!!! Very very good! And: this interior looks great! Light, very welcoming, nice view!!!  Location: the best.…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Koenigsallee 11 Entrance Theodor-Körner-Strasse 1-7, 40212 Düsseldorf, North Rhine-Westphalia Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: We stayed here on a one night stop over in Düsseldorf. We wanted a comfortable place to spend the night between to international flights. The hotel couldn‘t be more central just off Düsseldorf‘s fashionable and very expensive shopping street Königsallee. The hotel was part of the Capella group till just a few months ago - so you know the house is luxuriously furnished. There is a large and comfortable lounge for hotel guests, a beautiful almost decadent bar, a rather good restaurant called The Duchy (where we had the joy of being served by a very charming and funny waitress) and well appointed rooms. All good. Sadly we had a rather unpleasant check in. The reception staff who from the start came off as rather unwelcoming could not find our reservation. So they jumped to the conclusion that we had made some mistake. The reservation confirmation email on my phone they dismissed as somehow fraudulent. - Only after I got seriously irate they suddenly figured things out. They did give us an upgrade to a fabulous room as emotional compensation, so i don‘t want to dwell on it for too long - only so much: something like this should never ever happen in a hotel that has a 5 star rating. The rest of the experience was pleasant enough, so as long as you survive the check-in process this is a really nice place to stay at while in Düsseldorf. I would go back. …

HOTEL_LOCATION: Koenigsallee 11 Entrance Theodor-Körner-Strasse 1-7, 40212 Düsseldorf, North Rhine-Westphalia Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: Fantastic staff, service, facilities and room. Most hotels have an Achilles' heel but I didn't find one in this hotel. Everything was consistently of a high standard. Slightly a victim of their own success in that the restaurant, bar and lobby lounge are all busy. Highly recommended.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Koenigsallee 11 Entrance Theodor-Körner-Strasse 1-7, 40212 Düsseldorf, North Rhine-Westphalia Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: Every aspect at the Breidenbacher Hof, from valet service, check-in, stay, spa, breakfast, to check-out, is outstanding in terms of quality, service and thought that is given. Personal requests are met to 100% (in my case, some prep for a birthday). Despite the hotel being fully booked, you still have a feeling of privacy. An "oasis" in the heart of Düsseldorf. Thank you for a lovely stay!

HOTEL_LOCATION: Koenigsallee 11 Entrance Theodor-Körner-Strasse 1-7, 40212 Düsseldorf, North Rhine-Westphalia Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: I have never felt more and better taken care of than during my (short) stay at Breidenbacher Hof. Great Service for the customer is something many hotels put out as a vision statement, view succeed in making it happen. At Breidenbacher I felt every employee I interacted with had just one goal, making my stay perfect.  Thank you Breidenbachers - you are the benchmark!

HOTEL_LOCATION: Koenigsallee 11 Entrance Theodor-Körner-Strasse 1-7, 40212 Düsseldorf, North Rhine-Westphalia Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: I have to admit this hotel was far the cleanest, most organised from what I have ever visited. The room was large, very convenient with a very practical, spacious bathroom. The soap, shampoo was amazing. The bed and the mattresse was very pleasant. The room and overall the hotel was super clean. The staff was super friendly, respectfull and helpfull. I have to note especially the breakfast staff, where I guess the staff manager was extremely proffessional, she had everything under controll. The staff knows your name and has always a kind word to you. Whoever manages this hotel, I have to congratulate him. Very statisfied!

HOTEL_LOCATION: Koenigsallee 11 Entrance Theodor-Körner-Strasse 1-7, 40212 Düsseldorf, North Rhine-Westphalia Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: I decided to spend some days at this hotel together with my family during autumn holidays for 10 days and must say best decision ever.  From check in the employees very kind and professional always smiling and willing to help.  We decided to have dinner at the new restaurant The Duchy and wow!! , the food is magnificent!!!  The ambiance, decoration and taste of food was to die for but best of all is the attention to detail in the service you get from the waiters.  I specifically loved my entrecôte  steak and the chef salad I can highly recommend   Our table waiter was called Torsten , very lovely and friendly guy we really got on well.  We shall for sure be coming back to celebrate my wife's  birthday on 05th November!  The rooms are impeccable condition, and very very clean…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Koenigsallee 11 Entrance Theodor-Körner-Strasse 1-7, 40212 Düsseldorf, North Rhine-Westphalia Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: Pros - -Everything very clean -Large room -Good location -Friendly staff  Negatives  -Concierge wasn't very proactive. I first asked for a restaurant recommendation by the river and was told to go to the Grill House which was no where near the river. Second asked to book a specific Thai restaurant. It wasn't available which of course isn't there fault. But I wasn't given any other recommendations and just told it wasn't available. I would have at least expected them to offer some suggestions proactively.  - The Maître D' at the lounge/restaurant was quite rude. He wouldn't even let me up the steps until i showed him my room key even after explaining I was a hotel guest and was simply trying to get to room. He physically blocked my entrence. It was very off putting and not at all…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Koenigsallee 11 Entrance Theodor-Körner-Strasse 1-7, 40212 Düsseldorf, North Rhine-Westphalia Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: Beautiful hotel in fantastic location. Very quiet, superb mattresses, very good bar and outstanding service. Staff makes you feel very welcome. You must try the Restaurant in the Hotel (Duchy). We have been kindly upgraded to a suit which was very luxurious and spacious.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Koenigsallee 11 Entrance Theodor-Körner-Strasse 1-7, 40212 Düsseldorf, North Rhine-Westphalia Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: Pleasant stay with helpful staff in a great location. Good quality room with a lot of space and well arranged. Didn’t get a chance to use most of the facilities, but staff did offer to help arrange and make sure I was well looked after.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Koenigsallee 11 Entrance Theodor-Körner-Strasse 1-7, 40212 Düsseldorf, North Rhine-Westphalia Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: We spent one night here on our way home and wished we could stay longer! The staff were great and so helpful! The „Living Room“ area is really neat to relax and have a complimentary coffee or soda. Everything was very high tech and the safety protocol was excellent. The front desk staff greeted us by name and showed us to our room. We ordered dinner in the Lobby Lounge - it was awesome! My husband had the salmon and I had the spinach salad. We each got dessert too. Our server was wonderful and let us practice our German. We had the best sleep. My husband used the control panel to close the curtains and turn off the lights and the temperature was perfect. The next morning we had breakfast in the Duchy. What a nice restaurant. The breakfast included with our room was excellent and…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Koenigsallee 11 Entrance Theodor-Körner-Strasse 1-7, 40212 Düsseldorf, North Rhine-Westphalia Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: After 8 years since our first stay, we returned to the Breidenbacher Hof. Not much has changed. It remains superb. We stayed on the 9th floor in a wonderful room. Location is perfect for visiting shops or the Altstadt. This place has earned a very special place in our hearts.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Koenigsallee 11 Entrance Theodor-Körner-Strasse 1-7, 40212 Düsseldorf, North Rhine-Westphalia Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: From check-in to check-out it was a place unrivalled! The friendly doorman to the outstanding staff at the front office, the top-notch job of the housekeeping team, this hotel has the best service team in the world. The room was just perfect! They had a bath and a rain shower, not to mention the room had things you didn't even think of but had it anyway making it seem as if it's your own house! TIP TOP!

HOTEL_LOCATION: Koenigsallee 11 Entrance Theodor-Körner-Strasse 1-7, 40212 Düsseldorf, North Rhine-Westphalia Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: Absolutely TOP!  Everything was perfect. The room was very clean and well cared for. No threadbare linens here! The bathrobes and slippers also were gleaming white. For a Hotel that see many, many guests, I find that impressive. Even the little things have been thought of here - hardwood clothes brush and shoe horn, Iron and board - even an umbrella was provided in the room. I can unequivocally recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Düsseldorf.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Koenigsallee 11 Entrance Theodor-Körner-Strasse 1-7, 40212 Düsseldorf, North Rhine-Westphalia Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: After many nights in the main 5 star Düsseldorf competition, I decided to try the Breidenbacher Hof on a recent business trip.  Located directly at the Kö, it is very central but does mean that views are largely over busy streets or a non-picturesque (but quiet) inner courtyard. The superior rooms have an old-style luxurious feel, but the style is starting to look dated and the bedside electronics (lights, curtains, etc.) showed their age by not functioning on one side of the bed. My room had not been serviced properly at arrival, the showerhead was lying in the drainage (probably to remove smells - see picture). Not a great first impression, not very hygienic. Reception wasn’t interested when I commented on this. Considering the hotel is pretty much empty during Corona and does…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Koenigsallee 11 Entrance Theodor-Körner-Strasse 1-7, 40212 Düsseldorf, North Rhine-Westphalia Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: The hotel is very lov, very easy to get around, very stylish decoration, the rooms in my opinion are quite spacious. Breakfast is great, in terms of service, it’s just phenomenal. It is definitely worth returning!

Traditional, luxury hotel with very friendly, efficient and helpful staff. The lobby and restaurant/bar areas were tastefully and luxuriously decorated. The bedroom/bathroom was however rather dated, but huge and spotlessly clean.  We were touring Europe and it was lovely to stay in a hotel with such a spacious bedroom! Would happily return if ever in Berlin again.

The Regent Berlin offers a classy stay in a very nice area of downtown Berlin.  Refined and gracious, this hotel is also quiet and luxurious.  We enjoyed our stay and walked all over the city from this central location.

We stayed here from Sunday to Friday in early September on a city break booked through BA. We chose the hotel because of its location and recommended restaurant for ‘fine dining’,as they say on their website, for a nice evening meal. The good points were that the room was very comfortable and clean and the location of the hotel was excellent for exploring the city. The bad point was that neither BA nor the hotel advised us, either in advance,or when we arrived that the restaurant would be shut for evening meals for the full length of our stay and therefore there would be no ‘fine dining’ at the hotel for us ! We did not find this out until our second night when after a long day’s walking and sight seeing we returned to the hotel and tried to book a table. It was at this stage we found out that we would have to go back out to eat as we did not want to eat in the bar. According to the information in the hotel the restaurant is open from Tuesday to Saturday. Surely someone should have advised us of this situation as we would not have booked the hotel if we had know. Or maybe that was the reason we were not told ? Additionally the Spa and Wellness centre is not manned and rather unwelcoming being tucked away in the basement. The staff on the front desk did not seem aware of what services were on offer or the procedure for getting a massage. We did not use it as a result.  Overall a nice hotel, well located but with poor customer service and no apologies for the lack of facilities provided.…

Hotel itself is beautiful but feel customer service needs to be improved. They couldn’t meet our dietary needs on the first morning despite me emailing in advance. I emailed asking for the breakfast cost to be removed for the first day. This was ignored. When I asked about this on checkout I was told that the reduction would come from head office and we’d have to wait. When I queried this I was Interrupted and told ‘I know my job madam’ which I found to be rude and unnecessary. To date we still haven’t had the reduction. Disappointing for a 5 star hotel

A terrific base for exploring Berlin. Very well located for walking to Museum Island and great shopping. Many restaurants nearby as well. Our suite was spacious and so very comfortable Extremely  good  beds and linens. Great pillows as well, a rarity.  We had a beautiful marble bathroom as well. The food is very, very good. Excellent service as well. Cozy nice bar for dinner too. We enjoyed our stay very much in this beautiful hotel.

The staff and intimacy of the hotel along with incredible  breakfast service has validated our switch from the Adlon on all future visits .The location is ideal for all cultural interests which are in walking distance . This is not to knock the Adlon but a comparison . We plan on advising all San Francisco friends who are veteran travelers the book the Regent .

We were greeted at the entrance by friendly partiers and had a quick and efficient check in. The foyer is classic, luxurious and relaxing. There is a grand piano with a pianist playing from lunch time onwards, it a wonderful way to be welcomed back to your hotel after a busy day of sightseeing.  The location is perfect.  The breakfast is very good with full table service and your favorites made fresh by the chef.  The bar is inviting and has large selection.  The housekeeping service is excellent and they service the rooms once you have left in the morning so that once you return all is in order.  The rooms are spacious, elegantly decorated and all items in working order.   The only thing that could be better is to supply individual toiletries rather than large bottles on the wall in an inconvenient location. This I would expect in a 5 star hotel.  This being said they stay was highly enjoyable and the service impeccable.  This is a classic, charming and high standard hotel.…

My family and I stayed at the Regent in berlin for two nights in the last week of May. This is a very luxurious and beautifully finished hotel. The rooms were large and the bathrooms were very grand, with beautiful marble finish and all sorts of amenities.  The desk in the room is provided with an electrical outlet strip to suit all sorts of international plugs. That was extremely convenient. The staff at the reception were very welcoming and helpful. The location of the hotel was quite central nearly halfway between the brandenburg gate and the berlin dome. I will certainly stay here when I visit berlin again.

We booked this hotel last minute (due to a bad airbnb experience) and were very happy we did! The customer service we received was top notch- special thanks to Bul at the front desk for the fabulous upgrade. We also loved the location; very central and easy to get to all of the major landmarks yet very quiet at night. Thank you to Qais as well for the smooth check out. We look forward to coming back to the Regent.

Our room was immaculate and very well maintained. If we could give 6 stars for cleanliness we would!  Everything was first rate and well done at the Regent Hotel. Very friendly check in and wonderful twice daily maid service.  The interior is very traditional but very well done.  Great location for tourists  and fine restaurant in the lobby.  We couldn't find fault with anything and will return.

Amazing hotel!  So classic and beautiful hotel. The hotel staff are very helpful. Such a classic & fine hotel.  It feels like you are in a castle. The room is so big & clean. Location is perfect .  Don’t miss the five o’clock tea experience which is absolutely magical

Absolutely divine. So classic and clean and luxury and amazing. From the rooms to the tea room downstairs, the  breakfast, the spa, the staff. Everything was absolutely perfect shining and divine.  The break fast was amazing. The location of the hotel is perfect and the bike they rent out was by far the best bikes ever.  Everything and everyone was perfect. Thank you so much

Stunning hotel , flawless service, top location. Tastefull decor, mix of old world and contemporary .  Rooms tidy and super clean. Hotel employees went above and beyond. Always available and so helpful.   This will be for sure our forever hotel in Berlin. Highly recommended.

The Hotel has truly earned the prestigious award to be the world leading Hotel. Everything is just prefect, excellence everywhere without over-doing it it and that is the balance most luxury Hotels can not manage. Service is outstanding and you really feel welcomed here. If you go to Berlin, there is no other option than the Regent if you want to get the little extra.

We had a family reunion in Germany during mid November 2021 and stayed in three separate rooms at the Regent Berlin.  I am particularly impressed by the professionalism and thoughtfulness of the Reservations Team. I had numerous requests and they were most obliging. A smooth check-in after long flights from Asia and North America was very helpful.  Housekeeping was friendly and provided fresh fruit plates and a large bottle of Evian everyday. There is a coffee machine/kettle in the room as well.  Breakfast was included in our room rates. Buffet plus hot entrees (to order): eggs, side dishes, pancakes (the best), waffles, omelettes...etc. Excellent selection of fresh fruits. Very happy with it.  Windows can be opened and one of our rooms had a balcony.  Hotel within walking…

We've been coming to the Regent Berlin intermittently for a long time. This was our first visit "after" the pandemic and IHG's takeover of the Regent group and we are said to say that the hotel was not up to its usual excellent standard. It is still a very good, clean, safe, and superbly located hotel in Berlin with a great breakfast offering that we can recommend without hesitation, but there are a few issues with the service and room maintenance that we believe should be addressed to elevate the Regent back to its former self.  - Staff friendliness and competence varies across the personnel employed. Housekeeping did a fine job, yet forgot to refill cream each day without fault. Breakfast staff forgot to ask for coffee, did not present options for hot meals, and reacted in a…

The Regent Berlin is located walking distance from many of Berlin's must-see attractions--B-burg Gate, Museum Island, Memorial to Murdered Jews of Europe, etc. More importantly, it is first class all the way...the staff could not do enough to make our stay comfortable. We were with a small group of California travelers on a university alumni trip, yet we were treated individually with great (and friendly) attention. We had opted for the breakfast option, which is probably worth the $$ (you can eat enough to be able to bypass lunch). Rooms were spacious, comfortable, and well-appointed. Covid safety measures firmly in place; we felt safer in this hotel than our local Lucky Market. Also a special shout-out to the bar/lounge, which has a surprisingly diverse menu for late night or…

It was fairly quiet despite the Berlin Marathon but nevertheless the hotel was excellent. Our room spacious and comfortable. Breakfast fresh and good service. Reception and concierge all very helpful (and especially when we left something behind after check out!). Great location, 10-15 min walk from Branderburg Gate, easy access via UBahn or bikes which you can hire from hotel (E25/day) or locally (cheaper) or use Lime bikes which we did too.

The Regent Berlin is the perfect base for exploring Berlin.  Our 6 nights there flew by.  Quiet,  incredibly comfortable and elegant,  we will definitely stay here again. The staff were welcoming & professional.  One of the best hotels we've ever stayed.

Friendly and professional staff at this elegant hotel in the heart of Berlin within easy walking distance of historic and cultural sites, shopping, and restaurants.  Our family thoroughly enjoyed our stay here, especially our leisurely and delicious breakfasts where we were well looked after by Ergun and Malta. Florian at the front desk was responsive and welcoming. Highly recommend Regent Berlin.

We had a great city trip to Cologne and thoroughly enjoyed the Excelsior Hotel Ernst! Service was impeccable from arrival to departure. Food in the restaurants was at a very high level and the location takes some beating.

I am currently staying at the Excelsior hotel and here is my feedback so far. My full stay will be 5 nights I’ve been here 3 nights. 1.great location. They hotel is directly in front of the cathedral, 2. great service - everyone who works at the hotel has been extremely friendly and helpful. 3. Piano bar has great cocktails and service but overpriced with an average €20 + per drink, 4. The Michelin star rated restaurant Taku was perfect.   Now for the disappointing part - 5. the room has been sub par to say the least. The bed sits low, the AC is not cold enough, the room seems extremely dated even the nob on the sink is coming apart and the room is facing a building (other rooms). Additionally today Sept 9th there has been no water at the hotel. While they state it’s a street issue and It will be back in a few hours it’s now been over 6 hrs since my last check in and no water. The hotel is listed as a leading hotel of the world and while the restaurant and service have been great the rooms need attention and I would have thought they would have delivered a bottle water or something as a bare minimum to brush ones teeth.…

I've been doing the Eric and Deborah travel bucket list since my husband's passing in Sept. 2021.  Cologne was on the list of cities we wanted to see together.  I asked my friend who lives Germany to meet me there and headed to this beautiful hotel.  They are doing some minor renovations in the lobby, but the entire hotel is so elegant.  Our room was enormous and with complimentary breakfast and the proximity to everything in the city made it even better.  The staff was very accommodating and the food at breakfast was good as well.  I will return to this hotel when I travel back to Cologne and would highly recommend.

I cannot say enough great things about this hotel. The location was across the street from the train station and the amazing cathedral. We walked to dinner every night along with many other places in town to site see as well as shopping. The accommodations were very impressive. Our room had a walk in closet, a large shower and the walls were lined in wood. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. They had a great fresh hot breakfast with plenty of options for gluten free patrons. The bar was also nice for a night cap.

Aging, but offering timeless service. Unmatched position facing the Cathedral, this property is still the best in Cologne and indeed it represents a landmark in and of itself. Excellent staff, prompt service, spotless rooms, offer a very pleasant stay. .

Housed in a pre war building with the elegance and ambience of times gone, the hotel has all the modern conveniences and located just 2 minutes walk from Central Railway Station. Elehant restaurant, very good breakfast buffet, free mini bar, excellent service. You cannot expect better in Cologne.

Really enjoyed our stay at the Excelsior in Cologne, the service was excellent, the food was excellent and it was fun to spend Christmas away with a little luxury. As a base for exploring Cologne, you couldn't really go wrong with this property, would recommend certainly!

I was so looking forward to my trip to Cologne with my niece as we had to cancel from the previous year due to Covid.
