On check-in we decided to upgrade to a suite which was a very large sitting room facing the Dom, a large bedroom and bathroom.  the bathroom is in need of upgrade, it had a bath/shower combo which was very high to climb into, not ideal. A walk-in shower and separate tub would always be my preference. The wi-fi was patchy and not available in the bedroom, I had to ask for a plug-in hotspot for that room. The TV only had one English speaking channel, BBC News even though it listed various others, ITV etc. these were not available - I did mention this to the front desk but they couldn’t help.  The breakfast in-room dining was misleading, it did not mention that there was one inclusive price for everything. We ordered tea first in the morning which duly arrived (there was no kettle in the room) and later we ordered a basic breakfast of a bakery basket and cheese/meat plate - for this they charged 60 EUR (all inclusive breakfast price) however they also charged the tea service seperately at 19 EUR - I did talk to the front desk and they did reduce it by 30 EUR however not great value and to be honest, with a suite upgrade that we paid for it would have been nice if the rate included breakfast. Overall a disappointing experience which was a real shame.…

Stayed for 1 night, two adults and 7yr old kid, and booked via LHW. Overall - wonderful place, old-fashioned feeling and very warm, attentative service. Before coming, we exchanged a couple of communications via email and they were responsive and detailed.  Upon arrival we got triple upgrade - which I was really surprised, even we've booked via LHW / status tier. The room we got was amazing - very spacious, super design and unusual shape, with extra bed for the kid already arranged. Nice touches like free minibar and ultra quick room service with some home made sweets. Hotel interior was nicely decorated for festive season (also exterior as well, not just inside), with special attention to Ginger House at the lobby, where the kid got complimentary treats, as well as we bought back home traditional Stollen.  Breakfast was good and included for LHW members, yet the room itself was very dark, with dimmed lights, which perhaps is nice for a dinner, but looks strange at the breakfast time. Food was mix of buffet and a la carte, high quality and great taste (incl their specialty dish). All at all - great and truly luxury experience, a bit overpriced due to special season, but nevertheless a beautiful stay, well relaxed and enjoyed. Would stay again if in Cologne.…

I stayed apparently in a renovated room for a short night. Checked in at 2300 and checked out at 0630. I found the room NOT being in a good shape. Slightly run down, tiny shower, no single usage bathgels (in covid times), slight mold in the shower and incredible dirty air filters (see picture).  I dont want to know how it looks behind these walls if the guest can already see that….. The beds are far from being comfortable (at least my subjective feeling)  I am not a regular Cologne guest for the moment but certainly will not come back to this hotel. Way for improvement

Fantastic property with plenty heritage, great central location with Dom view and service minded, proactive and friendly staff. Breakfast buffet with huge selection of high quality food. We are already looking forward to return during our next trip.

St Bernhard was, as you all know, a Cistercian monk canonized as far back as 1174. A mystic and founder of the Abbey of Clairvaux, this notable human has been reincarnated at the Excelsior Hotel, Cologne. Crowds run to touch the hem of his garment, veterans kiss his shadow, the unfortunates hold out their palms in supplication. 'He lives! He lives!' Here is a 21st century Saint, a man who goes beyond the role of mere Human and transmogrifies into a living, canonized mystic. This gentleman, and his array of Lesser Saints is one of the reasons I choose to stay in this hotel. The service is spectacular. The rooms are marvellous too though there is one word of warning. I always pay the modest upgrade to a suite because, on the one night I stayed in a simple room, I found it a little…

We was staying at the hotel for the   second time, and found the same perfect and personal  service as always. The hotel is well maintained and elegant. We look forward to stay there again. Xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx. The hotel was, because og corona restriktions not the same.

I used to write copious, and secretly rather witty, reviews for this site which, erroneously I bet, then claimed I had been read by over 50,000 people. I am returning to the reviewing fray in a bid to get my readership up by one because, if nothing else, Joe Public must be made aware of hotels like the Excelsior. The derivation of the name is not, as some might suppose, a computer application of some use, but a verb, ‘excel’, to be damn good at something and the Excelsior does exactly what it says on the rather glamorous 1930’s entrance. It excels. It is damn good at everything. Aside from a slight misunderstanding over breakfast charges, the guilty party may or may not be another site or my own latent stupidity but I would have to describe this as one of the best hotels I have…

I like to start with the most important thing: the people (staff). Everywhere you look, smiling people. You literally feel welcome as a guest. A special thank to Ben, the young man who fetched us at the Cologne/Bonn Airport; the young lady with the dark hair at the restaurant. (Unfortunately we did'nt have her name, but obviously she had asian roots), and finally the lady of the room service, who brought our in-suite meals, as we arrived lately.  The room was very clean and decorated, even when some pieces of furniture already show up small damages of everyday duty.   The view from our suite was quite ugly. At our last stay back in 2017, we had a handsome suite with looks at the Cathedral - this time, we had a look at a office building. Surprisingly, our suite back in 2017, was…

This hotel could not be better located: right opposite the Cathedral.  Staff were more than helpful and, despite Covid restrictions everything worked well.  The room we had was superb and breakfast worked well.  A mix of table service and buffet.  Definitely as good as the best anywhere.

Not many historical buildings  in Köln happily this hotel is in tip top condition.  Every corner of this hotel is well maintained.  The restaurants were flawless and the bar/ lobby evoke an old world charm.  The staff was at all times very friendly and helpful.  I stayed in a Grand Deluxe Room (was happily upgraded) , well appointed and thought out.  While I was in the new(ish) wing of the hotel, you wont notice the difference as they have gone to great trouble to keep a continuity of style.   They do a great job of keeping the hotel safe and clean.  I highly recommend this hotel if you travel to Cologne (dont worry about parking as they have an excellent valet parking service).    In days of Corona there is plenty of choices when it comes to choosing a hotel, I would say that…

Restaurants concrete number of choices gives bigger guarantee for more fresh food. The Hotel is a Holiday for itself yoi could spent all weekend in it. Especially if you like slow food is excelent to have.

Stay away from this hotel if you have a choice.  The room we stayed in was outdated with worn out furniture. Carpet and drapes were dirty and the bathroom smelled bad.  We paid good money for the room but was told by email to pay extra EUR 378 for my wife; the second person 3 days before we arrived.  All the hotels I stayed at always assumed 2-person occupancy for a room.  This hotel is just too greedy!

The facade of the Excelsior hotel is part of the city landscape. If you are lucky to stay in one of the suites, you will enjoy an incomparable view of the Cathedral, If not, the experience is still worth it. From the friendly staff, to the elegant rooms, the stylish wooden piano bar, the great breakfast buffet, every detail becomes an unforgettable experience.

Beautiful hotel. Nothing is overlooked. Impeccable friendly service. Perfect location. One of the owners is always on the premises and accessible. Delicious dinners. Lovely patio dining. Gorgeous comfortable extensive public areas.

An elegant, refined hotel with a very comfortable room, with staff who go out of their way to provide great customer service and make the stay an experience to treasure.  We enjoyed dinner at the restaurant, and the food and service was up there with the best hotels. However the two sommeliers took it to the next level both with their knowledge of the wines on the list, and their service! They along with the bar and reception staff provide amazing customer experiences, and compliment the hotel beautifully.  The bathroom and WC are amongst some of the smallest I’ve ever seen in a hotel of this standing, and candidly for someone older than we are, the step up and down from the in-bath shower would be a challenge.  The WC was so small, we had to step to the side of the pedestal to close the door.…

I stayed at the hotel for one night. I found the staff very helpful and the little touches very nice. The spa is good too and makes clever use of the space.  The rooms are more traditional and some may see as slightly dated but everything was very clean and brilliantly maintained.  One quick note though is that the jacuzzi baths in the room need to be cleaned better. I turned on the jets and a fair bit of debris and bits came out. These need to be ran through with proper cleaning detergent regularly.  I would recommend the hotel to anyone looking to stay in Heidelberg.

This has been my third of fourth time staying with the Europaischer Hof hotel and everytime I return everything is always exemplary.  I enjoyed a wonderful four day stay. I hardly left the property, my suite was very clean and tidy upon my arrival and housekeeping always refreshened when I returned back.   This is a big plus for me as I am very ocd and like to be in a clean environment with new towels etc.   The staff really makes you feel like you are at home because they are really compassionate with you about what they do.  Everyone works together as a team to make sure that the commitment to excellence is above the standard.  I had dinner all four days at the hotel. The food and the mixed drinks are fabulous. Everything is presented so beautifully and everything taste as good as it looks.  Europaischer Hof definitely leads in Heidelberg but not only just in this city but other cities around Germany!   Europaischer Hof is the epitome of luxury. The experience is what counts and they make sure you leave with a great impression every time!   Until my next time in Heidelberg, I will definitely be staying here again…

Absolutely first class experience. Could not have been better. The attention at reception perfect, the room excellent and beautifully clean. What more could one want from such a well respected family run hotel.  I shall certainly re-visit on the next occasion of a visit to Heidelberg.

We had an excellent stay at the beautiful hotel Europäischer Hof Heidelberg. We loved the location, the excellent service and attention to detail. We can only hope to come back! Thank you for a great vacation!

We arrived late afternoon last Sunday 24th July. Unfortunately, we hit one of those busy moments and space is extremely precious in the small courtyard outside the hotel. It made our car arrival a bit awkward. We stayed for two nights with the day between for exploring the city. Unfortunately the weather was very oppressive and we just did not find Heidelberg very exciting. Combined with this was the fact that their Spa is shut on a Monday and although they said the Pool could be opened for us, we did not bother using it. Our room however was nicely appointed, and the communal areas the same - They have an abundance of fresh flowers everywhere ! So I probably should give this rating 4*, but my overall experience at the hotel/Heidelberg was just not memorable.

After a long drive my husband and I arrived at what can only be described as a oasis of beauty. We were greeted by the warmest and friendliest staff we have ever met in a large hotel. The decor and furnishings we exquisite and our room was breathtakingly beautiful. It was a sort of old glamour which was perfectly maintained. Every thing you need or want is available and the beds made sure dreams were easy. Dinner on the terrace was divine, our course’s were all a gastronomic treat, the wine was delicious and the staff were very pleasant and helpful, especially the wine waiter who guided us through a magnificent wine menu. At a beautifully presented breakfast buffet we were lucky to meet two members of the owning family. Their love and dedication for this establishment  shone through and we are sure as well as being a great place to visit it must be a lovely place to work. We want to thank you all for making a fantastic memory and will definitely return. X…

This is a fabulous hotel! The room was spacious and comfortable and the furnishings were lovely.  Breakfast was wonderful and the server was very friendly.  We walked around the hotel and saw Dr. Caroline von Kretschmann who graciously posed for a picture with us. I would highly recommend this hotel!

This is a top hotel with a very rich history. The building itself is very impressive. Good location in the center of the city.  Nice SPA on the top floor + roof terrace Top sleeping quality in spacious rooms

Understated elegance with exemplary service and care to all details The restaurant is a superior setting, with service and food to match The sommelier Max is very knowledgeable and well informed of his wine selections The spa is relaxing and beautiful with help of the caring staff…especially Natasha Perfect location in old town and walking distance to attractions

OMG! Such a wonderful hotel! Beautiful property, very accommodating staff, comfy cozy beds, delicious food and tasty cocktails. If we knew how amazing this hotel is, we would have stayed longer in Heildberg......now must come back for another visit. Caroline sets an excellent example of leadership, leading her team or as she stated, her "family". Thank you for making us feel so welcome.

Huge room, with extremely comfortable bed, pillows and mattresses. Very good bathroom with two sinks. Great breakfast, recommend to order a egg benedict, which was gorgeous and delicious! Good location, close to Old Town.

It completely blew away our expectations for a classy, traditional, and elegant hotel. Everything went absolutely perfect with the most spectacular staff, and management, that we have ever seen in a hotel. We will come back!

This beautiful hotel was perfect for our trip to Heidelberg. Within walking distance to all the major sites and a convenient car park that aade it easy to get around.  Our room was really special with lovely elegant features. It was also large and comfortable. The bathroom was very roomy and clean with double sinks . We would definitely stay here again.

What do you expect from a family run luxury hotel with more than 120 years of history , except warmth and elegance as reminiscence of such kind of posh living in classic era .staff are more than it’s needed polite , helpful and breakfast was spectacular.highly recommended

My wife and I stayed three nights.  This was the end of a long overdue, several times postponed anniversary vacation.  In a word, our time at the EH was excellent.  The accommodations, service and overall experience were unparalleled.  Beginning with the front door service, and moving through the front desk, the room, breakfast dining, the bar, and housekeeping – it was great.  We asked many questions and for a number of travel and dinning recommendations of the front desk.  The staff was kind, resourceful and offered excellent recommendations, and great service.  We had a minor issue with our first room, which was quickly and very satisfactorily addressed, without making us feel uncomfortable.  In our rush to leave early to the airport, we mistakenly something in the room.  The…

Great place to a peaceful night and enjoy the great cuisine. Elegant, private and charming hotel in the beautiful city of Heidelberg. Most wonderful staff, highly motivated, friendly and welcoming. Walking distance to the city center. Highly recommend!

Excellent staff, service, restaurant (both dinner and breakfast) - we will certainly be back and will gladly recommend this hotel to friends and family. Any guest requiring extra service will undoubtedly be pampered here. A plus that is very much felt is that the hotel owners themselves are present and are going out of their way, every day, to make guests feel at home. To a 150 years more!

We had a wonderful stay at this Grand Hotel.  what charisma and charm!  we had a wonderfully luxurious and spacious apartment with 2 separate bedrooms, living and dining areas, 2 spacious bathrooms and even a complete kitchen!  but we'll start at the Royal entrance and lobby.  nice!  the lobby bar is as it should be in a hotel of this status.  Beautiful cocktails leave the shaker of the charming bartender.  Sublime meal in the in-house restaurant.  probably Heidelberg finest!  Top service.  Highly recommended!!

HOTEL_LOCATION: Am Kai 3, 25997 Hornum, Sylt, Schleswig-Holstein Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: Fantastic food at the grill restaurant. Wine choice us amazing. Definitely a place to visit, top! We enjoyed the evening and had a fantastic experience as a family. Great food and a wine list that leaves no unturned stones. We can highly reccomend this place as a great experience. Golf course just next door.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Am Kai 3, 25997 Hornum, Sylt, Schleswig-Holstein Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: Generally this is great place to stay and relax. Very elegant with decent size of rooms, many with terraces facing quiet see and harbor. Superb service in the hotel lobby bar and front desk. So why just 4/5 rating ? This is connected only with one subject. Before arrival I contacted Guest Relation asking to help me to book restaurants for dinners. I wanted to dine in two hotel restaurants and one in the city. I was extremely shocked when first I have received an answer, that they can only book me one hotel restaurant, as the other one is fully booked. And they refused to book me something in the city, explaining that they focus on own restaurants (!!!) and they want to avoid situation with giving my personal data to external places.  Having such a respond I thought that maybe I was not lucky enough and my request reached a trainee, so I responded that focusing on their own restaurants mean for me, to be on a waiting list for one dinner and leaving me without any support for the one outside the hotel. And then real shock came, as I have received an answer from Guest Relation Manager, just repeating all arguments used before by another hotel employee. This is not the approach which I’m expecting from 5-stars hotel with price per night > 300 EUR. In this same time I was in touch with consierge in another hotel, asking for this same support and in the other place I have received an extensive list of more than 10 possible places recommended by the consierge, with pictures, menus and driving time.…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Am Kai 3, 25997 Hornum, Sylt, Schleswig-Holstein Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: I have to write this review in English or I will miss out in expressing my utmost thanks to this Hotel for their spectacular attention to customer service. I have stayed in Hotels in Singapore, Cambodia, Poland, Dubai and even 5 Star Hotels in Kazakhstan. Budersand Hotel is in a class of its own. It might be a challenge if you only speak English but I think the staff at Budersand can manage that too without issues.   I do not wish to comment on specifics as it would spoil the amazing experience that you will have at this hotel. I highly doubt that the Burj Al Arab 7 Star Hotel could match and exceed professionally, what this Hotel offers. The Staff Smile! The Staff Care! The Staff seem happy! Without further ado, just don't hesitate to book, this is the best Hotel in Sylt and I simply cannot wait to go back there again. Thanks Budersand.…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Am Kai 3, 25997 Hornum, Sylt, Schleswig-Holstein Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: It is not so easy to find a great hotel on Sylt. Most hotels have very small rooms and are too "traditional" for us. Budersand is a great property and extremely well managed. The staff is very friendly and competent. Rooms are bright and very comfortable. Seaview rooms are recommended. Breakfast is a highlight. Only the gourmet restaurant was not for us. We had a lot of fun though as one course (described as a curry) ended up to be only one small carrot. :) We already have booked our next stay.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Am Kai 3, 25997 Hornum, Sylt, Schleswig-Holstein Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: Great hotel with friendly and helpful staff, fantastic breakfast and rooms with everything you can wish. We had the most fantastic sea-view - the perfect start of the day. The golf course right next to the hotel was great, challenging (with a very rough rough) and good fun. The small town Hörnum didn't offer a lot, but the hotel surely did. And the nature around is amazing. We would love to come back for a luxury break.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Am Kai 3, 25997 Hornum, Sylt, Schleswig-Holstein Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: The venue is modern, comfortable and luxury. Great hospitality during check-in and check-out. The staff even learned how to say "Goodbye" in my local language ! Excellent all type of services ! Superb piano music in the bar at the evening and my personal discovery - Basil Smash - as of now, my favorite drink ! Both hotel restaurants are very, very good. My subjective vote goes to Stronholt above KAI3. Surely I'll come back !!!

HOTEL_LOCATION: Am Kai 3, 25997 Hornum, Sylt, Schleswig-Holstein Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: Came back to Sylt after 25 years - its a great place and not well known outside Germany. Think I saw one French numberplate, that's it.   Hotel has a nice atmosphere, friendly staff, 2 nice restaurants (one in the hotel, one in the golf club). It is 10 years old, but it's so well taken care off , it could have opened this year.  Breakfast buffet was amazing and I am not a breakfast guy ! And its open until 12, so a decent sleep in is assured.  The golf course was tough when the wind blows....miss the fairway and good luck finding the ball in the local dune grass and gorse bushes. Fun to play anyway ! And very reasonable at 110 EUR green fee versus international courses of similar quality.  I stayed with 2 kids (11) in a junior suite - its a touch crowded, would opt for something bigger next time. Ahh - and insist on sea or golf course views !  Will def. return and hope it won't take me another 25 years !…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Am Kai 3, 25997 Hornum, Sylt, Schleswig-Holstein Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: We vistited the place the second time since it was opend and it has further improved. Friendly and helpul staff, a top restaurant KAI3 and special link golf club embedded in mother natures environment right next door. You can feel the signature of a top resort manager who manages this place with experience and the right feeling for the guests need. The location is calm, you can perfect relax an enjoy the luxury of the place including a perfect Spa. The views over the costline tn the wild nature is amazing. Perfect location for a break!  Peter Titz Switzerland

HOTEL_LOCATION: Am Kai 3, 25997 Hornum, Sylt, Schleswig-Holstein Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: The hotel is located at the southernmost point of the island, close to the little harbor’s waterfront of Hörnum. On Arrival, you are welcomed by the staff and escorted to your room. The staff will present the room’s feature to you and guide you to every possible activity on the hotel ground. It’s also possible to get an advice what’s to see on the island and the staff can arrange any bookings needed.  After unpacking you are free to enjoy the spa, get a massage (I was told they are really great), go golfing (at least if you can play), take a welcome drink at the bar or just relax in your room / on your balcony. It doesn’t matter what you are doing, you will relax instantly and can really enjoy your stay. As the day goes by and the next arrives you will be free to relish the breakfast at its fullest extends. The wide selection of (fresh) breakfast items in combination with a variety of newspapers really made this part of the day as good as possible.  The only downside so far is really unobjectively because it’s regarding the hotels outside architecture / façade. The style really is a matter of taste! The interior on the other hand was just fitting for a relaxing holiday trip.  (I can’t rate the price performance ratio, because this trip was made with a voucher)…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Am Kai 3, 25997 Hornum, Sylt, Schleswig-Holstein Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: returning to sylt for a few relaxing days was a great idea. to choose budersand is always a definite win. we had a spacious room with nice view to the sea and the lighthouse. mr. brönnimann and his crew are most welcoming and know every aspect of guestrelated service. our kids enjoyed the stay as much as we did and of course the easterbunny with all the gifts was another highlight.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Am Kai 3, 25997 Hornum, Sylt, Schleswig-Holstein Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: This is a superb property located on a golf course with plenty of local coarse grass holding the sand away. It has very well laid out rooms with plenty of natural light. The lobby is spaciiys and staff very helpful It has a captive stretch of beach not far away with the large sylt Chair's on it. There is a light house and traditional market outside the hotel The breakfast is functional and gives you a reliable start as you go about sylt. The location is at one end of the island so you need driving time to et to places in central sylt or to the hafen

HOTEL_LOCATION: Am Kai 3, 25997 Hornum, Sylt, Schleswig-Holstein Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: Do you know the feeling when you enter a place and feel calm, relaxed, at ease, light? I did so when entering the hotel, our room, opening the terrace doors, standing on the balcony, smelling the sea, listening to the sing sang of the waves, watching the silent gliding flight of sea gulls in the blue sky. I did so every day. The hotel stands for luxury, not for the glamorous one but for deluxe privacy with a "less is more" touch. No frills but skills! For me a vacation day starts with a delicious breakfast! Clear yes here! For me a vacation day ends with a relaxing swim and sauna experience, relaxing in peace, and then dining at ease. Clear yes here! Even though the Strönholt restaurant crew could do with more professionalism to match five star expectations!

HOTEL_LOCATION: Am Kai 3, 25997 Hornum, Sylt, Schleswig-Holstein Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: Budersand is by far the best hotel in Sylt and maybe even that I stayed at. The service is excellent from the time of check in to the check out. The restaurant has the best food and the spa has perfect. The room is clean, modern and has a great layout. The only minus point is that in the room with sea view you can not watch TV from the bed.  We will definitely come back to this hotel when visiting Sylt as it made our stay there a wonderful experience. Thank you staff of Budersand!

HOTEL_LOCATION: Am Kai 3, 25997 Hornum, Sylt, Schleswig-Holstein Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: We have just returned from a 2 week vacation in Germany.  We spent time in Dresden and Berlin, two cities we both know well and then drove north staying a night in Luneburg, before arriving at the island of Sylt for 4 days.  This was our first visit to Sylt and we found it to be beautiful,unique and quite magical.  However, the icing on the cake for our visit, was the Budersand Hotel. Since retiring a few years ago, we have been fortunate to travel the world a little and stay in some fine hotels.  The Budersand was up with the very best hotels we have stayed at. Beautifully furnished and wonderfully comfortable. Everything here is first class.  As we drove up to the front door in our car, our luggage was collected and whisked away and our car parked in the garage. We were…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Am Kai 3, 25997 Hornum, Sylt, Schleswig-Holstein Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: Budersand hotel is a comfortable refuge - overlooking the sea , windswept beaches,golf grounds and some dunes it offers  many things a stressed city-dweller might need: comfortable rooms, a spa, rounds of golf, gastronomic restaurant, well-stocked bar ( ask for honey and chili flavored popcorn with your drink)  great breakfast and sense of remoteness. The village is quiet and calm, a bit lost in time. Take s a short drive away and you will find trendy bars and expensive boutiques. In short, a good place to hide from the world in great comfort!

HOTEL_LOCATION: Am Kai 3, 25997 Hornum, Sylt, Schleswig-Holstein Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: i never wanted to stay in this hotel but the other day i had overseas visitors and we went to the hotel for checking. as the hotel is in the very south of sylt ( the village hörnum is not the best) there is nothing much but the hotel and the golf club nearby. beautiful walks on the beach though. the hotel is not very charming from the outside , but from the inside it is very comfortable. great, beautifully furnished rooms . there is peace and quiet everywhere. sansibar is close by so if you feel like hitting the crowd, i am sure they will take you there. the views from the hotel is either out to the sea and the other islands or overlooking the golf course. the spa is well known.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Am Kai 3, 25997 Hornum, Sylt, Schleswig-Holstein Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: Coming to Budersand Hotel was amazing. The location at the seafront is perfect and from the deluxe room we had full sea view and could fall asleep listening to the waves. We felt very welcome and I must compliment the hotel for the great sense of details in both decoration and service. There were so many small things included in the service (newspaper for each room, change of towels several times during the day and free mini bar in the room). The breakfast buffet is world class, fresh, large selction, high quality and with emphasis on home made.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Am Kai 3, 25997 Hornum, Sylt, Schleswig-Holstein Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: Great rooms, not to big but cozy, wonderful views over the dunes or the sea, excellent breakfast buffet, may be the best you can ask for in Germany. If you like quiet places this is the one and only. Heard the golf is excellent but difficult to play, well, I am not into sports. Bus connection to all places on the Island, ships to near Islands just in front of the hotel. Great Restaurant. Modern, very pleasant decor all over.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Am Kai 3, 25997 Hornum, Sylt, Schleswig-Holstein Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: The typical hotel for the untypical Sylt guest. Located in Hörnum, away from the Kampen scene, a heaven of tranquility & relaxation.  Rooms are fabulous designed, understated but with all amenities. Great drink sleection at honor bar. Cleanlines at its best.  Nice spa with swimming pool, two saunas and steam bath. Enjoy the private spa suite if you can! Great treatments.  Very creative cuisine at KAI3. Absolutely deserving the 1 star michelin. Great wine list with nice finds ...  All in all, the best option on Sylt for a relaxing honeymoon break!

HOTEL_LOCATION: Am Kai 3, 25997 Hornum, Sylt, Schleswig-Holstein Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: First time at Sylt and Budersand and we will for sure come back. Stayed in a deluxe-room with lovely seaview. Outstanding breakfast and very good food at 1-starred KAI3 and Strönholt restaurant at the golf-club. Marvellous golf-course ( best course at Sylt ) with a lot of difficult golfholes. The staff at the hotel and golfcourse were very kind and did an excellent job. If You are looking for luxery and a quiet calm place to stay, Budersand is your spot. Despite high price, the hotel is truly recommended.

My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights and we were truly impressed: the hotel is fantastic. The combination of the location (close to the center of town, and close to nature to make the most beautiful walks, and right next to the park), the impeccable service (the housekeeping is top), the facilities (they have the best massage therapists, and I had he best pedicure in my life), and the staff is just the best there is.   We had wonderful outside dinners in both restaurants, and we loved the pianist Robin Meloy Goldsby who played every evening in the Wintergarten restaurant.  We can not come up with one thing that wasn't good. So, we can absolutely recommend this hotel and we will definitely return!

This is my third stay at the Brenners since 2021. The hotel and its garden are as beautiful as always. Every staff interaction was excellent. I was greatly impressed with the arrival: an upgrade to an amazing suite with the biggest bathroom I've ever seen in a hotel. Being escorted to the room by the front staff is a nice touch, as well as the welcome amenities (fresh fruits, chocolates, flowers, etc.).  I was also very satisfied with the F&B: nice dinner at Fritz&Felix, great breakfast in the garden and good room service. Twice daily housekeeping. World class spa. It is nice that the hotel maintains such a high level of service.

There was lots to like at Brenner’s Park, the staff were excellent, very professional and courteous.  The Good: The hotel is old fashioned in a good sense and covers quite a large plot.  We stayed in both the original hotel and Villa Stephanie rooms.  The Villa Stephanie is definitely the place to stay, the rooms are bright, modern and airy and have all been recently renovated in a traditional but modern style.  The bedding and bed was extremely comfortable in contrast to the main building.  The Spa facility is exceptional as is the pool area and the sunbathing area is very beautiful, the grounds are immaculately kept.    The Bad: The main building rooms have seen better days, and the bathrooms, bedding and mattresses need a refresh given the prices being charged.  A basic at a five star hotel is a quality mattress and this was missing in the main building.  The food offerings - an integral part of any great hotel - are absent/ lacking.  The menu choices are pretty narrow, the food is quite average and the prices high; the room service menu is also very very limited and again expensive.  If in doubt visit the restaurant trip adviser reviews which we should have checked before staying.  Also prices throughout the hotel are a little on the crazy high side. We had two G&Ts at the main bar and found they came to E48, which would give the George V a run for its money!  All in Brenners Park would benefit from a bit of healthy competition as there is quite a lot of room for improvement on the food and beverage front.  All in if you are going to charge top draw prices - which Brenners is - you have to deliver flawlessly on all fronts, and at the moment they are falling short.…

I booked the "PURE MASCULIN" treatment for my fiancé at the Villa Stephanie as a surprise before our wedding. 3,5 hours of pure relaxation with a body massage, a pedicure and a facial treatment. This was absolutely amazing. The staff of the SPA is super friendly and made us feel welcome.  As I was waiting, i went to the restaurant BRASSERIE RIVE GAUCHE for the lunch. The food was excellent, the service as well.  We ended our day at the restaurant FRITZ & FELIX where we had the tasting menu. As I dont eat meat, i asked for some changes and the waiter immediately proposed an alternative with fish. Everything was perfect. Thank you so much, this day will remain a great memory for my fiancé and I and we cannot wait to come back !

It was so good I stayed another night. The hotel itself isn’t my favourite, I’d like a more contemporary decor and a nicer pool/Spa area, but the hospitality at Brenners is second to none for me. All the staff go the extra mile, this is a ‘yes’ hotel, not only are the staff polite, they are all pleasant and genuinely seem passionate about being professional. The hotel has struck the perfect balance of elegance without being pompous. As an example, they will offer to take your car on arrival, but are not offended if you wish to park it yourself. I just love the feel of this place, it has such a friendly and inviting atmosphere. A few little details that suited me well, include a larger than usual bottle of complimentary still water in the room, large balcony and opening doors for fresh air, bath mats covering the areas you stand (no underfloor heating in the bathrooms and a cold tile floor) and a duvet that isn’t tucked under the mattress at turn down. The Fritz and Felix restaurant is a must if you stay here. All in all, I found it faultless and look forward to coming back again.…

I’ll I can say is that I loved every minute at this truly beautiful and luxurious hotel. Everything from the staff, the service, the facilities, our room, the restaurants, the location, the whole experience is just perfect. I especially love the winter garden but really it is all just so - and just so being just right. Have high tea next to the blazing fire place. You will know what I am talking about. Actually it is so good that I can just advise to come and stay here and experience it for yourself. I will be back in December if I can help it. This hotel for me ranks among the very best in the world.

This was my second visit to this hotel, and what can I say? The hotel is truly a first class property, and one of my favorite hotels in the world! It's a real gem!  The property is incredibly expansive with gorgeous views in one of the most beautiful and relaxing towns. Everything about this hotel is first class from its decor, amenities, location, food and beverage, state of the art spa, and of course its crown jewel- its staff.   I was welcomed back to the property by Maximillian, Assistant Front Office Manager, who was so happy to see me- like welcoming family back, and he upgraded me to a gorgeous room with wonderful balconies and expansive views of the surrounding area, which truly made my stay unique. He had kept my preferences on file, even the most minor details such as my newspaper preference. Although I had a very early departure on Sunday morning, he ensured that I was sent off with a wonderful breakfast. Maximillian is a consummate professional and world class host!   It was great to see Katharina who had welcomed me on my previous stay, and she was so happy to see me return.   I enjoyed meeting Sven, the wonderful charismatic bartender, who created an impressive array of beverages and cocktails.   Merle, the Head of Sales and On Duty Manager one evening, was so kind and friendly, and really enhanced my stay.   Thank you to the entire team for once again creating such wonderful memories and world class experiences! I look forward to returning.…

One of the best hotels in Germany, classic and contemporary style (Villa Stephanie), great amenities in the room, very good housekeeping. Location great with its own hotel park. The only thing where the hotel unfortunately falls short is the food (separate review of Fritz & Felix). Both variety and quality for the price offered are not good - which is a bummer when you want to stay mostly in the hotel. It's a similar problem with Four Seasons hotels - could be the best there is if only the food offered would be on the same level as the hotel!

This is by far the best hotel experience I have ever had! The customer service is beyond excellent. Staff members and an exceptional atmosphere made this weekend truly special. Thank you for an unforgettable time!

Brenners hotel is the perfect establishment if you are looking for a cozy winter break. Although the surroundings were cold and the weather gray - the hotel provided a warm and happy atmosphere. The food options were definitely a highlight of our trip from the new contemporary restaurant to the classic one in the beautiful winter garden and of course the famous afternoon tea in the winter garden offering Pierre Herme canapés and tea. The French bistrot was also a solid lunch option. Breakfast was first class and even offered some vegetable options such as avocado toast - a welcome and rare option for German breakfast. The suites were spacious and luxurious with a nice view of the rivers. The bathroom was nice and spacious. Congratulations for the renovated spa! Service was excellent. Daily test was required by German law and the hotel was very accommodating offering the test for free and in a convenient fashion. Overall would recommend if you plan on not leaving the hotel.…

Really enjoyed my stay at this superb hotel. Everything from the rooms to the standard of service and food was flawless. The location is perfect, right in the town centre and the views from the rooms are just stunning. I would highly recommend this property

This hotel is one of the best hotel in Germany and the best option in Baden Baden. I used to come with my family and I’ve been staying already twice this year (July and October). The deluxe room was amazing and more like a junior suite than a standard room, with a huge bathroom and a big balcony with park view.  The most positive points, in my opinion: - Most of the staff is attentive and it a is nice touch to be shown the hotel facilities and to be escorted to the room - The spa and the indoor pool is world class - Housekeeping is excellent (including the turndown) - Having a newspaper in the morning, not so usual anymore in luxury hotels - Fritz and Felix is a great addition to the hotel F&B offer: high quality food and very good service - The new a la carte breakfast is a…

This is a fantastic hotel located centrally in Baden Baden.  The hotel is well appointed in a beautiful location, and it's right off a park where you can go for strolls.    The rooms are large and feature wonderful views.  They use their own very impressive array of toiletries.    The spa is fantastic, and a must visit.    The staff are simply incredible, and truly want to ensure a world class experience.  From the moment I walked in, I felt truly cared for.  I was welcomed by Katharina who was so kind, offered me coffee, and showed me around.    The hotel extended my already late checkout, and were so happy to be able to accommodate me.    Maximiliian, the assistant  front office manager, checked me out, and was so incredibly gracious and professional.    The food and beverages…

Brenner’s is largely perfection.  The service - outstanding, intuitive, and picks up on everything.  It’s often meant to be in leading hotels such as this. It rarely is.  Here, absolutely.  Housekeeping - beyond strong (the best we have seen with turndown being a rare proper turndown with near full evening clean).  The valets - the same.  Room service - excellent.  The updated dining concepts also fit well - Fritz and Felix works.  The bar - one of the few in this area to make a perfect cocktail.  The new sommelier - she is outstanding!  In short, the staff makes the hotel what it is.  The facility - it’s excellent.  We love the charm of the rooms, the building, it all works.  Extremely comfortable.  Concierge - perfection!  Spa and fitness - as it should be for this hotel. …

My wife and  I spent a lovely relaxed week at Brenner's hotel recently. The surrounding and location is lovely. From the moment. you step in to the hotel, the staff take over, treat you like someone special. Valerie and her colleague John at front desk were so kind in explaining every detail about the hotel, the  rooms, the environment etc. She then gave us a beautiful room facing the park. From our balcony, we could even see and hear a small lovely  stream. We arrived, just a few weeks after peak season, so the hotel was not very full, restaurant and spa reservations were quite easy.

Hotel building, location, surrounding and scenery is perfect. The food and service was impeccable. I used the fitness room and it has all yhe newest equipment. We had massage at the hotel spa and it was ok. The rooms need renovation but the rest is very enjoyable.

This hotel experience was one of the best experiences my family and I have ever had. The staff were absolutely incredible and the service was outstanding. In particular, Sasha S. made us feel at home and took care of everything we could have possible needed. The food was magnificent and we would recommend this property to anyone! My wife also enjoyed the spa which was world class.

I have heard of Brenners  Hotel for some time now, as I am familiar with the Oetker chain and on their mailing list. I wasn't sure what to expect, as the price was quite high, but the reviews were excellent.  I have to say, I was not disappointed.  The service was excellent and the whole ambiance of the hotel is heavenly.  The weather was hot, so the garden was really wonderful. I actually felt my stress form the last months of lockdown melt away as I sat on the terrace having lunch. and walked in the gardens, which are stunning.  I was on my own and they were particularly hospitable  and calm so I didn't feel awkward or out of place-  a real bonus.  The spa area was a bit confusing to navigate as its a bit of a warren, and I wasnt sure how to get towels etc.  I was less keen on…

Classic luxury, romantic ambience, best customer service. These summarize our experience at Brenners Park-Hotel & Spa. Recently my husband and I stayed here one night to celebrate our 1st wedding anniversary. We enjoyed using the high-class and spacious room with a great view of the beautiful park, especially the antique wood furniture and the spa that we think represent the city of Baden-Baden in terms of its locality and history. All staff members welcomed us warmly: kind greetings at the front desk, welcome messages in the room with flowers, and snacks for our road trip that we planned after our stay. We would like to thank the staff who made our stay even more special with their best service.

My mother, sister and I stayed three nights at Brenners hotel and it was undoubtedly the most beautiful hotel we have visited. The stay was magical, we had breakfast outside in the garden rocked by the sound of the fountain overlooking the black forest and the small river, the peaceful atmosphere was unique and priceless.   The hotel 5000 m2 Spa is a masterpiece itself and the pool which overlooks the forest and garden brings harmony and balance to your day.   The service was beyond exceptional, it was personalized, efficient, thoughtful and real. We were very well welcomed  by Rebekka and treated with delicatess during the stay.   We especially wanted to thank Lara, Lea Victor, Rene and Sanjeev from the restaurant and breakfast. Emmanuel from the concierge desk was very helpful…

Excellent hotel with beautiful view! Everything was perfect and our room was a very generous size. Staff were faultless and breakfast was incredible. So many saunas too - fantastic  spa facilities. Lobby was stunning and there was a great place to swim In the lake. We loved it!

My family and I very much enjoyed our stay. This hotel has all the facilities (pools, gym, array of restaurants, cooking school) to name a few but what makes this hotel truly special is the attention to the little details that the staff gives. This shows that they truly care to make guests happy. I came with my family wife and daughter and they had a special amenity for my child once we arrived in the room as well as turn down a little set of slippers. She was so happy! They have transformed an old guest room into a play room for young children which she also enjoyed. But for those with children we know they like something when they cry to tell them we are leaving. ( her reply was can we please come back to Uberfhart). I also would like to call attention to the bartender Alex who was very personable and very attentive. 5 star review for a 5 star hotel. Bravo  We will be back  Sincerely  Rafaela , Stephen and Saskia Ullrich…

We had the chance to stay at the stunning property for 3 nights and had a flawless stay from start to finish.  the staff is welcoming, friendly and on top of all matters small and big.  restaurants were amazing, food is definitely a standout. We had dinner at the rustic "Bayern Stube" and the more refined "Egerner Bucht".  Bikes are available for rental to take a tour around the Tegernsee.  the Spa is second to none and one of the biggest in Germany and a great way to completely relax, unwind and treat yourself.  can highly recommend for a visit.

Everything is perfect in this hotel. It is the second time I stay in and I hope to go there more. Rooms are large, nicely furnished, cosy. Bathroom is very beautiful. Location is also great with the lake. Staff perfect: caring, smiling, helpful, efficient. Last but not least, the breakfast is the best we ever had, even in comparable 5 stars.

Our stay was good the rooms are specious and state of the arts room facilities. The SPA was below our expectations. The indoor pool was not heated and the outside  pool was closed despite the weather was sunny. The reception staff and customer staff were very supportive and friendly. I express my thanks and appreciation to all of them in particular Ms. Alina and Ms. Brigitta.

My husband started vomiting the morning after we arrived, received immediate and caring attention from every member of the staff and we got him to a local hospital quickly. I don’t speak German but the wonderful manager Michael Braun and his staff did everything they could to help me for five scary days. THEY COULD NOT HAVE SHOWN MORE CARE.

Hotel and restaurant staff are very nice and professional. The location at the Tegernsee is fantastic with sublime views on the lake and the mountains . The 3-star restaurant alone would have been worth the trip.

A wonderful hotel experience that rekindles the enthusiasm to travel. The staff are so well trained and make the whole stay as comfortable as possible. Outstanding cuisine too!  We cannot think of anything more the hotel could offer

Great ambiance, effortless service and stunning location. It’s definitely worth investing a little more to get the lake views. The staff were so accommodating and friendly from the moment you arrive to the moment you leave. Just wonderful. We will be back again.

Absolutely stunning in all ways; having stayed in luxury hotels across the world in the most exotic locations, the service experienced here really is top notch.  Every little detail is seen and observed; cigarettes were on the side of my bed side table, so after the first service an ashtray has been put into the room with matches. Heated floors in the beautiful bathrooms and the room staff organise everything very well.  Front staff were of high quality; we asked to change room as wanted one higher up and with lake view; accommodated with a smile.  Breakfast is nice; variety not as large as some resorts and lacking some options, but it’s Covid and not full capacity.  We have two treatments booked today at the SPA and know already they’ll be excellent.  Only downfall is paying €20 a night for parking. Just feels quite cheap when spending €1250 over two days excluding food and drink to then pay to keep your car. Just feels slightly class-less.  All else is excellent.…

Wonderful hotel all staff friendly and professional.Hotel spa was excellent and breakfast service was exceptional Roomsare luxurious it is a real treat and experience to stay at this hotel.The setting on the lake and village is breathtaking

A hotel that fulfills everything you would expect from a leading hotel.   The support throughout the long weekend was extremely positive. The natural friendliness of the staff, the cleanliness of the entire hotel, and the fact that nothing seemed too much trouble all deserve a big compliment. We had a wonderful, large double room and enjoyed the lake view from our balcony. Note a single socket on the table is really not sufficient these days.  Breakfast deserves special mention. It was absolutely fantastic with everything you might ever ask for and all of the food was of the highest quality.   The spa area was huge with the largest indoor pool I can recall in my travels with various saunas, steam rooms, and quiet relaxation areas.  We only ate once in the hotel at the Il…

I really have to compliment the HR department of this property, the staff was as good as I have ever seen. Beautiful property and wonderful staff. They truly are at your service. I would highly recommend this hotel.

We've visited a ot of 5* hotels all around the world and always they are some things who are not at the attempted level. Here almost everything is perfect. Why "almost" : only because they don't know how to make a true "Irish Coffee" what's effectively a very little detail in front of all their other "performances".

Such a lovely hotel! Wonderful room (with the best carpet), gorgeous bathroom, and great spa services. Not to mention it's in a beautiful location!   I saw one review about dogs and there were indeed a few. I absolutely love dogs, so I was happy with it, but if you have allergies may be worth asking if there's a separate area / room for them (which I'm sure there is).  I didn't eat lunch/dinner at the restaurant, so wouldn't know about that, but I did have the breakfast which was great!

An excellent hotel with friendly caring and attentive staff. The restaurant staff need to check the salt and pepper containers on each table regularly. Often they were nearly empty and we had to ask for them to be replenished. Restaurant staff tend not to listen properly at times and as they didn’t write our orders down they tended to forget things like 2 poached eggs and not one, like fried eggs sunny side up and not fried on both sides mostly staff were friendly and helpful.

I oscillated a lot on the grade given to this hotel, but considering the amount I paid for this stay I consider that I should have had incomparably better services.  The hotel is very nice with large spaces at the reception, car parking service, good quality shops, the rooms are large, airy, there is a minibar that is filled daily, swimming pool bag, coffee maker (but not tea);  gorgeous bathroom, very clean and with good quality cosmetics.  The restaurant has Michelin stars, but unfortunately the number of restaurants does not cover the number in the hotel.  So if you don't make a reservation the day before for dinner, you run the risk of eating in the room.  I waited for a quarter of an hour for a coffee.  The outdoor pool is small, as is the jacuzzi - only 3 people can enter.…

Excellent hotel in every way. Great attention to detail and friendly very efficient staff. The meals are fabulous some of the best I’ve ever experienced. The hotel is clean and welcoming and the rooms are wonderful with every comfort.

Liked ·   Spacious room with great, stylish bathroom, stunning location next to the lake, great staff attitude and service. Very upscale atmosphere, yet also kids friendly - room, facilities, food - all has something for kids. Great that they prioritize experience of in-house guests over external and trying to serve even last minute restaurants request. This place is very much "food destination", but also nice SPA - and we liked pool in particular - very clean water, no smells of chemicals - great!  Disliked ·   Breakfast was a bit messy those times - a lot of people, you need to find the table yourself as nobody guides you to that - the food was tasty and of great choice, though. I guess this is where with COVID things got much improved now, as hotels introduced more upfront…

Hotel itself is okayish, a bit 90s, no Bavarian charm a bit neutral overall. Rooms are nice and spacious. Great breakfast. Spa looks a bit like in 80s softporn movie or scene right out of Scarface (“Roman” sculptures, marble interiors) However, abysmally bad service experience. Never experienced anything similar in my entire life. Rude waiters and ignorant hotel mgmt. 1st night waiter would refuses to change a drink order “because it was already in the system”. Then waiter at the bar tells us he can’t do an espresso martini because the “espresso machine was not working” (in a 5 star hotel with loads of espresso machines across the property) then a friend of our is told off because he holds a cigarette in his hand.. speechless..  After telling the hotel mgmt of our experience the…

Lovely setting at the Flensborg fjord, just 5-6 km from the city center. Easiest to reach by car, but reachable with public means of communication (bus from Flensburg). Shaped as an overgrown wooden villa Alter Meierhof houses a variety of rooms and suites, many facing the waterfront and garden.  Public areas are very nice and the stunning flower arrangements and overall freshness of the lobby and ground floor are impressive. The dimensions are perfect for a sense of both luxury and intimacy. The staff at the reception kind and helpful and what you'd expect on a five-star level.  The rooms are however somewhat tired and radiates a feeling of the (19)90-ies. Nifty bathrooms and comfortable beds for sure, but the need of an upgrade is evident. Heavy keys for the door instead of key cards (useful if you are more than one) is annoying. What is most appalling for a five star hotel is the lack of air condition! Well... On second floor under the roof it can get pretty hot in the summer.  Alter Meierhof houses three different eating options: First, there is the two Michelin starred "Meierei Dirk Luther", which we would have loved to try - but alas closed for vacation. The "Brasserie" was the option and I have reviewed it here on TA separately. Stylish "semi fine dining" with good food, lovely setting outside (in the summer), a tad over expensive and with slow service. Third option is the "Bodega" - a small room like a wine cellar with a Spanish theme. Kitchen obviously the same, but the tapas/Espagnol is what is presented. Very nice little cosy room for a few couples/singles. We didn't try it, but it looked as a good option.  The slow service at the Brasserie was our main concern for not giving this five star establishemt five stars, so to speak... Obviously understaffed with veeeery long waiting time between the dishes. NOT what I - or you - should expect and accept from a five star "superior" hotel.  OK - vacation time and a hard time post covid to get qualified staff. But no, not OK to have a dinner with two courses during two hours and forty minutes.... Must be sharped up - i. e. management: staff your floor appropriately!  Another major fault was that I sat down at the pool area in the evening (at tables for drinks and food) - and was waved away by a waiter! "You can't sit here if you don't wear svimming clothes". I was properly dressed for dinner.  My God - staff can't wave people away in a five star hotel! Major fault!  The five stars of a hotel is NOT golden knobs in the bathroom. It's all about service quality and level! Here Alter Meierhof alas doesn't deliver.  But coming to the spa part, this is where the hotel really shines. All types of "spa:ing" you can think of with differently tempered hamams, saunas, cool pools etcetera. In this respect Alter Meinhof excels. A treat and we enjoyed!  On the whole it was nice to stay here, but the shortcomings I've mentioned above do manifest that what's on the sign at the entrance ("five star superior"), just isn't true. And I have plenty of reference...  Breakfast very good, with an extensive assortment of any kind of breakfast ingredients you might long for. Parking available outside at a fee - and the parking lot was crowded.  If you have the budget - because Alter Meierhof is a bit over priced and uneven - you could well try it. And hope that the management improve staffing to live up to the five plus "superior". It's what it's all about...…

Amazing hotel and spa - Professionel people all over the hotel. Beautiful nature and sunset all year around. Rooms are great in any way - Great with children. Restaurants are at a very high level. Thank you!

My boyfriend and I had three wonderful days here. Absolutely beautiful place. Nice swimming pool- heated, a little small area of sauna and the view from the room was amazing. If you want to go for a treat, the visit this place :-)

Very luxurious hotel. Two star restaurant. Excellent service (though not consistently very friendly). Nice pool. Nice view of the Baltic Sea. Overall good experience. Deduction of one point as the rooms are not very quiet, we heard the noise from above, from the neighboring room, the restaurant below us and particularly of the street which is passing by. Ask for a quiet room!!!

After a 2 night stay, we feel pretty secure in not recommending this hotel to the discerning traveller, much less to couples looking for a romantic, intimate setting to enjoy one another.   The bed was great, the room excellent (after we paid 200 EUR upgrade, despite not being shown a price list), but the service, the food, the drinks, the ambience and the "spa" and pool area are all seriously underwhelming and bland.   Think of any tasteless nameless lounge at pretty much any Airport anywhere, just with thicker linen, and that's pretty much it.   We ate dinner there once, upon check in, but left after the main course, and walked 800 meters to an Italian Restaurant that served 100 times better food at one quarter of the price. I wish we had read the reviews before booking this place. If we had, we would have gone with an Airbnb instead, and explored the excellent restaurants in the area from there instead.   I decided to keep this review short, so this is all I am going to write:   Go for a different destination in the otherwise excellent Flensburg area, and leave this hotel in the dust behind you. For dusty and pretentious is exactly what it is.…

Stayed four nights at Alter Meierhof and must say that we are very disappointed when comparing price and value for money. Rooms, at least at the lower floors with view to the sea, are ok though it is somewhat strange to have a bath (separate toilet) without a door. Breakfast is not impressive, e.g. the selection of cheeces and sliced meat are limited. The breakfast is not something you would expect from a 5-star hotel. Staff is nice, but lack overview. The spa area is too small and limited. If the hotel is full you almost sit on top of other guests in the sauna and steam baths (only these 3 options). Additionally, the pool was unacceptable cool the first 2 days and only just acceptable the rest of the time.  Restaurant Brasserie have only 2 seatings (6pm and 8.30pm), not what we like to fit into a holiday timeplan.…

My husband and I stayed on a two night prepaid deal including room, 3 course dinner in the brasserie, a accompanying bottle of wine, water as well as fresh fruit in our room. We got our room ahead of check in tine, a room upgradewith the beds made to our satisfaction, which was great as well as a personal greeting from the Alte Meierhof team regarding our anniversary. So this was in total very satisfying. The staff is very welcoming and there is a good ambience in the hotel. There were a few hick ups, that I don't expect in a 5 start hotel. I did inform the hotel that I don't eat fish and shellfish, but the staff at the brasserie wasn't informed. Secondly I did in advance ask for a neck supporting pillow, which never turned up. These are not big issues, but still if you inform the hotel in advance, and get a confirmation about the food issues, then one hope it will be sorted. However I loved our stay, the cosiness of the hotel, the great rooms and lovely beds, the friendly staff, the visible management and the feeling of the hotel being a nice workplace. Breakfast was very busy on the first morning, don't know if they were short of staff. Next morning everything was up and running perfect. I would recommend tea and coffee making facilities in the room.…

My wife and I spent two nights here, and sampled just about everything the place has to offer. The entire facility is a weird dichotomy of relaxing luxury and a blatant, noisy moneygrab, and as a whole, we are somewhat underwhelmed if not a little disappointed. I'll break it down:  THE GOOD: - The surrounding area is beautiful, and if you get a room with a view of the water, you'll spend hours looking at it. - The service is (mostly) impeccable, at least with regards to the front desk, concierge, cleaning and room service, and spa personnel. - The rooms are outstanding. Clean, spacious, quiet, and cozy. - The spa treatments are fantastic. We had the haram treatment and full body massages, and left feeling like royalty. - It's nice and quiet just about everywhere. - The bar has an impressive menu, and the breakfast buffet carries everything you could ever ask for.  But there is also the MEDIOCRE or outright BAD: - The entire spa area consists of a few small saunas, a small cold-water basin, and a single large pool that extends to the outdoors. There are no hot water basins, and not even a proper jacuzzi – instead, the large pool has a small area with a semi-broken "air dispenser". That's it. Honestly, this surprised me. I've visited many cheaper, vastly better equipped German "therme". - The famed Michelin-starred restaurant was stylish and (mostly) tasty, but honestly not as great as we'd hoped. We were treated to a lot of food, but amongst it was bland stuff like chewy lobster (with a consistency like rubber). Something in that six-course menu managed to upset our stomachs, which lasted well into the following morning. - The brasserie food was more down to earth, but the room (dare I say hall?) was unconfortably hot and noisy, and the waiters were rushing around like headless chickens. No-one bothered to actually present what we were eating, some waiters refused to even communicate if we didn't speak German from the first second, and the horrible acoustics made conversation almost impossible. It felt more like an airport McDonalds than an expensive brasserie. The entire three-course meal was crammed down our throats in just 90 minutes – usually, we'll spend twice or thrice that time on the same amount of food.  As a whole we enjoyed our little getaway, and the spa personnel deserve praise for their fantastic treatments. But for the money we paid, there is so much to fault with the Meierhof that we will likely never return.…

Our home away from home where you relax because you know everything is perfect. We love this hotel and the great service as well as the beautiful surrounding.  Fantastic hotel and we will be back again and again

While it is a fine hotel, we experienced a terrible process on agreements and payments of the arrangement that was a larger family stay. They tried to double charge us for extra services and persons, although pre-paid, and after the stay we had to discuss a lot on what was included in the offer that I had received in writing. Here 3 month later we are still receiving claims from the hotel, that we can document was paid. I find this the most messy process I have ever experienced from a hotel and certainly not 5 star quality.

I don't even know why I haven't reviewed this place before - bc We've stayed there multiple times. Actually it is our favorite spa a few hours away from Copenhagen. And heres why:  Rooms: *****  Big! spacious rooms nicely decorated in New England style. Plenty of closet space and the bed an covers are excellent. We've stayed in different types of rooms but prefer "förde view deluxe" or the maisonette suite. I will say that even their standard rooms are well above what you will usualy find at others hotel and this hotel and the rooms really are 5 stars even at baseline without any add ons.   Bathroom:***** Big! Huge! and many of them with a big tub i addition to the shower. For more expensive category rooms you will always find a tup and in some a spa even with a view over the…

This is an absolutely wonderful hotel with a stunning view, beautiful rooms and very serviceminded staff.   We had booked one of the suites and it was definitely worth the extra price. Completely newly renovated, split over two floors and with a free standing bath tub to relax in, taking in the great views of Flensburg fjord.   The hotel also has some very good restaurants offering top class cuisine.   The spa is very nice as well and has some good facilities.

We returned to Alter Meierhof for our second stay and we are glad to to confirm that everything worked just as well as during our stay last year.  The highlight was once more our dinner at The Meierei Dirk Luther.  Our room with fjord view was the very best and so was the service at the reception.  The Brasseri restaurant was  good but the set  evening menu was not something really to remember so going a la carte could be a good choice and bigger menucard for lunch would be nice. The bar service was more special than professional.  But our stay was overall a  succes and we are definately planning to return.

Beautifully situated, well maintained, professional staff, comfortable accommodations and nice restaurants. Will return and will recommend. Our only disappointment was that we had many events to go to and had to leave the hotel. I would recommend staying on site as much as possible, it’s that lovely.

We went to Alter Meierhof for two days with orr 6 month old son. The hotel is lovely, the room big and well equipped. The hotel was very helpful and friendly - also in making the stay as easy as possible for us when travelling with a baby. Lovely breakfast and the food in the Brasserie was good as well.  The spa is perhaps more moderate, but you can take your child with you in the early morning or late evening. The heated outdoor pool was wonderful in the morning sun!

... and will be back! Booked a two Day deal offer, and was not disappointed. Parking in front of the Hotel. Fast check in, and on top we got an upgrade to a suite with view.  As always the service is excellent, all the way and in every aspect.  Both nights we had the 3 course dinner menu. Excellent!!  The spa, with heated outdoor pool is very relaxing and quiet.  If you want to treat yourself.. try this!  Breakfast is great and have everything.

First, to the positives : - Really nice rooms, with nice products to go - Nice breakfast selection (but don't you dare to go up to the waiter to order your coffee, you must wait at the table!) - Beautiful views - Nice spa-area with a gorgeous heated outside pool  To the negatives: - First thing we were greeted with was a demand for a parking fee of five euros per day. What a way to greet a customer. Should really be included in the EUR 450 per day room rate. We couldn't believe our ears when the reception mentioned it, why hassle customers with something so petty. Another annoyance was the EUR 9 per bottle of water. We paid more for water than for wine in the restaurant. It's not about the cost though, its about the feeling of being ripped off. Big difference to other spa hotels…

The best place ever. The service is excellent. The food is excellent . We love it here. I think it is our visit number 12 or something like that, and it’s not the last😀. It’s our favorite place to recharge the batteries and enjoying time together just the two of us.

I'm stayed here for one night, breaking the journey from Hamburg airport to a customer meeting in Denmark. We arrived in the early evening and were warmly welcomed by the reception staff. The rooms were very good. Large and modern in a classic German way., with a great shower. The bed was a little too soft for my taste but I slept like a log.  We accepted the offer of a table in the restaurant and enjoyed a convivial dinner. Sadly, there was no room for dessert...  Breakfast was also very good, with a choice from a well-stocked buffet, followed by freshly prepared scrambled eggs.  We will definitely return when we make the next trip to this customer.

The place is really great - stunning views, nice decor, newly renovated, large rooms, lovely garden, spa etc. Food is excellent. But service does not match - e.g. chekin guy did not have a clue and told os we did not book - until he found the booking anyway. E.g restaurant - the waiters don't know the dished and cannot answer questions. We had to go up to the counter to get attention and get the bill.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Hofenstetten 55, 92431 Neunburg vorm Wald, Bavaria Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: It is a hotel on the top a hill, not that high, where when you get s beautiful day the landscape is truly beautiful. The room is nicely maintained and all amenities ok. Restaurant is nice and even still in Corona time, serving a decent food. In this hote one should stay in as there’s not many alternatives surrounding it but bushes ..

HOTEL_LOCATION: Hofenstetten 55, 92431 Neunburg vorm Wald, Bavaria Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: We had a fantastic 8 night stay at this lovely hotel in Bavaria. The setting, overlooking acres of wooded valley, is blissful, & the hotel offers a multitude of terraces to revel in these vistas. Restaurants, rooms, spa, & gym, all enjoy stunning outlooks. We loved our 5 roomed Landhaus suite, so spacious & light. Views from both main rooms were wonderful & had either patio doors or myriad windows. Decor in these suites is classic, with comfort & quality the aim. Fab shower, tons of wardrobe space & ample hangers. The only downside was that one bedroom was over a restaurant & was a tad noisy. So we opted to move to a quieter Spa Suite. These rooms are separate from the main house, within the newer spa complex. Whilst we adored the Landhaus Suite, Spa Suites are in a different league. Decor is more contemporary, more chic, & with little enhancements such as nicer bathroom products. Our particular suite (249) was on a corner & enjoyed a fabulous wraparound terrace. This really is a super room. Unfortunately none of the rooms have AC, which is probably not an issue 10 months of the year, but was quite a problem during our scorching July stay when temperatures hit 40 degrees. This meant leaving windows open on a night to aid sleep, which even in the Spa Suites exposed us to noise from the bar/restaurant. We requested a fan which helped mitigate the muggy air a little.   Other guests were mainly German during our stay, just a handful of fellow English visitors. I felt that a little bit got lost in translation when booking by email, but once here we found reception staff to have excellent English skills & to be really switched on - in addition to being really helpful & warm. Restaurant staff were also charming with a very friendly, can do attitude, though service was often painfully slow & odd things forgotten. Easy to forgive when people are so nice though. Dining here is a gourmet affair, we took the Half Board package which entailed a generous breakfast & 5 course dinner. Food was by & large excellent - accomplished & beautifully presented. The hotel also has a renowned, uber fine dining restaurant ‘Eisvogel’ which offers a tasting menu varying from 5 courses (€120) to 9 (€192). Breakfast was a super buffet spread plus live egg station. And it’s always a big thumbs up from me when fizz comes as part of the breakfast offer. Excellent, speedy service too. The hotel is big on the wellness front, with a very nice spa & various sauna/relax rooms. Beautifying isn’t my bag but I used the gym which was pretty well equipped with high quality machinery & a divine outlook over countryside. However, I did feel the gym fell second fiddle to the other wellness areas as there was no water provided & often no towels, & in contrast to the rest of the hotel which is utterly pristine, gym equipment could have done with a wipe down. The hotel boasts an indoor & 2 outdoor pools plus various attractive lounging areas. In addition there are complimentary bikes & a golf simulator. Ample private parking & a shuttle, albeit at a charge. Despite the flaws we loved the hotel & always looked forward to returning following our day time jaunts. It’s a very well run establishment & just has a really nice vibe.…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Hofenstetten 55, 92431 Neunburg vorm Wald, Bavaria Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: We stayed 1 night as a stop over on our way to Austria.   Pros:  Beautiful location off the beaten path. Great views from the balcony overlooking the wooded valley, mountains and lakes. Friendly and courteous staff. Pretty descent breakfast. Good parking. Roomservice had a good selection and pretty fast delivery. Beautiful and we'll kept grounds with garden, fountains, pools and patios.   Cons: No AC. Remote location means you either eat dinner at the hotel or take a drive. Also, it's a bit of a drive off the Autobahn (which is kind of the point) and some of the roads in the area are narrow rural roads. Take care when reviewing your GPS calculated route if countryside driving isn't your forte.  The glass walls of the bathroom might not be to everyone's liking.   Verdict: We only stayed for 1 night, which felt kind of sad once we arrived. The place is gorgeous and has loads to offer. We didn't get an opportunity to try the spa. Next time around we'll probably stay longer. …

HOTEL_LOCATION: Hofenstetten 55, 92431 Neunburg vorm Wald, Bavaria Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: We sat there for a board meeting in a plant close by. Hotel is elegant, good bar and  nice green area. WiFi as sometime unstable but usually works Room was ok and well served. Missing water and other amenities in the frigobar. There was even no water, you should go to reception to request Breakfast and dinner in the internal restaurant is pretty good ! Taste the omelete which is well prepared

HOTEL_LOCATION: Hofenstetten 55, 92431 Neunburg vorm Wald, Bavaria Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: Very nice Hotel, nice rooms and excellent facilities including pools and SPA area. Great views of the area. Good restaurant. Just missing caffee kit in the room, other than that - very good. Recommended.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Hofenstetten 55, 92431 Neunburg vorm Wald, Bavaria Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: This hotel is borders national park and has a great view of a lakes and hills. Very tranquil atmosphere. One michelin star restaurant on site offers great food, but regular hotel restaurant is almost as good and way less expensive. Stuff is caring and professional, speaks good English. Nothing to complain about.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Hofenstetten 55, 92431 Neunburg vorm Wald, Bavaria Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: staying there during business trip did unfortunately not leave lots of time to enjoy what this hotel offers. So I only got a short glimpse of the comfort and wellness offers. And I experienced an extremly friendly service staff

HOTEL_LOCATION: Hofenstetten 55, 92431 Neunburg vorm Wald, Bavaria Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: Famos for the Michelin Star Kitchen this is a total relaxing place. large heated indoor and outdoor pool, great spa very quiet. bicycles provided for rides, golfcourse very close. Excellent breakfast.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Hofenstetten 55, 92431 Neunburg vorm Wald, Bavaria Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: Close to the local town of Bordenwohr and not far from Regensberg this gem of a hotel is a place to stay for more than one night . Excellent food and the Swimming pools both in door and out door are great . Plenty of local runs and walks . Even has a Vegetarian option on the menu - You have to understand in this part of Germany this is special  Have stayed a few times on business for a couple of night s- intend to spend a week out there in the spring on holiday

HOTEL_LOCATION: Hofenstetten 55, 92431 Neunburg vorm Wald, Bavaria Germany
