REVIEW_TEXT: We were here for business conference of which the hotel provided great facilities, although  wifi in rooms was only obtained by buying credit from T-mobile. The hotel is in the middle of the countryside so you need a car to get around but a good stop off if touring around Bavaria. The restaurant is excellent. The 11am checkout for us was a little early. Drinks on the patio with it's lovely country views in the early evening was a joy.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Hofenstetten 55, 92431 Neunburg vorm Wald, Bavaria Germany
REVIEW_TEXT: It is a hotel on the top a hill, not that high, where when you get s beautiful day the landscape is truly beautiful. The room is nicely maintained and all amenities ok. Restaurant is nice and even still in Corona time, serving a decent food. In this hote one should stay in as there’s not many alternatives surrounding it but bushes ..

REVIEW_TEXT: We were here for business conference of which the hotel provided great facilities, although  wifi in rooms was only obtained by buying credit from T-mobile. The hotel is in the middle of the countryside so you need a car to get around but a good stop off if touring around Bavaria. The restaurant is excellent. The 11am checkout for us was a little early. Drinks on the patio with it's lovely country views in the early evening was a joy.

We really enjoyed our three days at this hotel. Our suite, Printemps, was hugely comfortable, well appointed, with fridge, kettle, glasses etc. The staff were excellent and very personable. I appreciated the cleaning staff who also regularly changed towels etc. The reception staff were first class and took great care to welcome and look after us. We had one dinner in the restaurant, a seven course tasting menu, which was first rate. The waiter was extremely diligent and helpful. I would have appreciated a more varied wine list with more choice  below 70 euros per bottle and this may have encouraged us to eat again in the restaurant.  Fabulous grounds and swimming pool and very peaceful. Thanks for a great stay!

One of the most beautiful hotels set in fantastic gardens and lakes. Quite breathtaking. This is our second visit, the first in September 2020, which I didn't review as everyone was struggling re covid and it didn't same fair. The rooms are beautiful and finished like everything in and surrounding the chateau to very high standards. The staff, especially the concierge, were good....our receptionist just about ok. The food was very average and there was very little atmosphere in the restaurant.

This was a stunning place that was of unexpected beauty. The beautifully manicured gardens with lakes surrounding the property as a back drop greeted us, along with very friendly staff. We were shown around the hotel and then our room which was truly beautiful, clean and very traditional. The views were stunning of an immaculately well kept property. We had dinner outside with a blind menu which was an extravaganza of food and wine. We were so well looked after and wished we could stay longer. We will definitely return to this tucked away hidden gem.

Driving from London to Portugal, we decided to stay at this hotel, situated slightly off the beaten track. What a find. We had dinner at the main restaurant and it was nothing short of perfect. Great staff and a great experience. We will definitely stay here again but we would stay for at least two nights as there's so much to do......

One of the finest hotels I’ve stayed in. Impressive in every way possible. The architecture and design are stunning. The service was faultless. The grounds including the lakes, the floating tennis court, the cows, the electric cars, the loft converted into a stunning games room were priceless. The General Manager was as friendly as you can get. What a fine retrieve especially during Covid. Thank you Des Etangs.

After the lockdown, we were so looking forward to a break. We stumbled upon this hotel on a little guest collection website and how fortunate were we. Words cannot describe how stunning this place is. I had tears in my eyes as I walked in as I was completely blown away. The gardens and the outdoor space are heavenly and there are acres to explore. We took the bikes out one day and got completely lost and it turned into one of our favourite adventures. There are numerous walks you can go on and the swimming pool is lovely too.  We stayed in one of the cottages and were provided with an electric car to drive around the estate. The cottage had every amenity one could want and a rustic/romantic feel. We had a lake on our doorstep and a rowing boat at our disposal.  The spa was lovely and the views from it were surreal. My husband and I both had massages which were great. There were a few glitches - breakfast was incredibly slow but I imagine that was due to covid restrictions. If you wanted food in your villa you needed to order it 24 hours in advance - this is a pain especially with small children. Also, there is only one restaurant which is Michelin starred. The Michelin Star restaurant was fab. The food was delicious and the staff really bend over backwards to cater to your needs. We went there twice and they kindly changed the menu for us the 2nd night so it wouldn't be repetitive.  There are a few restaurants scattered around the nearby villages - concierge were brilliant in arranging the reservations. Our whole family thoroughly enjoyed the stay and we cannot wait to return. It truly was one of the most memorable hotels we have stayed at.  …

This place is just awesome, it’s really big and there are a lot of things to do. The rooms are nice and comfortable, we can feel at home. You also have the option to sleep in little houses named “metherie” really familial and cool. The people are really nice and polite.

Celebrating our anniversary this month we have selected a number of special places including the Domaine des Etangs.  It’s location is extraordinary with spectacular views and lit out very nicely at night. The combination of rustic buildings combined with modern art gives an extra dimension to the luxurious surroundings. Pool, tennis court, gym, vegetable garden, play-ground, well-being all wonderful. We were sorry we could not stay longer. Excellent (Michelin star)restaurant. For some reason the staff is not at the same level as the surroundings or quality of the restaurant. The (female) sommelier was not up to par. Very mediocre (and cheap) selection of wines paired with the five course dinner. But more importantly not in tune and not on time. We had to wait numerous times to start eating because we had not been offered the accompanying wine. This although the restaurant was far from full. No interest either in talking about wines (even though we mentioned we had drunk a specific wine in the country of origin) or in the guests. This lack of interest seemed more common with the staff who basically did what they had to do in a somewhat unstructured way. Not what you would expect for a place of this standing. …

It’s really Amazing place , every thing is perfect , every where its Art , Any time it’s plaisirs , Nature and Luxe , Every corner it’s details of “ Refinement “ Maybe one of the top 3 Places I have stay in the World , but it’s in the middle of one small French Village . Really Amazing   I Forgot , food also amazing .  Merci Merci Merci to all the team .

It is difficult to describe this property adequately. A castle set in 2500acres surrounded by several large lakes. No expense has been spared in creating one of the most spectacular hotels I have experienced anywhere. The food in the Michelin restaurant was superb. The only mistake we made was only booking one night so we could not take advantage of all the fabulous facilities. We shall return !

Words and pictures don't do justice to this place. We came with the understanding that it's a wonderful property as recommended by our friend but no words or pictures can truly describe the beauty and the energy of the place!

My husband and I (plus our 2 Bernese Mountain dogs!) have just returned from an amazing 4 days in Domaine des Etangs.  We cannot put into words how truly beautiful and amazing this hotel is.  To call it a hotel is almost an understatement.  At the heart of the property is an amazingly restored chateau but in addition to this are the farmhouse cottages, one of which we stayed in.  We stayed in the beautiful Licorne cottage which is a 1 bedroom cottage that has been incredibly well designed.  It has an amazing open fire, kitchen and fabulous bathroom and what seems like your own private lake. The hotel is superb and one of the reasons as to why it is so amazing is the staff.  Everyone was incredible but to name a few - Guillame and Fanny on reception, Julien, Guillame, Eva and…

...how great this hotel is, in case it gets too popular for when I want to return, but as the people were so great I feel I ought to!   As you drive into the area, it does feel like you’re disappearing from the rest of the world and once you see the chateau and grounds you’ll want to keep it that way.  Our room was stunning but couldn’t compete with the grounds, lakes and formal gardens.   We used the Michelin stared restaurant, which was fantastic, as well as the best massage I’ve ever had in their beautiful Spa building.  Vincenzo and the team were extremely friendly and helpful at all times and with a limited number of rooms across a huge estate it always felt very quiet and exclusive, especially given the stunning contemporary art displayed everywhere you go.  Highly…

This was our 2nd visit to this wonderful restaurant, set in a beautiful chateau setting. We had the 8 course “taster” menu that just seemed to go on forever!! Every course was divine, a fine balance of taste that looked amazing and tasted even better.  Not cheap nearly  400 euro for 2 people( this included  wine etc with each course), but for a special occasion it was well worth it.  The service is attentive but laid back and the staff are lovely and informative about the food and wine. Would definitely go again when next in France.

Getting to Domaine des Etangs can make yo feel you are falling off the map.  Small winding roads which seemed to have a tractor or a combine every other kilometer (time of year though).  However, when you get there it is truly beautiful.  The renovation of the properties has been carried out with great skill whilst being sympathetic to the history of the buildings.  Our room (Ete) was very nice indeed, well fitted out and nicely finished.  Dinner was excellent. I believe that there is a new Chef who did a wonderful job that allows the food to stand up to the very best of restaurants . The staff were all very good.  Polite and efficient.  Well worth a visit and no doubt we will return.

Part of me wants to be selfish and not tell people about the Domaine des Etangs. However, they deserve to be discovered. We've stayed in many exquisite places in France. This one stands out.  Start with where you'd sleep. There are 3 spectacular choices: the completely updated, elegant chateau; the four charming apartments that adjoin the restaurant; and the far flung individual cottages that can accommodate several people very privately. We had the opportunity to stay in the chateau and the apartments. Both were superb and fun.  The food. The restaurant has one Michelin star, but has a strong case to deserve two stars. The food is outstandingly tasteful and beautiful...yes, it's beautiful when served. The menu is somewhat limited, but the chef will accommodate you if you've…

Chose this place as an overnight getaway and we were more than pleased.  The accommodations, the service, the restaurant were all just outstanding.  Loved it so much that we are already planning our next, longer stay.

We chose this hotel as we considered that it offered a luxury break in an area we were unfamiliar with.  On booking we were sent a menu of activities.  All sorts of things from an introduction to fishing (30€) to a tour of the grounds (20€).  The Domaine des Etangs comprises a beautiful chateau, (with the indoor pool only available to those who stay in the chateau) renovated buildings including accommodation and a Michelin starred restaurant and several cottages set amidst verdant rolling parkland scattered with cattle and lakes.  The setting is lovely.  When we were there we enjoyed warm spring days and nature was looking at it best.  Our renovated old stone building was situated almost 4 kms from the main chateau and we were provided with an electric car.  I’m not really sure…

Welcome to Fantasyland. This resort is difficult to describe. The creation of a superlatively talented owner, who has designed a quiet, calm, relaxed and over the top destination. Every accommodation is unique, so choose carefully. Smaller may be better. Restaurant, again, a very special experience. Grounds are pastoral, site remote, so outside of Limoges, no major cities. Management needs maturing and a lack of a Concierge, is a shortfall.

We spent nearly 6 weeks away travelling mainly through France just recently and wanted to stay mainly in Chateau's.  While researching properties, this one appeared and appealed to us.  We opted to book the Junior Suite for a 1 night stay as the cost was quite high, especially when converting it into Australian dollars. Check in is not until 4pm and they are quite strict on this.  We arrived at 3pm to be meet by bollards blocking the entrance.  Unfortunately we could not find an intercom to speak to anyone at reception nor were the bollards going down for us.  Fortunately it was not raining (as it had done the last few days) so one of us got out and tried to find reception in order for us to check-in.  Luckily a gardener assisted myself to the reception area and found a staff…

HOTEL_LOCATION: 4 rue de Collonges au Mont D Or, 68970 Illhaeusern France
REVIEW_TEXT: You never know when choosing a hotel online if it will be what you expect. From the moment we stepped onto the property, we knew we were in the right place. The staff jumped up to greet us and showed us to our room without delay and quickly unloaded our baggage. The room (number 9) was spacious with a nice table and chairs as well as two other chairs to relax in. It is literally the cleanest hotel I have stayed in and I have stayed in many four and five star hotels that were not nearly as well kept. The bathroom was modern and well furnished with all the amenities you would want. Every request was completed within minutes of asking. We never had to wait for anything or call a second time. The first evening we were sitting at table outside near the water and had the pleasure of meeting the owner, Marco, who sat and visited awhile. He is warm and engaging and offered us suggestions on dining and wine tasting. He even personally called and booked us. At his suggestion we made changes to our plans and were glad we did. The breakfast is delicious and served outside on the terrace or garden. We had dinner the last evening at the hotel’s Michelin star restaurant and again it was outstanding. The food was excellent and the entire team who served us were fantastic Throughout our stay we met several of the owner’s family who work there. It was an exceptional stay and we can’t wait to return to this special place again.…

HOTEL_LOCATION: 4 rue de Collonges au Mont D Or, 68970 Illhaeusern France
REVIEW_TEXT: What a beautiful hotel!  The photos don’t do it justice. Everything was perfect - the staff were excellent, the room was quirky , massive and wonderful, the meal was exceptional at the restaurant which is just over the road …. And the owner (who served us breakfast) was lovely Just Fabulous …. We’ll definitely return

HOTEL_LOCATION: 4 rue de Collonges au Mont D Or, 68970 Illhaeusern France
REVIEW_TEXT: Excellent family run hotel, attentive service, big and friendly rooms, exceptional but very expensive breakfast. There is a spa with good treatments, heated swimming pool and great Michelin starred restaurant. Loved it!

HOTEL_LOCATION: 4 rue de Collonges au Mont D Or, 68970 Illhaeusern France
REVIEW_TEXT: We stayed at Hotel des Berges for 1 night on our way back from Italy to the UK. And whilst the prime reason we chose this place was to have dinner at Auberge de l'Ill (lovely dinner by the way - not necessarily the most adventurous cooking but well executed and delicious), we found the hotel excellent too. The hotel is quite small so it feels cosy. Rooms well decorated, all in a different style. Great outdoor swimming pool (long enough for a swim) and spa. Friendly service. Fantastic breakfast with a lot of delicious local specialities. Definitely worth spending more time than just a one-night stay to have dinner!

HOTEL_LOCATION: 4 rue de Collonges au Mont D Or, 68970 Illhaeusern France
REVIEW_TEXT: The welcome, the people, the garden, the rooms, the pool and of course the great breakfast. Simply the best. An Oasis of hospitality, taste and culinary delight. Thanks to Marco and his family and team. We look forward to many more visits to come. Recommendation: book a room in the new Spa building.

HOTEL_LOCATION: 4 rue de Collonges au Mont D Or, 68970 Illhaeusern France
REVIEW_TEXT: We came to this hotel for three nights as well as to try a great restaurant L’auberge de l’Ill. Everything was great at this hotel - the staff was super nice, professional and friendly. The rooms were wonderful. We had a huge suite with two terraces. The breakfast was one of the best we had in any hotel in a long time. It was really a perfection. The setting on the river was just beautiful. It really is a wonderful property to come back again and again.

HOTEL_LOCATION: 4 rue de Collonges au Mont D Or, 68970 Illhaeusern France
REVIEW_TEXT: This 5 Star Hotel is a bit pricey but the location is fantastic and belongs the the Restaurant  L'Auberge de l'ill. (3 Michelin Stars). The room #4 was okay and everything in good Quality but nothing over the extraordinary.  The highlight is the Dinner at the Restaurant and the breakfast next day. If the weather is good you can be on the terrass and then it's even better

HOTEL_LOCATION: 4 rue de Collonges au Mont D Or, 68970 Illhaeusern France
REVIEW_TEXT: We found Hotel des Berges because of its connection to L'Auberge d'Ill-- one of the very best restaurants in France.  It is situated in little Illhaeusern in the beautiful Alsace with the delights of the Route du Vin at your doorstep and plenty to explore in the area.  The Haeberlin family has created a bit of heaven on earth with their gastronomic temple and sybaritic retreat that embraces with hospitality and an always delightful experience that reminds you that "life is good."  This hasn't happened by accident-- but through the dedication of the Haeberlin and Haeberlin/Bauman family.  If Michelin ever created a fourth star-- it should be for this place.  The restaurant continues to be one of the best in France-- continuing the family affair with cuisine.  Both the restaurant and the hotel attend to every detail without being "fussy!"  In both the restaurant and the hotel you feel like a welcomed and honored guest.  Although there's plenty to do in the area, you could simply luxuriate right there on the property on the banks of the river.  As I swam on my back  in the exquisite pool in the hotel garden I watched several young storks flying overhead. Time for a massage, a nap, a soak in a super-tub, then dinner. Marco Bauman and son and staff and the Haeberlin family have created something very special here.  Mrs. Haeberlin/Bauman graciously welcomes and looks after guests at the restaurant. This place deserves every bit of recognition and praise. So many places have a corporate feel.  This place has a family feel, a warm country feel, a relaxed and elegant feel of excellence, a feeling of  "I didn't die, but somehow got to heaven."  And just when you think you're dreaming you wake up to the most wonderful breakfast, served outside by the river.  They received an award for best breakfast in France.  (I've stayed here a number of times and this is a breakfast that dances in my head when I'm thinking of the "best ever."  I've stayed at Hotel des Berges with friends, family, and alone.  Even when alone, I wasn't, because I was among friends.  I've just returned from travels and already look forward to the next visit.…

HOTEL_LOCATION: 4 rue de Collonges au Mont D Or, 68970 Illhaeusern France
REVIEW_TEXT: Small boutique hotel with a beautiful location by the river Ill and an affiliation to the michelin restaurant L’Auberge de I’Ill next door. Friendly staff and a luxurious breakfast service. Large garden and pool area and very good SPA facilities. We had a fantastic suite ‘Toledo’ with a terrasse overlooking the garden, pool area and the river. Hotel very good for a relaxing and private stay, and for visiting L’Auberge de I’Ill.

HOTEL_LOCATION: 4 rue de Collonges au Mont D Or, 68970 Illhaeusern France
REVIEW_TEXT: We have been 2 days in Hotel des Berges and enjoyed it a lot. We stayed in wonderful, perfectly modern designed suits, while enjoying a fantastic spa, modern, clean, perfect and harmonized - the hotel is located in 'a picture' with scenic landscape and natural sounds which eating the natural, superb breakfast there is like enjoying a symphony and a poem of great experience - thank you Marco and the Baumann extended family for a wonderful experience

HOTEL_LOCATION: 4 rue de Collonges au Mont D Or, 68970 Illhaeusern France
REVIEW_TEXT: Out of gas on the Highway, I decided to stop at Illhausern and spent a night in Hotel des Berges with no reservation. The warm welcome, quality of service, amazing suite, and the Spa! Everything convinced me to go back there with my husband as soon as possible!  The breakfast is my n*1 breakfast ever, with of course homemade pastries and Kouglopf, and I was so spoiled: they offered me Mirabelle jam and some Marc Haeberlin recipe book! I felt part of a family, but a family who follow the rules of a *** Michelin excellency domain. Spending time at Hotel des Berges is a privilege. Thank you all!

HOTEL_LOCATION: 4 rue de Collonges au Mont D Or, 68970 Illhaeusern France
REVIEW_TEXT: Stayed here as we planned to dine at the outstanding restaurant Auberge de L'Ill, which was part of the same set-up.  Hotel itself was gorgeous, superb and friendly service.  Family-owned and run, and this really showed in the genuine care with which they treated all the guests....  As well as the beautiful village, an excellent stopping-off point for a visit to Strasbourg (also recommended).

HOTEL_LOCATION: 4 rue de Collonges au Mont D Or, 68970 Illhaeusern France
REVIEW_TEXT: First time we stayed at this hotel - in the newly opened spa building.   It was overall a lovely experience: the room was really welcoming, in a very japanese way (quiet / warm / understated), i found it well equipped (at least with everything needed), sized appropriately.  The spa is really a small gem - it is very intimate, again a very japanese feel in the decoration & atmosphere. We enjoyed the outer pool and the quiet river banks.  Breakfast was amazing: i usually feel that breakfasts in michelin stars restaurants come as a slight disappointment, it was not the case here. Perfect, all in right proportions, extremely warm service.  Needless to say we have booked ourselves for another stay !  Worth going: start to pack ! Expensive: worth it

HOTEL_LOCATION: 4 rue de Collonges au Mont D Or, 68970 Illhaeusern France
REVIEW_TEXT: Everything the five-star reviewers have said is true. On the plus side are the riverfront location, the view, the general comfort of the room. The A/C is terrific and the WiFi is very fast for such a small hotel in a countryside setting.  A few things could be added to make this hotel really top of the line. First, a coffee maker in the room, say a simple Nespresso or something similar, would be nice to have in the morning. Next, replace the foam brick temperpedic-style pillow with some nice soft options. This had me waking up multiple times in the night. Also the only English language channel on the television roster is CNBC and the Netflix button on the remote is a fake-out, but that’s a small price to pay for such a nice experience overall.

HOTEL_LOCATION: 4 rue de Collonges au Mont D Or, 68970 Illhaeusern France
REVIEW_TEXT: It’s just stunningly beautiful as the property locates itself along a stream where you can have breakfast by booking a boat or go kayaking in the afternoon. Large spa and 20m pool, then you see an airstream! Michelin 3 star, Auberge de L’ill is part of the hotel and celebrating its 50 years of being awarded restaurant!

HOTEL_LOCATION: 4 rue de Collonges au Mont D Or, 68970 Illhaeusern France
REVIEW_TEXT: This hotel is associated with the Auberge de l’Ill, where we dined last night. The rooms are intelligently designed, the beds are very comfortable, and the view over the river guarantees quiet nights. My wife loved the pool, which is designed for swimming lanes. Breakfast is extra and not cheap, but then, neither is the hotel. Breakfast is very good, and with any luck you will get to enjoy it on the balcony overlooking the Ill. If you’re dining at the Auberge, this is definitely the place to stay. Highly recommended!

HOTEL_LOCATION: 4 rue de Collonges au Mont D Or, 68970 Illhaeusern France
REVIEW_TEXT: Wonderful property -- on the river, lovely gardens and a great spa area with pools, sauna/steam, hot tub, and cold pool.   After a long day of biking, I got refreshed in the steam, cold pool, sauna, cold pool routine -- then enjoyed an elegant yet simple meal at the adjacent Auberge de l'lll.    Definitely worth a visit when you are in Alsace.

HOTEL_LOCATION: 4 rue de Collonges au Mont D Or, 68970 Illhaeusern France
REVIEW_TEXT: This is the boutique hotel attached to the three star Michelin restaurant Auberge de l’Ill. I had a brief one night stay here in June 2018 when visiting the restaurant, in room 7. The key feature of the hotel is the superb riverside view, shared by the restaurant, which is maybe fifty metres along the river. The river view is framed by weeping willow trees and is truly glorious, the banks populated by the odd stork and a rather cute black and white cat.   My room was large, with a comfortable bed, sofa, table and small balcony overlooking the river, along with air conditioning. The bathroom had both a shower and a proper walk-in shower. There was free wifi, which I measured at an acceptable 3MBps download, though much slower upload. This was sufficient for basic email and web…

HOTEL_LOCATION: 4 rue de Collonges au Mont D Or, 68970 Illhaeusern France
REVIEW_TEXT: For the first time this year, i had the opportunity of visiting the Alsace region and its incredible wine route. I never thought it was so beautiful both on the cultural and architectural aspects of it. I stayed at l'hôtel des Berges, and enjoyed fully their very nice property. The exellent service and the spacious room were extremely enjoyable. I will for sure return there in the near future. I will recommended without hesitation L'Hôtel des Berges".  Very "paradisiac"

HOTEL_LOCATION: 4 rue de Collonges au Mont D Or, 68970 Illhaeusern France
REVIEW_TEXT: Once again, Such a great time at l’Hôtel des Berges ». Last year, i had the chance to stay there during a seminar and decided to come back with friends. The spa treatment was exellent. The georgeous new pool is a must; and the top notch service delivered by Marco and it’s family was unspeakable. Truly thank you again for an amazing Journey

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel de Crillon, A Rosewood Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 Place de la Concorde 8th Arrondissement, 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: Definitely one of the best hotel stays in the world. Friendly and helpful staff, perfect location and really luxury feel. Highly recommend to anyone looking for the best place in Paris to stay. My only critique is that I would love to see more vegan options on the menus!

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel de Crillon, A Rosewood Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 Place de la Concorde 8th Arrondissement, 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: I had to travel to Europe for a very difficult work project during lockdown and decided to treat myself with a weekend in Paris before having to quarantine back in the UK! It's my second time staying at the Crillon this year, and the trip we had in March was made so special that I couldn't imagine staying anywhere else. I needed to relax on my own and knew that Serge, our butler extraordinaire from last time, would take good care of me!  I arrived absolutely exhausted and was shown to a beautiful room (my new favourite!) and it was wonderful to be greeted as though you're coming home! The next day my boyfriend arranged the most incredible surprise - photos of us in the room, a jacket potato a la Caviar Kaspia, a massage, the works - even a packet of Cheeto's (how did you find these in Paris!). The butler team, led by Adrien and with the help of the concierge and the chef completely blew me away in their ability to do this all on a Saturday in Paris while my boyfriend was in London.   I felt completely spoiled and I think whether you're coming for a special occasion or for business you always leave the Crillon feeling like this. Nothing is too much effort. Everything was spectacular, above and beyond - from their drivers to the bar staff. I'm already looking forward to next time. Thank you!…

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel de Crillon, A Rosewood Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 Place de la Concorde 8th Arrondissement, 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: We have been to many top hotels, and it just doesn't get any better.  The hotel and staff are simply superb.  The suite we had was magnificent, and every member of the staff we encountered were fantastic.  Location is terrific. Apparently there has been some renovation, and every inch looks magnificent.  There is an old adage that "you get what you pay for" and here the cost is high, but you get more than you are paying for.  Only bad thing is that we could not stay longer.

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel de Crillon, A Rosewood Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 Place de la Concorde 8th Arrondissement, 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: Just returned from an amazing stay in Paris at the Hotel de Crillon. If there were a six star category it would fit this hotel. The hotel has recently been redone and the public spaces and the rooms are all beautifully decorated. Every need of the guests is anticipated and met. All of the staff are welcoming, friendly and go out of their way to make you feel like this is your home. The spa and pool are outstanding. Breakfast in the courtyard is an absolute treat. The suites are over the top in terms of appearance, comfort and functionality. Location is perfect. A stay here is a true indulgence for the sophisticated traveler.

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel de Crillon, A Rosewood Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 Place de la Concorde 8th Arrondissement, 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: What an extra special place to stay when you are in Paris!  A must.  Best location to a lot of the main sites in the city.  Over the top service.  Hamza was amazing - always remembered our names and took great care of us.  Made us feel so welcome.  The breakfast was superb - you must get the hot chocolate!  We stayed in four European countries on our trip and this was definitely the highlight.  Worth every penny.  No question - an extraordinary property.  The staff should feel very proud.  Thank you for making our trip an over-the-top experience!

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel de Crillon, A Rosewood Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 Place de la Concorde 8th Arrondissement, 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: Fabulous. The staff. The food. The ambience - the best in Paris and lord knows we’ve tried the others. It’s not cheap but if you want the best - this is it.  We treated some elderly relatives to a three night stay and although it cost more than most cars, my mother in law said it was her ‘dream come true’ - so it was worth it.  Just.

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel de Crillon, A Rosewood Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 Place de la Concorde 8th Arrondissement, 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: This was an experience! To date the best tea time I have had. From stepping out feet into the lobby to our table. The service was brilliant. The staff are warm , welcoming and attentive. The decor is grand but warm and cosy at the same time. The property is beautiful and the sandwiches and pastries were just so tasty. Also I appreciate how they changed their service because of the hot weather and gave us the option to have cold drinks instead of the usual hot tea. This was simply a beautiful experience. Luxurious setting but with a simple warmth and not ostentatious. I love the place and would definitely recommend anyone to go there. The staff were simply great! Smiling and warm faces in Paris. This is rare. I do not recall the names but thanks to the guy who took us pictures, the lady who served us, the lady who kindly escorted me to the ladies and the guy at the entrance who took us pictures.…

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel de Crillon, A Rosewood Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 Place de la Concorde 8th Arrondissement, 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: Everything was faultless, the staff, the room, the details, the breakfast, the cocktails at the bar. We could not have chosen a better "Palace" to spend 2 nights in the city of lights. We love it and so will you. Highly recommended.

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel de Crillon, A Rosewood Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 Place de la Concorde 8th Arrondissement, 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: I recently spent 4 nights at the Hotel de Crillon in a Grand Premier Suite.  This is the best room category before you get to the named suites.  While the suite was very pretty, it was quite tiny.  I was in Paris several times during this trip and on other occasions stayed at the Plaza Athenee and The Ritz, all at similar price points. The Crillon accommodations  were not on a par with either of these hotels; in both cases the suites were considerably larger.  It was the hotel's pettiness in other small things that really got to me.  As we all know, the hotel industry's latest rage is to pretend to be ecologically conscious and generally ask the guest to place a card on the bed if a sheet change is not required. We know that this is a flagrant attempt to save money, the environment be damned.  At the Crillon, the guest must place the card on the bed in order to have the sheets changed.  Who can remember to place a card on the bed when they are racing out to see all that is Paris?  Remember, we're talking about a suite in the range of 3,600 Euros per night.  Another tiny but annoying matter was turndown service.  The night maid would come in and remove all of the dirty towels, but not replace them with new clean ones; that appeared to be the job of the day maids.  On a high point, the L'Ecrin restaurant, a small space hidden inside the ground floor, is a gastronomic gem which will succeed despite its pretenses of creating a meal around the wine chosen.  I am not partial to wine, but the food was excellent.  The Crillon was my late parents' hotel of choice in Paris, and it was mine as well in my younger days.  Sadly, Rosewood has spent a lot of money on the place, but the dedication to hospitality appears to have gone.  I won't be returning.…

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel de Crillon, A Rosewood Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 Place de la Concorde 8th Arrondissement, 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: My stay at Le Crillion could not have been better.  The property is beautiful designed.  Every space was unique and inspirational.  Much to my husband’s disappointment, the hotel makes me want to redecorate!  The spa is a cannot miss.  I had a wonderful massage and dip in the magical indoor pool.  The restaurants and room service were fast, the food presentation lovely, and of course delicious.  I also enjoyed an evening in the bar area, with unique speciality cocktails.  I stayed at Le Crillion because the George V was full.  I’ve now completely forgotten about the George V.  This is where you stay in Paris!

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel de Crillon, A Rosewood Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 Place de la Concorde 8th Arrondissement, 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: what can i say, the most beautiful hotel in Paris. service is fantastic, a shoutout to the maids. the sweetest crew i have ever met. every time my wife and I were in the hall on our way to the room or leaving, all of them would greet us, ask us if we needed anything etc. amazing! i could go on, but let me just say the place is a palace, and you would be making a mistake if you stayed anywhere else.

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel de Crillon, A Rosewood Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 Place de la Concorde 8th Arrondissement, 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: I have benn here twice before the pandemic anonce in may...what can i say.. everything here is perfect, whatever need you might have it will be met with kindness, profesionalism and efficiency. I have tryed the Ritz just to see if the Crillon will be the second best but nooo, its still  my favourite hotel in Paris

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel de Crillon, A Rosewood Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 Place de la Concorde 8th Arrondissement, 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: This is my third stay at Hotel de Crillon and my first since it because a Rosewood property.  I am a experienced and picky traveler and  can write you a litany of long read and just say, if you are wondering if you should stay at Le Meurice or de Crillon, it's Le Meurice, if you are wondering if you should stay at La Reserve or du Crillion, it's La Reserve.   To mention a few glaring shortfalls: 1.  You can't control the temperature in the room.  You have to ask them to do it and they never get it right.  You are either freezing or waking up in a pool of your own sweat.    2.  Their concierge is useless.  Has no pull anywhere.  We got into everywhere we wanted to, but not once was it with the help of their concierge.  This team is so inept, that they couldn't even ship items…

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel de Crillon, A Rosewood Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 Place de la Concorde 8th Arrondissement, 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: The hotel was magical as we travelled during Christmas 2021. The staff were extremely helpful and hospitable. The rooms were also very clean and spacious.   The concierge helped us to book many of our restaurants and booked a private tour for Versailles Palace.   Can't wait to visit again!

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel de Crillon, A Rosewood Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 Place de la Concorde 8th Arrondissement, 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: Happy to resume my travels after a 2 year haitus ( for obvious reasons ) and I decided to book this hotel. Actually I booked this hotel way in advance in 2021 when Delta was still raging on. Crillon is one of the historic “Palace” hotel in Paris and after reading reviews and also watch some youtube videos of the property, I was very eager to try.   Arrival    My hotel comes with round trip airport transfer and I arranged for them to pick me up from train station instead as I was taking the Eurostar train from London to Paris. A staff from the hotel was available to greet me at the train platform and in no time, I was whisked to a luxurious Mercedes car and on my way to the Crillon.   On arrival, I was warmly greeted by name and escort to the reception area for check-in. The…

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel de Crillon, A Rosewood Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 Place de la Concorde 8th Arrondissement, 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: My partner and I love to travel but by the end of a trip we are always ready to go home to our house/bed.  The Crillon was so amazing that we, for once, did not want to leave. We were actually sad to say goodbye to the lovely suite and all the employees that made every moment of our stay special.  The staff is genuinely happy to see its guests and attend to their needs.  Edi at the restaurant remembered our plans each day, the airport attendants were seemless and our Butler, Claire was alone worth the price of our stay.  She was perfection.

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel de Crillon, A Rosewood Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 Place de la Concorde 8th Arrondissement, 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: In a world where more is better, where excess is a must and where the ultimate luxury is to post a fake smile in a golden background, Hôtel de Crillon and its team have found an unbeatable way to be far above the rest.  The things you will feel when staying in their hotel wont apear in you Iphone pictures. It's about feeling at home and not getting impressed or distanced by such beauty (and yes, there is so much around!). Its about coming back at anytime and having someone not only knowing your name but also that you favorite football player was amazing last night. Its about magically knowing what you will like from the restaurant today and discussing it with you with outstanding manners but without distance.   Getting into your room and discovering not just a beautiful note but…

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel de Crillon, A Rosewood Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 Place de la Concorde 8th Arrondissement, 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: I would like to express my thanks and appreciation for the service and care I received from your hotel. This is the first vacation for my family and me, and I wanted it to be perfect. The Hotel de Crillon certainly did not disappoint.  I want to acknowledge the honesty of the room cleaning staff. I had left out a large quantity of cash in the room and had forgotten to put it away. When I returned to my room later in the evening, all the cash was accounted for, and safely tucked away in the bedside drawer. I would also like to specifically thank Michael for his exceptional service. He was taken care of my family and me almost the entirety of our stay.  We will definitely be back.

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel de Crillon, A Rosewood Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 Place de la Concorde 8th Arrondissement, 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: We had a great week staying in Hotel de Crillon. From the meet-and-great to our departure we had excellent experience. The hotel design, the room, the pool, the restaurants and the bar were quite captivating. The staff was great. This was truly 5-stars when I compare to other 5-stars hotels we have stayed. The L'Ecrin food and presentation was exquisite and the staff was great (didn't really noticed we actually spent more than 3 hours dining). Jardin d’Hiver for breakfast and lunch in the garden will be missed by us for a while :), especially the pastries. The bar Les Ambassadeurs with live music was so enchanting, we had to visit it couple of times during our stay. The butler and housekeeping service was impeccable.

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel de Crillon, A Rosewood Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 Place de la Concorde 8th Arrondissement, 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: I enjoyed a tea time experience at the Jardin d'Hiver on Friday April 29.  My waiter, Arnaud, was incredibly friendly and kind, and we were able to practice our French and English together.  The food was beautiful and tasted delicious, and the setting was also beautiful and very relaxing/quiet.  The only thing that could have been better is that when Arnaud had to leave, no one came to check on me or refill my water for the remainder of my time there.  I felt a bit forgotten.  Other than that, it was a very nice experience and I would happily come back again to enjoy with my daughter or a friend.

We just completed a three day stay at the Splendide Royal.  It was a truly remarkable hotel visit and added so much to our experience in Paris. From the moment we arrived, we were warmly welcomed by Caroline (who made our stay that much more exceptional with her professionalism, warmth and attentiveness).  She offered us a glass of champagne (and water)  on arrival as she took our details.   Our room was spacious and lovely and well air conditioned (something that does not necessarily exist in France).  There were many small amenities in the room that were replenished on a daily basis.  The bathroom was also large and comfortable with two sinks, a separate tub, shower and commode.  We were in Room 302. I loved the fact that everyone working in the hotel (from the manager, to the front desk staff, to the breakfast servers) were simultaneously professional and warm and extremely helpful.  The boutique hotel experience was accentuated by the fact that we were welcomed by name each morning and evening.   We will most certainly return to the Hotel Splendide Royal the next time we are in Paris!  Merci à tous pour  votre aide!…

Customer care and attention to detail was on a different scale.  The hotel location, amenities, ambience and food were of the highest quality. It was, however, the staff at the smallest 5 star hotel in Paris who made our trip so much more memorable and special.

Stayed here with the family and had the most marvelous time.  The service was so amazing and the staff really made it one of the best experiences ever.  Everyone who works here is so sweet and kind - they really go out of their way to make sure everything is to your liking and that you are happy.   The rooms were so clean, the beds were very comfortable and there was a nice intimacy about the hotel.  This is a hidden gem in the city of lights.  Cannot wait to come back!

My husband and I spent 3 lovely nights at the Hotel Splendide Royal Paris last week.  Everything was excellent-- the service, our suite, and beautiful Paris as a backdrop!  This is a small, boutique hotel.  Service is excellent.  The staff works expeditiously to make certain that every comfort is met, every expectation is exceeded.  We stayed in room 501-- a suite with a balcony and gorgeous view of the Eiffel Tower.  It really felt more like our own luxury pied-a-terre in the city than a hotel.  The hotel staff felt more like family, welcoming us home, than employees of a hotel.  In fact, the excellent service started well before our arrival.  I exchanged several emails with the staff in preparation of our trip.  They were warm, friendly and exceptionally helpful in assiting me with preparing for our travels.  Hotel Splendide Royal is well appointed with luxury furnishings and overall a delightfully charming boutique experience.  The only negative experience we had was leaving!…

This is our favorite hotel of all time and we have stayed at many wonderful properties!   The staff is constantly kind and proactively helpful, the rooms are absolutely beautiful, the complimentary breakfast is outstanding and the location in just perfect for everything you will want to do in Paris.  The amazing staff even helped by ordering my bouquet and my husband's boutonnière for our vow renewal ceremony.  We had the best time and will always stay at the Hotel Splendide Royal when in Paris from now on.  Highly Recommend if you want a perfect Paris experience!

Hôtel Splendide Royal Paris is without question one of the finest establishment in which we have ever had the pleasure of staying.  The staff, who you will likely know by the first few days are helpful and sincerely interested in your impressions of the hotel, restaurants you visit and Paris's countless sites.  This is the closest you'll get to a "French Downton Abbey" experience,  With only 12 rooms, one does feel like you are staying in a mansion rather than a hotel.  We want to add that the entire staff's helpfulness comes across as an authentic desire on their part to make sure your visit is most memorable.

I traveled to Paris few times a year before Covid interruption and stayed at various hotels throughout the years including the most renowned ones. But since Hotel Splendide Royal opened its doors in the fall of 2016 it became my number one choice without a doubt. Everything in this hotel is a refined perfection. Located on a quiet street just around the corner from Élysée Palace, its rooms are impeccably appointed, layout is spacious and planned for utmost comfort, the lobby is an exquisite mix of traditional French period pieces and contemporary art. The service and attention by all staff members is beyond reproach. Unlike many other places this one gives its guests a feeling of an elegant and hospitable private home rather than a big city hotel. I hope for many more returns to the best city in the world and for the chance to stay again and again at the beautiful Splendide Royal! …

This was our first time in Paris, and the hotel was lovely! It is small, only 12 rooms, but ours was quite spacious. The staff were attentive and the service was great. The restaurant food and breakfast were delicious. The hotel is right next to the Presidential Palace, so we felt safe walking around. It is close enough to walk to the Champs Élysées, Louvre, and Grand Palais. I would return.

I am luxury traveler and try to go to five stars hotels who gain five out of five in TripAdvisor. This time I choose this hotel as I have heard a lot about it. I start from the first,as we arrived to hotel was around 2:30 PM ,we asked about s.th to eat in our suite,surprisingly there were no snacks or food available except club sandwich,so we ordered it since we were so hungry.The sandwiches were prepared after45 minutes but the waiter fell down one if the sandwiches before entering the room,she apologized and told us she will bring the new sandwich but guess what?she brought the one that fell down on the floor. I found the carpet pile on the sandwiches☹. I complain about this to one of the staff ,but nothing happened except an apology and some excuses. Next morning we went for breakfast and the menu was as simple and limited as possible  Surprisingly you should pay extra for omelet. I asked for pancake for my son and sadly the chef does not know how to bake a pancake. They brought s.th weird that was no similar to pancake.it was really sad that a five stars hotel can not serve a pancake. These things was really disaster in a five stars hotel. Sadly,whenever I called the reception there were no one to.answer the phone. In every five time we went out of hotel or come inside the hotel there was no one who we can ask our questions ,or tell the problems that we have. No concierge,no coffee shop, no room service. Ignoring all the faults,the staffs does not care about hygiene and health of the guest in no aspects. It was the only holiday that I was really ashamed of my family and Splendide spoiled my vacation in Paris. I will never forgive them. Splendide is not hotel in my idea ,it is just like a lodging-house.it does not have the basic facilities of a hotel. Oh I forget to write about our suite,it was attic with literally nothing. No amenities.  They ruined my ,but I will do my best to inform other traveler to avoid this hotel. Splendide is not hotel in my idea ,it is just like a lodging-house.it does not have the basic facilities of a hotel. Oh I forget to write about our suite,it was attic with literally nothing. No amenities.  They ruined my ,but I will do my best to inform other traveler to avoid this hotel.…

Nothing more can be said other than excellent ! The staff were exceptional and we loved every minute. The food is very fresh and really high quality. The suite we stayed in was perfect and from the moment we arrived until we left we felt very special. Thank you.

This was our first stay at the Splendide Royal and we were sorry that we had not discovered it before. From the warm welcome by the friendly staff who made us feel at home to the great service of a delicious breakfast, the staff was caring, knowledgeable  and helpful.   The Junior Suite Saint-Honore' was spacious, comfortable and peaceful. The lighting, the air-conditioning and other features were well thought-out and simple to use.   We will defiantly stay at the Spendide whenever we are in Paris.

An amazing boutique hotel, located at the heart of Paris, in a quite and very convenient area to main attractions and nice restaurants. Excellent personnel. They all made their best to make us feel at home. Everything was scheduled for us well in advance. Special thanks and congrats to Benoit and all the team. Will go back for sure. Recommend to all couples that want to feel Parisian chic atmosphere, away from crowded, big hotels.

Fantastic location, staff & space.  The rooms were spacious & well-appointed.  Our family suite, which connected a suite with a jr. suite, included 2.5 baths, a mini-fridge and microwave.  Very friendly staff, who welcomed even our rambunctious young kids.  Splendide is in a quieter part of town, surrounded by art galleries & the president's residence (so if you're hoping to be near lots of restaurants & nightlife, this may not be a good choice).

Just returned from a truly wonderful week at the Splendide Royal. Great staff and service ; we were on a first name basis with the staff within two days. Location was great; centrally located in the 8th arr within easy walking distance to the Louvre, Orsay, Champs Elysee, and the shops on Rue Honore; room was beautiful with a great shower and view of the Eiffel Tower from the balcony.; breakfast offered eggs in addition to great selection of fresh baked pastries; had two wonderful meals at Tosca, soon to be Michelin-starred! If your looking for a 5 star experience and service in a small, boutique environment this is the place. And when our original flight home was postponed a day they easily accommodated us for an extra night and sent us to the airport with fresh coffee and…

A fantastic 5-star hotel in the heart of Paris. This luxurious hotel is situated in a perfect location, allowing to visit the highlights of the city within walking distance. The Paris-style atmosphere is everywhere in the hotel combined with absolute luxury. Our room (suite) was extremely clean, spacious with all the amentities provided. The breakfast was served (our will) in our room and was very tasty everyday. All the staff was more than kind, aiming to help us in every aspect (restaurants, booking of tickets etc). And of course, i have to highlight the fantastic Michelin-star rated restaurant of the hotel (Tosca restaurant) which offers unique italian tastes. We will be back to this fantastic place soon. Thank you for everything.!!!

A beautiful property in one of Paris’ most elegant neighborhoods,  my stay at The Splendide Royale was one of the highlights of my recent trip.  My room was ready when I checked it at 9:30am (unheard of!) and my bags were brought to my room along with fresh croissants and coffee. My room was both beautiful and comfortable, housekeeping did a great job all week. The staff was both very friendly and extremely helpful. I loved eating at their restaurant, Tosca, as well. I’ve been recommending The Splendide Royale to all my friends in NYC since returning home from Paris a few days ago. You won’t be disappointed!

Lovely hotel rooms, friendly staff and perfect location for our purpose. Though the breakfast menu was limited with very little hot option for vegetarian. The cleanliness of the hotel was 10 Out of 10 and the house keeping team managed  the room every day to a level Where we did not have to ask for any thing that was not done to our liking.I have travelled to May places and different hotels but the house keeping team at Splendide have been the best!!! This really make the stay even more pleasant and stress free

With only 12 suites, this small, luxurious hotel is everything and more in what we were looking for in our combination anniversary/birthday trip to Paris! Tucked on a small side street off of Rue Saint-Honore, it's a great locale to walk and explore with terrific shopping and restaurants nearby. We were on the second floor with three large floor to ceiling windows and a wee balcony. I was a little bit concerned about street noise but there was none! We slept so well in our seven nights there; it was so quiet, the bed was just the right amount of firm and comfort and the linens were to die for.  I can't say enough about the staff; they anticipated our needs and didn't hesitate to accommodate us with anything we desired. Our room was immaculate whenever we returned from the day's…

One of the smallest luxury hotels in Paris, but a hotel with  extremely heigh standard of personal service and a tasteful decor in a  family inspired environment. We enjoyed our  two night stay in one of the hotels junior suites and  also the very helpful and friendly staff.. The Hotel’s restaurant Tosca  served us Italian food at its best. We will look forward to return.

This hotel really made our stay in Paris unforgettable. Excellent experience!!! Fantastic and unbeatable service!!  Everything is absolutely beyond perfect.  The district where this hotel is located is the best, we walked to all places because it’s very central. We felt very safe in this area, actually it’s the safest in whole Paris and very chic. The hotel interior is beautiful and the small lobby and reception area is warm, cozy and very inviting. We had a beautiful room on the top floor with a view on the Eiffel Tower. I wanted a room with a bathtub and they changed us to the lower floor with a bathtub, I was so happy that they made it possible to meet my wish.  Talking about wishes the staff will do everything to make your stay amazing. They are all so kind and honestly…

HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 rue de la Trésorerie II Accès véhicules pour service de voiturier & garage : place du Château, 73000 Chambery France
REVIEW_TEXT: This hotel is certainly reflective of the 5 point rating. We arrived for a 2 day visit and were greeted warmly and efficiently. Room was super clean, comfortable and spacious. The dinner we had was just outstanding. Lamb (best I had ever eaten)and salmon dishes were superb. Service was outstanding the entire visit from the dinner to the room service to just helping us be more comfortable. It wasn’t overboard service ..it was just right. Clearly the staff is highly trained..and everyone is genuinely nice.  We will be back for sure.

HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 rue de la Trésorerie II Accès véhicules pour service de voiturier & garage : place du Château, 73000 Chambery France
REVIEW_TEXT: We had telephoned to ask to modify the dates whereas we normally arrived only in 1 month, that had been refused because our reservation made did not allow it, we had therefore come on the scheduled date without modification, there was a smell of humidity which we did not like and we had asked to change rooms but this had been refused because the hotel was full except that on the hotel website there were still rooms available, not very commercial

HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 rue de la Trésorerie II Accès véhicules pour service de voiturier & garage : place du Château, 73000 Chambery France
REVIEW_TEXT: Very friendly and personal Welcome.  A little Oasis with a fantastic Restaurant! Nice personal Spa Area and view of the Castle. Rooms were very clean and well climatised. - I will certainly come again, the next time i am in the Area.

HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 rue de la Trésorerie II Accès véhicules pour service de voiturier & garage : place du Château, 73000 Chambery France
REVIEW_TEXT: Luxurious hotel but I had to wait too long to get my room, at first they did not find my reservation then they misplaced my payment and finally they found everything without really apologizing, there were no wifi networks in my room even my mobile phone did not work in the room, a pity for such a beautiful hotel not to have the latest generation equipment for wifi and telephone

HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 rue de la Trésorerie II Accès véhicules pour service de voiturier & garage : place du Château, 73000 Chambery France
REVIEW_TEXT: WOW.  We happened upon PHC, accidentally, when we had to reroute our trip for unforeseen reasons.  Found on Google, and on our route, PHC looked nice in photos and had availability on short notice. We crossed our fingers and took the plunge.  We are so lucky we did.  It is hard to describe what it is like when you find a true gem - something so special and unique that it reminds you of the joys of travel. Built into a centuries old building by Charlotte and her husband, this beautiful, personally managed hotel/restaurant exhibits the love that the owners have put into it.  Providing five-star attention, the owners and their adorable team, make this property feel like a fine home. The location is perfectly situated across from the 12th century castle, and a stone’s throw away from cafes and patisserie. There is nothing cookie cutter about PHC. Style abounds.  And the restaurant is run by a young Malaysian chef whose cuisine is inventive, fresh and delicious.  He feels like a *star* in the making.  Our visit felt very much like a top-notch Relais & Chateau experience. For now, as the name suggests, PHC is a very well kept secret.  Not for long, I suspect.…

HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 rue de la Trésorerie II Accès véhicules pour service de voiturier & garage : place du Château, 73000 Chambery France
REVIEW_TEXT: Sometimes its the little things that make all the difference, and its so true with Le Petit.  Every room detail was perfect, the feel of the rug on your bare feet, the comfort of towels and bed sheets, the waterfall option on the shower head, every little thing to many to mention was perfect and then combine it with the fact that hotel is owner operated and they are so thoughtful and considerate in each interaction makes this hotel a must for anyone staying in old town Chambery.  The location of which is across from the castle which is magical in its own right.  100% would recommend to all our friends and family.  Loved every moment of it.

HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 rue de la Trésorerie II Accès véhicules pour service de voiturier & garage : place du Château, 73000 Chambery France
REVIEW_TEXT: Absolute gem of a hotel. Beautifully designed and kept from the entrance to the rooms. Charlotte, the owner, is an amazing host and her attention to every detail is reflected across the property. Rooms are very warm and welcoming with all amenities that you could require. Breakfast was excellent. Safe and secure parking is also available at an additional cost close to the hotel. Thank you Charlotte and team for an excellent stay... will be back!

HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 rue de la Trésorerie II Accès véhicules pour service de voiturier & garage : place du Château, 73000 Chambery France
REVIEW_TEXT: We had an appointment in this hotel with friends before taking the road to go to a ski resort, we had been very well received, our room was large and bright with a beautiful decoration, the whole hotel was very beautiful with an ideal location, the restaurant was also very well decorated and we had eaten very well, everything was of high quality,

HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 rue de la Trésorerie II Accès véhicules pour service de voiturier & garage : place du Château, 73000 Chambery France
REVIEW_TEXT: We arrived late evening however the reception kindly arranged for a reservation in their Folie restaurant. So glad they did… attention to detail is found throughout the hotel: rooms, service and of course food. The hotel has been renovated with taste and no expense has been spared. The rooms are super comfortable and the shower room had 2 in-built  shower rain systems. The restaurant will soon (in my opinion) get a Michelin star. We travel the world and I can safely say I have eaten better here than in other 2 star Michelin restaurants.  The breakfast is incredible, both in terms of size and quality… the table was simply not big enough.  Without a doubt a hotel I recommend. It’s 700m away from the train station so easy to pop in/out.  Well done to the team for managing such a wonderful place!…

HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 rue de la Trésorerie II Accès véhicules pour service de voiturier & garage : place du Château, 73000 Chambery France
REVIEW_TEXT: Such an exquisite hotel, from the property to the rooms and all of the amenities. Breakfast served in a beautiful room, all made to order. The spa are was one of a kind and the rooms the same. The owners have remodeled the grounds impeccably. We loved our time there and were treated like royalty.

HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 rue de la Trésorerie II Accès véhicules pour service de voiturier & garage : place du Château, 73000 Chambery France
REVIEW_TEXT: An excellent hotel that I highly recommend for Chambéry visitors. The owners and the staff are so helpful and keep their guests totally pleasant. The quality of services, the cleanliness of the room and the breakfast are excellent. They also handle carefully the valet parking.

HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 rue de la Trésorerie II Accès véhicules pour service de voiturier & garage : place du Château, 73000 Chambery France
REVIEW_TEXT: The hotel is wonderful.  The rooms are excellent.  The pool and spa are magical.  The breakfast is delicious and it is served in a lovely room.  The staff is extraordinarily kind and helpful.  I give Le Petit Hotel Confidentiel my highest rating!

HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 rue de la Trésorerie II Accès véhicules pour service de voiturier & garage : place du Château, 73000 Chambery France
REVIEW_TEXT: A beautiful lovely stylish hotel super centrally located. Very unique design and atmosphere. The bed linens are extremely nice 😊 and comfortable in a very good bed. Bathrobes and slippers come for tall men in large sizes. The owners are very sweet and helpful. Our dog 🐕 Lotta enjoyed the cookies and Spezial bed for her and dishes. Thank you

HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 rue de la Trésorerie II Accès véhicules pour service de voiturier & garage : place du Château, 73000 Chambery France
REVIEW_TEXT: Never again !!!  Booking confirm (twice !!! ) but when we arrive it was fully booked.  Waited 2 hours for answer and ended up with an additional 2 hours drive to another hotel outside Genève.  The husband even ended up mad at us because we complained. How dare we !!!!

HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 rue de la Trésorerie II Accès véhicules pour service de voiturier & garage : place du Château, 73000 Chambery France
REVIEW_TEXT: My wife and I have traveled many places in Europe and had many nice experiences, but Petit Hotel Confidentiel is truly exceptional. It may be the most perfect small hotel we've ever stayed in and our first trip to Europe was in 1973...YIKES! The location of the hotel is ideal for experiencing ALL that is special about Chambery (and there's LOTS)  and the hotel is still in a peaceful, quiet location. The owners of the hotel are completely involved in the operation, not at a distance, and this creates an extremely perfect stay. The decore of the rooms is lovely and the rooms are very very clean, as is the entire hotel, from stairwells to elevators...to every corner. We did lots of walking in this beautiful small town and hope to revisit it in the future. And, we would most…

HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 rue de la Trésorerie II Accès véhicules pour service de voiturier & garage : place du Château, 73000 Chambery France
REVIEW_TEXT: What a wonderful experience: the room was spacious, superbly decorated, all modern cons (even a sort of nespresso capsule to add to the shower water!), quiet and spotlessly clean. The renovation of this historic building is an absolute success - and has one of those rare smokers' corner: a wonderful courtyard with ambience. And the hotel is in the midst of it all in the pedestrian zone with restaurants, market and sights within easy walking distance. But it was the owners that made the difference: helpful and genuinely interested in going the extra mile (like getting stuff out of our bag in the car that was already parked somewhere for the night!). Anybody not staying here is missing out...

HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 rue de la Trésorerie II Accès véhicules pour service de voiturier & garage : place du Château, 73000 Chambery France
REVIEW_TEXT: My husband and I run a business and our supplier arranged for us to stay at this amazing Hotel during our visit. We were instantly amazed. The owners are kind and attentive and very easy to talk to. They will help with arrangements for visits and ensure your every need is met. The room we stayed in was stunning and every detail perfect. It was relaxeming and easy to make the perfect temperature. The bed was the most comfortable  we have never slept in. The walk in shower included an aromatherapy shower. The bath shaped like a huge egg was a must to relax in. We had room service one evening and the food was both delicious and perfectly presented.   The view from our room showed us the château and when we opened the doors to the tiny balcony lovely street sounds from the quiet…

HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 rue de la Trésorerie II Accès véhicules pour service de voiturier & garage : place du Château, 73000 Chambery France
REVIEW_TEXT: Petit Hotel Confidentiel is exactly what a top class boutique hotel should be. All of the staff were so friendly and welcoming, the hotel is beautifully designed and decorated, the pool and sauna were fantastic..... and the breakfast was magnificent. This  hotel is a real treat...!  Expensive, but well worth every penny (euro..) ...   : - )

HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 rue de la Trésorerie II Accès véhicules pour service de voiturier & garage : place du Château, 73000 Chambery France
REVIEW_TEXT: It was wonderful and the owner was adorable. Nothing was too much trouble. Superb spa as well. A new indoor pool and a restaurant to come. This really is a special hotel with great attention to detail and delicious breakfast.

HOTEL_LOCATION: 10 rue de la Trésorerie II Accès véhicules pour service de voiturier & garage : place du Château, 73000 Chambery France
REVIEW_TEXT: As per all the previous reviews we loved this gem of a hotel...even though we didn’t partake in all of its ‘facilities’ ...we had a wonderful night here.and in probably one of the cleanest and most comfortable that we’ve stayed in for quite a while...with its quirky layout and beautiful design we will definitely come back....a special mention not only for the complete care and attention from ‘all’ the staff ...but also a great breakfast..that yes isn’t cheap but great quality.

HOTEL_NAME: La Reserve Paris - Hotel and Spa
REVIEW_TEXT: We spend the weekend to celebrate my wife's birthday and we where spoiled. There was a nice attention in the room. And we got an upgrade. A big shout out to the team of La Réserve!! The hotel is well located behind the Champs Elysées and close to the most important highlights of the city. From our suite we had a nice view to the Eiffel Tower.

HOTEL_NAME: La Reserve Paris - Hotel and Spa
REVIEW_TEXT: Everything about our stay at La Reserve was incredible. The staff was very welcoming and attentive. The hotel is beautiful yet comfortable and the location is very convenient to all of the sights. The room was spacious and beautifully appointed with all of the important extras, such as Nespresso coffee. We enjoyed an excellent dinner in the beautiful back garden, under flowering trees that we lit up. It was such a charming atmosphere and the wait staff was informative and friendly. All in all, our stay was very short but we will definitely stay La Reserve the next time we're in Paris.

HOTEL_NAME: La Reserve Paris - Hotel and Spa
REVIEW_TEXT: This property epitomizes  luxury in every facet of its performance. My clients arrived with high expectations and La Reserve delivered on all points; a gorgeous facility,  excellent location (views of the Eiffel Tower), exceptional dining and most important, extraordinary service. We had a little miscommunication but the front desk kept me apprised of the situation and took care of the clients - to their delight. I would recommend this property to every discerning traveler headed to Paris - they won't be disappointed.

HOTEL_NAME: La Reserve Paris - Hotel and Spa
REVIEW_TEXT: Having had the privilege of traveling all over the world at the most coveted hotels for both business and pleasure, we have very high expectations.  There are many luxurious, professional and beautiful hotels and so it is very difficult to truly standout among the best of the best.  La Réserve is the that rare exception that exceeds the expectations of a 5 star hotel.  La Réserve is the marriage of all the best services provided by a large preeminent hotel with the excellent  service, attention to detail and intimacy of the best small hotels in the world -- a combination so rare, difficult to achieve and exceptional that once you experience La Reserve, you realize the true meaning of the ideal 5 star experience. I think the Premier Concierge, Olivier at La Reserve embodied the essence of what makes this hotel exceptional -- in (always a fun) conversation with Olivier, he described his role as not a job but a true passion -- the passion to unlock and provide the best and most unique experience for each and every guest.  This authentic and sincere goal to provide the best experience possible for each guest was exemplified by many on staff at La Reserve from Maxime, our wonderful porter to Melodie's  grace and professionalism at the front desk to Myla and her outstanding team each morning at breakfast.  Each day of our visit was better than the last and our only regret was leaving La Reserve -- the new bar for what we will try to seek in all our future travels.  Unfortunately for now, La Reserve probably stands on this pinnacle alone.  Thank you to the staff at La Reserve for showing us what an elite hotel experience could be.…

HOTEL_NAME: La Reserve Paris - Hotel and Spa
REVIEW_TEXT: Staff was amazing.  hotel is beautiful.  A truly wonderful experience.  Every attention to details.  Great location to many attractions and excellent restaurants. My friends told the staff about my birthday and they went out of their way to wish me well.  the Cake and champagne in my room was truly a special treat.

HOTEL_NAME: La Reserve Paris - Hotel and Spa
REVIEW_TEXT: Beautifully appointed, well situated, absolutely lovely hotel. Very intimate service, the staff could not have been more helpful if they tried. Great location within walking distance of the best shopping Paris has to offer and the Champs Elysses. Rooms were very spacious, even by US standards. We departed on Bastille Day and the streets were all cordonned off. The bellman walked us and our very heavy luggage for almost 15 minutes to find an opening for the car to pick us up. Highly recommend this hotel.

HOTEL_NAME: La Reserve Paris - Hotel and Spa
REVIEW_TEXT: Wonderful room, great service. Dinner at the restaurant was absolutely fantastic.  We would return again.  Everything at this boutique hotel is top class. Safe and quiet location but close to everything. Attention to detail in every sense.

HOTEL_NAME: La Reserve Paris - Hotel and Spa
REVIEW_TEXT: A long awaited, post-Pandemic return to La Reserve was met with all the charm and personal service that I remember. Two meals on the hotel’s terrace were lovely. The concierge team provided great guidance, helping us secure reservations at hard-to-get tables and unveiling a few hidden, local spots not covered in guidebooks.  We were upgraded to an amazing room - bed, the bath amenities all superbly comfy. We did not want to leave, but we anticipate a return to the property soon. Thank you to the entire La Reserve team for another amazing Paris visit.

HOTEL_NAME: La Reserve Paris - Hotel and Spa
REVIEW_TEXT: Magnificent hotel. Staying there is experiencing French culture at its very best. Spectacular decor, facilities, and staff. The food at La Gabrielle is a culinary experience. The staff are well trained and cannot do enough for you. We celebrated my wife’s 60th and the hotel made it a memorable, exceptional experience.

HOTEL_NAME: La Reserve Paris - Hotel and Spa
REVIEW_TEXT: It was an absolute pleasure to stay at La Reserve. I almost don't want to write this review so to keep it more of a secret but it's too good not to share.   We were there for a week, enjoyed a lovely suite, and experienced almost everything this lovely hotel has to offer.  The Concierge team, in particular went above and beyond, in assisting us during our visit.  Between the lovely room, beautiful breakfasts, enjoyable bar, great location and welcoming and attentive staff, I'd highly recommend it to anyone looking for a special experience in Paris.

HOTEL_NAME: La Reserve Paris - Hotel and Spa
REVIEW_TEXT: One of the best hotel experiences.  Any negative reviews are likely particular individual issues and overall the service, rooms, staff and facilities were impeccable.  A smaller boutique hotel in a fantastic location with attention to detail and exceptional service.  Look no further for your stay in Paris.

HOTEL_NAME: La Reserve Paris - Hotel and Spa
REVIEW_TEXT: The hotel is top notch.  The rooms are absolutely gorgeous.  Probably the best shower I have had in a hotel.  The location of the hotel is ideally located about a 20-30 minute walk to the Eiffel tower and about a 5 minute walk to great shopping areas.  I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris.  It is a boutique style hotel that doesn't have many rooms which makes it an intimate experience.

HOTEL_NAME: La Reserve Paris - Hotel and Spa
REVIEW_TEXT: Fantastic visit, especially as the hotel was thoughtful about what we originally designed as a birthday trip.  Staff left a thoughtful gift in the room for our arrival.  All the rest was completely professional and excellent.  Particularly appreciated the note and help of Astrid de Vannoise, Maitresse de l'hotel.  All the best, look forward to visiting again soon.

HOTEL_NAME: La Reserve Paris - Hotel and Spa
REVIEW_TEXT: An excellent hotel with providing exceptional service, accommodation and food in a perfect location....  The rooms and staff catered for all your needs...  Beautiful bathrooms facilities and relaxing treatments in the Spa made for the perfect get-away....  The

HOTEL_NAME: La Reserve Paris - Hotel and Spa
REVIEW_TEXT: We had a great stay for 7 days. Initially , we were upset as they gave us a room on the 5th floor that was not like the one we had stayed in before. It did not have the Toto toilet , which call me crazy , it’s really one of the reasons we like the hotel so much. Anyhow , they changed our room after we complained and the rest of the trip was very nice. Special shout out to Kevin at the cigar bar. My husband and our friend met him in there and for the rest of our stay he made sure we were taken care of even getting us a table in the restaurant when we were told there weren’t any left.

HOTEL_NAME: La Reserve Paris - Hotel and Spa
REVIEW_TEXT: I stayed at La Reserve for my honeymoon. It was THE best hotel stay I’ve experienced in my life. The staff was kind and welcoming; the room was incredible; the food was delicious. This was a once in a lifetime type of experience. The hotel is located in a great location - walking distance to most of Paris’ most sought after sites.   We had an incredible experience and will certainly return in the future!!

HOTEL_NAME: La Reserve Paris - Hotel and Spa
REVIEW_TEXT: As usual la reserve is an hotel which cannot be compared to any other in Paris Small and dedicated to his customers you deserve la Reserve or you go somewhere else  Quality of service is so rare today especially in france, rooms are big and refined  Sometime not easy to go back home …,

HOTEL_NAME: La Reserve Paris - Hotel and Spa
REVIEW_TEXT: Exclusive, Luxurious, Posh, Elegant and Historic.  It’s absolutely Gorgeous with service that’s beyond Magnificent. If you like Beautiful Decor and Furnishings, Sumptuous Cuisine and Royal Treatment in an intimate setting… La Reserve Paris is your destination. It was the Palace of Napoleons Brother so it’s easy to understand the level of Beauty.
