The staff were Phenomenal…the doorman were like Angels… so helpful, kind caring protective… the Reception and concierge staff were unbelievable and there was the sweetest young girl from room service who  we wanted to adopt lol. My wife and I love coffee and lots of cold cream…so we called late at night… bought a lotttttt lol. Every day our Suite had fresh refills, We love her!  We travel around the World a lot, we meet many staff and…

HOTEL_NAME: La Reserve Paris - Hotel and Spa
REVIEW_TEXT: From the reservation experience, to concierge service, F&B offer, Spa treatments and service in general, everything at La Reserve is perfect. Four nights family trip, in which we´ve discovered this great hotel: perfect location, rooms equipment and furniture with absolutely top quality, bathrooms have a lot of space and multiple amenities, decoration is elegant and cozy.... Special mention to concierge team (Olivier, thanks!!): they where able to book table with very short notice from our side in some top restaurants (Guy Savoy and Jules Verne). Really impressive service. Very good a la carte breakfast, with nice and friendly staff, with the kind of "easy-going" but elegant service we appreciate as frequent travelers. After having stayed in some of the top 5* Luxury hotels in…

HOTEL_NAME: La Reserve Paris - Hotel and Spa
REVIEW_TEXT: My children and I were lucky enough to spend three wonderful nights here. We debated staying here or Four Seasons but we were so pleased with our choice, this  hotel exceeded our expectations on so many levels.   Firstly, It is in a wonderful location sandwiched between the bottom of the Champs Elysee and Rue Faubourg Staint Honere.  It is a small hotel with an intimate, members club vibe. Service is of the highest level, we were always greeted by name and a smile. The concierge was one of the best I have come across. We were made to feel like members of a private home, where our needs were of the upmost importance to everyone we encountered. The decor is delightful.  We had a junior suite with a balcony and spectacular view over the Champs Elysee and Place De La Concorde. The…

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel & Restaurant Lalique - Chateau Lafaurie Peyraguey
REVIEW_TEXT: Jerome and Alejandro in Lalique could teach so many Michelin star restaurants a thing or two.. created special meals just for us, due to dietary requirements, and created truly amazing meals, and made us feel so welcome. Nothing was a problem.. the rest of the hotel staff duly followed suit to make us genuinely regret only staying two nights! Will definitely return. If you are looking for an amazing quiet get away with truly amazing dining, this is the place for you.. can't recommend highly enough.

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel & Restaurant Lalique - Chateau Lafaurie Peyraguey
REVIEW_TEXT: Our staying were pretty nice we enjoyed atmosphere and place. But only thing when we come lady on reception was Unfriendly! And didn’t explain information about hotel . And also didn’t was answering on our questions very aggressive. I would like to note the work of the person who helped with the luggage, on the contrary, he tried to smooth out the conflict as much as possible and apologized. He did our staying

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel & Restaurant Lalique - Chateau Lafaurie Peyraguey
REVIEW_TEXT: Absolutely stunning hotel. Our in beautiful Sauternes country.  The Michelin restaurant is superb, staff is so kind and inviting, our room looked over the vineyards.  Every aspect of the hotel is filled with Lalique. A visit to the cellar chapel  is a must to see the Lalique crystal barrel.  Fantastic wine— a must do bucket list

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel & Restaurant Lalique - Chateau Lafaurie Peyraguey
REVIEW_TEXT: This hotel is just stunning ! The minute you see it from the outside you just know it’s going to be special. We stayed in a deluxe room , so comfortable and incredibly high end and just beautiful . Everywhere you look in this hotel there is a thing of beauty . We’ve stayed in a lot of the Relais & Chateaux properties in France and in our view, Chateau Lafaurie, in terms of the quality of the rooms is the one of best, and yet it’s very reasonably priced compared to other Relais & Chateaux that don’t offer anywhere near the same quality.  The staff are incredibly friendly, very warm and welcoming. The manager Ricardo made sure our stay was perfect. He recommended that we visit Chateau de Cazeneuve , a must , and we can’t thank him enough .  What a fabulous experience the restaurant is , again one of the best we’ve experienced in France . The ambiance and the setting of the restaurant as well as the wonderful menu created by Jerome Schilling , such a pleasure especially when he came over to introduce himself .  We had wine tasting in the shop opposite the hotel . Im just so pleased I’ve been introduced to this premier cru it’s just delicious  I’ve already booked to return next summer and I’d loved to have been able to find time this winter to try Jerome’s winter menu too. I can’t recommend this hotel and restaurant enough. If you want a really special high quality break in an outstanding area then this is the place .…

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel & Restaurant Lalique - Chateau Lafaurie Peyraguey
REVIEW_TEXT: This hotel is stunning and well worth a visit.  Every corner has something Lalique. The staff are 5 * +! Incredible service  The rooms are just fabulous, gorgeous beds (I’ve travelled the world and this was the best bed I have slept in!)  We used the laundry service and our clothes came back pressed and cleaned to perfection  Make sure you dine in their Michelin restaurant. The food and service in there is next level. The best food we’ve eaten.  Of course everything comes at a price, but this is well worth every penny!

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel & Restaurant Lalique - Chateau Lafaurie Peyraguey
REVIEW_TEXT: The easy charm of the staff is representative of the hotel and restaurant. You need a car to visit because it’s some way from a town or village but you’re surrounded by their vineyards as well as those of Pape Clement and D’Yquem. Their wines are fabulous and the restaurant with its Michelin star is sublime. The chef presented us with a signed menu after our meal and personally thanked us for our custom

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel & Restaurant Lalique - Chateau Lafaurie Peyraguey
REVIEW_TEXT: We stayed with a friend at this unique property during low season. Although weather in November isn't the most friendliest and hotel restaurant wasn't operating at that time, there was so very few guests staying that we truly enjoyed the feeling of having such a wonderful place almost just for ourselves. The bathroom, and especially the shower room was exceptionally great; and having complimentary minibar was greatly appreciated. Crystal artwork are exhibited throughout the premises, notably in the wine boutique that you truly should take a look at, get yourself a bottle of this incredible nectar that match 'foie gras' like no others. Finally staff was very nice and discreet.

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel & Restaurant Lalique - Chateau Lafaurie Peyraguey
REVIEW_TEXT: The owner of Lalique decided to open a hotel inside the well known property he also owns in the heart of Sauternes. Luxurious, all decorated with lalique, wonderful property, excellent restaurant and a unique experience. Very few rooms for the lucky few. Bravo!

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel & Restaurant Lalique - Chateau Lafaurie Peyraguey
REVIEW_TEXT: From the Lalique toilet roll holder in the loo to the Steinway in the lounge, from the tastings of one of the finest wines in the world to the Crystal barrel of wine in the chapel, this is special. Full Stop.   This is touch of luxury I didn't expect outside of the world of TV dramas. It is dear, but also exceptional value.  There is little to say when there are no faults, except that this is an experience we won't forget and we will be back.  Staff, excellent Room, excellent.

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel & Restaurant Lalique - Chateau Lafaurie Peyraguey
REVIEW_TEXT: I never started a review raving about the chef.  Why would I, or anyone for that matter?  After all, it is a hotel review.  But...  Chef Jéróme Schilling and his Restaurant Lalique is quite the exception. He is a rock star.  He is friendly.  He loves what he does... and it shows.   His food brings you to near tears.  THAT'S how good it is.  Memorable.   Outstanding. Genuine.  As for the hotel, also referred to as Hotel Lalique (there's beautiful Lalique crystal... EVERYWHERE), the staff is excellent, attentive and accommodating.  Do yourself the favor, stay here, and dine.  Also, make sure to get a booking at both the Lafaurie-Peyraguey AND Chateux d'Yquem vineyards for a sauterne throw down! :-)

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel & Restaurant Lalique - Chateau Lafaurie Peyraguey
REVIEW_TEXT: I never started a review raving about the chef.  Why would I, or anyone for that matter?  After all, it is a hotel review.  But...  Chef Jéróme Schilling and his Restaurant Lalique is quite the exception. He is a rock star.  He is friendly.  He loves what he does... and it shows.   His food brings you to near tears.  THAT'S how good it is.  Memorable.   Outstanding. Genuine.  As for the hotel, also referred to as Hotel Lalique (there's beautiful Lalique crystal... EVERYWHERE), the staff is excellent, attentive and accommodating.  The rooms are quite nice, and had the hotel not had someone like Chef Schilling, it would get 4 stars.  But, do yourself the favor, stay here, and dine.  Also, make sure to get a booking at both the Lafaurie-Peyraguey AND Chateux d'Yquem vineyards for a…

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel & Restaurant Lalique - Chateau Lafaurie Peyraguey
REVIEW_TEXT: We stayed at the chateau for the time of our life’s . The room was beautiful overlooking the amazing Sauternes vineyards. The restaurant an amazing Michelin star display , the whole place and people were just amazing. They have bycicles to rent and go around the vineyards and amazing people, while costly this is a place to explore and enjoy!!

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel & Restaurant Lalique - Chateau Lafaurie Peyraguey
REVIEW_TEXT: This is what a 5 star hotel really is! The decor is superb and pays attention to all details, the staff gives great recommendations and makes you feel like home, the rooms are superb, the vineyards a dream. The restaurant deserves a special review . You must do this hotel if you are around Bordeaux. Exploring the grounds with a bicycle is fantastic.

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel & Restaurant Lalique - Chateau Lafaurie Peyraguey
REVIEW_TEXT: One of the finest of hotels by Relais Chateau, enjoyed our stay, staff extremely friendly, professional and helpful. Kitty that restaurant was closed, however the front desk staff booked a great place in Sauternes. Highly recommended.

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel & Restaurant Lalique - Chateau Lafaurie Peyraguey
REVIEW_TEXT: If you’re an art fan, you’ll find this lavish Lalique furnished hotel all the more fabulous.  Exquisitely decorated with incredible attention to detail, it’s a stunning 1st class hotel in a beautiful vineyard setting.  Rooms are light and spacious, service is lovely and the food - only 1 Michelin star but beats several 2 stars we’ve eaten at hands down.  Service is excellent but communication is the only thing which lets the hotel down - how to order breakfast for example and MUCH more importantly confirmation of whether guests want to eat dinner or not.  We were attracted to the hotel because of the chef and thought we had emailed in our original reservation but there was no record of it. Our bad! Unfortunately although having heard a great deal about the ‘surprise ‘ restaurant…

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel & Restaurant Lalique - Chateau Lafaurie Peyraguey
REVIEW_TEXT: We had a fabulous stay here in this exquisite hotel! The service is outstanding and the property is gorgeous! The decor is studded with Lalique crystal which is used in the most magnificent way throughout the property. The hotel is a chateau converted into guest rooms. The Château is part of the vineyard and so a wine tasting with the vineyard is a must! (Schedule in advance.) They also -at our request- scheduled visits to vineyards in the Medoc - this was very memorable and must have taken a fair bit of effort on their part!   The dining is truly exceptional! We dined for two nights during our stay at the hotel. It was delightful! First of all, the service was impeccable. Formal French service at its best without being arrogant. In fact, the service was precise but at the same…

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel & Restaurant Lalique - Chateau Lafaurie Peyraguey
REVIEW_TEXT: The top of the top! It allies the beautiful work of arts of Lalique located in Alsace ( Wingen sur Moder) to the highest quality of sweet Sauternes (Premier Grand Cru classé). The executive and resident Chefs are also from Alsace and were taught by the famous Klein of the Villa Lalique, also a Relais et Chateau. At all level the staff is perfectly professional and trained. The view on the vineyard is fsuperb Visit the chop where we bought 2017 primeur which will be bottle only in December. Do not forget that quality wines were the best investment of the century before classic cars, that are definitely more expensive..

HOTEL_NAME: Hotel & Restaurant Lalique - Chateau Lafaurie Peyraguey
REVIEW_TEXT: We knew this hotel had only been open for one month, and were keen to stay there. First impressions were great: Its a gorgeous building, immaculately restored and manicured, and impressive. The receptionist and porter on duty were very friendly and welcoming, and offered us a refreshing drink while we checked in. We stayed in a suite, which was immaculate and decorated to a very high standard. it was very comfortable and quiet. The bed was superbly comfortable and the shower was the best we've ever experienced! Thankfully we stayed sans-enfants..it could become a very expensive stay- as there is Lalique everywhere throughout the hotel and the room!    We had a wine tour in the hotel winery with a fabulous member of staff (Justine?). She spoke excellent english, and was…

HOTEL_NAME: Grand-Hotel du Cap-Ferrat, A Four Seasons Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 71 boulevard General de Gaulle, 06230 St-Jean-Cap-Ferrat France
REVIEW_TEXT: Staying at Grand Hotel is like staying in paradise with the beautiful sea, exceptionally well groomed, spacious property, lovely rooms and most importantly, outstanding staff. If given the opportunity, make a reservation at Le Cap, as it is a delightful gastronomic experience with presentation almost too pretty to eat. Club Dauphin has the best olive bread and olive oil we have consumed anywhere.  Concierge staff is exceptionally helpful in organizing activities, including hikes and dinner off property in picturesque seaside villages.  Grand Hotel is the perfect place to unwind and rejuvenate one's soul.

HOTEL_NAME: Grand-Hotel du Cap-Ferrat, A Four Seasons Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 71 boulevard General de Gaulle, 06230 St-Jean-Cap-Ferrat France
REVIEW_TEXT: Saint Jean Cap Ferrat is such a beautiful utopia, but The Grand Hotel Du Ferrat is the crown’s jewel. We only had the opportunity to stay for one night, but that day was enough to feel the warmth, magic and generosity of spirit of every single member of the staff. The premises of the hotel are the most gorgeous and delicate curated, the rooms are a dream and the hotel in general is just perfection. We hope to come back soon.

HOTEL_NAME: Grand-Hotel du Cap-Ferrat, A Four Seasons Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 71 boulevard General de Gaulle, 06230 St-Jean-Cap-Ferrat France
REVIEW_TEXT: The best time to visit the French Riviera is May / June in my opinion. We spent 5 days at the FS Grand Hotel Cap Ferrat mid May and it was a delightful and rejuvenating break. Everything was perfect: elegant estate, magnificent gardens and landscape, enjoyable large pool area at Club Dauphine, cozy and tranquille spa, fine restaurants of which one Michelin starred. And best of all, first class service worthy of FS standard. Will definitely come back.

HOTEL_NAME: Grand-Hotel du Cap-Ferrat, A Four Seasons Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 71 boulevard General de Gaulle, 06230 St-Jean-Cap-Ferrat France
REVIEW_TEXT: We come to the Grand Hotel for many years and it has nothing lost of his attractiveness. The tranquility of the whole place including club dauphin, the first class service of the staff and attentiveness is remarkable. The location at the tip of the Cap Ferrat peninsula with its gardens makes our summer vacation a highlight.   This year I believe as a result of COVID the hotel had a lot of new staff, but all of them were very eager to do their best in order to deliver a first class service. I have to admit they did really a great fantastic job. The Restaurant La Veranda had a very attractive menu as well as you could also get the mix of Japanese and Peruvian style menu Izakaja.   We definitely will come back in 2023 because this is really a place were you can calm down and enjoy.

HOTEL_NAME: Grand-Hotel du Cap-Ferrat, A Four Seasons Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 71 boulevard General de Gaulle, 06230 St-Jean-Cap-Ferrat France
REVIEW_TEXT: My wife and I ended our 2 week vacation at grand-hotel du cap-ferrat and it was some of the best service we experienced, certainly the best we experienced in France. From the moment we walked through the doors, we did not have to lift a finger. The service is incredibly warm and truly some of the best we’ve ever had. The staff are available but not overbearing - almost always stopping to ask “can I get you anything at all?”. For example, my wife wasn’t feeling amazing on our second to last day and asked about whether there was a pharmacy where she could purchase a specialty item. While there is a pharmacy in town, the staff offered to go into town for us, purchase the item, and hand deliver it to our room. We charged the cost of it to our room but the “delivery” was complimentary. Not only was this “above and beyond” but the staff treated us like it was no problem at all. In advance of our trip, they emailed us promptly and made excellent recommendations. They speedily and expertly booked us a boat trip within a few minutes of the request, rearranged reservations, and made us feel welcome. We’ve been fortunate to stay at a number of luxury properties in France, Europe, and around the world, and the service here is top-notch. They are truly always anticipating our wants and needs a step ahead of us. Special shout out to Julia, Salvatore, Emily for their hard work, dedication, and making our stay memorable. We are still here now but already can’t wait to return!…

HOTEL_NAME: Grand-Hotel du Cap-Ferrat, A Four Seasons Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 71 boulevard General de Gaulle, 06230 St-Jean-Cap-Ferrat France
REVIEW_TEXT: Although a top price property, it is always a delight staying at the hotel. One of the world’s great vacation spots.Great rooms/suites and exemplary service. Club Dauphin (pool etc) is a delight. Difficult to beat!

HOTEL_NAME: Grand-Hotel du Cap-Ferrat, A Four Seasons Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 71 boulevard General de Gaulle, 06230 St-Jean-Cap-Ferrat France
REVIEW_TEXT: Thank you to every staff member including Olivier for the warm welcome. Each and every staff person was kind, caring and welcoming. A most memorable stay enjoying food, unforgettable coastal walks, great recommendations  This Hotel is a gem

HOTEL_NAME: Grand-Hotel du Cap-Ferrat, A Four Seasons Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 71 boulevard General de Gaulle, 06230 St-Jean-Cap-Ferrat France
REVIEW_TEXT: I am late in posting this review but it is important that everyone know what an amazing hotel this is. My wife and our youngest son (14) spent 3 nights at the hotel in April and had an amazing time. The hotel is absolutely spectacular and is only surpassed by its staff. We stayed in a deluxe terrace room which was just gorgeous. The room had a nice patio with a great view of the sea and was very comfortable. The room was quite large in that it comfortably slept three of us--my son slept on the sofa bed and said it was very comfortable. The bathroom was fantastic. Everything was spotless.  We visited during the "low" season and so only one restaurant was open (the others opened right after we left). We had dinner our first night in the restaurant and then breakfast each morning there as well. Each meal was great and the service was impeccable. The pool at the Club Dauphin is one of the most amazing hotel pools anywhere with simply incredible views. The grounds and the gardens were also beautiful and we enjoyed walking around the gardens.  We did not visit the spa but it also looked amazing. The hotel is at the tip of the peninsula and we spent a great day walking along the ocean into town and also visiting for dinner. It was a remarkable few days and we can't wait to visit as it was surely one of the best hotel stays we have ever had.  I also need to extend a massive thank you to the hotel. I purchased our stay at a breast cancer awareness charity auction in 2019 before COVID as I wanted to take my wife to the south of France for a special birthday trip.  Although the stay was to be completed within 1 year of the auction event, COVID hit and we were unable to make the trip. While the hotel certainly had no obligation to honor the stay, it graciously and without hesitation extended the trip a total of 4 times until we were able to finally go.  I mention this as the hotel should be applauded for its support of breast cancer research and its fantastic customer service in light of COVID.  Well done and we can't wait to visit again!…

HOTEL_NAME: Grand-Hotel du Cap-Ferrat, A Four Seasons Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 71 boulevard General de Gaulle, 06230 St-Jean-Cap-Ferrat France
REVIEW_TEXT: Well, you really have to hand it to the Four Seasons.  They know how to separate you from your wallet.  But this was over the top!  There are about 75 rooms in this location and all of them except the suites are like 200 sq feet.  There's room for a bed, a small table, a tiny closet and an even tinier bathroom.  It's really ridiculous.  And all for the bargain price of $6,000 per night.    So what do you get for that?  Well, the answer really is nothing.  They don't know you at the front desk despite the fact that you may have stayed hundreds of nights in Four Seasons properties.  They don't know you down at the pool.  Could we have those two lounges over there with the unobstructed sea view and a little bit of privacy?  "No, merci, they have been rented for the entire month."  Yeah, that's good but there's no one there and it's 4:30 in the afternoon!  "No, we can not do that.  II est impossible."    And then there's the pool.  It's big.  Too bad the rooms aren't that size.  But its crowded and a ton of kids are in the water.  So, you know what that means.  Yup, you're swimming in a peepie and poopie water hazard.  Avoid it at all costs.  The people watching is entertaining.  There are a lot of thin, sleek pretty women with men who are at least 30 years older with bellies that are distended as if pregnant or maybe just full of cream puffs.  I was equally entertained by a robust (read: cream puffs)  Kuwaiti woman who after bossing her Filipino help around endlessly, fell asleep next to me and starting snoring, every bit the equal of the Zephyr express chugging through the Sierras.  My suggestion:  avoid this hotel like the plague and go to the Aman in Greece.…

HOTEL_NAME: Grand-Hotel du Cap-Ferrat, A Four Seasons Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 71 boulevard General de Gaulle, 06230 St-Jean-Cap-Ferrat France
REVIEW_TEXT: Impeccable service starting with a kind and warm welcome from Julia at the concierge desk. We were upgraded for our anniversary and the experience was the best of our lives. Having traveled the world and stayed in many 5 star hotels… grand hotel du cal ferrat outshone every one!!    Every moment was truly magical. Thank you so much, Julia and Maelys for making our stay so memorable. Undoubtedly we will be back for for future anniversaries!

HOTEL_NAME: Grand-Hotel du Cap-Ferrat, A Four Seasons Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 71 boulevard General de Gaulle, 06230 St-Jean-Cap-Ferrat France
REVIEW_TEXT: Let’s start with the positives: the hotel is beautiful, the gardens are luxurious, the pool is magnificent. The service definitely needs improvement. I tried to book a dinner experience and never got a response. Then they didn’t have availability. When I asked for a dinner reservation the answer was “we will try.” For $3300/night they can do better than that. They did get us a reservation but that required me complaining. Overall they were coolly adequate.  Then my brother stub his toe by the gate opener. There is a very inconvenient post right there. It was a pretty bad cut. The front desk was helpful and called a doctor but again it was nothing more than adequate. A doctor came and gave my brother a tetanus shot. They were going to make us pay for the doctor which I probably…

HOTEL_NAME: Grand-Hotel du Cap-Ferrat, A Four Seasons Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 71 boulevard General de Gaulle, 06230 St-Jean-Cap-Ferrat France
REVIEW_TEXT: We recently returned from a 6 night stay at this FABULOUS hotel.  Words cannot describe how special this hotel is. It was on my bucket list and it exceeded all my expectations.  From the moment you drive up – you can feel the luxury! The beautiful lobby and flowers, the fabulous manicured lawns and foliage and the views overlooking the Mediterranean Sea.  It will take your breath away!  The rooms have  stunning décor, large closets, and gorgeous bathrooms. The bed linens and beds are so luxurious. Even the bathroom towels are the softest I have had in a hotel. Nothing but the best! The housekeeping staff were wonderful cleaning our room  twice a day.  Breakfast is served outdoors at the La Veranda Restaurant  in the prettiest setting I have ever seen. It is truly like being in…

HOTEL_NAME: Grand-Hotel du Cap-Ferrat, A Four Seasons Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 71 boulevard General de Gaulle, 06230 St-Jean-Cap-Ferrat France
REVIEW_TEXT: I normally post reviews after finishing an experience, but in this rare instance, I was so disappointed in the service received that I felt it was appropriate to record my thoughts immediately.  As the last leg of our honeymoon, my wife and I were so excited to stay here to cap off what has been an amazing trip (and wedding) in France.   Throughout the course of the trip, we've stayed at mostly five star hotels throughout Paris (where we got married) Bordeaux, Provence, and the Cote d'Azur, all of which have been successively sublime experiences, replete with the type of service and attention one might expect from a hotel at this price range and given the special occasion we are celebrating.  The streak came to an abrupt end here, at the Grand-Hotel du Cap Ferret. A Grand…

HOTEL_NAME: Grand-Hotel du Cap-Ferrat, A Four Seasons Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 71 boulevard General de Gaulle, 06230 St-Jean-Cap-Ferrat France
REVIEW_TEXT: Want to have the best vacation then you MUST visit Grand Hotel du Cap, it’s specIal.  The view, the pool club, the food , the rooms, but this is all pulled together by a fantastic team of people who go above and beyond.  We will be back!

HOTEL_NAME: Grand-Hotel du Cap-Ferrat, A Four Seasons Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 71 boulevard General de Gaulle, 06230 St-Jean-Cap-Ferrat France
REVIEW_TEXT: The location of the Grand-Hotel du Cap-Ferrat, A Four Seasons Hotel is absolutely magical.  Yes, you pay the price for is, but it is worth every single penny.  The pool and the view of the Mediterranean Sea, is like you are in Heaven.  The staff is very kind, attentive and know you by name.  We stayed 3 nights at Grand-Hotel du Cap-Ferrat, A Four Seasons Hotel and wish could stay more, but the availability of the hotel was limited due to the busy season.  Both restaurants at the Hotel are amazing and the breakfast has a lot of variety of choices that we enjoyed.  The only thing is that I would recommend is to let  future guest aware that there are two different buildings - one is the Palace building that we could see on all pictures, and there is a Terrace building that is…

HOTEL_NAME: Grand-Hotel du Cap-Ferrat, A Four Seasons Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 71 boulevard General de Gaulle, 06230 St-Jean-Cap-Ferrat France
REVIEW_TEXT: We stayed at the Grand Hotel du Cap Ferrat for our honeymoon. We booked a Superior Pinewood room, which is the entry level room. The room itself, while small, was beautifully furnished. It had a large walk in closet and bathroom that compensated for the smaller size of the room. The grounds and hotel itself are stunning, and the service was wonderful.   Our expectation going in was that this would be expensive. It was the third Four Seasons we have stayed at. We also live in Manhattan and are used to high prices for things like food, drinks, and parking. However, the biggest downside for us was the pricing of food and services onsite. When you’re paying a minimum of ~$1,200/night to stay there you do not want to feel like you are being nickle and dimed once you’re there. $50/day…

HOTEL_NAME: Grand-Hotel du Cap-Ferrat, A Four Seasons Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 71 boulevard General de Gaulle, 06230 St-Jean-Cap-Ferrat France
REVIEW_TEXT: Beautiful location and nothing to say about that. Unfortunately what killed my experience is the service since the staff was new, untrained and unprofessional. The breakfast buffet was not what we expected from a luxury hotel like this one where rates start at 2k per night. No sense of welcoming or smiling. Getting the attention of the staff at the f&b outlets is challenging.  Pool is enjoyable even though the sunbeds are stuck one to each other giving non sense of privacy or luxury. Not what one expects from a luxury resort.  Overall experience is enjoyable but definitely lacks in value for money.

HOTEL_NAME: Grand-Hotel du Cap-Ferrat, A Four Seasons Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 71 boulevard General de Gaulle, 06230 St-Jean-Cap-Ferrat France
REVIEW_TEXT: Grand-Hotel du Cap-Ferrat is one of the most beautiful hotels in the world.  The accommodations are lovely, the setting is gorgeous, the food is consistently excellent and the staff cannot do enough for the guests. The hotel is so well managed that everything from arrival to departure was seamless. It was a most memorable 35th anniversary trip.

HOTEL_NAME: Grand-Hotel du Cap-Ferrat, A Four Seasons Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 71 boulevard General de Gaulle, 06230 St-Jean-Cap-Ferrat France
REVIEW_TEXT: I visited this hotel in may 2022 together with my wife. Pré-arrival, I saw already a lot of pictures of the hotel on different media channels, but to experience the full beauty of it, you should stay a couple of nights. The property is very big, very beautiful & very well maintained. The staf is super friendly and makes you feel at home; thanks to all the team members. The rooms, restaurants, Club Dauphin (swimming pool), ... all lived up to my expectations. A place I definitely will visit again.

HOTEL_NAME: Grand-Hotel du Cap-Ferrat, A Four Seasons Hotel
HOTEL_LOCATION: 71 boulevard General de Gaulle, 06230 St-Jean-Cap-Ferrat France
REVIEW_TEXT: Beautiful property, rooms, gardens, pool area, etc. There is a great trail behind the property which will allow you to hike the peninsula either towards the town of Cap Ferrat or the opposite direction. I really enjoyed this hike and the views are outstanding. Lounging at night under the canopy of the umbrella pines, drink in hand is fantastic. The property is located at the tip of Cap Ferrat, far from Nice. It takes a while for a taxi or an Uber to get to the property and a ride into town will cost between $40 to $90 dollars depending on mode of transport. The Michelin restaurant was very good for dinner. It was pricy but expected. Breakfast was disappointing. There is only a buffet at $60 pp with various items laid out (very nicely) and an egg and a dessert type item (waffle,…

The hotel exudes luxury and delivers superb service. Bed was super comfortable to the point I just wanted to stay in bed the whole day.  Tried room service and two of the restaurants, I could tell fresh ingredients were used. Location wise it is close to Place Vendome a shopping hot spot. Will definitely come back.

It’s a beautiful place and the reception and communal areas are stunning in the main but they hallways and more importantly the rooms are dated. Classy, clean but ultimately - this hotel needs a revamp.   One thing that really annoyed me - there are no shorts allowed in the bar. No problem with that rule - even if they were lovely tailored ones :) but it was an empty bar and seems a bit silly as we were all well dressed.   But what REALLY annoyed me was the fact a few mins later, some noisy kids were with their mother in the bar and throwing paper balls around whilst running around the same bar like lunatics …..and to top it all, some chap in a suit with a bare chest (not joking) speaking loudly on a FaceTime call to some poor person about the ‘quality’ of ladies in Paris and other dross was allowed to wonder around the bar and reception barking into his phone at will.   Neither appeared to be ordering drinks - we won’t be back.  The beds were comfy though and staff generally nice.…

My husband and I stayed at Le Meurice for 5 nights in August.  Hotel is located in the heart of Paris with most sights and restaurants within a walking distance.  Louvre is only 5 mins walk away and famous Angelina cafe frequented by Coco Chanel is right next door.  We arrived early afternoon and our room was ready. We were also upgraded on arrival to a delux room on the third floor. The room was well appointed and hotel left us lovely wedding anniversary gifts of chocolate cake and a defuser.  We had breakfast included in our rate, and during August, it was hosted at Alain Ducasse’s Michelin restaurant.  Food was exceptional with a choice of a la carte dishes such as eggs cooked to order, pancakes, French toast, salads, charcuterie and pastries.   We had lunch at Le Dali our first afternoon and it was one of our favourite meals in Paris.  We used hotel spa twice during our stay and it was very good. It was a nice way to relax after full day of sightseeing.  Overall we had a wonderful stay at Le Meurice and will definitely be back when in Paris.…

I’m very disappointed with the interior of the room, we saw the pictures on booking.com and google maps and it looked 100% different and lower grade although it's a Dorchester hotel one of the top hotel chains. The room is not convenient at all there’s no mirror in the room not even a space to plug your phone to charge it they got us an old fashion extension to plug it in the closet so we can charge our phones. We paid this amount of money for nothing, although we stayed in the ritz and everything was 100% amazing! Historically the ritz is way older than le Meurice yet they changed a lot of things to make their clients happy and comfortable.

Rooms are small, but efficient. Very rundown same as 20 years ago.  Great location top notch concierge, house keeping, toiletries, services.  Nice gym, ok spa.  Angelina is right next door as well as the best shipping area.

Booked to have a good rest after long travel day and long flight. The hotel arranged airport pick up in advance. I opted for the meet and greet option which was worth every euro! From that first moment to check in and the stay, the service was impeccable. My room was beautiful. Having booked thru AMEX had hotel credit and breakfast which was convenient and relaxing. If you want top drawer accommodations this would be the place.  Paris was very crowded, busy, it was nice to have a quiet place to retreat.

Our stay simply could not have been better.  From accommodations (the view was spectacular) to the service, everything was perfect.  We felt at home from the moment we arrived and were given our requested early check-in to everyone making sure our granddaughter and her husband could extend their stay an additional night when their flight was cancelled at the last minute.  We cannot wait until our next visit to Le Meurice.

My wife and I spent three nights at Le Meurice during May 2022. We had made our reservation through the American Express Fine Hotels and Resorts program.  Upon check-in our room was upgraded to a lovely suite overlooking the Tuileries Gardens. Ferdinando, the Deputy Front Office Manager, gave us an excellent tour of the public rooms of the hotel and then escorted us to our room. The room was beautifully furnished and had a wonderful view over the Tuileries all the way to the Eiffel Tower.  We enjoyed daily breakfast in the beautiful main dining room. The staff in the restaurant was excellent.  Overall, our experience was spectacular and beyond our expectations. We hope to return soon.

Le Meurice is an elegant, classy, centrally-located luxury hotel in Paris. We just love it! Our room was stunning and the breakfast is unforgettable! The concierge was also tremendous at assisting with reservations at all the top restaurants. We had a lovely time having drinks each night at the cocktail lounge. Can't imagine a better hotel in all of Paris! Can't wait to return.

I had stayed several times at Le Meurice over the years and always felt that no other Palace in Paris (except maybe Le Bristol, more recently)  came close to the best location and a true, classy Luxury establishment. After arriving from Israel, we checked-in for 2 nights before heading to our little gastronomy tour across France. From the very elegant and efficient valet team to front desk /check-in and getting to our room, everything was handled perfectly, the room with view over the Tuileries was as booked and a personal welcome note, flowers and gift were awaiting. The concierge Bertrand was very helpful and room service as well as cleaning were excellent. Our stay was great albeit short and we only got to enjoy the bar, as we had before, with a couple of Parisian friends who met us there. The restaurant seemed as beautiful as the last time we dined but we had too many plans across town to squeeze a dinner.And I hated that we didn't get to taste one of the pastries of the talented Resident Pastry chef Cedric Grolet....! I had soon the opportunity to be greeted by the GM, Franka, as well as the main managers who each introduced themselves and were ready to assist in any way possible. One of the signs of great Leadership is always how a team of managers and client facing employees handle themselves and address questions: in this hotel, you can tell that the GM has empowered them to perform at their best level and lets them shine while she, rather reserved, stays in the background and available if necessary: it is a rare quality of a true , humble and effective Leader that should be celebrated, especially in a Parisian palace where GM can sometimes act like  “in your face” King/Queens of the castle  Bravo Franka Holtman and thank you for making this stay as great as possible, this is why we will always return to Le Meurice, an institution that , over the years, stays true to its standard and roots. When in doubt when it come to choosing a great palace in Paris, go for Le Meurice that will always deliver. The one thing I would note as a possible improvement is that maybe the bar and lounge areas are a bit small for an hotel of that caliber: I know that real estate in this block is challenging but having more areas where guests can mingle and enjoy the atmosphere of this exquisite place would probably allow a higher level and sense of hospitality for the guests and their party…Maybe something that The Dorchester group can consider and could afford, even in this in-demand rue de Rivoli location …

A lovely hotel that will now cost you an additional service fee of 72 euro per night. Unlike ALL other hotels in Paris, Meurice now has this charge in order to help compensate service employees. Just thought you should be aware of this change.

Difficult to provide any negative for this hotel. It was magical from the front desk staff during checking in to Conciege booking amazing restaurants to amazing room with an amazing view.   I can say this is the best hotel to date. I stayed in Four Seasons, Shangri-La, Ritz and other hotel in Paris, but I can truly say this hotel should be given the honor of “magical” hotel. Very “boutique” feeling hotel service with highly well trained teams.  Great restaurants in the hotel(make sure you try the afternoon tea time), beautifully designed all around with centrally situated hotel, truly an hotel to stay.  Only small glitch would be the front of the hotel, staff do not open doors for guest coming in via car service or not so welcoming. But once you step inside the hotel, this is…

In Paris, there are 6 classic "palace" hotels: The Ritz, Bristol, George V, Crillon, Plaza Athenee and Le Meurice. There are a few others also in the same realm: La Reserve, Cheval Blanc, Lutetia. Very simply, you can't go wrong with any of them. They are all extraordinary. The level of "spit and polish" is unmatched. Everything gleams and is perfect. Your choice is totally personal. The Meurice had a Philippe Starck lobby renovation a few years ago. It's striking, if not quite my taste. My suggestion: check rates and Amex Fine Resorts program. Many of these hotels offer specials. I would choose the one with the best deal. You won't go wrong with any of them.

From start to finish this Hotel and staff was amazing!! When I first booked they communicated with me via email. They asked everything you can think of in order to make sure my family’s stay was amazing.  When we first arrived we were greeted by Christopher who immediately connected with my kids and  by made us all feel at home. The front desk staff was welcoming and accommodating. The concierge handled all of our request and communicated with us constantly. This hotel is hands down the best location in town. More importantly they always made us feel at home. Pascal was very inviting and always took care of everything we requested

My husband and I had the pleasure of visiting Paris for our 20th Wedding Anniversary, and we couldn't have asked for a more desirable hotel. Our room was beautifully decorated, comfortable and quiet and immaculately clean. The staff at the hotel is courteous and professional and very friendly. Everyone speaks English. The hotel itself is exceptionally elegant and historically rich. Breakfast was delicious, served daily from 7 to 11 am in one of the first floor rooms. And evenings at the hotel are extremely pleasant. The bar is gorgeous, and there was live music every night. The Louvre is a mere five minutes walk away from the hotel, and next door is one of the finest bookshops in Paris. In short, our four days stay at Le Meurice surpassed all of our expectations.

We spent one night at this 5 star hotel and it was a very nice experience. The hotel is old school and quite ornate in a lavish way. The bar serves very good drinks in a clubby atmosphere and breakfast was delicious. Our superior room was not large with a king sized bed, 2 night stands, a desk with chair and two chairs and a small table. There was a little hall entry area and a very well equipped bathroom with shower (great fixture), separate bathtub, a separate toilet, and 2 sinks. It was so nice having a hand towel rack with special hand towels. All plugs are international plugs and the room is well lit.  Each nightstand has controls at bedside of lights in the room, charger, telephone, reading light and night light. This room is very high tech…in fact we couldn’t figure out…

As close as a perfect old world Parisian experience as one can ask for.  From the hotel itself, to the rooms, to the staff and the food.   We couldn’t have come closer to meeting and often exceeding our picky expectations.  I couldn’t recommend it more if you’re seeking a high end, quintessential, old world, Parisian experience.

A fantastic hotel at the best spot in the heart of Paris! Wonderful and spotless room, with  a spacious marble bathroom. Very friendly staff doing their best to keep us happy! Breakfast was a dream. Croissants by Cedric Grolet , (as well as his fantastic sweets, we had the pleasure to taste another time), homemade marmalades, fresh fruits  and eggs in any way you ordered them gave us the boost every morning to go out and explore Paris. The bar is warm and welcoming offering  jazz music every night. There were nights we definitely preferred to stay in the hotel than going out!!

A great location with some amazing views, but nothing to compare with Plaza Athénée. Feels more like a regular overpriced hotel, where you are just a nameless guest, we’ve been even asked once by the doorman if he can “help us”, as in “wtf are you doing here?”, as we were entering the hotel, this would’ve never happened at the Plaza. Upon the checkout, the lady at the reception ended up blocking my card by charging me twice due to her lack of knowledge of the hotel’s system. She kept insisting that she is right instead of apologizing, until one of her colleagues showed her how to confirm a pre-authorization, but it was too late and my card got blocked till the end of November. A huge inconvenience. We’ve booked the “Chef’s Table” at Alain Ducasse restaurant for one of the…

In two days of my stay, I see the filming of a famous film and a great director working. Once I had to pass on the set (the entrance) also if they were getting ready to film, but no problem at all. The next day they closed one dining room and EVERYTHING in the hotel was under control.

HOTEL_LOCATION: 112 rue du Faubourg Saint Honore 8th Arr., 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: Everything was delightful. Got upgraded to a junior suite. Only annoyance was that the columns were placed in such a way you couldn’t actually see out the windows from the bed (pictured) which felt a little claustrophobic…but otherwise the room was large, beautiful, and had nice views of the courtyard. The service was on point: I casually mentioned at check-in, when asked about my plans, that I wanted to go to Girafe but my concierge was being slow. That night I got a confirmation letter for a reservation at Girafe from the hotel. Hospitality is clearly a key value.

HOTEL_LOCATION: 112 rue du Faubourg Saint Honore 8th Arr., 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: Just returned from a 9 day stay with my family at Le Bristol, and it was perfect in every way! The hotel staff was incredibly helpful, and the service was extremely refined but never stuffy.  The concierge did a terrific job securing dinner reservations at hard-to-get places (the hotel concierge desk is wonderful, but Noe and Guillaume in particular stood out), and housekeeping was very professional and very cheerful with our children. Room service was always a treat in the morning-- our meals were beautifully presented, and breakfast trays even came up to our room with fresh flowers! We had notified the hotel that we would be checking in several hours before check-in with young children, and the check-in was seamless- we were very grateful the hotel made every effort to ensure our rooms would be ready.  Our rooms were tastefully appointed and very quiet.  The pool is small, but whimsical and delightful-- and our kids enjoyed swimming in it each day after sightseeing.    The hotel location is terrific for shopping and sightseeing, and the doorman always were helpful in getting cabs for us on the spot.  The area around Le Bristol feels exceptionally safe given a high police presence in light of the nearby presidential home and embassies.  We would happily return to Le Bristol on our next visit to Paris!…

HOTEL_LOCATION: 112 rue du Faubourg Saint Honore 8th Arr., 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: The most beautiful hotel in paris! Our corner room on the 5th floor was maticulously appointed with 14 foot ceilings, wrap around terrace and classic french furnishings. The staff on point and attentive. The concierge team fullfilling our every request. Dining a culinary experience from michelin starred Epicure to our favourite Le Jardin Francais. if unsure where to dine ask mai-tre d'Hotel Antoine. But most of all we felt welcomed from the moment we arrive to the moment we left. Thank you Le Bristol for making our stay in Paris memorable.

HOTEL_LOCATION: 112 rue du Faubourg Saint Honore 8th Arr., 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: Le Bristol lives up to its legend/reputation.  Easily one of the best hotels we've visited in the world and unique in its essence of French luxury.  Quite worth the experience!  Thanks so much for all the staff and especially to Camille and Eva for all their help during our stay.    Pros: - Nicely sized rooms especially for Europe. - Beautifully furnished - pictures don't do justice to how luxurious and nice the whole hotel is.  Everything is very well kept and the details are sublime. - Great service- from the initial email reservation to leaving the hotel, service at every step is responsive, consistent, understanding and helpful.  - room service was the most consistent and fastest we've seen.  Food is great - at a price - but quite delicious.  Even the daily fruit basket always has fruit ripened at its peak. - Beautiful common spaces and touches such as the evening piano and the splendid cage elevator.   - Garden with the art and fountains was a treat for both the adults and kids. - Location was nice and quiet but centrally located such that all tourist spots can easily be reached.  Cons: - gym is well stocked but a bit small - appreciate that it has windows.    The whole place felt like a retreat from the hubbub of the city - but so convenient and close to everything Paris has to offer. Our only disappointment was having trouble spotting Socrate in the days we were there.  But then again, you can't herd cats....…

HOTEL_LOCATION: 112 rue du Faubourg Saint Honore 8th Arr., 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: What a wonderful stay.  Every detail and interaction was flawless from booking to the concierge and on arrival as well. Genuine warm service from every member of the team. Had a man excellent corner junior suite with a view of the Eiffel Tower.  The hotel is ideally located for enjoying the best Paris has to offer with many of the best museums and galleries just a short walk away.  Thank you to everyone at Le Bristol for making it such an impeccable experience and in particular to Stéphane David who made sure all it was a one of a kind stay!

HOTEL_LOCATION: 112 rue du Faubourg Saint Honore 8th Arr., 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: Wow! This was a fantastic experience at the hotel and epicure restaurant. All the staff were so helpful and lovely. The room was huge and had lovely products to use, a turn down service envy night and so quiet. The rooftop pool which I had to myself sometimes had a great view over Paris! Thank you everyone at hotel  Bristol and see you next year !

HOTEL_LOCATION: 112 rue du Faubourg Saint Honore 8th Arr., 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: My family and I had the BEST stay in Paris at Le Bristol Hotel this past week. The staff was so friendly, the service was outstanding and the accommodations were superb. If you have young children like me, the staff goes out of their way to make them feel at home. The food at the hotel is truly outstanding. We have been to many cities and stayed in numerous hotels; we’ve never had food quite as good as Le Bristol, from the room service to the cafe outside, everything was delicious. The location is also something to be desired. The best shops are right down the street, the Eiffel Tower, the Louvre, and the rest of the attractions are a short car ride away. I cannot say enough about Le Bristol and know you will have an INCREDIBLE stay! Thank you to all of the staff at Le Bristol for making our first family trip to Paris a truly memorable one! We will be back! XO…

HOTEL_LOCATION: 112 rue du Faubourg Saint Honore 8th Arr., 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: This is my second stay at the Bristol, the last one was about 7 years ago and I dare say this was an oasis in the middle of all the crayziness going on with traveling this summer. We could not book a room on the website and decided to then try another “5 star hotel” nearby. After having the worst experience we called the Bristol and they found us an amazing room. From then on our stay in Paris became a totally diferent experience. This time I brought my kids who were extremely tired afer 10 days of traveling through France and the hotel was our safe haven. Our meals were delicious and always in the most beautifull setting no matter where in the hotel we decided to have them, but our dinner at the 114 Fouburg was incredible. My daughter and I got a mother daughter massage at the SPA which was so relaxing and she had a little Bonpoint massage bed that was so cute and made her feel super special. The kids also got to enjoy the amazing pool whenever they wanted and that was also great. Overall I just feel so lucky that we got to end our trip in this amazing hotel. Thank you do much Le Bristol for staying amazing through all the difficulties we have all had since covid started. This hotel remains excellent!…

HOTEL_LOCATION: 112 rue du Faubourg Saint Honore 8th Arr., 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: Such a lovely hotel, with handsome accommodations, wonderful staff, excellent location, incredible restaurants, and a lovely courtyard , and rooftop pool = heaven in Paris!  We were there as a family, including a 6 month old granddaughter, and they were marvelously accommodating. They came up with an ideal solution for us to dine at their 3 star Michelin restaurant with the baby. Their Directeur, Leah Marshall, regularly appears in the lobby to greet guests. At the end of our visit, I sustained an accident in Versailles- and they sent me flowers!!!  I am looking forward to returning.

HOTEL_LOCATION: 112 rue du Faubourg Saint Honore 8th Arr., 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: I can not say enough wonderful things about Le Bristol. First off the customer service and attention to detail is by far the best I have seen in any luxury hotel! We brought our infant and they made a custom Bib with her name and the cutest little stuffed bunny that she still loves! The gorgeous restaurant in the courtyard just makes you feel like a piece of heaven in Paris. I love the family feel when all the staff knows who you are and goes an extra mile to make you comfortable. Will definitely be staying here again!

HOTEL_LOCATION: 112 rue du Faubourg Saint Honore 8th Arr., 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: I’ve stayed at Le Bristol 15-20 times over the last 10 years. I consider it home when visiting Paris. As it was over two years since my last visit, due to COVID-19 lockdowns and border restrictions, I was very excited for my return stay.   As a returning guest, the welcome from the staff (with several familiar faces) was particularly warm. The suite was immaculate, spacious and well appointed with a lovely view of the newly remodelled garden. Since my last visit they have replaced the televisions (again) and made some soft furnishing updates - all very nice.   Similar to the suites, the hotel's public areas remain exceptionally well appointed, and immaculately maintained.  The atmosphere in Bar Le Bristol was great, as were the cocktails.   Cafe Antonio for lunch on multiple…

HOTEL_LOCATION: 112 rue du Faubourg Saint Honore 8th Arr., 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: This hotel is just beyond the expectations. Two years ago I just spent 7 nights there but this time I am so regretful that I chose another one for variegation.From the second day of my stay of course we went to le bristol everyday for breakfast,lunch and dinner. Great food,fabulous lobby and restaurants, lovely staffs. My first and last choice for my next travels to Paris.

HOTEL_LOCATION: 112 rue du Faubourg Saint Honore 8th Arr., 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: The architectural and historical beauty of the hotel is amazing. I have really great experience.  Location of the hotel is perfect. Near by most fashionable boutique street . The staff super friendly. The restaurants is good as well.But I  recommended to book in advance because it's full majority of time.

HOTEL_LOCATION: 112 rue du Faubourg Saint Honore 8th Arr., 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: I stayed 8 nights in a “Prestige” room and it was an extraordinary experience. Our room was just wonderful with two outdoor terraces affording wonderful views and a relaxing place each afternoon before dinner plans. We had the American breakfast plan so we enjoyed that in their 3 Michelin-starred restaurant L’Epicure each morning and it was every wish come true. Superb pastry, bread, eggs, service, and the sunlight streaming into that lovely dining room was just an extraordinary way to start each day. Our dinner in L’Epicure was a very special experience worthy of 3 stars. Our spa experience at the Bristol was also a lovely afternoon thanks to outstanding therapists. The service throughout the hotel and with every interaction was attentive, very professional and everything I…

HOTEL_LOCATION: 112 rue du Faubourg Saint Honore 8th Arr., 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: Just perfect!! Amazing customers experience! We loved it! Nice service, nice crew, nice food! We stayed 8 days and it was a truly happiness!! We will definitely be back!  it was magical!!  What a stay!!  just wow!!!

HOTEL_LOCATION: 112 rue du Faubourg Saint Honore 8th Arr., 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: "We were treated to the most sublime experience, from the instant we pulled up outside Le Bristol.   Having had the most wonderful meal at one of Le Bristol restaurants, 114 Faubourg, on a trip to Paris months earlier, we decided to stay at the hotel on our return to the capital.   The exceptional attention to detail flows so beautifully throughout the hotel, however the pièce de résistance goes to the team at Le Bristol, flawless service delivered by utterly charming, engaging and thoroughly professional individuals, who read the situation, and deliver! Simply impeccable service.  It's now impossible for us to stay anywhere else when visiting Paris. You know it's good when weeks after your visit, your thoughts transport you back to Le Bristol, and you emerge from that daydream…

HOTEL_LOCATION: 112 rue du Faubourg Saint Honore 8th Arr., 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: This property has the "WOW" factor. I needed to stay at this hotel to be close with clients and it was just amazing at every level. Perfectly clean superb ambiance every part of the hotel looks incredible and the staff are just Brilliant! Every requirement was met with speed and I could not have been happier. I look forward to returning again soon.

HOTEL_LOCATION: 112 rue du Faubourg Saint Honore 8th Arr., 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: I have stayed in many of the finest hotels in Paris, but none compares to Le Bristol. The hotel is in a great location. The service is flawless. The attention to even the smallest detail is astonishing. The staff could not have been nicer or more helpful, from the doormen to the concierge to management. I will definitely be staying again in the near future.

HOTEL_LOCATION: 112 rue du Faubourg Saint Honore 8th Arr., 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: In Hawaii, the term aloha spirit is used so often that it has become almost cliche. However, the true meaning of this is reflected in the actions of people who treat each other with love and respect; send and receive positive energy and live in harmony. This is the essence of the staff at Le Bristol. From Leah Marshall (Hotel Manager) to Jean-Marie Burlet (Head of Guest Relations) to Aurelie Martin (Head of Rooms Division) to front desk staff to restaurant staff and to evening housekeeping staff, the spirit of aloha is alive and well in Paris. No matter when we passed through the lobby or dined in a restaurant, day or night, hotel management would greet us and inquire about how our day was going. This was not a simple hello - how are you?, but instead an instigation of an actual…

HOTEL_LOCATION: 112 rue du Faubourg Saint Honore 8th Arr., 75008 Paris France
REVIEW_TEXT: We had 6 nights at Le Bristol and it was a most wonderful and peerless experience.  While it is not a small hotel, the staff and the service made it a highly intimate experience.  The food was extraordinary regardless of where you dine and our favourite place was Le Jardin Francais - a little garden  oasis in the middle of Paris in the summer.  The service was exemplary and the concierge staff are some of the best in the business.    I have been fortunate to have stayed at some wonderful hotels in my time and this very close to being the best of them.  It reminded me of Claridges in London in its prime.  While not cheap, given the level service, the outstanding food, the room, the ambience and frankly the class, it is actually exceptionally value.  I will back next year!

Stayed here for a few days before a conference at Porte de Versailles. Helpful staff spoke English very well and was tolerant of our poor French. Room on the fifth floor was very quiet, heard no street noise at all. The room we had was a little oddly shaped because it was the top floor with dormers, so you could bang your head if not careful. Clean, had everything you need including heated tile in the bathroom, rainforest shower, double sinks, safe, free minibar (no alcohol). Breakfast was fantastic with many choices or they will make whatever you want. All the staff was friendly and actually had conversations with us in English. Already planning a visit to JK Place in Capri!

Excellent hotel, super charming. The staff is incredibly helpful at all times. They go out of their way to make sure you have all that you need during the stay. The rooms are quite large for Paris and the location is superb. There is a metro stop in front of the hotel where you can buy mobilis tickets and Muse D’Orsay is just five min walk from the hotel. The food at the hotel restaurant is very good as well.

This hotel has a lovely feel to it. Really attentive and friendly staff without being over the top. You get the feeling they are proud of where they work, and so they should. Beautifully decorated, snazzy not stuffy. The room was spacious (deluxe) enough, the bed was very comfortable. The towels/bed linen top notch. Spotlessly clean. I really liked this hotel.

My husband and I stayed 6 nights at the JK Place Paris and it was perfect!  I cannot say enough about this hotel, the cleanliness, the attention to detail by all the staff was perfection at its best.  If I could, I would give this hotel and staff a 6 star.  Do not think twice about staying here.  I cannot wait to return to Paris and will look no further as to where to stay.  Thank you to the staff at the JK Place in  Paris.

To say JK Paris was an amazing boutique hotel would be an understatement. You are welcomed as if it is your own living room and home. The location is prime for walking everywhere ( or biking!) The rooms with canopy beds and luxe linens are comfortable , air conditioning, fresh flowers, large closets and bathrooms with amazing showers ( heated floors and towels!) the pool and gym are perfect and private,  and spa treatments were French amazing! Every detail, arrangement is warmly provided. Every wish is accommodated with kindness, grace and perfection. Wonderful restaurant and activity suggestions from concierge. Casa Tua is your room service! The bar mixologist is a treat! This was my home for 2 weeks… I’ve never had such an amazing hotel experience. I’ve also stayed at JK Roma and JK Capri - also wonderful - it was what made me choose JK Paris for my stay ( I’ve stayed at a dozen palace and 5-star hotels in the city) no other hotel has the ambience and soul to make you feel like you are “home” in Paris. Well done GM Riccardo Ortogni for your lovely team and Place! I will long to return!…

I stayed at J.K.Place for one week. The interior design of the rooms is very impressive and the house keeping crew is immaculate. The whole hotel is very clean and the chrome is always polished. The venue had a very French vibe and the friendliest employee was Alexander; our concierge. He helped us book many actives and some of them were difficult to arrange since we didn't plan anything before our arrival. We went to The Louvre, Champs Elysees, Catacombs, Moulin Rouge, Crazy Horse Show and an amazing Versailles Palace Horseback ride! The restaurant breakfast was lovely. There is a limited 'butik' style all-day menu at the restaurant. They didn't have the expected international 5-star hotel dishes like Caesar salad or shrimp cocktail, the food that they do offer is amazing and the chefs are very talented. If you stay longer than 3 days then the restaurant menu gets boring. The Spa is very small and Linda who works there is quite stuck-up and unavailable/overworked. When we arrived to the spa reception she said she just finished with a massage customer and she could not attend to us immediately. We waited about 15mins for her to fumble with the computer and then she showed us around the spa. When I asked for a Spa Menu she said she can email it to me. This is unprofessional since the customers shouldn't be expected to check their own email for the jk spa massage price pdf. The second day I went to the Spa there was no one at the reception, the doors were locked and the guests could not even get inside to use the pool. The third day I attempted to book a massage at the spa; The women's lockers had no keys. I had to go behind the spa reception table myself and look for locker keys.  No one was attending the spa at all. They are obviously understaffed. Having only one person work at the Spa is unacceptable and inefficient for guests. The next day I realized that there were two new spa employees and the Spa was back up and functioning. Lara is very friendly and she made my massage experience perfect. Spa Steam room sprayer is broken + steam room faucet is broken and the Sauna door gets stuck this is dangerous because it can not be opened from inside. On our forth day of our stay the ground of our hotel room (22) started shaking and a very loud rumbling noise was coming from the ground. This woke us up at 9:00am and we first thought it was an earthquake. This was actually construction coming from the building next door. In addition to being woken up every weekday by this rumbling we were notified that there would be no hot water for some time. It's been two days now with no hot water to shower with. We were moved to room 30 for our final two days and this room was quieter. Emiliano was  a very friendly waiter. Most of the staff is Italian so we were disappointed with the limited to only 6 item menu. The kitchen staff has a much higher potential than this and I'm sure they could manage with 20 items on the menu. P.s. the menu has photos of random people on the middle section, they said these are photos of the family who owns the place. This is vain and tacky. At 1.900 Euros per night we were expecting a bit more from J.K. place Paris. I'm sure that when they iron out the problems this will actually be at a five star level.…

My spouse and I enjoyed staying here on a recent visit to Paris. Great location, beautiful property, well appointed rooms, terrific service. The restaurant staff is particularly wonderful. We can highly recommend the spa also. Can’t go wrong.

I cannot adequately describe the exceptional level of service that I received at this hotel.  Every member of the staff were helpful and engaging.  My room was both beautiful and comfortable and the location made walking to major attractions very easy. The food in the restaurant was delicious and the staff here went above and beyond. I was sad to leave and can’t wait to come back.  Many highlights but the standout  was the staff!!!

Wonderful place to stay in Paris; luxurious and stylish boutique hotel. Staff was extremely attentive and helpful. Beautiful room with large bathroom and walk-in closet. Enjoyed breakfast and dinner at their fabulous restaurant. Perfect location on a quiet street adjacent to Musee d’Orsay and across the Seine from the Louvre. Great gym with free weights and cardio equipment.

We had a lovely 3 night stay at the JKPlace in Paris. What an amazing location… perfect for walking around all the key sites - Musee d’Orsay, Louvre, Invalides, Eiffel Tower, Concorde… the list goes on… all 20 minutes or less by foot.   We stayed in the beautiful Room 1 and it comfortably fitted 2 adults and our 2 tweenagers. It was elegant, with designer furniture, art, books, and an amazing ‘cube’ in the middle of the room - beautifully designed (containing the wardrobes, bar, and air-con). The only thing missing was a bathtub!  Note to JKP: Please add one (there is plenty of space in the bathroom!).   The service was very good. Their mantra of Italian service in Paris is fair… any traveller knows that French service is unique 😁 but although there were some minor imperfections, overall it was excellent and definitely worth 5 stars.   In particular, Oliver and Caroline were highlights of our trip. Oliver was kind, thoughtful with a brilliant attention to detail, while Caroline had such a positive attitude, looking after my and my daughter’s food allergies… and she was also a lot of fun!  Thank you both.   Overall, an excellent place to stay for families, couples and on business… would definitely recommend.…

I am not one to write reviews but we just had the most wonderful stay at J.K. Place that I felt compelled to do so. The hotel is so intimate, with only 29 rooms, so at times you feel like you have the entire hotel to yourself (a rarity among the luxury hotels in Paris). The hotel is beautiful, the breakfast superb (with guilt free portion sizes that allow you to try everything on the menu!), Dyson hairdryers (a small nod to the little luxuries in the rooms), and I could go on, but it is really the people that make the experience so special. We were only there for 3 nights but within a few hours of arriving, we were spoken to by name. The concierge is fantastic and because I do not speak French, I leaned on them significantly (even emailing them from whatever part of the city I…

Just one word: Amazing  Thank you again to all the staff, was a soecial weekend.  The location, the detail of the forniture, the quietness and the atmosphere was pure Paris.  Hope to be back again to have an other wonderful stay.  Perfect location for the rive gauche

If you want lots of attention , great food at Casa Tua  and great concierge service on the Left Bank then. This is the place . It is small boutique hotel brand new with generous rooms for Paris . The hotel restaurant Casa Tua made great food whenever requested. Special thanks to all the staff including Benjamin Francesco Louis Louise  Germain Haby and more .

Like staying at a rich friend's town house with exceptional decor and 5 Star Service. Stunning setting, intimidate lobby and spacious rooms (including the bathroom) for Europe.   We arrived close to midnight and were offered a cocktail, to find impeccable Negronis in our room. I had trouble finding a pharmacy and so the Doorman got a bottle of mouthwash from behind the front desk. And they opened the restaurant at 630a on our last day so we could have breakfast before leaving for the airport. Also, incredible to have a spa and indoor pool at such an intimate hotel, where I had a great massage and a good swim/sauna.   I'd recommend JK Paris if you can afford the price. Given the rate, I'm not likely to return unless we have another special occasion. But I'll be dreaming about it!

This is my third time staying at a JK establishment and I hope there will be many more to come. This is hospitality and comfort at its best and let me share what I mean; when we arrived we asked what time breakfast is served? the answer: "at any time you would like it"! Do I need to say more?

This hotel the true and live description of "Your Home in Paris". The staff at JK will become your family in Paris.  I stayed 7 nights at this hotel and was able to experience so many instances of going the extra mile for a WOW service from this team!  The location, decor, facilities, food and amenities where beyond expectations.  Do not hesitate to stay here if you get a chance!!!

If you missed Paris terribly as I did, and want to celebrate your reunion with the City of Lights with a bang, look no further than JK Place Paris. This boutique hotel is very well situated, on the Left Bank between the Assemblée Nationale and the Musée d'Orsay, right off subway line 12 that will take you directly either toward Le Bon Marché or Pigalle. From what I could see it gathers a well-heeled international clientèle.  Michele Bönan's decor is extremely tasteful, refined, and luxurious, but never verges into the bling. Given its relatively recent opening, and because it had to stay closed during the pandemic, the hotel remains in a very fresh and pristine state. I very much hope that they will keep it this way. The public areas on the ground floor are spacious and invite…

This was a unique and truly outstanding experience. It feels less than a hotel but more like a stay with friends. The team takes away all bureaucracy from you to focus the stay fully on your delights.  In short: super service, rooms designed with attention to detail, a nice bar, remarkable staff.

In my experience, Boutique Hotels usually stand for small rooms, non-existing service, and overpriced rates. Not so at the J.K. Place. Yes, the nightly rate is quite steep indeed. Compared to other high end establishments in Paris, however, the hotel is offering a reasonable value proposition still.  What’s more, the rooms are comparatively large and represent the epitome of understated Parisian luxury. Exquisite fabrics and expensive materials dominate the interior, while an eclectic mix of well preserved furniture from flea markets add a quirky note. Service is exceptionally polite and attentive throughout from doorman to barman to chambermaid. If things are not right, they will go out of their way to make it so. Equally exceptional is the quality of the food. The à la carte…

Just returned from a 3 night stay at the amazing JK Place in Paris.  From the first moment I was greeted with a  professional, friendly and helpful attitude.  The staff are unbelievably helpful and respectful - they take charge and anticipate your needs. From the concierge staff to the house keepers.  Rare and amazing in today's world of hospitality.  The restaurant is fantastic and so is the staff beginning with Andrea. The design is superb and you truly feel as though you are visiting someone in their brilliantly appointed home.  I have stayed in many lux hotels in Paris (and the world for that matter) but the JK is my new home in Paris. Unparalleled in service, attention to detail on all levels. Kudos to Ricardo - you run a tight ship.

HOTEL_LOCATION: 1308 route du Golf Golf de Roquebrune, 83520, Roquebrune-sur-Argens France
REVIEW_TEXT: plus:  room / bathroom / bed / terrace / quitte / good cleaning / coffee tea in room  min: small shower / no sun beds on the terrace / breakfast service is good but slow /         tv is not working perfect ( satellite )   we had room 103  personally I think that price is to high and not in balance with guest satisfaction.

HOTEL_LOCATION: 1308 route du Golf Golf de Roquebrune, 83520, Roquebrune-sur-Argens France
REVIEW_TEXT: Gorgeous, large room, excellent amenities (Cinq Monte) and generally excellent all round. All rooms quiet.  Reception friendly, efficient and really helpful. Super stay and would definitely stay here again.

HOTEL_LOCATION: 1308 route du Golf Golf de Roquebrune, 83520, Roquebrune-sur-Argens France
REVIEW_TEXT: Excellent service, golf course as well in really good shape. Private place where no need for waiting since everything is in place and available whenever needed. Can recommend if you want to relax, play golf and enjoy worderfull food and service.

HOTEL_LOCATION: 1308 route du Golf Golf de Roquebrune, 83520, Roquebrune-sur-Argens France
REVIEW_TEXT: We were so well looked after from the moment we arrived at this beautiful place to the moment we (reluctantly) left. Beautiful room, wonderful facilities and one of the best facials I've ever had. We felt as though this was our own private retreat. Simply loved it

HOTEL_LOCATION: 1308 route du Golf Golf de Roquebrune, 83520, Roquebrune-sur-Argens France
REVIEW_TEXT: Loved the hotel which in spite of having only 5 rooms is a real 5*. We would have loved to use all the facilities - golf, water skiing, spa but we had time only for the restaurant by the water skiing lake. Family owned with all the attention of a family. Absolutely great - especially in this area where the beaches are tiny hence crowded. Go!

HOTEL_LOCATION: 1308 route du Golf Golf de Roquebrune, 83520, Roquebrune-sur-Argens France
REVIEW_TEXT: From the time we arrived we were treated perfectely. We were thrilled with our room it was so modern and extremely clean, the bathroom toiletries were lovely. We also had a balcony with a great veiw of the area and also the sea. All staff were so polite and helpfull. The meal in the restaurant was wonderful and enjoyed the saxophonist evening, thank you very much for making our one night stay so very enjoyable.  We shall definately come again, we do not play golf but have already recommended you to some of our golfing freinds as a must place to go. There is nothing I can think of I didnt like, apart from I didnt get time to try the spa, next time!!

HOTEL_LOCATION: 1308 route du Golf Golf de Roquebrune, 83520, Roquebrune-sur-Argens France
REVIEW_TEXT: This is a beautiful hotel situated on the golf course  at Roquebrune Sur Argens. We stayed one night whilst attending  a jazz evening. We were met in the car park and our luggage was whisked away. We had an extremely warm welcome from the team and Charlotte showed us the hotel facilities including the wonderful spa. As we were early I could not resist trying the spa, which I had to myself and then I had a fantastic 60 minute massage, using entirely natural products, not tested  on animals. I felt fabulous. Our room  was spacious, beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean.  There was a welcome letter from the management and a platter of macarons and then, in the bar, we were treated to a free drink ! The jazz evening was superb, great music, very varied. It wasnt long before we were all dancing! The food in the restaurant was excellent, very fresh  and well presented. If you ask me  to find fault, I really cannot, everything was perfect. We will be returning…

HOTEL_LOCATION: 1308 route du Golf Golf de Roquebrune, 83520, Roquebrune-sur-Argens France
REVIEW_TEXT: If your looking for something special & appreciate attention to detail and the very best of service, Le Daya is such an excellent discovery.  My husband & I decided to stay here to discover the Var region and use this hotel as a base to explore & it has proven itself to be so much more... The family and like minded staff are such a delight. Their care, genuine consideration and help, has enabled us to make a number of decisions that will ensure our move to the Var is a successful one.. For that alone we are totally grateful.  We love this hotel! It's too good to keep a secret ....

Everything about our stay here was wonderful, from the champagne reception to check out the next day.  It was the most beautiful hotel we have stayed at.  Stunning rooms, great food, and lovely attentive service.  I hope we are lucky enough to go back one day.  I would highly recommend this for a special treat.  Not cheap, but you get what you pay for.
