I am with some of the other reviews; if we could give this 10 stars we would. Hotel is inviting, warm, well-located, comfortable, and with amazing restaurants on property and service.    We were greeted with a warm welcome and invited on to the patio for a Champagne welcome.  Our room wasn't quite ready but they were very keen to keep us aware of readiness and make us comfortable in the interim. Check in was smooth and our room was lovely. Bedding, amenities, space, views - wow.   Breakfasts are delicious and the two restaurants on property ARE MAGIC!  We celebrated a friend's birthday at Le Parc and enjoyed lunch and dinner at Bistro Jardiniere.  Love the bar area which is a perfect setting pre-dinner. This place is pure tradition - elegant and warm.  Would go back in a heartbeat.…

Another visit and another great experience. It is amazing how they keep up the standard. It is a grand hotel which makes everyone feel at home. The rooms are first rate, the longe and bar area very confortable and welcoming. We ate in the bistrot and in the restaurant gastronomic. I cannot understand why this restaurant does not have 3 Michelin stars. There are other three stars that we have visited which are nothing like as good. The food and the service are impeccable. Cannot wait to go back!

We stayed here for 2 nights and had a great time. The hotel staff were fantastic from checkin to we left.  Nothing was too much bother, all the staff were friendly and engaged in conversation. Our room was a good size and had the character of the old house. We only ate in the brasserie but the food was excellent. Breakfast was nice sat outside.  We will definitely stay here the next time we are in Reims.

Wow - if I could give this Hotel 10+ stars I would. This hotel is stunning. The bedrooms and bathrooms are beautiful. The main rooms downstairs are beautiful. The gardens are really lovely and the Terrace and garden area where we had breakfast and drinks are simply stunning.  Le Jardin Brasserie is fabulous. Great menu and fantastic cooking and wonderful attention to detail.  But the outstanding features of this Hotel are the service and the staff. Everyone without exception was so helpful, professional, kind and attentive. Nothing was too much trouble. The General Manager should rightly be proud of how the beautifully trained staff attend to the guests.  As one might expect with such a luxurious hotel, the china is Limoges and the glassware is beautiful.  I must mention housekeeping - it is immaculate. The rooms, bathrooms and Hotel public areas are spotless and full of lovely antique furniture and paintings.  This has been a truly joyous experience for us. So thank you for a quite memorable stay. We shall be back.…

We stayed here for the last night of our honeymoon.  We'd been to the restaurant in the garden a few years ago and always wanted to stay in the hotel. It's a beautiful building and very grand inside but the room we had was slightly disappointing. It smelt a little fusty and was a little traditional (although I guess that's the feel of the whole hotel). We had a couple of drinks outside on the terrace which was lovely. We ate in the Parc restaurant which again was a little stuffy and formal (for us) and extremely expensive, The food was pretty good but very rich. We left early the next morning so didn't have breakfast but overall slightly disappointing. I think for the money we could have stayed somewhere nicer.

This property falls into my Top 5 in the world for service and presentation.   The rooms are stunning and over the top, surrounding you in luxury in your own Chateau.  Grounds are not large but beautifully manicured and tended.   The GM Mr. Arnaud is a pleasure.  A  return trip is eminent.

After eating in the rather excellent Brasserie Le Jardin in the grounds of this imposing hotel, we ventured in to the main building to enjoy a digestif. To say it is a beautiful place does not do it justice, it is actually amazing and whilst we didn't stay there, we very much hope to one day. Everything just exudes class and the attentive service we received in the lovely bar was first class. Very professional barmen and a very acceptable hand poted glass oc Chivas 18 year old went down a treat. A Bientot

What an absolute masterpiece of a hotel. From the reception, room service, amenities, staff, and gorgeous grounds, I honestly can’t think of a criticism for our stay.  We stayed in a superior room in the cottages by the château. We were welcomed by very friendly valets who took our bags and recently bought champagne bottles (which were stored in a chilled area during our stay). Every staff member greeted us cordially as we went and enjoyed a welcome glass of champagne. Every need was taken care of and they truly make you feel like royalty.  It’s not the cheapest hotel and could definitely be considered very expensive in relation to others, but worth every penny.  Will return for a longer stay. 100% recommended.

We found the place, location, staff and the dining experience made  this an amazing and memorable stay. Particularly enjoyed the hospitality of the general manager - Arnaud Valary who checked in on us from our check in all the way to the check out to make sure it was wonderful. He was kind, generous and even volunteered to call a restaurant in Paris to help us. We stayed in one of the premier rooms that had a balcony overlooking the garden and it was French classic in its decor, clean and comfortable. Stay here for your visit to Reims.

Another visit to this establishment and again it was absolutely top-class. From the moment of arriving to the departure our stay was without fault. A very warm welcome from a smiling team who obviously take a huge pride in their work. The room was large, beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean. Also it had a great view of the park with the Cathedral in the distance. We ate for three nights in the gastronomic restaurant - what an indulgence but we could not resist!. The service was outstanding- highly professional but discreet without grand cloche waving. The food itself was of the highest quality. Starters like the Tribute to Notre Dame de Reims and the asparagus cooked with vine shoots and champagne were memorable. The main courses were equally good, particularly the lobster…

The property is a stunning castle, former private home of the respected Polignac family and has been properly updated and decorated. Although this 5 stars property should have it, pool and a Spa are missing. The well kept park is  apparently open to the public (we met several “visitors” ) and has gorgeous trees and ample benches to have a quiet moment and enjoy nature. There seems to be an endless staff for such a small hotel and the G.M. was in attendance, having met our party at arrival, albeit ostensibly dismissive at several occasions afterwards: I have met dozens of GMs of much more important hotels around the world (from Oberoi, Mandarin Oriental, Peninsula, Waldorf or Dorchester) just having stayed at Le Meurice in Paris the 2 nights before…and there were all simple,…

Having booked this a while ago I was excited to stay and rarely does that live up to expectation. It exceeded it.  The staff could not have been more lovely upon arrival. They made it feel like a home for the time we were there and could not have been more friendly.  The room itself was superb. A view of the garden and into Reims itself. Stunning. The terrace drinks were supremely relaxed with excellent service and drinks.  The food, both for dinner and breakfast (in the room) were also of the highest quality. It was my favourite meal of a weekend littered with Michelin stars.  I will go back to Reims and I will go back here as my port of call. It is a treat, but at the same time value is determined by price and quality and for me the latter comes in abundance.  Lovely setting,…

We stayed for 2 nights at Les Crayeres, as part of a family trip. Our stay was perfect from the moment we arrived.   As we arrived at the hotel, there were two bell boys waiting, who quickly organised the luggage and whisked away our car. Check in was incredibly friendly, with the offer of a welcome drink. We went for a fantastic lunch at Le Jardin; a lovely relaxed restaurant, where the hotel manager walked across to give us a personal welcome.  Following lunch, we checked into our rooms. Our party had premium, superior and deluxe rooms and all were an excellent quality. Very classical style, with great amenities in the room. The grounds of the hotel were also beautiful.  Breakfast was served in the main dining room, which was fantastic. The most incredible continental…

Warm welcome in an unique setting : everyone and everything is geared towards an exceptional stay. staff in omnipresent to deliver highest service and comfort but never intrusive. The surroundings (park) are stunning (esp when enjoying a balcony view towards the garden), the rooms are tastefully decorated and very comfortable (esp the bed), and the restaurant experience is simply unique.

We've stayed twice at this wonderful hotel and plan to stay many more on our regular trips to France. Everything is wonderful; the location, the grounds, the elaborate, unique rooms, the bar and restaurants, quality of the decor and the amazing breakfast! But what truly sets the hotel apart is the service. All of the staff are attentive and friendly and nothing is too much trouble. They go the extra mile whether it is welcoming you, showing you to your room, making reservations or collecting your car. It's a real joy to stay here, and the surroundings are so peaceful you feel like you're in the countryside, despite being surrounded by some of the world class champagne houses. One of the best hotels we've stayed at.

One of the staff members clearly didn't think we spoke french, it was horrible to see such disregard for seemingly foreign clients. We had to cancel our dinner due to my brother's household being caught in covid. Staff member was adamant to charge for dinner table (we had never agreed to that and when informed by colleague that my emails were correct she instantly faked table taken by waitlist) along with the room.  We had a lovely start with lunch at Le jardin and a kind welcome by a different set of staffers and then it turned into a nightmare to a point we left instantly! For €1000+ a night, we clearly didn't sign up to be treated in such demeaning ways especially for a milestone birthday family celebration.   Unworthy of relais chateaux branding or even a basic hospitality…

Super five star hotel, lots of character and certainly very grand but without being stuffy. Staff were first rate, nothing was too much trouble. Dinner in the Parc restaurant was a true Michelin delight. Great bar with cosy corners and huge choice of wines. 10 min taxi ride into the town centre but right next door to some of the big Champagne houses like Pommery and Veuve.

Very recommended. Champagne offereded at our arrival in the very elegant settings of the bar. Dinner at the restaurant outstanding (cheese trolley highly recommended, lamb terrific). Staff very professional. Elisa

Pros (1) Beautiful building and grounds (2) charming bar with nice drinks (3) Walking distance from Champagne houses (4) Receptionists speak good English with prompt and good service  (5) Has 2 good restaurants: formal 2 stars and a more informal 1 star (6) Cottage was pretty  Cons (1) Cottage room was rather bare. No coffee or tea making facilities.

HOTEL_LOCATION: 9 rue de la Republique, 51160 Champillon France
REVIEW_TEXT: What an amazing stay! A very special Hotel - a real treat!  The location is stunning, champagne lush and suite just beautiful! Loved how special they made us feel including our tern daughter! Can’t wait to return - you are doing an amazing job. Karen O

HOTEL_LOCATION: 9 rue de la Republique, 51160 Champillon France
REVIEW_TEXT: Third annual trip to Champagne region and the hotel. As always excellent property, great rooms, amazing views and helpful concierge to organize trips around the region.  Food is good although with small selection and breakfast is ok. Service in the main restaurant a little spotty sometimes but nothing major. Room service was very good  Really like the spa with the indoor and outdoor pool and excellent sauna  We will happily come back again and enjoy a few days at this beautiful hotel

HOTEL_LOCATION: 9 rue de la Republique, 51160 Champillon France
REVIEW_TEXT: Another fantastic stay. The hotel is beautifully designed and finished to a very high standard, and is on a site to dream of. The whole series of rooms and floors seem to endlessly blend. The food in the gastronomic restaurant was outstanding- two Michelin stars must be coming. All in all brilliant. We will be back!

HOTEL_LOCATION: 9 rue de la Republique, 51160 Champillon France
REVIEW_TEXT: New and shiny on the outside , quite a disappointment on the inside. First we were placed into a room with non working air conditioner. After complaining 5 times they moved us into a different room at midnight.  Rooms have no full size mirror. Suit has nowhere on the balcony to seat. House keeping doesn’t come until the evening even if you put a sign on. Beautiful view in the room is blocked by tv. Massage service was average. First night we had dinner at the hotel which ended up being just ok.  Overcooked salmon, bland chicken and bad service.

HOTEL_LOCATION: 9 rue de la Republique, 51160 Champillon France
REVIEW_TEXT: Absolutely outstanding! I cannot recommend enough staying here at the gorgeous Royal Champagne Hotel. Not only is this one of the most beautiful hotels we have ever stayed in — and we have been fortunate to stay in many lovely places the world over in Europe, Asia, and the US (and this ranks at the top!) — but the level of hospitality and customer service at this hotel are second to none. We had a brief amount of time to spend in the Champagne region before leaving to attend our friend’s wedding in Versailles, and it goes without saying that we wanted to maximize it to the fullest extent. So we leaned on the concierge team, who were agile in setting us up with Champagne house tours at Bollinger, Ruinart, and Moët et Chandon; plus a lovely lunch at Cellier Belle Époque, the Champagne bar and restaurant of the house of Perrier-Jouët. All were stellar and we were able to see our favorite houses with lovely tasting and cellar tours.   The hotel also arranged ground transportation for us from Charles de Galles airport in Paris to the hotel and then from the hotel to our next destination in Versailles.   The food is absolutely delicious. The gorgeous breakfast buffet and dinner are served in Le Bellevue, which is a stellar restaurant with exquisite crystal lighting fixtures with the most breathtaking view of a valley of vineyards in Champagne. The view alone from the terrace is reason to stay! But of course the real fun comes when you go out and about in the region and explore the lovely villages of Epernay, Reims, and Aÿ. The Royal Champagne Hotel is the perfect spot to return to at night and celebrate a day well spent.   I highly highly recommend this as a place to really luxuriate and enjoy. If you are interested in winemaking and the complex art of Champagne, visit the region — and STAY HERE!!!  Big thanks to the spectacular concierge team including Lyse, Margaux, Leon, and the full staff there who work tirelessly to bring their guests a few days of joy in a gorgeous place. We owe it to them for handling our itinerary with such care and diligence and making us feel so welcome and at home. They deserve the highest praise and gratitude from guests.   We will never look at Champagne the same way again now that we have had these intimate opportunities to experience the houses, and cannot wait to return to the Royal Champagne Hotel soon.…

HOTEL_LOCATION: 9 rue de la Republique, 51160 Champillon France
REVIEW_TEXT: Wow, this hotel was simply exceptional. We stayed in the Champagne Junior Suite, and I honestly don’t know how there are higher level room categories. The room was very spacious, the bed somehow bigger than any king size bed I have ever slept in, giant soaker tub, large shower, private balcony, and on and on. There is a beautiful indoor pool and smaller outdoor pool with large loungers. Room service was very good. This place is worth every penny! My only regret is not staying longer. We didn’t have a chance to eat at the restaurant or try the spa…just another reason to come back for another stay! The staff were all helpful and friendly.  FYI, The hotel is isolated. I think you may be able to rent bikes if you want to go into nearby towns. The hotel can arrange cars but this is expensive, so if you’re planning on going into town every night for dinner or sightseeing or whatever, plan accordingly. This is definitely not just a hotel, but truly a resort you want to check in and spend time relaxing…at least next time we go that’s our plan!…

HOTEL_LOCATION: 9 rue de la Republique, 51160 Champillon France
REVIEW_TEXT: Stayed only two nights and didn't want to leave. Highly recommend for a stay in Champagne.   Royal Champagne is a modern take on French lux. Design marries modern simplicity (wood floors, subdued tones) with touches of French maximilism (crystal chandeliers, curvy wallpaper).    Service was attentive and friendly. They even went out of their way to buy me a pair of shoelaces from a local store when mine broke. They were helpful making arrangements for Champagne tours and restaurants, though they led us to a biodynamic champagne house that was interesting but subpar.  The view at Royal Champagne alone is worth the price. Rooms all overlook Epernay and the valley though the second floor is far superior than the first and worth the extra cost. Rooms come with free mini bar which is a nice touch at the price point. Another hotelier told us this was the best hotel in France and I believe it.  Only disappointment was the restaurant which has an incredible view sitting on top of the hotel but lacks good service and good food, especially for the price. Wouldn't eat there except for the view.…

HOTEL_LOCATION: 9 rue de la Republique, 51160 Champillon France
REVIEW_TEXT: The Royal Champagne is a work of art. The design, suites and staff are exceptional. While this place is expansive, the interiors are cozy. Bruno, Florence, and every staff member was smiling and made us feel most at ease (this was our group's first visit in a luxury hotel.) They answered all of our questions, helped plan our day & also helped organize champagne tastings and a short bike excursion on their e-bikes. I had planned (with Leo the concierge) a day full of actives in advance however because of the rain we had to change them; the staff helped us (without hesitation) to move our plans to the next day. We enjoyed our stay start to finish. The attention to every detail in the suite, spa and public spaces is impeccable. The staff made us feel like home even if we were unsure about what to do next. The food at Bellevue is divine and the champagne menu impressive. We learned a lot about the varieties of champagne during our short stay and had a fabulous visit at the hotel's champagne house Leclerc Briant in Epernay. The suite was extremely well thought out in its functionality and design, with an incredible view from the balcony looking across the valley. Even in the rainy fog the view was splendid. On our second day the sun came out and we could really soak in the views from the terrace and rooftop bar and dinning. We spent a solid 3 hours lounging, snacking and drinking champagne on the roof terrace. The spa areas were serene, well equipped and extremely clean. Every area in the hotel was spotless, cozy, and full of architectural and interior design marvels. Even the lighting details were stunning. We all agreed (3 friends) we want to come back for our future honeymoon vacations. The details in the hotel are masterful. A huge thank you to Bruno and his team for making us feel comfortable and happy in this absolutely splendid place. Well done.…

HOTEL_LOCATION: 9 rue de la Republique, 51160 Champillon France
REVIEW_TEXT: Stayed here recently for a very special occasion and the Royal Champagne Hotel & Spa did not disappoint. The staff and service were incredible, they had read all the comments on our booking and knew why we were travelling, the experiences we had inquired about during our stay and were anxious to help us with any arrangements. The restaurants onsite were wonderful and very accommodating (we were traveling with our 15 month old) and the hotel itself is modern, spotless, beautifully designed, comfortable and the rooms are luxurious & lovely. We stayed in a room with a view of Épernay and it was positively dreamy with a balcony that looked out over the vineyards and nearby village. There is a button on the phone that dials directly to "Champagne Please" (need I say more). Would love to stay again, highly recommend!…

HOTEL_LOCATION: 9 rue de la Republique, 51160 Champillon France
REVIEW_TEXT: this is top! no other words to describe the hotel and every single member of the staff; it starts with the voiturier: a service we are not really used to in Europe, but here: the perfection; when we went out to visit something  and if the reception knows where you are going, the voiturier has your car ready right in front of  the hotel entrance with even the gps already programmed!  how incredible is that;  all you see are smiling faces, from the reception personnel to waiters, cleaning staff: rarely seen.  How welcome can you feel; the reception personnel even stands up when you enter the hotel: we, the king and queen of Belgium :-)  We had the opportunity of talking to the general manager, mister Bruno Tailly, a most gentil Belgian (of course :-), always present and eager to help you with every need or question.  The rooms are stunning, the views of the same caliber; le royal (where we  ate 3 times after eachother) is a REAL one star restaurant with an excellent sommelier;  to be short : it blows you away: go for the utter holiday and service experience and book; we are going back in august already, cannot wait to arrive and be spoiled again!!!…

HOTEL_LOCATION: 9 rue de la Republique, 51160 Champillon France
REVIEW_TEXT: We had a wonderful stay at the Royal Champagne and cannot wait to go back! The staff is incredible, the concierge went out of their way to help us with a rental car issue. The rooms are beautiful, spacious and very quiet. We regretted not staying more nights. It is located in a terrific area that is way to get to all of the champagne houses and villages. The view from the terrace is breathtaking

HOTEL_LOCATION: 9 rue de la Republique, 51160 Champillon France
REVIEW_TEXT: We travelled extensively and stay in luxury hotels, but a hotel has to be exceptional for me to take the time to write a review.  The Royal Champagne exceeded my expectations.  The location between Epernay and Reims, the beautiful facilities, but most of all the dedicated team made this stay exceptional.   Before our arrival Florent, Guest Experience Director, personally made sure we had a wonderful itinerary planned including a balloon excursion, Champagne house visits, dinners.   This was our third visit to the region, our first to Royal Champagne, and it was a great experience.  Upon arrival Ste'phane made us feel so welcome, and all our needs were met.  The room and view over the villages of Champagne were spectacular.  We ate at several Michelin star restaurants on this…

HOTEL_LOCATION: 9 rue de la Republique, 51160 Champillon France
REVIEW_TEXT: We visited for lunch after our Champagne tour and we were pleasantly surprised.  This is a 5 star venue with outstanding patio views overlooking the valley.  Food was excellent,  well presented and prepared.  Service started slowly but ramped up mid way thru the meal.  They were understaffed on the terrace but pulled it off in the end.

HOTEL_LOCATION: 9 rue de la Republique, 51160 Champillon France
REVIEW_TEXT: We had one night at the Royal Champagne at the end of a long weekend in Champagne and Burgundy. Whilst it may seem churlish to be less than enthusiastic about such a striking and impressive location, for me the Royal didn’t quite hit the bullseye.   Why? The staff were uniformly pleasant. The surroundings are luxurious and the room well appointed, though we had to ask for a robe too small for any adult to be replaced. The spa was excellent although a little over occupied inside because the weather was so poor outside. The issue was more in the fact that some public areas, the bar and the restaurants, were very busy and therefore noisy while others such were completely empty. There was a strange sense of the place being both too big to feel comfortable in and too small for the…

HOTEL_LOCATION: 9 rue de la Republique, 51160 Champillon France
REVIEW_TEXT: I don't know where to begin to tell you how amazing this place is. My daughter and I spent three days at the hotel and it still didn't feel like enough. We were there mid-March and it was an unfogettable experience.   The hotel itself is stunning! Modern and tastefully decorated. Built into the hillside, there's a stunning view from any window. The rooms are exquisitely decorated - comfortable and restful.   And what can I say about the staff? Everyone is absolutely amazing! They go out of their way to make you feel welcomed and special. By the second day, they were greeting us by our names - how amazing is that?! They are kind, professional, courteous and so pleasant!   The restaurant the Bellevue is simply amazing - everything on the menu was delicious. But for a once in a…

HOTEL_LOCATION: 9 rue de la Republique, 51160 Champillon France
REVIEW_TEXT: Royal Champagne is a very friendly, hospitable hotel.  Our suite overlooked the vineyards with exceptional views.  The staff are very warm and friendly.  The food is delicious and the service very good.  A beautiful hotel.  Highly recommend.

HOTEL_LOCATION: 9 rue de la Republique, 51160 Champillon France
REVIEW_TEXT: We visited this hotel for the first time since the rebuild. It is in a wonderful position with panoramic views of the vines. The new build is very modern but it is beautifully conceived with a variety of areas with great flexibility. The welcome was very warm and helpful and the room was well appointed and spotlessly clean with a generous sitting area. The gastronomic restaurant was excellent with professional unobtrusive service and first rate food beautifully presented. It has been described as "discreet luxury", which seems very appropriate. The Negresco's loss is Royal Champagne's gain with M. Rieubland.  The second restaurant was also excellent with the possibility of eating on the terrace with wonderful views in the good weather- it was 29C when we were there! A very good…

HOTEL_LOCATION: 9 rue de la Republique, 51160 Champillon France
REVIEW_TEXT: 1st visit. very modern hotel, architecture is very modern as well, tries to blend in countryside and vineyards. A few tens of meters down the hotel you can walk by the vineyards! Was concerned i  would see windmills that are now polluting more and more the area but no, no wind mills -otherwise would have cancelled my stay-. Staff is very pro and kind, restaurant very good as well 1*. If you like modern hotel, countryside in Champagne area, this is for you.

HOTEL_LOCATION: 9 rue de la Republique, 51160 Champillon France
REVIEW_TEXT: Great dining options including a spectacular terrace overlooking the vineyards. Delicious food with seasonal dishes, plus an amazing selection of Champagnes. Staff was very friendly and always there to assist guests, also with providing recommendations for activities in the region. The rooms are beautiful, spacious and well-maintained with sophisticated design and a lot of attention to detail. The wellness area with the two pools is amazing and a perfect place to unwind.

HOTEL_LOCATION: 9 rue de la Republique, 51160 Champillon France
REVIEW_TEXT: This place is just a dream! The place is amazing, the service is awesome. This is the first time I am writing a review because it is so much deserved. The Spa is beautiful. The view is gorgeous.  I can only recommend this hotel. The region has also plenty to offer.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Castello di Poggio Alle Mura Sant'Angelo Scalo, 53024, Montalcino Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: My wife and I stayed for 5 nights in JUly and it was wonderful!  The room was spacious, clean, and everything we wanted.  nice views and close to dining and parking.  The staff were all just so good, they really made this place special.  The location was perfect to base out of to explore the area.  Highly recommended!

HOTEL_LOCATION: Castello di Poggio Alle Mura Sant'Angelo Scalo, 53024, Montalcino Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: It’s like a dream. Me and my husband took some time together and run away to this fantastic place. It’s  very romantic, nicely decorated. The food was so good and we put some pounds during the holiday:) We left very happy and maybe someday will be back.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Castello di Poggio Alle Mura Sant'Angelo Scalo, 53024, Montalcino Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Came here for a wedding in August and it was beautiful! The restaurant is Michelin starred and delicious. The rooms are huge and very fancy. Lovey pool area which was ideal for a post wedding party the next day. It was beautiful! Recommend :))

HOTEL_LOCATION: Castello di Poggio Alle Mura Sant'Angelo Scalo, 53024, Montalcino Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: The location is fantastic. The Michelin star restaurant is awesome. But the rooms for the price are dark and lacking sophistication. Yes, one could argue that the resort has a rustic charm, but at the price it charges, there is a lot more that can be done to make a stay more comfortable. All in all, great location, good food and wine, and friendly staff. A decent choice but not spectacular.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Castello di Poggio Alle Mura Sant'Angelo Scalo, 53024, Montalcino Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Amazing experience in and incredible setting. We stayed three nights and had a suite which was immaculate and a turn down service that you could not fault. The dining experience at the Michelin starred restaurant was superb and highly recommend. They were amazing at catering for kids and small touches here and there for kids was great!   Pool area fabulous, gym well equipped and some super charged bikes to get you around. All round excellent and will definitely return.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Castello di Poggio Alle Mura Sant'Angelo Scalo, 53024, Montalcino Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Third visit to southern Tuscany.  All previous accommodation were great, but this place is over the top.  Wine tour, wine tasting, Michelin star restaurant, staff, location, views exceeded expectations.  About 20 minutes from Montalcino, 40 from Montepulciano.  Food in Michelin restaurant is art and service is friendly and efficient.  Taverna food and service also excellent. Not at all pretentious.  Rooms and all levels of service were exceptional.  ($4000 expresso machine in each room in case you can't wait for extensive breakfast which is included - if you don't see it; ask.)  Library with snacks and drinks open past my bed time.  I cannot think of one single thing that we could improve.  Privately gated car park for guests only.  Wife and I had couples massages by husband/wife team.  Buy the $33 vinegar - only liquid we brought home from 15 day trip.  Both worth the money.  Invite us as your guests and we will gladly endure the long flights!…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Castello di Poggio Alle Mura Sant'Angelo Scalo, 53024, Montalcino Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: The Mariani Family has created such an incredible property.  The Hotel is beautiful.  The Restaurant deserves it's Michelin rating.  Exciting memories created at this spectacular property and in surrounding areas.  Truly an Italian Paradise!

HOTEL_LOCATION: Castello di Poggio Alle Mura Sant'Angelo Scalo, 53024, Montalcino Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: This place exceeded our expectations. Castello Banfi is by far, BY FAR, the best place we have ever been. From the views, to the friendly staff, to the location. Everything was absolutely perfect from the moment we arrived at the gate. The drive up was mesmerizing, and the accommodations even better. My fiancé and I are just grateful to have had the opportunity to enjoy what Banfi had to offer.   The food was the best food I have ever had, the service in the restaurants was top notch. Reception answered every question in a timely manner with a smile on their face. We will DEFINITELY be coming back.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Castello di Poggio Alle Mura Sant'Angelo Scalo, 53024, Montalcino Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Truly a one of a kind experience. My wife and I could not find one thing wrong as every aspect of our stay was perfect. The staff was fantastic. The rooms were large and well appointed with every amenity available. The beds were so comfortable and views were amazing. The food in all three restaurants were over the top. This is a must for people traveling to the wine country in Italy

HOTEL_LOCATION: Castello di Poggio Alle Mura Sant'Angelo Scalo, 53024, Montalcino Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Absolutely the BEST. The facilities the hotel the restaurant everything and everyone was amazing.  The rooms were very large and gorgeous. Beds were super comfortable and everything was spotless.  The restaurants were fabulous we are big foodies and their Michelin star restaurant was out of this world. And so was their trattoria.  Ebiking  through the vineyard was gorgeous  and the working of the vineyard and tour was enlightening  Try the 2015 Brunello ❤️

HOTEL_LOCATION: Castello di Poggio Alle Mura Sant'Angelo Scalo, 53024, Montalcino Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Oh wow. What can I say? This was without a doubt one of the best - quite possibly THE best - and most beautiful places I’ve ever stayed in, and that is saying something since I have travelled a lot and seen many a place.   We stayed for one night, and enjoyed everything thoroughly with everything we have. The setting is about as romantic as it can get on the planet - if, in fact, it was this planet we were on, and not some magical paradise. The day, evening and night spent here will hopefully forever follow us, no matter where life might take, together or apart. A fraction of myself will never leave the castle grounds, but stay there in peace and tranquility. Simply amazing!   Price should not even be considered, as some experiences in life have value far beyond monetary…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Castello di Poggio Alle Mura Sant'Angelo Scalo, 53024, Montalcino Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: The centuries old Castle formerly Poggio ala Mura is an awesone edifice that houses a superbly modernized and exquisitly comfortable hotel with a starred Micelin restaurant and an excellent tratorria surrounded by stunning Tuscan landscape.  The estate produces some of Italy's finest wine and a cellar the dates back many decades.  In addition to the main hotel there is a marvelous 3 bedroom Tuscan farm house with a functional farm kitchen and all of the comforts which is available and feels as if you are transported in time.  Service, hospitality and comfort abound at every turn.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Castello di Poggio Alle Mura Sant'Angelo Scalo, 53024, Montalcino Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: We've stayed all over the world and this was probably the best experience we've had.  First off, the property is beyond stunning -- the pictures don't really do it justice.  The grounds themselves are so well maintained and it just adds to the magic.  And most importantly -- what can make or break any place no matter how beautiful -- is the staff.  The staff here from the waiters to the groundskeepers were amazing beyond words.  Particularly the waitstaff was incredible.  We had amazing dinners at both La Sala Dei Grappoli and it was magical, particularly because of the setting next the castle overlooking the vineyards.  Though our favorite meal at the property was probably at La Taverna -- the food and service there was amazing and we still talk about this meal.  Thank you all…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Castello di Poggio Alle Mura Sant'Angelo Scalo, 53024, Montalcino Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Staying at Castello Banfi was one of the most beautiful hotel experiences I have ever had. The castle is absolutely stunning, and in the most incredible surroundings. It really is a magical place to stay and watch the golden sunset with a glass of local wine. The location is wonderful amongst the hillside vineyards, it's feels very remote, but also not too far from the lovely Siena.   My partner and I were lucky enough to have an exclusive stay at Castello Banfi in the off season and enjoy the property in its entirely, for ourselves. We loved the Castle and the wonderful rose garden, but there are views to be enjoyed from every angle and every corner of the property. The swimming pool is also a highlight, it's gorgeous, and a fantastic sun trap where its very easy to spend the…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Castello di Poggio Alle Mura Sant'Angelo Scalo, 53024, Montalcino Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: We have not stayed at this beautiful villa yet but their service coordinating out stay has been 12 of 10 stars  Extremely detailed and responsive.                                  I am excited to stay here. I have done a ton of research. This is the place to stay hands down.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Castello di Poggio Alle Mura Sant'Angelo Scalo, 53024, Montalcino Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: We're in the process of planning our wedding at Banfi! Thus far the experiences has been excellent. We visited to view the grounds, rooms, and facilities and experienced a capable, friendly and efficient team. It should be mentioned that some of the photos posted by reviewers on TripAdvisor are taken before a recent refresh of the rooms and gardens so preference should be given to the newer interior shots. The glass museum should be mentioned since it is stunning and the overall setting is very impressive and perfectly maintained. We'll keep you posted on progress over the next few months. Thus far: A+ E&K

HOTEL_LOCATION: Castello di Poggio Alle Mura Sant'Angelo Scalo, 53024, Montalcino Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: A gorgeous property!  My visit was too short (2 nights) with rainy weather but I absolutely loved it.  Beautiful views of the vineyards and surrounding hills (which would be even more stunning on a sunny day).  Luxury rooms with historic details.  The team is amazing and provided excellent personalized service.  The restaurants were lovely and the food delicious - lunch at the Taverna with classic Tuscan fare, a tasting dinner at La Sala dei Grappoli - both featuring the Banfi wines.  The wine tour and tasting followed by a visit to the Enoteca were a great way to sample many of the Banfi wines - and of course, ship some home!    I cannot wait to return!

HOTEL_LOCATION: Castello di Poggio Alle Mura Sant'Angelo Scalo, 53024, Montalcino Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: This was our 3rd visit to Castello Banfi.  It is a spectacular property and self contained with the best accommodations, food, service, pool, and winery.  Anything you want, it is here.  It's also a good home base from which to explore Tuscany.  Have lunch and La Taverna, dinner at Sala dei Grappoli and you won't be disappointed.  The food is exquisite!   Also, the wine tasting is a great opportunity to sample multiple vintages.  We always ship a case of wine home to last until our next visit.  Many thanks to Maddalena, Domenico, Edouardo and Sylvia and rest of the team for another wonderful stay.  Looking forward to visit #4!

HOTEL_LOCATION: Castello di Poggio Alle Mura Sant'Angelo Scalo, 53024, Montalcino Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Imagine the most perfect resort with elegant and gracious rooms, warm and perfect service, stunning views, extraordinarily informed staff, quiet, private spaces, understated luxury, and delicious food.  That is Banfi.  We just spent two nights there in October, 2019 and left feeling as though we had been transported to a magical world of perfect delight. We would strongly recommend the morning wine tour for hotel guests; Paul is extraordinarily informed and imparts all sorts of interesting bits of information (there is not a question he can’t answer).  We would also recommend spending some time enjoying the property. Just take walks, sit by the pool, gaze at the stunning views. You will miss this place when you leave!

HOTEL_LOCATION: Castello di Poggio Alle Mura Sant'Angelo Scalo, 53024, Montalcino Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: We had the amazing pleasure of staying here during our trip to Italy in September 2019.  I can hardly begin to describe how wonderful the property is. In fact, I believe this was our best experience at a resort that we have ever had. And honestly, that is saying a lot since we are fortunate and have traveled extensively.    The views from everywhere are astounding. It was amazing just to walk around the property and just gaze at the 360° views of the countryside. The staff was incredible, the room was spotless and beautiful, the pool was wonderful and the food at the restaurant was amazing.    The property is well situated to do day trips to other areas of Tuscany. We rented a car and drove all over the surrounding area. We will treasure these memories for the rest of our lives.…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Gennaro Capriglione 147 Via Breve, 84010 Praiano Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: We stayed at Casa Angelina about four years ago and after visiting Lake Como and touring Puglia on this trip, we decided to end this vacation with a relaxing three-night stay at Casa Angelina. We were hoping that the hotel would continue to live up to the fond memories of our first stay. Casa Angelina, in its inimitable style, did not disappoint.  Aside from the sheer beauty of thIs intimate 40-room hotel, its stellar quality revolves around its staff. All well trained in hospitality, they can never do enough for you. Whether offering you a chair,or custom cutting meat at breakfast,or making a dinner reservation, the team at Casa Angelina always offers a sincere hand to help. Special accolades go to Peppe at the pool, Daniel in the main dining room, and Marina at the Reception/Concierge Desk.  The food is wonderful, from the anything-you-could- ever-want breakfast buffet, to the a la carte breakfast, to the informal dining option, to the formal dining area overlooking the Mediterranean Sea. All are top notch.  Now, getting to real estate, the rooms are absolutely beautiful. Everything is white and immaculate. Turn-down service offers you a good-night chocolate and L’Occitane hand cream for sun worn bodies. Bath accessories are either L’Occitane or Jo Malone. It is your choice upon check-in. The rooms are modern, bright and cheerful, and the entire property maintained, again, impeccably. I suppose impeccable would be the one word to describe this amazing hotel. No wonder it was just named a Leading Hotel of the World! Congratulations to the owner who built the hotel to memorialize his mother, and congratulations to the staff who really make this wonderful property.…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Gennaro Capriglione 147 Via Breve, 84010 Praiano Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: More than the incredible vistas on the Amalfi Coast, the succulent meals (THAT breakfast, seriously!) and the relaxing color palette throughout the hotel, you won't forget the exquisite and genuine hospitality.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Gennaro Capriglione 147 Via Breve, 84010 Praiano Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Set in the side of a mountain overlooking the Bay of Palermo this boutique hotel offers adults a place to relax and unwind after touring nearby sites including Positano and the Amalfi coastline. Service is the primary objective of the well trained staff, there to meet your every need. Sleep on fine linen, wrap yourself in Etro towels and just enjoy your contemporary spotless room. High end electronics let you control all your lights from your beside, your bathroom offers a choice of amenities and your hair dryer is, of course, a Dyson. Rooftop dining is refined experience from amuse bouce to a tiered tray of bites of delights. Casual dining overlooks the same magnificent view with made to order pastas. Service staff are well trained and anxious to please. A lovely library is at your disposal and there is both an indoor and outdoor pool. Truly a memorable place to stay!…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Gennaro Capriglione 147 Via Breve, 84010 Praiano Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: The views alone make this hotel special. Breakfast every morning and cocktails in the evening overlooking this quiet stretch of the Mediterranean Sea made each day feel like the perfect vacation. I will say, the high cost of the hotel does not stop after you book it. Drinks by the pool are €25/each. But the breakfast buffet is second to none, the staff are super friendly- especially Pepe at the pool - and they'll help you with anything. The hotel is a short walk (all stairs though) to some nice restaurants and the shuttle to and from Positano is very easy to set up. Definitely check out Saghir, small restaurant in Praiano right up the stairs. We ate there twice it was so good. We would wake up every morning, have breakfast, tour the coast (Amalfi, Ravello, Positano and Sorento were all easy drives, one day we did a charter boat around Capri directly from the dock below the hotel), then come back for some cocktails at the pool before dinner out. The pool is beautiful and nice and cold which is necessary in the hot sun. Everyone at this hotel goes out of his or her way to make it a great stay for you. They've earned their five stars. …

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Gennaro Capriglione 147 Via Breve, 84010 Praiano Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: I stayed here during my honeymoon and I am so happy I did! The views from breakfast and the pool area looking out onto the water and Positano is magnificent! The hotel is beyond beautiful, clean, but more importantly is it the staff that really made my experience the best at this hotel. Everyone by the time you check in, to each breakfast with the wait staff, to the staff by the pool and restaurants are so nice and friendly. The breakfast is beyond anything you have seen-they offer everything! The hotel is about a 10-15 minute drive to Positano and they have a free shuttle that takes you and picks you up--the drivers are the nicest people and so accommodating with driving to Positano and making sure to pick you up on time. The pool area is relaxing and beautiful under the lemon trees. They also have a beach club which is steps from the hotel. I booked the canopy room which was small, but it was clean and bathroom itself was large. I would definitely stay here again! …

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Gennaro Capriglione 147 Via Breve, 84010 Praiano Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Let me start this review by stating that I stayed at this beautiful hotel TEN years ago on a work trip (as a luxury hotel reviewer) which is sadly not my job anymore and I was completely taken aback by how amazing it was. And ten years later it is still absolutely beautiful! One of the best hotels I have stayed at. I was travelling around the Amalfi Coast and Capri to review 6 luxury hotels and this by far was the nicest. I remember the views were breath-taking and the staff were impeccably polite, friendly and welcoming. Now 10 years on I still recommend anyone who is travelling to the Amalfi Coast to stay at Casa Angelina! I would love to and intend to return here with my partner and two children in the near future.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Gennaro Capriglione 147 Via Breve, 84010 Praiano Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: One of the best for sure- we stayed at a hotel in positano and after coming here wish we had jsut stayed in casa Angelina the whole time. Positano is very crowded and Angelina is like a quiet relaxing haven away from it all with a free shuttle going to positano. Breakfast was so delicious and a gorgeous buffet with tons of the best fruit and salad and omelette s and a huge selection of baked goods, hot food items and also fresh honeycomb. The hotel itself feels like a art museum and service was amazing - everyone always knew u by name and was so kind and accommodating. There’s also a beach club u can walk to and swim in the ocean. I can definitely see why this hotel has such rave reviews- highly recommend!

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Gennaro Capriglione 147 Via Breve, 84010 Praiano Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon and were very excited about this hotel as the pictures look beautiful, and it was the most eyewateringly expensive hotel we'd booked. No doubt it's a beautiful hotel, and maybe it's because of where we came from (Puglia) but something just didn't feel right.  The service is excellent, too excellent. The staff act like they've been trained to within an inch of their lives, nothing felt natural. Don't get me wrong - everyone was very friendly but it all felt a bit false. They are all still having to wear masks in the hotel too so we couldn't understand a word that was said when we were shown around (again not their fault).  We had a corner room with a terrace and spectacular views. The room was very small with no separate shower and the terrace was overlooked by the restaurant so we weren't comfortable sunbathing as a couple of the tables (the most popular ones) looked down on us. The breakfast was very good but they forgot our coffees - however the food was delicious. The pool is tiny, but there were always sunbeds available (unless you wanted the one "under the lemon trees") We so wanted to love this hotel and I'm really not sure why we didn't - I think the word that summed it up was claustrophobic - but maybe that's the Amalfi Coast for you? On a final note they washed our car for us and supplied us with a lovely packed breakfast which was great. If you want beautiful views and an airy open feeling then don't go to this hotel - in fact probably don't go the area .... head for Tuscany!!…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Gennaro Capriglione 147 Via Breve, 84010 Praiano Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: One of the best hotels you will ever experience.  Service from when you get to the hotel all round is amazing. The restaurants (both of them) are amongst the best food we had.    The room, all white and while not the biggest it is beautiful in it's simplicity  It is near perfect

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Gennaro Capriglione 147 Via Breve, 84010 Praiano Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: A little away from the very busy Positano and Amalfi, so a relax atmosphere. This 5 star plus hotel is everything you expect from the best hotels in the world. Spectacular views, top restaurant, perfect service. Try their pasta’s for lunch with view on Positano. Perfection. Be aware this is an adult only hotel. Probably one of the best hotels at the Amalfi coast.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Gennaro Capriglione 147 Via Breve, 84010 Praiano Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: This hotel is far and away one of the nicest we’ve been to. The staff goes above and beyond to meet your every need. The rooms are beautiful and the views cannot be beat. The presentation of the food in the restaurants are unreal and the food is amazing. It is not on the cheap side, but if you can afford it, definitely recommend it.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Gennaro Capriglione 147 Via Breve, 84010 Praiano Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: This hotel is absolutely amazing.  The rooms are crisp, clean with unreal views.  The artwork around the hotel is fantastic. The service is incredible.  The nicest and most helpful staff.  Breakfast was delicious.  Had lunch by the pool - also fresh and delicious.  The setting and the views are out of this world. Highly recommend.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Gennaro Capriglione 147 Via Breve, 84010 Praiano Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Its not often that I write a review while still on my vacation but here I am writing this. Casa Angelina is truly a slice of heaven in beautiful Praiano.  Away from the crowds yet still close to all other Amalfi towns. Positano is just 10 minutes away with their complimentary shuttle. Ok so as far as the hotel goes. It is sparkling  clean! The hotel is all white. Outside and inside. Do you know how hard it is to keep a white interior clean? Not one scuff or mark anywhere!  The service is impeccable! Every request and need and want is quickly addressed and taken care of. One of the evenings we were here there was a big unexpected tropical storm (more like a tornado)  We are talking about outdoor furniture flying and the entire Amalfi coast left with damages.  When we woke up in…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Gennaro Capriglione 147 Via Breve, 84010 Praiano Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Return visit after 5 years (after failed covid trips!), adn this super deluxe hotel has gone up a few more notches. Service so on point they are almost cleaning the floor in front of you as you walk along!! On leaving i managed to leave my passport and wallets in the room safe. They had already picked them up and were driving them around to my new hotel and no charge to me. THANK YOU! Yes we did have the best room on the hotel - suite on the top floor with a huge balcony, and that does make this place all the more special. Bute everything about this place just purrs oh so smoothly. we hardly left the place, eating delicious meals at all times and lovely selection of drinks and cocktails. trip down to the 'beach' a great adventure and use of the facilities all included. staff all…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Gennaro Capriglione 147 Via Breve, 84010 Praiano Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: We just left Praiana two days ago and we had a lovely stay. The rooms are comfortable, the beds delicious and the view spectacular. Every single person that works at that hotel is warm, engaging and will do everything they can to make you feel at home and pampered. I have a gluten allergy and only had to say that once and after that every single time I sat down to breakfast (their buffet is magnificent) or for a cocktail they made sure to offer me a GF treat. Their homemade GF bread is incredible and they always make it for you on demand. The gym is very functional, bright and airy. The entrance to the hotel is easy to miss (despite the gorgeous statue at the front) but once you do find it you will be transported.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Gennaro Capriglione 147 Via Breve, 84010 Praiano Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: This place is awesome, especially the views and the service . . . and the food. The hotel is in Praiano, which is a gorgeous coastal town with spectacular views of the cliffs, ocean and of Positano. Praiano does not have much retail/shopping, but the benefit of that is that there is little to no traffic or crowds. If you want a quiet hotel with amazing views and top-notch service and food, stay here.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Gennaro Capriglione 147 Via Breve, 84010 Praiano Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Let's start with I am not a "reviewer" but our stay there made me feel absolutely obligated to recognize this hotel. This hotel is a gem and I'm counting the day until we get to return. I recently went with my husband and I can say our time wouldn't have been the same if we weren't staying here. From the time we got there they were incredibly friendly and accommodating. We were greeted with sparking lemonade, champagne, and a room upgrade!!! Our balcony view was incredible.  First, their location and shuttle service is unbeatable. It is very nice to be out of the crowd of Positano but also have the luxury of transportation for dinners etc.   Another big thing that stuck out to us when comparing to similar luxury hotels throughout Italy was the housekeeping. They went above and…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Gennaro Capriglione 147 Via Breve, 84010 Praiano Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: We arrived after an “entertaining” drive of 1/2 the Almalfi coast. We were greeted with sparkling lemonade and welcoming souls. We had intended to just be allowed to leave our luggage, however they said our room was ready and helped us check in I believe it was 10:30am so we almost had and extra day.   Michella gave us a lovely tour of the property before leaving us to settle into our corner room #110. When we walked into our beautiful room they had provided iced champagne, fresh apricots and a large blue hydrangea. In a white glove ready room.   The view was astounding. We could see Positano and Capri, just a breath catching view. The bathroom is sleek, with 3 choices to distribute the water in the shower. I loved the waterfall feature the most. The bathrobes and towels are…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Gennaro Capriglione 147 Via Breve, 84010 Praiano Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: We had a wonderful stay at Casa Angelina.  The staff were very attentive.    Expect to be wonderfully surprised when you arrive.  The worries of the world will melt away.  The room view is exceptional.  The food and drinks are terrific.    The facility is outstanding.  We highly recommended it -- so much so, we plan to revisit in the fall.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Gennaro Capriglione 147 Via Breve, 84010 Praiano Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: We loved our stay at Casa Angelina! The staff were amazing, food was perfect and attention to detail was at a level rarely seen. The view from the rooms was breathtaking! We can’t wait to return snd would highly recommend to anyone travelling to the Amalfi coast for a meal or a stay.

Exactly what an hotel should be. Welcoming, fantastic and professional staff, stunning room, faultless service.   Thank you everyone for a most wonderful visit to Matera. This special place was totally enhanced by the quarry hotel.   Many thanks

This hotel is extraordinary. The service had a very personal touch by the owner and her fabulous staff with  great attention to detail. We had a wonderful room, with plenty of space. We also had an excellent dinner and operatives in their restaurant. They booked our Matera tour and outside dinner reservations which were first class. They have been the friendliest staff  in out two weeks in Puglia,

This was a brilliant little getaway, we stayed for three nights. We were greeted at Piazza Duomo be the porter and front of house who carried our bags all the way to the room for us.   Each member of staff was incredibly helpful and friendly, the service was excellent and were very tentative.   The food in the terrace lounge was lovely and the views of Matera were breathtaking.  The room was lovely and spacious and very well designed and the twice a day maid service meant the room was always clean and tidy.  Thank you for a wonderful little break.

I spent 4 nights at the Quarry Resort during a conference, and had a wonderful experience: the staff are all incredibly friendly and helpful, the room was beautiful and furnished with a fantastic rock pool which was the perfect complement to the hot Matera days, and the breakfast and drinks all excellent.  On our day of departure Signora Enza who runs the hotel surprised us with a gift, and we could not have been made to feel more at home.  Thoroughly recommended, and I cannot wait to be back.

The Quarry is a beautifully renovated boutique hotel, beautifully positioned in the center of Matera and with beautiful views available over the Sassi and Murgia Materena Park area.  Suite 410 where we were had an amazing view and good natural light with floor to ceiling windows (it also had a round bed which takes a little getting used to).  We visited several other rooms/suites in the hotel which had fairly small windows and limited light, so I would suggest choosing carefully if this is important to you.  While a very top end boutique hotel, we would not classify this as 5 star L nor as a "resort".  A small thing, perhaps, but there is no hair conditioner offered (that said they went out to buy some for us the next day), we had to request bathrobes (which arrived quickly), water was not provided on a daily basis, the heating was not turned on until we asked a second time, the heating in the bathroom never ended up working.    The hotel has 13 rooms, a private breakfast area and a lovely dining terrace which is also open to outside visitors (definitely worth a visit as the restaurant service is excellent, the cuisine very enjoyable and the view unbeatable).  The breakfast was less well done - we were the only clients and they still managed to burn our 2 slices of toast.  In summary, it was a very nice place with very nice and helpful service, but by calling itself a 5 star L resort, the Quarry sets expectations above what they provide.…

Fabulous, fabulous hotel right near the centre of Matera. Beautifully presented room and public spaces.   Our room was huge, comfortable and had everything you could possibly want in it. The biggest selling point, however, was the staff! No matter who he met/spoke to (reception, bar, chef, handymen), they were all ultra friendly, professional and helpful. A credit to the hotel.   We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here, we were just disappointed that we had to cut it a day short due to flight cancellation.

Stayed here a night and what a delight.  Booked at the last minute, this hotel is right in the middle of where you want to be.  Hotel is brand new, everything super clean, rooms immaculate.  Staff super friendly.  Upper terrace with great views and nice place to grab a glass of wine and relax.  I believe there are 16 rooms.  Breakfast was excellent with the usual European items.  Definitely would recommend!!  Good wifi throughout the hotel!

Went there just for aperitivo before the sunset. The view from the terrace was excellent. The atmosphere was great and cozy as the staffs were very friendly and professional. Had a wonderful and memorable time.

Walking through Matera stopped for a light lunch in a beautiful terraced caffè.  Lovely setting but a bit pricey, I guess one has to pay also for the view. Two very small glasses of wine and two light dishes. Nice setting, expensive food

We spent 3 nights at Quarry Resort.  The owners of the hotel, Gianluca and Enza, whom we met on the second day by chance, their main business is historic restorations and have restored this hotel while respecting the past, with all the modern conveniences and modern Italian furniture design and fixtures . This hotel has award-winning architecture, with very professional, bright, educated, English speaking hotel staff.  In the evening, we would dine on the rooftop terrace which has a spectacular view of the Sassi of Matera, and a perfect spot to get away from the tourist crowds. Take a leap and spend the money and enjoy the coolest hotel in Matera!

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Di Monte D'Oro 30, 00186 Rome Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Absolutely the BEST hotel I’ve ever stayed at!  The lobby and dining area are lovely and the service is PERFECTION!  The food, snacks, coffees are excellent! Our room was very large and the bathroom very very big and nice.  Soft clean towels 2 times a day! The service again here is beyond perfection!  I will 1000% be back!

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Di Monte D'Oro 30, 00186 Rome Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Excellent small hotel in perfect location with fabulous service and the coolest MCM decor. Rooms are not large but are elegant, thoughtfully laid out with spectacular bathrooms. Our room had a small balcony.  A lovely place to sit with coffee in the morning or prosecco at night.  Snacks, nespresso, water and soft drinks in mini bar included and replenished magically.  Housekeeping, concierge, managers anticipated needs we didn’t know we had.  Location is close enough to walk to everything but very quiet. On a square with fruit and vegetable market, a block from Ara Pacis, steps to spanish steps. 10 minutes to Pantheon, 15 min walk to vatican. Arranged dining reservations, transfers etc.  My kids who are now giant men are still suckers for the free candy in the room and lobby.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Di Monte D'Oro 30, 00186 Rome Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: This luxury 5 star hotel is one of my global favorites.  It is everything you would expect in a 5 star hotel PLUS it has the most welcoming and accommodating staff I have ever encountered. Maria Strati, the GM, is the heart and soul of this hotel and greets every guest personally.  We have stayed at JKPLACE Rome 3X in past year and I think of it as a second home.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Di Monte D'Oro 30, 00186 Rome Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: This is just a wonderful five star hotel in every way. It is a beautiful, comfortable refuge in the center of Rome, close to great sightseeing, dining and shopping.  GM Maria Strati leads a wonderfully friendly and knowledgeable team that makes your stay extra pleasant. Excellent, friendly service and attention to detail are hallmarks of this Roman refuge.  We commented on a slippery shower floor one week and when we returned a week later an anti skid mat was in the shower in our room. The restaurant is excellent and the lounge area stylish and relaxing. Don’t miss this Roman gem !’

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Di Monte D'Oro 30, 00186 Rome Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: JK Roma is an elegant, well appointed, beautiful hotel that offers exceptional  service. The rooms have gorgeous decor, a high level of cleanliness and extreme comfort to get a good night’s sleep.  The lobby is inviting and a wonderful place to share a cocktail and conversation. The staff is exceptional, professional and beyond accommodating! The charming General Manager is on site to ensure all of your travel needs are met.  Every detail is on point! I have traveled here both alone and as a couple. I highly recommend this pristine accommodation in the perfect location in Rome!

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Di Monte D'Oro 30, 00186 Rome Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: My partner and I stayed here for a quick 2 night stay after a cruise. I have visited Rome several times and stayed in other fabulous hotels, but this hotel is simply exceptional. Possibly the best boutique hotel I’ve ever stayed in. From checking in to checking out the service was first class. Friendly, efficient with each and every person going the extra mile. The restaurant is first class. The complimentary breakfast was wonderful, with freshly squeezed orange juice, pastries and a fantastic cooked breakfast… the French toast was delightful! The food was faultless, we enjoyed both lunch and had an evening meal there too. Again, the food and service spot on. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the rooms are delightful from reception to the bedrooms. Little extras like a personalised guide book left on the bed at night, turn down treats and a complimentary mini bar with soft drinks, again add to this top class hotel. We decided we wanted a few hours by a pool, as it was very hot in Rome. The girls on reception found us a perfect venue and organised it for us with the minimum of fuss. It was a perfect end to our trip. The hotel itself is in a great location for shopping and sightseeing and honestly if you’re planning a visit to Rome this hotel has it all.  Thank you to all of the staff for being so lovely and going the extra mile to make our stay so special.…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Di Monte D'Oro 30, 00186 Rome Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: This is a very small hotel in the NW area of Rome.  It is perfectly situated near the Spanish steps, Borghese garden, Tiber River and all the exclusive shops.The rooms are nice but small and are equipped with drink and snacks that are free and replenished often.  The most wonderful part of the hotel is the staff, who greatly outnumber the guests. They speak very good English and are willing do to anything at any time to make your stay more enjoyable. This includes the front desk, concierge,restaurant staff and even the manager (who personally introduced herself as we checked in!

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Di Monte D'Oro 30, 00186 Rome Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: I have nothing but amazing things to say about this property!   1. Location: Away from so many busy touristy areas, while being close enough to walk anywhere. You feel like you are at home the second you walk in. They know who you are.   2. The rooms are fabulous, with modern design with elegance.   3. BREAKFAST: If you have had breakfast in Italy before, especially coming from America, you already know what to expect... but have you had JK Places? They have such a FABULOUS variety of breakfast foods, including yogurts/green juices/eggs/egg whites/fruit (best mango I have ever had) and more. Much more ideal than your typical croissant and coffee breakfast elsewhere.   4. Service is top-notch!   I have never had a client dislike a Place property, but having recently been myself to experience it... I am confident in saying you cannot go wrong by choosing this location if you like smaller boutique hotels with all the amenities! \  - Custom Travel J…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Di Monte D'Oro 30, 00186 Rome Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Wonderfully elegant and comfortable hotel in a surprisingly quiet side street in an incredibly convenient location in Rome. A short walk to the Spanish steps, Parthenon, and only 20 minutes to the Vatican. The hotel has incredible design and the staff is incredible as well. Maria, the manager is friendly and along with her staff totally focused on ensuring you have a great experience. The restaurant is delicious and the core is so comfortable and elegant. If you're not having the time of your life here, you have bigger problems!

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Di Monte D'Oro 30, 00186 Rome Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: My wife, daughter and I recently returned from a 4 night stay at the JK Roma over the thanksgiving holiday. My wife and I had stayed here before and we knew we had to return when taking our daughter for her first trip to Italy. It certainly lived up to our memories our our first stay here. This is just an excellent boutique hotel in one of the best locations in Rome. The rooms are immaculate with some of the nicest bathrooms I have ever seen. The breakfast and bar in the hotel were excellent - my daughter was thrilled with the options. The fresh orange juice in the morning was particularly memorable. The concierge service was excellent - they helped us secure some of the more difficult restaurant reservations during our stay. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a world-class boutique hotel in Rome.…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Di Monte D'Oro 30, 00186 Rome Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: This is a great hotel hitting the right balance between contemporary luxury service and the feel of Rome with all its charm, warmth and classic features.  Great beds, great service, beautiful surroundings - close to perfect. True 5 star experience.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Di Monte D'Oro 30, 00186 Rome Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Truly a divine experience. We just stayed there for our honeymoon. The best hotel we have ever paid for in our lives. Don’t second guess and just book here. It was really hard to find a luxury  hotel in Rome that wasn’t stuffy and regal, but more boutique, feels like an extension of home, and romantic — the JK Place Roma is that. Also, huge shout out to Anna and Diego who redefined who hotel staff can be.   Finally, the restaurant was shockingly good - for breakfast of course but also for dinner. We only had dinner there because of our Amex FHR credit, and despite the credit I was reluctant. After all, we are in Rome and I’ve never had a good non-breakfast meal at a hotel. But this was excellent and could stand up to almost any restaurant we went to in Rome. Truly spectacular.…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Di Monte D'Oro 30, 00186 Rome Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: From the moment you walk in til your last ciao the hotel staff are incredible. No ask is too much and they are all willing to help.  We had booked our 20th anniversary trip in 3/2020. Since the initial booking the hotel was incredibly accommodating on several rebookings due to Covid. Once we were finally in Rome our four nights at JK were perfect. The amenities are plentiful, plush towels, luxurious toiletries (no need to pack your own), turn down service, room service, and there are many more.  Really just a wonderful place to stay and celebrate our love.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Di Monte D'Oro 30, 00186 Rome Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Cannot express how happy I was to have  chosen this hotel to be my ”home” on my first visit to Rome. The hotel interioir is outstandingly beautiful, very much beautiful decor. The room was clean and also very beautiful. Every little detail was well thought. The housekeeping was amazing, they even put a bookmark between my book, please see photo. Breakfast was great and there variety of items to choose from. I also had dinner there and it was delicious too, recommend the traditional roman pasta cacio e pepe and tiramisu. The had great wine recommendations too. But as always the great hotel isn’t a great or unforgettable one without the staff. I want to thank some persons which made my stay feel extra welcoming, they were cordial and went the extra mile to satisfy my needs. My…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Di Monte D'Oro 30, 00186 Rome Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: AMAZING! This was our second win for our recent Italy trip.  Our first win was at the JK Capri which was a fantastic hotel in it's own right. We were slightly disappointed with our second Hotel , Villa Tre Ville Positano but the JK Rome brought back our respect for 5 star accommodations.  Upon arriving at JK Rome it was apparent our stay here would be just as amazing as JK Capri and it did not disappoint.  It's clear Maria, the general manager knows exactly what she's doing and it showed.  The Hotels location was incredible if you enjoy shopping. Situated within the shopping district but not among the crowded streets. We even took a break from shopping for lunch and was delighted to find one of the better meals we experienced in Rome. FLAWLESS! in every way from room…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Di Monte D'Oro 30, 00186 Rome Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Great location, superb staff, gloriously comfortable room. Could occasionally hear adjacent rooms, as I am a very sensitive sleeper, but the room acoustics minimize outside noise. Complementary mini bar, and delicious breakfast is the icing on the cake. Worth every penny, I will be back!

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Di Monte D'Oro 30, 00186 Rome Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Unfortunately, our stay wasn’t what we had hoped for.  We unknowingly were arriving on the day of the Rome marathon.  When we arrived with our driver, he could not get to the hotel because of the blocked off streets.  You would think that the hotel could have given us a heads up about this, and a solution to getting our bags/us to the hotel.  Instead we had to call them several times and only then did they come up with a solution.  Upon arrival at the hotel check in seemed disorganized, with several people handling different aspects.  It was during the time I noted the absolutely overwhelming fragrance that they have in every space in the hotel, including the room!  I have allergies and could not understand why they would put a large scent diffuser in a 3 foot wide room.  Even…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Di Monte D'Oro 30, 00186 Rome Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Beautifully designed, sophisticated yet intimate and warm, JK Place Roma is what you hope for in a boutique hotel experience.   The staff was fantastic and knew our names and room number after the first day.   Four days is not long enough here.  A treat we will return to.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Di Monte D'Oro 30, 00186 Rome Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: This may well be the best hotel we’ve ever stayed in. The service is extraordinary,  impeccable, gracious and kind without being obtrusive.  Every detail is perfect. The public areas are classically beautiful, elegant yet incredibly comfortable, whether you’re relaxing in the library, or sinking deep into your chair in the cocktail lounge.  The food, well, just wow! We were in Rome for three nights, and after dining in the hotel the first night, we simply  decided we might as well eat twice more in the amazing JK restaurant!   The rooms are gorgeous! Comfortable without being fussy, beautifully appointed, with bathrooms that you simply don’t want to leave.    There’s literally not one thing wrong with this hotel, and thousands of little things, and all the big things, are spot…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Di Monte D'Oro 30, 00186 Rome Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: One of the coolest hotel i have ever stayed, we were there for new years eve, the news year eve dinner was nice and fun, roma was super crpwded but the hotel was really cool and calm. The location is good and the rooms are very nice. AmaZing lobby.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Alpe di Grual, 16, 38086, Pinzolo Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Stayed here for my 40th. One of the best destination spa I’ve stayed in. Impeccable service, gorgeous rooms and an assortment of spa choices. Only downsides are distance from the airport (about a two-hour drive) and on the pricey side, but worth it for something special.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Alpe di Grual, 16, 38086, Pinzolo Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: One of the best hotels we have ever stayed.  We booked half-course.  Beautiful location, superb quality and service. Spacious rooms, very good food (breakfast and dinner).  Price it high, but you get top quality and service.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Alpe di Grual, 16, 38086, Pinzolo Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Wonderful service from the team, who clearly enjoy their work. Stunning views and great facilities. Not cheap but definitely value for money.  Spa was very good, the pools were just right and the breakfast was amazing.  The restaurant dinner menus were not our taste but there are plenty of places to eat locally and the room service menu was very good.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Alpe di Grual, 16, 38086, Pinzolo Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: I stayed at the Lefay Dolomiti for eight days in August 2022 and we had a spa programme.  The structure of the hotel is magnificent, with plenty of wood and glass windows on the valley or towards the mountains. Common area are very comfortable and very well furnished, both indoor and outdoor. it is all very clean and very much taken care of.  Rooms are very comfortable, with all amenities, a beautiful balcony with chairs and a table, plenty of towels and a bathrobe, which is being changed on a daily basis. There is no real turn-down service, but a maid knocks at the door every evening to ask if something is missing. A half-litre bottle is complimentary every day for each person.  The restaurant is very good and with a rich menu, which, however, did not change for a week. Every day, however, there was a "day menu" with one new option per course. The restaurant is very expensive so a full-board option with a spa programme is a very good option. We did not try the Gruel upmarket restaurant so I cannot comment on this.  Staff is nice and reasonably helpful. It is very helpful in the restaurant.   The spa is beautiful and wide, very well furnished and really pleasant. Everything one can imagine seems to be available. Spa staff is quite nice even if they have a rather impersonal approach.  The negative point is that the Lefay Dolomiti Hotel is an hotel with spa, differently from the Lefay Garda, where the spa is really the core of the hotel. This means that, at the Dolomiti Lefay, guests are left pretty much on their own as regards treatments, there is no advice on how the treatments should be adapted to each person, it is quite impersonal. No comparison with the Lefay Garda, where one feels really cuddled and taken care of.…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Alpe di Grual, 16, 38086, Pinzolo Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Overall a really good 5-star resort; we are very likely to come back to this. Pool, service, spa etc. are all top notch.   Only smaller issue is that I first booked the room for 1 person - and when I needed to change to 2 people, they hotel charged me 100€ more per. day for adding 1 person (vs. the 37€ it normally would cost if done in advance). Not a big issue in terms of overall cost - but nevertheless a point worth paying attention to if booking here.
