HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Alpe di Grual, 16, 38086, Pinzolo Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: well organised, great service, very clean, not overcrowded too close to the many road (traffic noise) spacious and well maintained wellness areas friendly an attentive staff good an pleasant architecture

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Alpe di Grual, 16, 38086, Pinzolo Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Amazing service, stunning rooms and view. Best spa experience ever! The restaurant Grual is absolutely amazing, with the best service, food and wine - a must visit if you stay at the hotel. We will definitely be back for another stay next year!

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Alpe di Grual, 16, 38086, Pinzolo Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Good:  the rooms are well maintained and spacious, the pool areas are large, it is clean and housekeeping is first rate.  Not so good:  1.  not in the ‘real Dolomites, but a much smaller, much less majestic southern branch.   2.  Not really even in those Dolomites, but on their southern edge (another 8 to 10 miles on a narrower, more twisty road than the one it took to get to the hotel). 3.  The premium for the deluxe rooms is a ripoff….the views are not that great and the rooms are equivalent. 4.  Fully priced…i.e. expensive for a ‘resort’ in the middle of nowhere with few things to do (unless you are here to ski) 5.  They were inflexible on check in & checkout times even though there were  few  guests  A few hints: 1.  The entry gate/reception is not well marked..it is the first driveway with the large barrier gate immediately before the service entrance 2.  Pay attention to the directions from the reception area to the rooms…it requires two elevators and the crossover from one area to the other happens only on certain floors 3.  Higher floors are better…less pool noise if in premier (regular rooms), better views if in ‘deluxe’ (valley facing rooms)…..but you may wonder if the deluxe room view is really worth an exrtra 20 to 30%. 4.  Pinzolo, 1 km away, has very few real restaurants (mostly bars that have very limited menus) so reserve in advance.…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Alpe di Grual, 16, 38086, Pinzolo Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Absolutely breathtaking place with great service and highest level in all aspects. Will come back for sure! Lefay Dolomiti excited my expectations and I will be more than happy to share these feelings with my friends and clients and will recommend them to visit it soon.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Alpe di Grual, 16, 38086, Pinzolo Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Wonderful property for a wellness getaway. The rooms are comfy and luxurious with all the amenities one could need. The spa treatments and facilities were exceptional, clean and reasonably priced. Don’t miss out on dinner at Grual as it is extraordinary, delicious and unique with creative presentations.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Alpe di Grual, 16, 38086, Pinzolo Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: This is a 5 star hotel with 5 star services!  This comment may sound commonplace but this is a recap of our stay! The staff is amazing professions, the spa is beautiful, restaurants super good, the rooms are big and very clean. This is please is very recommended to relax, enjoy the mountains, do some skiing.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Alpe di Grual, 16, 38086, Pinzolo Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: We thought we had booked 6 nights at the Garda hotel but only discovered  that in error we were booked into the Pinzolo hotel, when we put the address in the satnav of our hire car, as we were leaving our previous hotel. We don’t know how the error occurred as we were specifically looking at the Lake Garda facilities via Trip Advisor when we made the booking. Whether this was our mistake or a glitch in the Lefay booking system we don’t know. And whilst our confirmation email did confirm the Dolomiti hotel, we assumed that this was Garda as we believed Garda to be in the foothills of the Dolomites. We called reservations from our car and tried to rearrange but the Garda hotel was fully booked and the only option would have been moving 2 days later and then changing rooms 2 or 3…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Alpe di Grual, 16, 38086, Pinzolo Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: We had a wonderful stay at Lefay in Dlomiti - The place is 5 star. It is a quiet place so not a big party atmosphere but it was just want we were looking for. Spa was amazing, food was amazing (we did not eat at Gruel). The breakfast buffet was off the chart, eveything you could imagine. We will definately go back if ever in the area. They even have an app to pick the type pillow you want for your room.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Alpe di Grual, 16, 38086, Pinzolo Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Best hotel with great services and food.  We had great stay at this hotel and one of the best hotels we ever stayed. Highly recommended as the staff are so friendly and helpful to recommend sight seeing, restaurants and recommended attraction. Rooms are great and the facilities are superb.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Alpe di Grual, 16, 38086, Pinzolo Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Everything at Lefay Resort & SPA Dolomiti was perfect during our stay: it is a beautiful structure, very well kept. The rooms are spacious and opulent, while also being quiet. The SPA is magnificent and it offers many services free of charge during your stay. The restaurants offer great selection and quality. If this is paradise, it surely has its own angels: Luca at reception, Michele at the restaurant, Enrico at the saunas, Mattia for yoga and meditation, Marco by the gym have all been perfect hosts for us during our stay. We are looking forward to our next stay at Lefay!

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Alpe di Grual, 16, 38086, Pinzolo Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Beautiful resort, beautiful spacious rooms, fantastic service. Nothing is too much, if you need something, you will be served at your call. Large swimming pool, good wellness treatments. Restaurant very good, top dishes and good quality wines, super extensive menu. Breakfast is a treat what you want  is there .  1 minus point is the service at the grill bar pool dishes are extremely poor compared to the restaurant as well as the cocktails are poor for the price this is better in Lefay Garda otherwise I am a fan of the 2 resorts

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Alpe di Grual, 16, 38086, Pinzolo Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: We have been guests at some of the finest spa hotels in the U.S. and Lefay Dolomiti is their equal. The location is beautiful, with wonderful views of the high nearby mountains and the village, and at an elevation that makes it much cooler than nearby Lake Garda and towns like Bolzano. The rooms are both stunning aesthetically and very comfortable, with the most modern baths and technology, and most appear to have gardens or balconies. The hotel staff is very professional, although as is the case in many resorts we have visited recently, some staff clearly are new and still being trained. With a very few exceptions, we found every staff member to be helpful and friendly.  The spa facilities rank with the very best we have ever experienced and the 4 pools ensure a pool experience…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Alpe di Grual, 16, 38086, Pinzolo Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: We had an excellent time at Lefay and it made our trip to the Dolomites and Italy very special and memorable! We loved the service from all staff including at the restaurants and the spa. Food was fantastic and high quality and so was the spa/massage services. We’ll definitely be back!

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Alpe di Grual, 16, 38086, Pinzolo Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Our family was impressed with the resort and Spa.  The wellness paths made us feel relaxed and we’re pleasant.  The breakfast was incredible, a large spread with just about anything you can imagine.  We can not wait to return here or try the Lake Garda location!

HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Alpe di Grual, 16, 38086, Pinzolo Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Found LeFay Dolomiti on google maps on a road trip from Munich to Venice. LeFay is off the beaten path in a wonderful village deep in the Dolomites mountains, near Trento. We were thrilled when we arrived - the hotel is amazing and exceeded our expectations. Clean, modern, with an alpine theme. The staff is highly trained and made us feel welcome as soon as we walked in the front door. The spa facilities are gorgeous, and the food delicious. We loved the indoor/outdoor infinity pool with its jetted massage features. We can’t wait to go back.

HOTEL_NAME: Caruso, A Belmond Hotel, Amalfi Coast
HOTEL_LOCATION: Piazza San Giovanni del Toro 2, 84010, Ravello Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Without a doubt best place we have ever stayed in. Never mind that the entirety of Amalfi and surrounding area seems like something out of a dream, the Belmond and luxurious experience really elevated our stay. From the attentive and friendly staff, to the beautifully adorned room, there is no hotel to compare. Do yourself a favor and stay here if you ever wish to stay in Ravello. You won’t be disappointed!

HOTEL_NAME: Caruso, A Belmond Hotel, Amalfi Coast
HOTEL_LOCATION: Piazza San Giovanni del Toro 2, 84010, Ravello Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Book a stay at the Belmond Caruso, Ravello, and never leave.  Le Serisuise, in Positano,  and Capri do not measure up to this wonderful property.  Every detail here is perfection.  I only wish that I was just beginning my stay here.

HOTEL_NAME: Caruso, A Belmond Hotel, Amalfi Coast
HOTEL_LOCATION: Piazza San Giovanni del Toro 2, 84010, Ravello Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: My wife and I are on our last day of a week at the Caruso and would highly recommend.   The hotel is perched high up in Ravello and in a quiet area but only a few minutes from restaurants and shops. We drove, there is parking and when we arrived there was a truly warm welcome. Your first greeting makes you feel very welcome as guests and your giving a short tour of the hotel and what to expect.   We were allocated a sea view with amazing views and the room was large, nicely air conditioned, very comfortable bed, coffee, TV, Aqua di Parma toiletries, Dyson hair dryer and more. This sets the science throughout the hotel of all the facilities and extra which are only the best.  The hotel has very nice breakfast area with wonderful food, and the staff work hard to serve you and provide everyone with best seats in the house overlooking the coast.  The pool has a view to die for, beds are not an issue and the staff are attentive even when it’s very hot. There is a nice poolside bar again I cannot say enough about the staff.  Take a trip to the hotels private beach area, secluded, relaxing time, treats are given and has shower and toilet facilities with a local restaurant, transport by boat or take the 30 minute hotel boat to Positano and back or the luxury mini coach for a 15 minute trip into Amalfi,   We regularly had pre and post dinner drinks in the two bars, both with amazing views, I always went for cocktail of the day! This had light local music entertainment which was a pleasure.   The hotel has a nice little outdoors gym, didn’t use but does the job.   Lastly I cannot say enough about all the staff, they are amazing and again make you feel welcome, above all of the hotel facilities the staff truly make this hotel.  And thank you for the treats in the room. It was a nice touch!   We both would highly recommend the Caruso, it is definitely rated our top hotel of all time and look to come back in the future.…

HOTEL_NAME: Caruso, A Belmond Hotel, Amalfi Coast
HOTEL_LOCATION: Piazza San Giovanni del Toro 2, 84010, Ravello Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: The most amazing hotel I have ever experienced.  Every aspect of this hotel is beyond expectations, hotel grounds and views, rooms, food and service.  Amazing views of the Mediterranean from the hotel restaurants, bars and pool.  The service is far superior to any other hotel.

HOTEL_NAME: Caruso, A Belmond Hotel, Amalfi Coast
HOTEL_LOCATION: Piazza San Giovanni del Toro 2, 84010, Ravello Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: This trip was 2 years in the making since Covid so I was super excited for the time to finally come.   We took a train from Rome to Naples and had arranged a car to pick us up through the hotel. The trip took about 1.5 hours and the road was narrow and full of turns so be prepared if you get car sick. Our driver Johnny was a great driver and took the roads slow which I appreciated.   Our first look when we got there was even better than I imagined. Pictures do not due justice, it's breathtaking. We booked a garden view room which was perfect, it had a big terrace. The bathroom was large and had a dyson blow dryer which I thought was a very nice addition.   We stayed for 5 nights and ate at Belvedere, at the Bar and at the pool and had a great meal at all restaurants. We walked the 5 mins to town a couple of times for meals and drinks.   The pool was outstanding and the main reason we booked the hotel.  The lounge chairs were comfortable and the drink service was great.   We will be back, it was the nicest hotel we have ever stayed. It was pricey but worth every penny.…

HOTEL_NAME: Caruso, A Belmond Hotel, Amalfi Coast
HOTEL_LOCATION: Piazza San Giovanni del Toro 2, 84010, Ravello Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: We planned our trip to Italy and our stay at Caruso, 3 years ago, then the pandemic and other issues... Finally, we realized our dream. We enjoyed the overall stay and the team for their attentiveness and care, everyone was so friendly! We are still talking about our trip with everyone we meet and we are already planning our next. Thank you for all your care

HOTEL_NAME: Caruso, A Belmond Hotel, Amalfi Coast
HOTEL_LOCATION: Piazza San Giovanni del Toro 2, 84010, Ravello Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: We have stayed at the Caruso many times, and it is always outstanding, and developments over recent times have served to make it even better. The spot, right at the top of Ravello, is breathtaking, with stunning views, but particularly amazing from the famous infinity pool. We had two excellent dinners at the Belvedere restaurant - the food is great and the sommelier is excellent - very helpful, and has revolutionised the glassware for the extensive wine list. The new casual dining area is a great place for lunch, and sunbathing in the gardens is a delight. The rooms are beautiful - large, beautifully decorated and very well maintained with huge bathrooms with baths and walk in showers. Many have gardens, terraces and views. An extensive breakfast was included in the rate, and could be taken in room at no extra cost. Lastly, and very importantly, the staff are incredibly helpful. They always go out of their way to try and help - Iolanda was great in organising our stay, and Roberta was very helpful sorting out our dinner reservations, but the whole team were delightful throughout our stay. This is a fantastic hotel to relax in place of exquisite beauty and calm.…

HOTEL_NAME: Caruso, A Belmond Hotel, Amalfi Coast
HOTEL_LOCATION: Piazza San Giovanni del Toro 2, 84010, Ravello Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Beautiful hotel with great amenities and an amazing staff! The view is breath taking. Local shops and town square very close walkable. Pool is gorgeous, with the best view. Staff is attentive and kind.

HOTEL_NAME: Caruso, A Belmond Hotel, Amalfi Coast
HOTEL_LOCATION: Piazza San Giovanni del Toro 2, 84010, Ravello Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: It looked so perfect ….. But I almost got a heart attack when I realized the price for a single night……and that was for an ordinary room……so maybe another time….But I have enjoyed the GM’s answers immensely, he’s a Poet …..

HOTEL_NAME: Caruso, A Belmond Hotel, Amalfi Coast
HOTEL_LOCATION: Piazza San Giovanni del Toro 2, 84010, Ravello Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: We had the best time at Caruso! The service was impeccable, as was the location. The property was beautiful and the staff was so so nice. We are excited to come back and are hoping that it will be as soon as next year!

HOTEL_NAME: Caruso, A Belmond Hotel, Amalfi Coast
HOTEL_LOCATION: Piazza San Giovanni del Toro 2, 84010, Ravello Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: The Hotel Caruso was an absolutely amazing hotel in every way. We stayed there with our daughter and son-in-law and both of our rooms were gorgeous with every detail thought of. The view from our rooms’ private terraces were breathtaking and we loved sitting out in them both morning and evening. The bathroom was the best bathroom I have ever had in a hotel. It was elegant and everything was perfectly thought out for comfort. Probably the best part of the Caruso was the staff. They were all incredibly polite, thoughtful, helpful and competent. We got a lot of help from the front desk staff with dinner reservations and setting up trips for the four of us around the Amalfi coast, They knew everything about the area and were so capable and helpful in setting things up for us. The…

HOTEL_NAME: Caruso, A Belmond Hotel, Amalfi Coast
HOTEL_LOCATION: Piazza San Giovanni del Toro 2, 84010, Ravello Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: EVERYTHING was top notch. This was the best vacation we have ever had as a family. We have been to some amazing places and hotels, including the Belmond Splendido in Portofino, Belmond Castello de Casole in Tuscany, Belmond Encanto in Santa Barbara, One and Only Palmilla in Cabo, etc. Caruso was by far the best - quiet, classy, welcoming, service, food, hospitality, … After a terrible experience at Hotel Villa Franca in Positano, a hotel that does not value the customer, being cherished at every step of the way and made to feel welcome and like family, was a much needed pleasant experience. We were upgraded before we even got to the property by Roberta, and our room was waiting for us. Both the dinners were exquisite, thanks to Alessandro, Marianna and Carmine. Donenico and…

HOTEL_NAME: Caruso, A Belmond Hotel, Amalfi Coast
HOTEL_LOCATION: Piazza San Giovanni del Toro 2, 84010, Ravello Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: After traveling from Venice to Florence to Rome with a stay over at Capri the final leg of the trip at Belmont Caruso was an icing on the cake, would love to come back again. From the infinity pool to the immaculate rooms to great service Constance miles and the most amazing property hotel Caruso is spectacular. The only downside the prices for the room where astronomical more than the Hassler in Rome four seasons in Florence or Belmonte Cipriani in Venice. Not to mention the hotels in Capri not sure why it’s so expensive however the amenities service quality is top notch.

HOTEL_NAME: Caruso, A Belmond Hotel, Amalfi Coast
HOTEL_LOCATION: Piazza San Giovanni del Toro 2, 84010, Ravello Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Belmond Caruso is a hidden heavenly gem in beautiful Ravello. A stay here means you are treated like family.  Every colleague here goes above and beyond to make your stay absolutely perfect! A special shout out to Iolanda for patiently and kindly organizing all of our excursions and tours.  A thank you to the entire concierge team, the front desk team, the doormen, the housekeeping, the pool staff and the entire dining staff. Every single individual was magnificent! I wish I could remember everyone’s name but I can’t! That is because it was not just one person that made the stay special! It was a collaboration of every single individual.  Bravo to general manager Mr. Pacifico for running this hotel the way every luxury hotel should be run.  We will be back for sure! In fact, I…

HOTEL_NAME: Caruso, A Belmond Hotel, Amalfi Coast
HOTEL_LOCATION: Piazza San Giovanni del Toro 2, 84010, Ravello Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: We have been coming here almost yearly since the opening in 2006. This hotel has the best manager and staff in the world and we have traveled a lot. Don’t miss the opportunity to stay at this magical place.

HOTEL_NAME: Caruso, A Belmond Hotel, Amalfi Coast
HOTEL_LOCATION: Piazza San Giovanni del Toro 2, 84010, Ravello Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: We just got back from the Amalfi Coast and can't say enough good things about the Caruso.  Yes, there were two slip-ups - we had booked a table at their Belvedere restaurant via email and they first seated us in the poolside (more casual) restaurant; the next morning, we asked for very early room-service breakfast because we were leaving for a hike before the breakfast restaurant opened and the card placed on our door before bedtime was never picked up (although it said "place by 4 am").  And yes, it is insanely expensive.  But it is hard to imagine a more beautiful place with a staff that, despite these two minor slip-ups, could not be more helpful or nicer. We need to add a particular word about Vincenzo, our waiter in the Belvedere restaurant and at subsequent breakfasts.  He…

HOTEL_NAME: Caruso, A Belmond Hotel, Amalfi Coast
HOTEL_LOCATION: Piazza San Giovanni del Toro 2, 84010, Ravello Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: I visited Belmond Caruso for lunch. I am so confused and in disbelief after my encounter. I found that Belmond Caruso operates in two extremes.  The positive extreme was the concierge staff. Their welcome and support was what I expected from a hotel with this standing; smooth, friendly and professional.  What I also liked is that they allowed us to see the world famous pool. The pool staff was equally friendly, helpful and supportive. Loved it!  But then it was time for our reservation at the Pool Restaurant. I am not sure if we were unlucky to visit at an inopportune time, but the personnel at the restaurant came across as flustered, unorganized and lacking in class. There was no protocol or forethought in how to handle guests while the table isn't ready. We had to step aside…

HOTEL_NAME: Caruso, A Belmond Hotel, Amalfi Coast
HOTEL_LOCATION: Piazza San Giovanni del Toro 2, 84010, Ravello Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: In 1994 we visited the Amalfi Coast and stayed in The Caruso Belvedere . It was an old fashioned hotel which had once been the haunt of the Bloomsbury set and many Hollywood stars of the silver screen. By the time we arrived in was owned by the fourth generation of the Caruso family and we and the somewhat eccentric guests adored it. As Belmond aficionados we have worked our way round the European Belmonds during the post pandemic era. Each has surprised and delighted and made us long to return.  Our arrival was special. The welcome from IOLANDA MANSI and her wonderful colleagues took our breathe away. Italians are so special. The Manager ALFONSO PACIFICO was always visible and in full control of his team. The service was faultless. The hotel has been meticulously renovated to…

HOTEL_NAME: Caruso, A Belmond Hotel, Amalfi Coast
HOTEL_LOCATION: Piazza San Giovanni del Toro 2, 84010, Ravello Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: What an impeccable property with wonderful staff! A special thank you to the front desk team, Fabiola, Roberta, Iolanda and the wellness center team, Francesca, Simona, and Lisa.  Thank you as well to the General Manager, Afonso.    We look forward to many return visits in the future.  —Todd

HOTEL_NAME: Caruso, A Belmond Hotel, Amalfi Coast
HOTEL_LOCATION: Piazza San Giovanni del Toro 2, 84010, Ravello Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Me and my fiancé had one of the most unforgettable experiences at the Chef’s Table at the main restaurant of the Hotel. The food and setting was amazing, but most of all, Vincenzo, our waiter for the evening made the experience even more incredible. Fantastic service. Grazie Vincenzo!!

The hotel is amazing! we had an amazing experience at an amazing location and hotel facilities. the staff is highly professional and welcoming. The food was great and unique. the room (tower suite) was wonderful and exceeded our expectations. everything is precise for small details. great experience. great architecture and internal design.

A perfect experience all around, (echoing what other travelers have stated).  Forestis does not disappoint.   The views and accommodation are second to none.   The warmth and kindness of the staff really sets this already perfect property apart from so many other lux destinations.    We look forward to visiting again soon.

The penthouse here is absolutely exceptional.  It ranks right up there with the absolute best in the world.   Having recently stayed at Portrait Roma's 5,000 euro penthouse, we loved Forestis Dolomites so much more.  It's exceptional. The welcome gift, complimentary bar and gargantuan buffet breakfast were outstanding.  We also stayed one night in a room category below the penthouse and it was also very good.  Thanks Foresis for the most magic stay.

A wonderful experience from start to finish.  The Tower Suite is spacious and comfortable - it smells of Pine, has unparalleled views of the Geisler Group of the Dolomites mountain range, and has pure, clean spring water coming out of the taps. My wife was literally in tears at the beauty of the view as we entered the room - the pictures you see here and on the hotel's website are real, and they don't do justice to how special it is.  The Spa is huge with a variety of different pools and rooms available - an indoor/outdoor swimming pool, a number of different steam rooms and saunas, and my personal favourite, the "forest spa" with an outdoor plunge pool fed by the mountain spring.  The restaurant is well-designed to ensure privacy for each visitor. You sit at the same table each night which is a little unusual - but it enables them to ensure you're addressed in your preferred language by all the staff.  The food at dinner is a delight - both the "detox" menu which is mostly vegetarian and often vegan, and the "regular" menu. Each meal is a combination of simple salads and soups with some fine-dining style plates - it's seven courses a night which means your dinners do take a long time however. The breakfast is perhaps even better with a huge range of tasty, fresh options - the best hotel breakfast I've had in Europe.  We tried the wine tasting which was pricey at 95 euros per person, but the wines were delicious, the sommelier informative and friendly, and the views spectacular. We also did a variety of hikes in the area including a guided hike by "Onkel Herbert", the uncle of the proprietor of the hotel. Definitely worth it, though Herbert speaks very little English, so get ready to converse in German with him or have a phrase-book (or google translate) handy.  Finally, we booked half board which felt easily worth it. The size of the breakfasts and dinners meant that we never needed lunch, but the hotel is pretty isolated so it's not that easy to go out for dinner.  We're already trying to plan how and when we'll return - since neither of us ski, it probably won't be the Winter, but we'll definitely aim to come back next year.…

Stay at hotel Forestis was just amazing…from the moment you enter the hotel you can feel warm atmosphere, you can taste amazing food, enjoy in spectacular view and great design. I just can’t wait to visit Forestis again and thank you for everything!!

We stayed over New Year and - despite the potentially chaotic time of year especially as a new hotel recovering from Covid - we did not notice in the slightest. In fact, it was probably the best hotel we've stayed in. From the views being equivalent across the dining room and Tower Suites, the incredible spa with multiple saunas, swim in & out pool, and incredible food & people, we could not fault it in any way. I am coeliac which can be challenging, but (aside from a couple of minor teething issues) I did not have to worry. There is so much to do in & out the hotel for differing tastes too - while we both ski, we both enjoyed a week of beautiful mountain air and hikes and spa treatments. New Year was a special bonus with all of the stops pulled out. We will certainly return!

Many glowing reviews already. Just stunning. What makes this place standout: the view, the tower suites (lux), the restaurant, the staff (great culture - never say no attitude), the spa, the pool..and the lack of children. We would go back in a heartbeat. Special shout to Luca (sommelier), Giacomo (reception), Laura and Giorgia (restaurant)

Forestis is a beautiful, Nordic-inspired wellness retreat in one of the most beautiful mountain ranges in the world. The location and views are stunning - we visited in the winter so we got to enjoy the snow-capped peaks and cozy ski chalet vibes. The food was one of the highlights of the experience - they create beautiful, artful dishes from local ingredients and locally-inspired specialties. The breakfast buffet allows you to try a wide variety of local fruits, honeys, cheeses, meats and artisanal breads. Dishes are wholesome, health-focused and delicious. Our room was also beautiful with a minimalist aesthetic and great attention to detail. We very much enjoyed the indoor / outdoor pool and all of the unique sauna experiences. Perfect way to unwind and warm up in the winter! Forestis is pet-friendly and goes out of the way to accommodate your four-legged friend. He was able to have meals with us at a dedicated dining area upstairs, and we think he enjoyed the experience as much as we did!…

The new wing of the Forestis hotel opened only a couple of years ago, and what a marvel it is! The Tower suite we booked, mught be the mist gorgeous room we've ever stayed at. Ever. See attached photos.  Service is top notch, and the food is superb.  Hannes the concierge was very helpful with recommendations about hiking trails in the area. We'll be back. Maybe for skiing season.

Forestis is all I dreamt of and more. My husband and I stayed here as part of our honeymoon and we were absolutely blown away by every part of our experience. We were greeted with champagne, flowers and chocolates in our room, and had beautiful roses at our dinner table each night.   Do yourself a favor and stay in the Tower Suite - the floor to ceiling windows mean waking up to stunning views of the Dolomites each morning. The backdrop of the mountains changed throughout the day with the weather and we felt like we were constantly seeing something new.   The hotel is tucked away in the mountains, creating a peaceful environment. The only noise we heard throughout our stay was birds chirping! We loved the spa as well and spent almost half the day there. The outdoor and indoor pools are connected and each heated, making swimming comfortable even with a slight breeze outside. There’s also a great gym and saunas that we took advantage of.   The food at Forestis was next level. We enjoyed breakfast outside on the patio and dinner each night in the stunning restaurant. We loved the privacy of our designated booth in the restaurant for dinner. As a vegan, I was blown away by the pre-fixe detox menu. The dishes were so flavorful and featured local produce that changed each night. Breakfast (which is included if you opt for the half board) was by far the best hotel breakfast I’ve ever had.   We also enjoyed pre-dinner drinks, including a local gin cocktail and local wines, at the lovely hotel bar.  The convenient location made hiking a breeze. The hotel is located directly next to the chairlift that took us up to local hiking trails. We also stopped midway at a local Refugio for some delicious lunch!  While remote, there are several options for getting to the hotel. We flew into the Innsbruck Airport and worked with the hotel to arrange for a driver to pick us up. We unfortunately had several travel issues due to Lufthansa and the hotel couldn’t have been more accommodating - communicating on our behalf to the driver and greeting us upon arrival despite arriving 9+ hours late.   I can’t recommend Forestis enough if you’re looking for a romantic hideaway in the Dolomites, and I’m already dreaming of our next visit.…

You cannot fault this brand new beautiful hotel in the Dolomites. The owners have thought of everything you could need, and beyond. From the beautifully sourced ceramics on the dining tables, the softest bed sheets, the local produce curated so thoughtfully and aesthetically on each serving plate, the pine scented oils that fill the spa, and the heavenly atmosphere and solitude... Calling this hotel flawless is an understatement.  We stayed in a Tower Suite with a stunning view of the mountains and woke up to birdsong each morning. As somebody who loves wellness and fitness, I was overwhelmed in the best way with the array of options. On the weekly itinerary is guided wyda (celtic yoga), hikes, sauna sessions, meditation, HIIT in the forest, as well as options for a true foodie…

This is the BEST accommodation we have ever stayed! The view at the tower suite is simply breathtaking . Breakfast spread was the best we had in Europe!  Love the valet service and the many special amenities as well!  The swimming pool area was really relaxing too

3 night stay on 3rd floor of tower suite (bed and breakfast). We dined twice in the restaurant in the evening, had breakfast and used the spa with treatments.   The whole experience was exceptional; the Forestis team were friendly, welcoming and helpful. The hotel is absolutely beautiful and well considered in its design and layout with great creature comforts in the suites (including refreshments, toiletries etc.). They have accommodated for everything you might need, the porter even ran our car in the mornings to cool it down with the aircon and gave us refreshments for the journeys.   The views which you see from every angle of the hotel are just spectacular! From the moment the front gate opens to the driveway, your breath is taken away.   It is in a secluded spot (about…

Came here with my husband to celebrate our anniversary as well as his birthday. The level of service in this place is top notch. Felt very looked after from the start to the end of our trip. The spa, the views, the food, the design of the hotel, the staff, the ambiance it was all beyond exceptional!  Hands down one of the best hotel I’ve stayed in! We stayed in the Tower Suite and honestly the views were beyond incredible! We felt incredibly relaxed and in awe every second!   Definitely worth a visit and we can’t wait to come back again!  Supriya and Alex

So far the best hotel Ive ever had in Italy! The hotel is family-owned with only 60 units. The interior is perfectly designed, blended with the nature of Dolomite, simple yet elegant - very Zen! All the staffs have positive vibe and their hospitality is beyond your expectation - the attentiveness is super! Ive gone to several luxury resorts and I can say this is one of the best! We took half board package and during our stays, the dinner was exquisite. The ingridients were fresh and well-cooked. I recommend this hotel for anyone wants to spend your days in Dolomite and recharge your zen!

We would rate Forestis as a clear winner in delivering an exceptional hideaway, after spending 4 days visiting for my husband's birthday. Since we love hiking we were outdoors for 5-6 hours on the mountain paths, and the scenery and hiking paths have stiff competition in this wonderful hotel. Incredible design. Incredible service. Incredible food. Quiet, peaceful, privacy and discretion along w the incredible beauty.  We were in a Tower Suite. Definitely worth the extra. Half board was a delight, left so much time to be outdoors as well as in the spa, or simply watching the view from our bedroom.  Really, really worth it. Unforgettable. Our grateful thanks to the team for having conceived this little piece of heaven, and for making the experience superlative!

We took a risk with his hotel as it is relatively new reset of a prior Alpine inn and hardly anyone in the U.S. knows it. We also do not typically stay at minimal, modern hotels. We are a well travelled couple who stays only at 5 stars, and I must say this hotel is truly amazing. It is isolated but in such a beautiful, quiet area with dramatic landscapes and a convenient, low key ski in/ski out area. The decor, interweaving Alpine and modern influence is sublime. Our penthouse suite was a gorgeous wood lined jewel box with pool, fireplace, sauna, kitchenette and front and center mountain views. Most importantly for a remote hotel that is all-inclusive is the food which was incredible in every way - a wonderful fusion of Italian and Austrian, incredible vegan options (the best…

Which I would expect from a hotel with this price level. Reception/Bell Boy: friendly and helpful at all times, nothing to complain Restaurant: the food is amazing (breakfast and dinner), the coffee is awful (although a biological variant, I didn't like it, neither in the restaurant nor the free coffee in the room), I also didn't like the seating system (every day breakfast and dinner at the same place), our table for example was in a place where it was unbearably hot in the morning when the sun shone in Building: there are  no shutters and/or awnings which is not very energy consumption friendly - and house with a concept of sustainability should not miss to have this (it could also solve the problem with the hot places in the restaurant) There is also not cover for the pool…

Of all the reviews I've ever written, Forestis is one place that leaves me truly speechless. From the moment we arrived to the minute we left, we were constantly blown away by every element of the experience: from the design and architecture, to the top-notch service, from the remote setting to the breathtaking views. Forestis is a place you have to see to believe.   Highlights included: - the best Old Fashioned I have ever tasted (and I've tasted my fair share) - exceptional privacy and breathtaking views from the Tower One penthouse  - a level of service that goes beyond 5-star (when we called down for anything, like requesting a fire be lit in the fireplace, there was someone at our door practically before we'd hung up the phone) - a completely unique dining room design where…

There are great resorts, and then there are places like Forestis -- incredibly special places that stay with you long after you leave. If you're considering a stay, think no further and just book it. It will be one of the best travel experiences of your life.   The resort is situated to offer stunning views of the Dolomite peaks from just about every angle. No matter how long you stay, they will not cease to take your breath away. You can spend hours gazing at them from your balcony, the spa, and the restaurant. Design elements across the resort, from large to small, are all perfection: seemingly custom stoneware, local botanicals, high-quality textiles and glassware, etc.  Rooms are clean and chic, with the modern natural vibe feeling restful and calming. The splurge on a tower…

Our stay at The First Roma Dulce Hotel was flawless from start to finish!  The staff were absolutely amazing- extremely helpful and professional. They really went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed to feel at home. One of the best things about this hotel is the breakfast…wow…best hotel breakfast we have ever had. Also, the patisserie counter was amazing! Big shout out to the chefs and waiting staff for making our stay so memorable. Our suite was very comfortable and spacious. The provided toiletries and towels were high quality.  The hotel is located within comfortable walking distance to Rome’s best sites and is surrounded by great shops and restaurants. And a 10 minute taxi to the main train station.   Overall we highly recommend The First Roma Dulce if you are looking for a five star boutique hotel experience with friendly staff who are extremely good at their jobs.…

From the check in To the check out we were treated like royalty. Everyone in this hotel is super friendly and professional.  Service is impeccable and the breakfast is definitely the BEST we ever had not to forget the delicious pastry’s.  We will be back here for sure. Thank you again to the Staff at the First Roma Dolce.

Exceptional hotel  Very stylish  large rooms and Amazing breakfast  The staff were extremely friendly and attentive Superb Location  Perfect for a treat  Highly recommend hotel for a perfect stay in Rome  The treatment from the manger exceeded our expectations

This hotel in part of 3 hotels around the same area, each provides different experience.  Once you book one you can enjoy the others. Very nice and helpful front desk and one they have one of the excellent breakfasts.  The room was well equipped with some gym stuff ,  big mirror ,sauna and a balcony.  Amazing.

We stayed at The First Roma Dolce to celebrate my partners birthday and our anniversary. The staff, from reception to security to valet service, were extraordinary. They were kind, friendly, payed attention to detail and went absolutely out of their way to make our experience magical. We had free upgrades throughout our entire stay as well as our room being decorated with chocolates and balloons. The rooms were beautiful - detailed with marble and super beds! Superb breakfast, lunch, pastries and drinks at the most beautiful bar. This will be the only hotel I am coming back to at Rome, would 100% recommend this to everyone wanting a magical experience of the city.

Best location to walk around the heart of Rome City. Piazza di Spagna, Pantheon , Fontana di Trevi, Piazza Navona, Piazza del Popolo, all walking distance as well as the best luxury shopping boutiques. The staff is very kind and the room comfortable and spacious. Luxury modern taste. Highly recommend for a solo or a couple visit, maybe for a family would be too small.

Staying in the hotel was the best part of visiting Rome  Amira at the reception desk made our stay 10 times delightful she assisted us in check in with super ease then managed to get us tables at the best spots in town in the same day! I highly recommend the hotel and ask for Amira she is a super woman!  Breakfast was very good with local selection of cheese and honey and jams.  Many thanks, Reem

We stayed 3 nights and upon arrival, there were some issues. But the staff was very quick to handle and they did with excellent results. Pros: Great location in the center of Roma, Beautiful dining room and delicious, outstanding breakfasts (the honey variety is the best ever), large suite with all the amenities and more, very helpful staff, very clean and new. Cons: Too much automation for lights, drapes, etc. not easy to work (and I am in that industry), very thin walls- can hear everything in the rooms that have adjoining walls (very loud children next door), on main street so will hear noises of late night party goers. We would stay there again and the upgrade to a suite is a must! Grazie Mille Dolce! Molto Bene!

The hotel, location were phenomenal. Also the staff were incredibly superb. Hotel: modern luxury cozy. Breakfast was delicious. The rooms, classy with woods & marble. Location: one of the best location in Rome wherein in the center of the city and shopping.  Staff: very welcoming people specially Amira she was so helpful for discovering the city and supportive as well.

First time at the First Roma Dolce.  pros: breakfast is good  Suite Dolce was nice but abit dark for my liking (personal preference). Very central location and walkable prettymuch everywhere Francesca from front desk very good and helped resolve some issues as well as took our feedback seriously.  Cons: housekeeping abit of hit and miss. Shoebag provided once and never replaced - would have been nice if they provided 2 shoebags - 1 for each of us in the room. Same with the notebook etc.   For a 5 star hotel, water is not complimentary. So we had to lug bottles from the carrefour express. Not impressed on this point given how much you for a room a night.  We would stay here again because of Francesca - very sincere and good service from her and the other members. But we hope the hotel will take these points and consider upgrading what they offer for the price of a room.…

Great experience!! Small problem at arrival but Solved immediately by the the hotel manager. Everyone in the hotel very friendly and helpful. Breakfast at the hotel was amazing. We Definitely will recommend this place !!! Can’t wait to go back.

it was the first time for me to stay in this hotel but I will absolutely return, everything is really nice from the ideal location, a very delicious breakfast and the room that was very tidy, last and not least a very special thanks to Amira in reception who took care of every tiny detail to make my vacation really easier, I really would come back just to see her again and enjoy her hospitality  😘❤️

This was truly an amazing stay!   We were slightly worried about the location being in such a busy street in Rome but the hotel was absolutely fantastic! It was close to all the major shopping areas, great local restaurant recommendations from the staff.   We had stayed at a “5” star hotel during our Rome trip and booked additional nights at this hotel and there was no comparison . This hotel offered the best customer severe we’ve experienced during our travels.   I wished we would of stayed here our entire trip!   We will definitely be staying here again!

What a wonderful place what a great hotel . Great location great service . We had book a room without a bath and I was not happy so the following day the changed out room to a wonderful suite .  Full breakfast  with white glove  service  . Thank you for hosting us❤️

We stayed for 3 nights and I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. The hotel is located centrally enough to walk to all the major sites, and with plenty of eating places nearby. The room was modern and beautifully clean. The included breakfast was excellent, a choice of almost anything you could wish for including eggs cooked any way requested.   All the staff, from the doormen to the reception staff were friendly and informative.

We stayed at the First Roma Dolce for the first four nights of our two-week honeymoon in Italy. From the moment we arrived, our stay was amazing! All of the staff were incredible. The hotel staff, upon finding out it was our honeymoon, let us check in early (at 10 AM) and upgraded us to a gorgeous suite! The room was very spacious, with a very comfortable bed, blackout curtains, tons of closet space, and a huge shower and bathtub. It was also very quiet. The concierge also set up some amazing dinner reservations. The hotel is very well-located  - we walked almost everywhere. We are so glad we chose to stay at this hotel while we were in Rome, and hope to be back!

The best hotel in Rome !   Everything is nearby and it’s in the center of Rome.  Hotel staff are the best they will make your trip even better!   Manager Danielle was very helpful   And the Staff Amira , Malk and all of staff will make your trip to the best👍  Everything is walking distance from the hotel, luxury brands, restaurants, famous districts 👍  I would recommended 3-5 nights in Rome 👍  Enjoy Rome 😉👍

Exceptional city break stay. The staff went over and beyond to make our stay as special as possible. Amazing breakfast with lots of choice and very friendly staff. Would recommend over and over and revisit again. Had a lovely 3 nights here but would have stayed longer if we could.

A fantastic little hotel - stylish and in a great location. Room was  great with comfortable bed and oozing Italian attention to detail. Brilliant staff who were always willing to help with anything from tour booking s to printing flight documents. The hotel is on one of B the best streets in Rome but it’s not noisy at all at night. Loads of restaurants within a few minutes walk and only about 2.0 mins walk to all the main attractions in Rome. Breakfasts are amazing!

Wonderful hotel in the city centre, newly opened for every tourist who is looking for comfortable stay! Fresh design, amazing service and importantly - delicious breakfast :) Staff is very kind and helpful!  Definitely come back, the ideal hotel in Rome! Highly recommended for everyone!

I brought my mother to Italy (Florence then Rome) for her 70th birthday.  It was her first time, and a return for me.  We both appreciated the beautiful location of the hotel, the friendly and efficient staff, and the room accommodations.  I will be sure to stay again, and recommend to family and friends.

We lost our luggage upon arriving in Firenze and couldn’t recover it even after 4 days thanks to the completely dysfunctional Firenze airport customer service. Nobody at the airport answered the phone…so we started to call the airline and our Amex travel protection and finally we found that the luggage was indeed in the airport but for some reason according to the airport automated system -“they are still searching for it”. So we asked the Portrait staff if they can go to the airport and help us look for the missing luggage as we were already in Milan. They didn’t only find our luggage but also helped us arrange a taxi to deliver it to our Milan hotel 1 night before our flight back to LA. A true rockstar service team at Portrait and I highly recommend them.

My Mum, sister and I just stayed at the Salvatore Ferragamo owned Portrait Firenze for 3 nights. A wonderful hotel with an outstanding view of the Ponte Vecchio. We loved the friendly, helpful staff who went above and beyond to make our trip seamless, fun and packed - last minute restaurant recommendations, tickets for the Uffizi, a motorised buggy tour, best place for coffee and cake and so on. A particular mention must go to the two amazing Matteos. We will be back!

Portrait Firenze is in the perfect location for visiting Florence.  Steps to the Ponte Vecchio and in walking distance to all of the Plazas, Squares, gelato shops, restaurants and all of the main tourist attractions.  The staff were all extremely friendly and helpful!  We had a bedroom and living area which had a sleeper sofa.  We also had 2 bathrooms.  The four of us had more than enough room to lounge and not get in each other’s way.  Our youngest said that the sleeper sofa was ok and our oldest said that it hurt his back….but with that being said, I have yet to find one sleeper sofa to be comfortable.    The breakfast was amazing and picture worthy and the little area out front was perfect for an afternoon Spritzer while relaxing.  Highly recommend!!

We enjoyed our stay at Portrait Firenze. As it was our first time visiting, we appreciated the central location and its proximity to the other side of the river to explore different neighborhoods such as Piazza Santo Spirito. We felt very welcome upon arrival, and we enjoyed the included breakfast (based on our room rate) each morning. We noticed a variety of guests staying there—couples of all ages, families, etc. Being a fan of Salvatore Ferragamo, it was v enjoyable to see the integration of the brand in the room decor, toiletries, and more. We had free access to the Ferragamo museum though ran out of time to visit it unfortunately. Our hotel card provided 10% off at various sister hotel locations, too, such as La Terrazza. Compared to other hotels where we stayed in Italy (also 5 star), Portrait offered the most pre-visit communication which was certainly a prelude to the high-touch concierge approach from all staff — (versus just one or two go-to concierge). Because we already purchased your tickets and planned excursions, we did not need to take full advantage of the concierge offerings; but it was obvious that if someone needed assistance planning or replanning their entire Firenze stay the concierge would 100% be able and willing to help. The only mild disappointment was that we could hear conversations of other guests through the main bathroom wall, and we heard a lot of slamming (doors? the room above? was unclear) at various points in the evening. That said, things seemed to quiet down at some point in the evening until the next morning; and we didn’t complain to the staff, as we chalked it up to the age of the building and part of the experience. The turndown service was good, and they provided a complimentary bottle of water each evening. In summary, we appreciated how welcomed we felt throughout our visit.…

Couldn't have been better.. location and service were amazing, the staff's assistance in planning restaurant reservations, a vineyard tour with private driver, helping make train reservations, everyone was so friendly and keen to help. A perfect time from beginning to end.  Thank you to everyone. Highly recommend.

The best location possible, staff was excellent, service great, rooms amazing! Thank you for a wonderful experience! Will be back in a few months! Make sure you call the hotel in advance, if you drive.

Our first visit to Florence was amazing thanks to the Portrait hotel.  They went above and beyond what we could have asked for and made our stay as comfortable as possible.  I would highly recommend and will definitely be staying here again the next time we visit!

As a family, staff did an exceptional job of making the trip special for my 5 year old daughter.  Rooms are good and guests must opt for the river view.  Bathrooms are miss however either being too small or outdated.   Also, some confusion about hotel breakfast with what is included and what is not.  Used to breakfast being all-in once you opt for room with breakfast.  Hotel staff were nice enough to remove it from the bill to clear the confusion, however was an embarrassing situation.   Nonetheless, overall the property is great and recommended.  Highlight is the staff and service.

We had a terrific time at Portrait Firenze! The staff was incredibly attentive and enthusiastic about helping us celebrate our daughter’s bday during our stay. It’s also in a perfect location in the center of Florence with picture perfect views of the Ponte Vecchio.

We loved this hotel so much! Incredible location, gorgeous room and the service was fantastic. The breakfast in the morning was so lovely because we could eat it outside right on the Ponte Vecchio! Highly recommend.

The Portrait Firenze is the perfect hotel for touring Florence.  It located centrally by the Ponte Veccio which allowed for easy walks to all the major sites.  Some rooms have views of the Arno River.  All the rooms and suites are elegantly decorated.  The staff were very attentive, and the restaurant was excellent.

Great hotel. The experience started off very bumpy.  After a long travel day we were provided the wrong room- promised a family suite with 2 bathrooms.  When asked, the hotel admitted the error.  It quickly provided an alternate room - a family suite with 2 bathrooms on a higher floor.  However, when it came time to move, the help to transfer a family's worth of luggage was not good.  There was a lack of communication and it ended up going late into the night.  And the new room was not exactly ready for us as it should have been.    HOWEVER, the very next morning the hotel manager was EXTREMELY responsive to the situation.   He met me for an espresso and we discussed the issues in very specific detail.  The staff clearly brought him up to speed on the situation, and he…

The location, staff, service, and food are all amazing! When we arrived for our honeymoon, they upgraded us to the penthouse to make our stay extra special! It’s hard to beat being right in the middle of Florence and next to the Ponte Vecchio. The staff helped arrange transportation, tours, and dinner reservations. We will definitely be back!

The hotel and its surroundings are beautiful and the location is perfect. The design is timeless, stylish and extremely comfortable. Our favorite thing about the hotel was Francesco who went above and beyond to make sure that we were comfortable. Francesco was extremely helpful, professional and very kind to suggest restaurants and answer any questions we might have about Florence and the surrounding towns. Even after we left Florence, he offered excellent dining suggestions. The entire staff at Portait were very kind, helpful and professional. The breakfast buffet was both delicious and beautiful. Our rooms were spacious and comfortable with everything you would ever need.

Phenomenal location, service and food.  This place was so amazing I actually changed my plans to go back.  Close to town, shops, food and an amazing view of the Arno.  Rooms are extremely spacious,  meticulously designed and clean. Room service was quick and everyone is extremely customer service oriented.

Just had the pleasure to stay at the Portrait Firenze for a 5 day trip.  The room was first class with the best view of the Arno River and the Porto Vecchio . Breakfast in the morning was amazing.  Staff is always friendly and helpful for any of our needs. The room was spectacular.  Just big enough.   i will for sure return and stay here again. Very comfortable bed and in the best location to see everything in the city.

We were recommended to stay at the Portrait by our wedding hosts. Our room was beautiful and comfortable, the staff was beyond helpful and kind and we absolutely loved the location.  I think those Ferragamo’s have a future in luxury design! 😂

This hotel is outstanding. the location is great, the food is delicious, but maybe most importantly, the staff is excellent. the open every door, they thank you for being there, and they whatever it takes to make your stay wonderful.  The only way I will go back to Florence is if I can stay at this hotel. It is a 10 on the 1-10 scale.  Get ready to be spoiled.

We enjoyed our stay at the Portrait.  The concierge team was incredible and worked hard to make dinner reservations for us at the perfect restaurants suited to our tastes.  The hotel management made an extraordinary effort to find a more quiet room when the first one wasn't the right fit.  Our assigned concierge went above and beyond helping me find a physician to remove sutures.  The entire hotel's team from concierge to housekeeping were professional and responsive.  One caution to those who are sensitive  to noise, The Portrait is located on a very busy section of the Orla River, a stones throw from the famous Ponte Vecchio bridge.  Mostly it was quiet at night, but on weekends there was the hubbub of young having night on the town.  The rooms were well appointed with…

HOTEL_NAME: Maalot Roma - Small Luxury Hotels Of The World
REVIEW_TEXT: Right in the center of it all, but you walk into an oasis of charm, comfort and impeccable service! Our room was ultra clean, well-designed, and large with high ceilings. I can't say enough good things about Maalot Roma. I wish there was one in every city!

HOTEL_NAME: Maalot Roma - Small Luxury Hotels Of The World
REVIEW_TEXT: We have just returned from the Maalot Roma and it was simply wonderful! Such a stylish hotel and the website pictures do not do it justice. If you worry that the sales pictures won't be matched when you get there, don't be as it's as beautiful in person as it is on the web. However, what takes it to a whole higher level are the staff. From the moment we walked in to the point we departed they were stunning. Attentive, warm and helpful and honestly the staff made the stay for us. A nice hotel is one thing, but staff trying their best to make your stay enjoyable is so wonderful to experience. Patick and Vitaly were superb but I could not give this review without mentioning Francesca who is the jewel in the crown. What a wonderful person she is and a highlight of our trip to Rome. Thank you.…

HOTEL_NAME: Maalot Roma - Small Luxury Hotels Of The World
REVIEW_TEXT: we stayed for 5 nights in Hotel Maalot. beautiful hotel, very friendly staff that are welling to go beyond to please visitors. we were upgraded to a beautiful suite due to street noise in our room. rooms are clean, well decorated, lovely atmosphere & comes with free minibar. the Hotel is located in the heart of old Rome & all attraction within walking distance. we defiantly recommend to family and friends and come back again!

HOTEL_NAME: Maalot Roma - Small Luxury Hotels Of The World
REVIEW_TEXT: I just returned from a 2 week vacation throughout Italy and one of the highlights of my trip was to stay at Hotel Maalot. I never expected for a hotel stay to be a highlight more in a country like Italy that has so much to offer. The hotel staff is beyond friendly, the hotel and the rooms are clean and have great taste in decor.  This experience started as a nightmare turned into a dream. I booked to stay in Rome at a different hotel directly in front of Trevi Fountain. Upon checking in and  going up to my room I was met with false publicity as the hotel was a nightmare. I stepped out to eat and bumped into the restaurant at Hotel Maalot. While having lunch I inquired about staying at Hotel Maalot and from the beginning the staff was helpful to my needs; especially given my circumstances that I was not going to sleep one night at the previously booked hotel. I was booked at Hotel Maalot for 4 nights and it was the best decision ever.  I wish I remembered the name of the staff but from the gentlemen greeting at the door to the two young ladies who manage the hotel to the employee who helped me I believe his name was Andrew. Thank you for making my stay in Rome wonderful.  It was nice to come into this hotel and room after a long, hectic, warm day in the city. To enter a room with amenities; no words to describe how happy I was of my decision to stay here. Thank you all at Hotel Maalot.   Juan Morales…

HOTEL_NAME: Maalot Roma - Small Luxury Hotels Of The World
REVIEW_TEXT: We spent 2 nights at this stunning stylish hotel.  The suites we had were spacious and well thought out. Beautiful linen.   The service was personal and impeccable.  The location was perfect for easy sight seeing, shopping and restaurants.  Will definitely be returning.

HOTEL_NAME: Maalot Roma - Small Luxury Hotels Of The World
REVIEW_TEXT: One of the best hotels I’ve had a chance to stay in. Have been coming to Rome quite often but this was a great find. The staff makes you feel at home from day 1, the room is extremely comfortable, the attention to detail is unmatched and the quality of the service is excellent. Would highly recommend to anyone looking for a unique 5* experience  Won’t even mention the gym which is genuinely world class.   A massive congrats to the entire team at Maalot for making this a splendid location that I’ll be coming back to every year.

HOTEL_NAME: Maalot Roma - Small Luxury Hotels Of The World
REVIEW_TEXT: Stayed three nights at the Maalot in mid-June with my wife and two teenagers.  While the scene outside the hotel can be quite chaotic due to its proximity to the Trevor Fountain, the hotel is truly an oasis and a nice escape from the hustle and bustle of central Rome.  All staff we encountered were friendly, attentive and eager to help with securing tickets to sites around Rome and reservations at great restaurants.  Laura, Antonella and the rest of the front desk staff/concierge were fantastic.  Same is true from the restaurant staff (I unfortunately don’t remember everyone’s names).  We had two room facing busy Via fella Murate, but once in our rooms, we never heard any sounds from the street.  Maalot Roma is a gem and we would not hesitate to stay again on our next visit to Rome.…

HOTEL_NAME: Maalot Roma - Small Luxury Hotels Of The World
REVIEW_TEXT: Lovely and surprising hotel in the middle of the strip between Pantheon and Trevi fountain. All main sites easily walkable. Lovely quiet rooms even though it is in the middle of the tourist area. Brilliant staff. Good breakfast and cocktails.

HOTEL_NAME: Maalot Roma - Small Luxury Hotels Of The World
REVIEW_TEXT: Although we only stayed one night, we had a beautiful stay at this fairly new hotel .  I traveled with my sister and 2 adult daughters.  We had perfect adjoining rooms .  The hotel is located in a perfect area that is walking distance to the Trevor Fountain.  The hotel is beautifully, eclectically decorated.  The art in the hotel is so interesting and fun to look at.  The service was impeccable.  The breakfast included in the restaurant had a great variety and was delicious .  We had a nightcap in the bar and also had a great experience.  It is in the center of town, but not too noisy .  We had a beautiful stay .

HOTEL_NAME: Maalot Roma - Small Luxury Hotels Of The World
REVIEW_TEXT: Our only regret was that our stay at this wonderful boutique hotel was too short. On arrival we were greeted warmly and were made to feel special. All of the staff were so friendly and nothing was too much trouble. Our room was extremely comfortable and tastefully decorated and looked out onto the bustling street below- just a short stroll to the Trevi Fountain. We had a meal in the Don Pasquale restaurant in the hotel which was delicious and memorable. This is also where they serve a lovely breakfast.  When we next come to Rome it won’t be a difficult decision where to stay.

HOTEL_NAME: Maalot Roma - Small Luxury Hotels Of The World
REVIEW_TEXT: Maalot is a gem in the heart of Rome. A brand new hotel situated a few steps from the Trevi Fountain and a short walk from Piazza di Spagna or the Pantheon or Piazza Navona, in a lively pedestrian area.  We were staying in a prestige room which was absolutely wonderful and extremely spacious and quiet for Roman standards. While outside the world is spinning inside it is totally quiet.  The design is just amazing. Every corner of the hotel is so beautifully decorated, that it’s worth staying here just to enjoy that. The personnel is outstanding, so attentive, friendly and kind. You have the feeling of being indeed their guest, not a paying customer. It’s the perfect spot for visiting or doing business in Rome since you can easily come back and relax like you were at home.  The…

HOTEL_NAME: Maalot Roma - Small Luxury Hotels Of The World
REVIEW_TEXT: We stayed here in late May as a base from which to explore Rome. It is fabulously situated in the heart of the city with most of the main attractions being less than a 30 minute walk (the Vatican is a bit further). From the moment of arrival you are treated like a long last friend - the hospitality is fantastic from everyone and we felt very welcome. The reception/concierge team are very happy to make suggestions for your stay and equally like to know how you find particular trips - their advice seems right up to date.   The hotel has a relaxing classic / contemporary feel with a nice terrace just on the street from which you can have a drink or something to eat and watch the world go by, with the Trevi Fountain a 2 min walk away.   We had a superior room which was very…

HOTEL_NAME: Maalot Roma - Small Luxury Hotels Of The World
REVIEW_TEXT: Stunning in every aspect! We stayed 2 nights at this most incredible hotel. Location is ideal, the rooms as nice as any luxury hotel that we have stayed in, and the staff were the kindest and most helpful that we have ever came across at any hotel. The Maalot is the real deal. Well deserving of its 5 star ranking!

HOTEL_NAME: Maalot Roma - Small Luxury Hotels Of The World
REVIEW_TEXT: My husband and I had a two night stay at the Maalot Hotel and we would like to praise the team on their wonderful service in welcoming and making us feel comfortable at all times. In particular, Laura, Ionita and Gian Luca. Entering the foyer for the first time I smelt a beautiful scent which was their diffuser (I asked them for the name of the brand and I have now ordered this online for my own home). The scent and vibe of the hotel was so wonderful and it has stayed with me since.  The room itself was outstanding, comfortable bed/pillows, amazing toiletries and a great set out with the interior. It made you really feel a sense of calmness and relaxation.   My husband had a small injury whilst we were staying at the hotel (not related to the hotel) and the staff attended to him…

HOTEL_NAME: Maalot Roma - Small Luxury Hotels Of The World
REVIEW_TEXT: A beautiful hotel in an extremely central location. I am so particular about hotels, especially in central Rome due to the noise - this one couldn't have been quieter, so at last a good night's sleep! The staff are also excellent and so accommodating. Extremely clean, great design, excellent breakfast. I couldn't recommend this hotel more.

HOTEL_NAME: Maalot Roma - Small Luxury Hotels Of The World
REVIEW_TEXT: The staff at Maalot are wonderful and always happy to help. The design is stunning and the rooms are generous with walk in closets. Daily breakfast is delicious and the beds are very comfortable. Highly recommend this hotel. Also very close to Trevi fountail, Spanish Steps and Pantheon. Loved it!!!

HOTEL_NAME: Maalot Roma - Small Luxury Hotels Of The World
REVIEW_TEXT: A charming hotel in the middle of historic city centre, while still being able to completely retire and relax in the beautiful rooms. Laura, Ioneda, Giancarlo, Francesca.. the whole staff actually, gave us a warm welcome and assisted us with all our needs. Breakfast in the wonderfully decorated restaurant was a nice start of the day. We hope to be able to visit the hotel again soometime soon!

HOTEL_NAME: Maalot Roma - Small Luxury Hotels Of The World
REVIEW_TEXT: We spent 6 nights at this new, very lovely and modern hotel. It is squeaky clean and new and decorated impeccably. We stayed in one of the suites and it is spectacular. The bed is very, very comfortable, the tub and shower are amazing and the hair/soap products in the room are fantastic. There is a lot of space to unpack and put your clothes in the closet. We arrived to the room to find prosecco and some delicious treats with a warm note from the staff! Thank you! The mini bar was included as well as lots of water provided at no extra charge. I can't say enough about the staff/concierge. All are very dedicated to making your trip an amazing experience. They are warm and inviting and can't do enough for you. I felt like I was visiting family! Thanks to Laura and everyone for…

HOTEL_NAME: Maalot Roma - Small Luxury Hotels Of The World
REVIEW_TEXT: We stayed here last minute when our original reservation fell through- on the busiest day in Rome. No rooms but here for over $1500. But it was well worth it. a large one bedroom suite with large closet and bathroom. Our did not have a tub though. We slept so well and it was so quite. and the morning complementary breakfast is so delicious. Highly recommend staying here. Only downside was that the shower heads in the huge marble shower are not very strong to get out shampoo and the main bedroom gets very hot if the parlor doors are closed. The staff were amazing and so helpful. got us a last minute spot in the parking garage and went out of their way to help with luggage and other things.

HOTEL_NAME: Maalot Roma - Small Luxury Hotels Of The World
REVIEW_TEXT: As a luxury travel advisor specializing in Italy, I have been very fortunate to see and stay at many luxury properties in the eternal city of Rome. But I have not experienced anything quite like the eclectic, bright, and perfectly designed Maalot.  Just a minute’s walk from the Trevi Fountain, it’s hard to find a more central location on the very popular pedestrian street Via delle Muratte.    To reach the check-in desk, we walked through the stunning and colorful restaurant Don Pasquale, where we were met by the super friendly reception manager Laura and General Manager Eduardo and offered a delicious spritz from the cocktail bar. What a way to start the day!  Our spacious room was beautifully decorated in cheerful colors and designer fabrics.  The bed and pillows were…

This hotel deserves every one of it's accolades. It's visually stunning and so charming. Everything from the food to how they serve bellini at apperitivo is perfection. The staff are so kind and helpful. I will be back to see you next year. Thank you so much

We stayed here for two nights. Experience was amazing! Our room was in the third floor facing the ocean view. The views where spectacular. Room was large very clean! We also had dinner at the Michelin (Terrazza Bosquet ) restaurant in the hotel.  I love the convenience of walking downstairs to the restaurant.   Breakfast was included in our stay. One the most beautiful rooms in the hotel, I believe also the oldest.  Buffet style was perfect a grand selection of food. Very good and delicious. All the staff was so friendly and helpful. They have a lady playing piano during breakfast and majority of the tables have an ocean view. Just lovely!   In the evening we got some cocktails to enjoy the view outside it was so beautiful. Also, the hotel has a great view of sunsets! They have a lady playing piano outside in the evening too.   The hotel offers an elevator to go down to the port if you are thinking of catching a ferry to any of the islands. Again the convenience of walking to the elevator.   Location was perfect right in the center of town. You will have to walk through a beautiful garden pathway to exit. Super private and only for guest. In fact they have a guard at the entrance of the garden verifying only guest enter.   Strongly recommend this place. Enjoy…

Had great stay here this year - the continuity of staff being a particular strong point. Nice to have buffet breakfast back - after two years of covid restrictions. We are looking forward to coming back.

We booked this hotel last minute in Sorrento. There is a Michelin star restaurant on the property we were intending to go to for our anniversary, though unfortunately it was closed the night we were there.  Due to the restaurant being closed, Mauro and his team went above and beyond to make our anniversary special.  They upgraded us to a wonderful suite with a huge terrace and had the Conceirge book us at another good restaurant nearby instead.   The room was impeccably decorated and felt like it was in a castle.  Sumptuous fabrics and wallpaper adorned the room and there was a huge bathtub, which we loved.  It’s a great location right in the heart of Sorrento with spectacular views.  The breakfast was decent, though my favorite dish was the spiced cake. It was divine! I would definitely recommend this hotel.…

We have just returned from a fantastic week in this Hotel, what a wonderful place. The staff were so helpful and friendly and we have to mention our favourites. Tina, Dora and Cortana from housekeeping were amazing and do a wonderful job in the rooms, they were so friendly and would help you with anything. Also Giuseppe, Giovanni and Francisco in the dining room were especially helpful and friendly. I can’t say how much we loved this place. They also put on a mid-summer party which was fantastic, professional singers and dancers, just wonderful. Thank you for such a lovely week!

This hotel activates all five senses.  Coupled with an exceptional staff, time spent here is true luxury.    Situated in a magical location, no detail was left unattended.  From the perfectly manicured gardens to an exquisite interior aesthetic and pool area, Excelsior Vittoria overloads you with beauty and charm.  The dining experiences at each venue offer instant satisfaction and excitement for your next meal.  This hotel is pure pleasure.  We will certainly be back!

After a couple of days in Capri we arrived in this beautiful hotel in Sorrento. Our room was with a magnificent seaview and all the amenities included were  beyond any imagination. One of the best hotel we been during our honeymoon. The staff were so nice and kind and the breakfast was amazing! Thank you

I knew little about the Grand Hotel Excelsior Vittoria when I booked. Previously when I visited this area i have always stayed either on a boat or in Capri. It turned out to be a wonderful discovery. An independent hotel with a long history that can match or surpass the best of the luxury brands in every way. The location has breath taking views over the Bay of Naples from Vesuvius to Capri. The service was impeccable. We didn't get to try their premier Michelin starred restaurant but their 'pool restaurant', the L'Orangerie, provides outstanding seafood that  didn't leave us wanting. I am not sure which restaurant provided the room service food, but it was of fine dining standard too. The Terrace drinks over golden hour for the sunset and beyond provided the magic that this part of the world is rightly famous for and the pool was fabulous for the kids.  Really thank you to the team, after three years of no travel, we found a new, for us, fabulous hotel that epitomises this region and the joy of travel.…

Probably the finest hotel I have stayed in in my nearly 50 years of travel for work or fun. An incredible experience. We had a suite overlooking the bay of Naples with a perfect view of Vesuvius. Lavish buffet breakfast, great pool, friendly staff exquisite gardens. Treat yourself!

Truly amazing hotel, and I must applaud the concierge staff (Marisa, Elisa and everyone else there) for all of their help leading up to our trip. They go above and beyond! They helped with restaurants, booking a boat for a day, and any other questions we had. Not to mention top notch hotel!

This hotel is situated in the heart of Sorrento. It has stunning views particularly from the sun terrace area where you can eat and drink. Whilst slightly expensive it is well worth the money. The service was excellent and the staff very friendly.

Service was impeccable they literally ran when you needed something. Very accommodating, let me into the gym early.  The rooms are beautiful and very clean. Excellent experience.  The hotel grounds are beautiful and the view from the terrace was amazing.

We stayed in 6 high end hotels through Italy and this was by far the worst ever!!! First the service was poor almost like they did not want to be bothered with anything.  Then to top it off the bell hop lost our luggage which contained important medication, all our stuff for the week and they could not be bothered, did not acknowledged or compensated us and continually lied.  Want a five star hotel, with five star service this is not it..stay someplace else

Beautiful hotel, lovely walk to the entrance of the hotel.  Beautiful decor though out  very Italian.  Great location with views looking out over Naples and Mount Vesuvius and you walk out onto the town centre.  Breakfast was outstanding great choice and you can ask for anything from the kitchen as well.  Great pool and lovely surroundings,  rooms are beautiful and we had a balcony view which was amazing.  And you can get a lift down to the harbour.  Will be back soon.

As usual Fantastic , Best hotel ever. Personable  service, Great restaurant, exceptionally clean. We’ve gone there in 2017,2021 and 2022. The Excelsior has had the same great staff who are all wonderful. We will be returning in 2023. Picture from our terrace

Our family (of eight adults) spent four glorious nights at the Grand Hotel Excelsior Vittoria. From the moment we walked into this beautiful oasis in the centre of Sorrento until we left, we were treated like royalty. The room & terrace views are amazing, the quality of food was beyond 5 star - especially the Michele’s Terrazza  Bosquet and finally the staff - unbelievable high quality of service & friendliness. This was our first visit to the hotel and we are now converts to an annual visit. Well done Tiziana and all the staff 🙌🙌🙌🙌

We were staying nearby and wanted to go onto the terrace for drinks.  Walked down the long drive and went on to the terrace with our friends.   There were no tables with four chairs so we were carefully moving two from another unused table when the waiter rushed up and told us not to do that, and sent us further along in the dark to another table.  There we waited and waited, then noticing that one had to access the menus by phone - which we always find irritating - we found to our horror that there was a minimum of 25 euros per person.   Not wanting to spend almost £100 on 4 drinks, and anyway had not been approached by anyone to see what we wanted, we left.
