Walked round the corner to the Foreigners club which has an equally gorgeous view - good service, and more reasonable…

Though located in the center of Sorrento, The Grand Hotel Excelsior Vittoria seems more like a seaside resort than a hotel.  Entering from the land side, you pass through a long driveway, bordered on both sides by trees and beds of flowers.  At the end of the driveway are several elegant buildings joined by enclosed walkways.  Behind the buildings is a dining terrace, and at its edge a balcony overlooking the Mediterranean.  To the side of the long driveway are a spa, a swimming pool, tennis courts, a large grassy area for ball games, a lemon orchard, and a large vegetable garden.  Service at the Excelsior Vittoria is exemplary.  The hotel has a high staff-to-guest ratio; there is a separate concierge station.  We particularly want to thank the hotel’s tireless general manager,…

We stayed five nights at the Grand Hotel Excelsior Vitoria in May 2022. The facility is beautiful but some of the details were not quite right. The staff tries hard but is not quite genuine. I give it four stars, because it is beautiful, but fit should be five stars for the price I paid. I found it a little lacking.

Staying here was on our bucket list and it has not let us down. We were here for 7 nights. Our large room with balcony (306) overlooking the Bay of Naples and the hive of activity that is the Port below was immaculate. The doors to the balcony keep all the noise of the port out. Large comfy bed and huge en-suite. Room service impeccable. The staff are friendly, helpful and fun. Great pool, pool bar and team of staff ensuring you enjoy your time by the pool.  Buffet breakfast with menu options is a great start to the day. Still recovering from covid not all restaurants were open - evening meals only available in the Michelin starred Terra Bosquet (an excellent theatrical culinary experience). Sorrento is, of course full of eating opportunities so this is not an issue.  We would…

This is our 3rd year staying here and it gets better each time! We travel around Italy and end our vacation in Rome- They treat us like family each year we return   Its a small boutique hotel in a great location- Its elegant, sophisticated, beautifully decorated and beyond charming- The breakfast is a 10! Best cappuccino in Italy This time we ate dinner  in their restaurant and had the most amazing food and dinning experience- Gabrielle is a true chef and the staff is wonderful-  Can't say enough wonderful things about the staff-

If you love small luxury hotels, this is your spot. Everything was incredible from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. Every single person on staff is kind and friendly. The rooms are lovely, comfortable, and well cared for. Small touches were so appreciated. The rooms were serviced with care and detail, the turndown service was great, the breakfast was delicious, the bar had fantastic cocktails, the front desk was swift and knowledgeable. Cannot overstate how much the team here really contributes to a wonderful experience, which makes being cozy in a stunning room even better. Absolutely love this hotel and did not want to leave!

Hotel Vilon is the perfect exquisite five star boutique hotel in Rome.  I originally planned to stay 3 nights but extended to 9 nights due to the above and beyond service from Annabella and her team, incredible breakfasts (the eggs Sorrentina were my favorite), stunning decor with exquisite details everywhere you looked and individual rooms.    I stayed in two rooms thanks to a very special upgrade for the first 3 nights to the terrace suite - if you can, definitely book a stay in this room.  My 2nd room still had a lovely view of the garden and was quiet, luxurious and beautifully decorated.    It was one of my favorite places I've ever stayed and a huge thank you to Annabella and the entire team for making my stay so special!

We have stayed in many hotels throughout Europe and this experience was by far the best ever!  Annabella and her team offered exceptional customer service throughout our entire stay. And when I say team, I mean the entire team from the front desk to the porters to the restaurant and bar, to housekeeping and the kitchen/chef.  They also offer WhatsApp communication for any pre-stay questions as well as needs when in Rome. Extremely responsive and helpful communication channel for their guests.  This is now our "go to" hotel in Roma.  Grazie mille Annabella and team! We hope to see you again soon!

This a beautiful small hotel in Rome. Superbly managed, amazing rooms, fantastic food and  thoughtful, warm service. Just lovely. Now that we've found Hotel Vilon will never stay anyplace else in Rome.

I know everyone says hotels like the Hotel Russie are the best in Rome.  It does have great amenities like the courtyard dining, but we really wanted something a bit more intimate.  So we thought we would try one of the "Small Luxury 5 Star Hotels".  We picked Vilon because it has an elegant high quality restaurant, a fun bar, is hidden from the mobs and has AC and king sized beds.....Annabella and her team were key to our trip being the BEST trip my wife and I have ever had....really!  We felt like it was our private hotel the entire stay and that is not easy to do.

Excellent small luxury hotel in perfect location. Amazing staff all very helpful. Arrived early morning after 20 hour flight and room wasn’t ready as hotel was full. Was well looked after with breakfast and a comfortable seat in the lounge area. Introduction from the manager who then personally showed us to our room and explained the fascinating history of the building. Also received a substantial room upgrade which was a real surprise and delight. Highly recommend getting a room with a terrace and serene view over garden of the Pallazo Borghese.

We loved this hotel so much - one of my favourite hotels I’ve stayed in. The location was perfect and the hotel was beautiful. The rooms were new, large with beautiful bathrooms. We were upgraded to a garden view which I loved ! The staff were great and really helpful in organising restaurants and tickets for us. The breakfast was the best hotel breakfast I’ve ever had! Would definitely stay here the next time in Rome !

We loved this quaint, boutique hotel in the heart of Rome! Our room was very comfortable with a balcony. The view from the balcony was of the gardens and nothing that exciting. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the bathroom luxurious. The room itself is small, but that is standard for Europe.  The breakfast was delicious, and the dining room was gorgeous. The property is a bit pricy, but overall we truly enjoyed our time here! The staff is accommodating!!! We would return!

Beautifully appointed luxury hotel in the heart of Rome located near the Tiber and a short walk from Piazza Navona  From the welcome we got at reception to the farewell when our taxi came , everything was perfect.   Well appointed rooms , nice bar , the barmen great at  recommending drinks ,  great food , especially the dinner we had on our last night.

I have some parameters when choosing a hotel: I like smaller, luxurious boutique properties with some history in quiet locations.  The Hotel Vilon checks all of these boxes and so much more.    The service was impeccable - I thought maybe this was because I have a fantastic travel agent in the Virtuoso network, but the five star reviews speak to the amazing service that this hotel provides. The hotel is small, I think there are only 18 rooms and suites, but it is beautiful, a jewel box of amazing quality.  We had a junior suite and a very comfortable sofa, a tv that swiveled between sofa and bed (although there is very little to watch in English and we couldn't get our phones to work with their streaming software).  I love a nice bathroom and this one was beautiful.  Super…

Hotel Vilon is the best hotel I have stayed in. Attention was given to every detail, the staff and manger was amazing, decorations and art was so unique and curated, and the rooms were large. Small luxury hotels is a great group of hotels, but this one has stood out as top. Highly recommend visiting and staying on your next trip.

The Hotel iVilon is a gem!!! It is located on a chic, but understated, quiet street right off the river, and close to everything in the center of Rome.  The Hotel is quite new and totally stunning. The decor is very stylish, elegant and totally comfortable, all the same time. It is a small boutique hotel and each room, no matter what the size, is super comfortable and decorated with great taste! The beds are fabulous as is the bedding, the pillows and all the amenities. The bathrooms are well appointed and complete with everything you could need. The fabulous  a la carte breakfast was served with elegance and grace with some of the most delicious treats you could ever imagine. From the fresh juices, the fresh fruit, to the bakery cart, everything is there. They will make you…

We chooses between JK Place and Vilon , in fact they are really really close to each other, more so than we thought. Anyway we are happy that we are staying at Vilon, everyone is very friendly and professional. Help with booking cars, tours etc. The rooms are nice and comfortable. Breakfast is amazing, very good quality and nicely presented. A perfect place to stay in Rome, highly recommended!

Weird hotel … Too modernistic.  Too many steps. Fell couple of time.   Phone system totally crazy. Doesn’t work.  Light switches weird.   Location in a narrow street not good.  Many taxis will not even go there.   Showers … water temperature uneven. Will never stay there again

As we entered the front door we were greeted by the most helpful staff. Beautiful entrance so well kept with a beautiful bar and sitting area. As they got our rooms ready, we were served some of the best Italian cappuccino and latte. Once we got to our lovely decorated room, we noticed how clean it was (which for us was very important). The shower is amazing and the bathroom easily has enough room for two people to get ready.   Closely located ( 5 minute walk) to the Spanish steps for amazing shopping and views, or 10 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain. This 5 star hotel is in the perfect stop for pretty much all you would want to do in Roma.   The staff was so helpful, nice and always willing to help you get a car, find a nice place to grab a bite or recommend delicious gelato…

This small boutique hotel was just beautiful. Tucked a a narrow street between the river and the Spanish Steps, the location was perfect to walk to all the key sites but quiet and bespoke enough to feel like we had the place to ourselves. We loved the decor and room sizes and loved the quality of the food and drink served there. But the real highlight was the staff, at the front desk, the bellman and the waiters. They all made us feel very special. They were quick to respond to all our requests, large and small, and had some great restaurants recommendations. They were all just lovely people to talk to - about how things were going in Rome as things were opening up, their interest in our experiences traveling through Italy, and, of course, their excitement and joy when Italy won…

LOVED THIS HOTEL. It's perfect. The decor is stunning - simple but elegant. They have a little outside courtyard so you have a mix of indoor / outdoor. My room was great. The shower and closet were bigger than what I have in my NYC apartment!   Staff was friendly and sweet. Concierge was on it. Every time I emailed them, they responded quickly with good answers or solutions. They even wrote me a welcome note with a few little cookies (which I ate asap).   I didn't eat at their restaurant but what I could tell from breakfast, I'm sure it was good.   Location was great. Close to Trevi Fountain and Spanish steps. I felt it was easy to walk to some of these main sites from the hotel. I would definitely stay here again.

Hotel Vilon was an incredible experience from the moment we checked in. The hospitality is like nothing we’ve ever experienced before. We arrived jet lagged at 8AM and they accommodated our early check in. That was just the start of an incredible week. The hotel helped us with things large and small. They got us tickets to all the sites we wanted to see. They noticed we liked still water instead of sparkling and stocked our room only with still water. They got us reservations at busy restaurants at prime times. One night we ordered room service and they showed up in 10 minutes!  The room itself is quiet and looks onto the Spanish embassy’s courtyard. It was really nicely laid out and super comfortable.  The food was incredible. We ate at the restaurant multiple times. The…

We just entered for a drink and we looked so much the disign and the atmosphere That we decided to stop for lunch. The staff has found a nice table Even thought we did not have the reservation. We did love very much the food and the creativite of the cuisine. We Will definitly go back for stay fot the night. I loved the decor and the peaceful mood.

HOTEL_NAME: Grand Hotel Timeo, A Belmond Hotel, Taormina
HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Teatro Greco 59, 98039, Taormina, Sicily Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: We arrived 4th September and was immediately impressed with the reception staff who were all very efficient. Our room had a lovely view of the sea which we wanted. It was quite adequate in size and had a small dressing room attached. We requested a kettle which they brought immediately so we could have a morning cup of tea on the balcony. The breakfast was fabulous and difficult to fault as so many options were available. The alfresco breakfast included a wonderful view of Mount Etna and was simply wonderful. The staff were very friendly and obliging and always attentive.Our rooms were cleaned and sheets changed daily .We used the shuttle bus provided to get to Taormina daily which provided us with a very scenic ride each night.Choice of restaurants on the evening were overwhelming so best to book your favourites .We truly had a great memorable holiday 💕…

HOTEL_NAME: Grand Hotel Timeo, A Belmond Hotel, Taormina
HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Teatro Greco 59, 98039, Taormina, Sicily Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: From pre-arrival to post stay follow up, every part of our stay was truly world class. Travelling with two young children was made easy by the professionalism and genuine care the team had for our stay. I would highly recommend this hotel for any occasion and for travellers looking for a  special experience in the heart of Taormina.

HOTEL_NAME: Grand Hotel Timeo, A Belmond Hotel, Taormina
HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Teatro Greco 59, 98039, Taormina, Sicily Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: We stayed in Villa Flora just next to main hotel and it was lovely and quiet. Hotel popular for weddings and American parties so main hotel could be noisy at times. Service from all depts was excellent. Views from the terrace and restaurant stunning and very comfortable but the wasps and flies were a nuisance and we felt there should be burners or at least citronella to deter them as this works in other hot countries we visit.  The price of drinks was surprisingly high,  even by most five star standards which really adds to the price of your holiday and needs to be considered if you like a few drinks and wine. A small glass of wine was 30 euros. The sister hotel on the beach is a great facility and the shuttle is efficient every half an hour.  The standard at the beach hotel is equally high,  as are the snacks and drinks. These can be charged to your room at the Timeo which is convenient. We enjoyed a complimentary boat trip around the bay which was a nice gesture for guests to enjoy.  Overall we felt that the hotel was the best location in Taormina and the standard was very high, but travellers should be mindful of the need for a generous budget for meals and drinks if planning to use the property's bar and restaurant. There are a lot of nice places to eat in the town which is just minutes to walk.   Also be aware that on the beach,  they don't warn you about jelly fish often in the shallows and further out so many people were being stung before realising the risk. There are staff clearing debris from the shoreline so it looks pristine but the jelly fish are a nasty surprise. We felt that staying in the Timeo was the better property as you have more choice around you,  whereas the beach hotel seemed to have fewer restaurant options in the area. …

HOTEL_NAME: Grand Hotel Timeo, A Belmond Hotel, Taormina
HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Teatro Greco 59, 98039, Taormina, Sicily Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: We stayed here for our honeymoon, and I’ve never seen a hotel where the staff pays so much attention to detail! They all remembered what we like on the first day! Rooms were beautiful and pool was perfect for post wedding relaxation!

HOTEL_NAME: Grand Hotel Timeo, A Belmond Hotel, Taormina
HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Teatro Greco 59, 98039, Taormina, Sicily Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: From check-in to check-out, every member of the staff was incredibly helpful and friendly. The food was amazing. The location right next to some ruins, and walking distance to the city, was perfect. Loved it!

HOTEL_NAME: Grand Hotel Timeo, A Belmond Hotel, Taormina
HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Teatro Greco 59, 98039, Taormina, Sicily Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Great hotel in a wonderful location with superb service. What is there not to like here, one of the best hotels own the island and so well located. With so much on offer it is difficult to leave the grounds.

HOTEL_NAME: Grand Hotel Timeo, A Belmond Hotel, Taormina
HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Teatro Greco 59, 98039, Taormina, Sicily Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: The garden sorrounds the hotel looking the sea. It is very special location closed to the theater of Taormina. We tryed the restaurant and it was very good. I loved pasta alla Norma best ever. The service very good , very hight quality . I will love to be here. Thank very much

HOTEL_NAME: Grand Hotel Timeo, A Belmond Hotel, Taormina
HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Teatro Greco 59, 98039, Taormina, Sicily Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Timeo, a dream place!  Grand Hotel Timeo is one of the most amazing and beautiful places we have ever seen. We got married there, and everyone went absolutely fantastically!   Alessandra Marisca, Mariangela Sapuppo and Roberta Scimone assisted us in the planning of our two-day event, and we could not be happier. They are personable, professional and incredibly kind. We trusted their advice, and we could not be happier.   The rest of the staff is incredibly professional, too. In particular, Orlando and Andrea were outstanding in setting up our tables when we ordered room service, and truly impressed us with their smiles and positive attitudes.   People who served our guests during dinner and the cocktail party that we hosted were incredibly professional and polite. We had simply an incredibly great time there, and were so sad to leave!  Timeo’s property is truly fantastic: the pool, the gardens, and the beautiful terraces take you to the real “dolce vita” concept. Everything is impeccable, elegant and chic. The spa offers great massages, and their personnel is wonderful!   Thank you again for the greatest wedding planning and services!   …

HOTEL_NAME: Grand Hotel Timeo, A Belmond Hotel, Taormina
HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Teatro Greco 59, 98039, Taormina, Sicily Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: This was a very nice large hotel in Taormina. It is very difficult to find - I recommend having them coordinate a transfer for you. The staff was very nice. Concierge was helpful. He arranged a lovely tour of a winery on Etna. The room was musty, unfortunately, but that would be my only complaint. Maybe it’s time for a renovation or maybe this particular room had an issue.

HOTEL_NAME: Grand Hotel Timeo, A Belmond Hotel, Taormina
HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Teatro Greco 59, 98039, Taormina, Sicily Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Having stayed in Italy many times and Taormina once before, this trip to the Timeo was the most spectacular of all.  We had 4 rooms for 5 nights  in the Villa Flora and were overwhelmed by the level of service everywhere. The Villa is beautifully situated as a quiet refuge from the hustle and bustle of the Greek theater nearby.  We had our own concierge and loved the stroll to breakfast every morning.  Speaking of which, the breakfast view of Mt Etna, the gardens  and the sea was  otherworldly. The pool is lovely and provides views of the exquisitely tended gardens that terrace down to the municipal gardens.  A lemon granita appears out of nowhere to cool you mid afternoon.  Drinks on the terrace before dinner provide a fairytale view and are accompanied by delicious snacks - different every night.  The service truly was unlike any we had ever experienced and a shout out to Francesco the bellman, Alberto at the pool,  Lucia at breakfast, Antonio the breakfast captain, and  Santi the concierge.  Staying at the Timeo feels like you have been transported back in time ta an era of elegance and natural beauty - you truly feel the soul of Taormina here  Charlotte and Paul Modly- Tarantino…

HOTEL_NAME: Grand Hotel Timeo, A Belmond Hotel, Taormina
HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Teatro Greco 59, 98039, Taormina, Sicily Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: This is without one of the finest hotels we have stayed in. The service is probably the best we've experienced. The staff were amazing and so was the food. We had a wonderful time. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough.

HOTEL_NAME: Grand Hotel Timeo, A Belmond Hotel, Taormina
HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Teatro Greco 59, 98039, Taormina, Sicily Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Our rooms were immaculate, beautiful and luxurious.  The concierge takes care of everything, with knowledge and care.  The hotel pays attention to every detail of your stay, and their sister hotel being on the beach gives the best of both worlds.

HOTEL_NAME: Grand Hotel Timeo, A Belmond Hotel, Taormina
HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Teatro Greco 59, 98039, Taormina, Sicily Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Our wedding at the Timeo was a perfect day. 3yrs in the planning and delayed due to covid the hotel staff were exceptional. We were made to feel welcome and reassured by all. A special mention for the wedding coordinators Alessandra, Mariangela and Roberta who helped make our day so memorable. If you visit Taormina you must visit this hotel. The beauty of the location and views across Naxos and Taormina are worth the airfare alone. On a clear day Mt Etna is a sight to behold creating a perfect setting.  Thank you all for making memories that will last a lifetime  Stephanie & Warren

HOTEL_NAME: Grand Hotel Timeo, A Belmond Hotel, Taormina
HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Teatro Greco 59, 98039, Taormina, Sicily Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: The hotel and its grounds are incredible and the service was impeccable.  The views are breathtaking.  I have rarely experienced the attention to detail of the hotel staff.  We loved our stay and will certainly be back.

HOTEL_NAME: Grand Hotel Timeo, A Belmond Hotel, Taormina
HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Teatro Greco 59, 98039, Taormina, Sicily Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: Great hotel with a spectacular view on the Etna and right into the town. The expérience to take your breakfast looking at the Etna in the morning is priceless. All the personnel was amazing. The only drawback was the size of our room. A bit small for a king bed. Also the pool is bit small and crowded.

HOTEL_NAME: Grand Hotel Timeo, A Belmond Hotel, Taormina
HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Teatro Greco 59, 98039, Taormina, Sicily Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: We attended a wedding at this hotel. The organisation was faultless, the venue amazing and the staff exceptional. The young lady who arranged the wedding couldn’t have done more, she was wonderful and looked after Steph and Warren better than they could have imagined and this was they way she looked after all of us! Absolutely amazing wedding I just haven’t got room to write the good words I want to say!! Food was amazing, staff service was faultless perfect!

HOTEL_NAME: Grand Hotel Timeo, A Belmond Hotel, Taormina
HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Teatro Greco 59, 98039, Taormina, Sicily Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: amazing experience with a fantastic suite contemplating the ionian sea and the etna volcano just below the greek theater. excellent cuisine not only in the one star michelin restaurant. very attentive service; possibility to use both timeo and sant andrea other hotel (beach) amenities is a clear plus

HOTEL_NAME: Grand Hotel Timeo, A Belmond Hotel, Taormina
HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Teatro Greco 59, 98039, Taormina, Sicily Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: There is something about stepping into a Belmond property that makes you feel immediately soothed and at ease - little glitz, just quiet luxury.  Grand Hotel Timeo is no different, albeit with views of the Greek Theatre on one side and Etna on the other. This was our first time and hopefully won't be our last. Manuela and her team, Santi at the concierge desk, Giuseppe, Andrea and everyone at the bar all made us feel incredibly welcome. Breakfast delivery by Orlando was the perfect way to start each day.  Meals on the terrace, down by the beach were all fabulous. We  thoroughly enjoyed our 4 days there.

HOTEL_NAME: Grand Hotel Timeo, A Belmond Hotel, Taormina
HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Teatro Greco 59, 98039, Taormina, Sicily Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: This hotel is exactly what I was expecting and wanted  in fabled elegance and luxury.  Everything about it is gorgeous and perfect and oozes old world opulence. Two things above the rest: the view from the incredible terrace- if you don’t stay here at least have a drink or lunch or dinner. It’s a dream from an Italian movie. The other is it’s proximity to the Ancient Greek theater. It’s FEET away. Also feet from town.  The only negative isn’t about the hotel and I hate to even include it in the review, but once you leave Taormina, Sicily is drowning in trash.  If you’re here you must see the rest of the island. Complete Greek temples, the villa Romana del Casale in Piazza Armerina (look it up).  But be warned, you’ll see LOTS of trash along the roads, in the streets, everywhere.

HOTEL_NAME: Grand Hotel Timeo, A Belmond Hotel, Taormina
HOTEL_LOCATION: Via Teatro Greco 59, 98039, Taormina, Sicily Italy
REVIEW_TEXT: I would have given this hotel a 5 star rating had they not missed on the following 2 points. We stayed for 3 nights at this amazing property. The staff is super friendly and attentive to help and the site is stunningly amazing! The first shortcoming is breakfast. The buffet is not a real buffet since you need to wait for a staff to serve you from behind a counter and the choice is limited. We stayed in many luxurious hotels and breakfast at Timeo is average compared to others. The 2nd shortcoming is the fact that we booked a room with a king size bed to find out that the bed is 2 twin beds put together.

Great location and hotel with superb staff and service. A happy team makes for a happy ship. Delicious food and wine. Personalised feel to looking after you. Always smiling and helpful even after an exhausting season.

Our stay would have been pure LA Dolce Vita if not for complacent, 3rd rate suppers at Cip’s and a hopeless bar experience  I have noticed so many improvements since our last visit. Although there is a pillow menu, the standard feather pillows we were provided with are the best one will find anywhere. The new luxury bath towels make such a difference and the bedding is now top quality. Pity about lack of tissues in bathroom. Rooms and suites however enjoy a special 'feel' which should not be mistaken by guests as being outdated, rather they are classic, beautiful, elegant and exactly what is expected by returning guests. Modern twists are carefully blended in, such as television rising from a period style cabinet. This hotel feels like home.  Having stayed at a few of the top hotels in Venice over the years I'm able to make a fair comparison. The loveliest hotels are of course the older hotels including the Cipriani and the Danieli. If you want something modern and new then stay at the JW Marriot (it's a particularly good JWM and could have been branded a Ritz Carlton) and it also has the 2nd best pool in Venice. The Very Best swimming pool to be found in Venice is of course at the Cipriani, where the Olympic sized pool comes with exceptional pool service. Relaxing by this pool takes some beating, not only in Italy but anywhere. Pure La Dolce Vita !  The choice of flowers in red and white outside all balconies compliment the property better than ever as do the floral arrangements throughout the hotel especially opposite the boutiques.  There is now a room next to reception where guests are welcomed. We received a marvellous welcome from Michael (who has been at the Cipriani since before the previous management). On arriving I found there was a new managing director, Mr Marco Novella, who used to head London's unbeatable Lanesborough Hotel. Returning guests will have no problem noticing the improvements.  We were however very disappointed with Cip’s restaurant. We had a table at Cip’s two nights running. Some of the food was tasteless, far too much olive all used which made two different turbot dishes actually taste greasy. I feel complacency has set in and we would never go back. On top of which one of the staff was not very kind or helpful to my wife when she asked for help during a total deluge of rain, my wife actually felt that the staff member was rude to her. I certainly found that the restaurant manager was not interested at all we’re on our second night I tried to explain that the food was disappointing. Both dinners at Cip’s were 3rd rate. I only complained the first night in the hope that they would resolve their kitchen problem ready for our second night. No such luck. We stay at the Cipriani so we can stroll over to Cip’s, then relax at the bar and enjoy the property. Walter the barman has gone and the standard has gone down. There is no consistency in the way cocktails are made and as for a Bellini, don’t bother. Sometimes there is far too much peach purée in the mix, other times there is not quite enough. Sometimes you get a full glass of Bellini, other times it comes 50% full of froth. For a perfect Bellini go to where it was invented, Harrys Bar where it is always perfect and consistent.  Given the price is charged at the restaurant and bar, guests are entitled to a good standard. Also, the Cipriani used to have a really great pianist who gave the bar atmosphere at night. On our first night, after dining at Cip’s, the atmosphere at the bar was reminiscent of being in a morgue. The live music was a monotonous dirge. We stood for two minutes and decided we couldn’t face it. The management should take a leaf from the wonderful entertainment at Belmond Splendido in Portofino where there is a fantastic atmosphere during and after dinner. On the second night the five piece band were monotonously going through the motions from their sheet music. No feel, no personality and no atmosphere.  On a positive note, the breakfasts at the Cipriani are very good indeed. Also all of the staff at breakfast are lovely. They are so friendly and welcoming and extremely together that it makes for a great start to the day. After staying for two nights at the Cipriani we moved to the Danieli Hotel. The offering at breakfasts at the Cipriani are easily twice as good as at the Danieli. However the Danieli bar at night has great atmosphere and a wonderful pianist who also sings who was so good we spent over two hours…and a lot of Euros, at their great bar. The wonderful Danielli cocktail list put the Cipriani list to shame.  Of all the top of the hotels in Venice, we would not normally consider staying anywhere except the Cipriani. With poor F and B (apart from breakfast) and a depressing night bar, our need to stay at the Cipriani is no more.  While the hotel accomodation itself was starting to get a little tired, this has been reversed by the new manager. Service, rooms and suites, the extensive gardens, facilities...everything (apart from Cip’s and the bar) is better than ever. As for the pleasure of breakfasts...the setting is so lovely and the service so perfect that it has to be unbeatable in whole of Venice. There used to be a bird problem at breakfast as well as a wasp problem at certain times of the year. Not any more. Annoying birds who would try and steal food in front of diners are now frightened by the sight of a hawk been carried about the restaurant by an experienced hawk handler. Problem solved. Brilliant. More top hotels should do this. Also on every table was a plastic contraption with wasp food inside so instead of bothering diners the wasps are attracted by this, have some food and then fly away. I’ve never seen this before anywhere.  Cipriani really should deliver the most wonderful guest experience as do so many of the incredible Belmond hotels around the world at other amazing locations, especially in Peru. One of us was staying at Belmond Iguazo Falls, Brazil earlier this month and that was off-the-scale exceptional ... and their restaurant was Belmond at their best. Incredible cuisine.  One final word of praise...Andrea, who greets and helps arriving guests climb off the various boats...(not always simple especially with older and disabled ) guests .... provides a careful and considerate service...no matter the water level. in fact arriving to a welcome from Andrea and Michael (reception manager) is lovely.  All things considered, I can’t give the Cipriani a five star rating for this visit and we don’t feel like returning. I am going to review Cip’s in detail separately. At no point did I ask or expect anything to be deducted from our hotel bill. I tried to pay the bill in full on departing however the Cipriani insisted on not charging us for one of our two dinners at Cip's. This did not make up for the disappointment caused (we had brought an 80 year old relative to Venice with us for her first ever visit) but at least the failures were acknowledged by the hotel manager.…

Excellent five star service throughout our two nights stay. This was our second holiday in the Cipriani in 4 years and we intend to return. Consistently excellent standard of service and quality of experience.

I was a little disappointed which I didn’t expect to be. Don’t get me wrong, this is a stunning venue. Beautifully set, the facilities are incredible, the bedrooms are beautiful, the linen on the bed is heaven and the food is exceptional.  What disappointed me was how we were treated by some of the staff. When we arrived our check in was rushed like we were an inconvenience, the gentleman couldn’t get rid of us quick enough to check in more guests. Not at all what I expected from such a hotel. At breakfast there were staff in abundance but they were highly inattentive and we struggled to gain attention several times. Honestly it felt like there was a tiering to guests and we were bottom of the pile. Such a shame for a hotel we had been so excited to visit and for such a special trip for us.…

The Cipriani holds a special place in my family's heart, as does Venice. Coming back after three years missed because of covid, we were unsure what to expect.  We got perfection as always before. The week we were there was at the peak of the summer's heatwave 42-45 degrees (108- 113 F) each day. The staff, our friends, were on their A game. Truly perfect Italian service, effortlessly welcoming and helpful but unobtrusive in the Italian way. The hotel remains the oasis of calm it has always been, tucked away in Giudecca, but for the first time, the famous pool came into its own. There is something ridiculously luxurious about drinking Bellinis at their spiritual home around this magnificent pool.  Whatever the world throws up, the Cipriani seems to take in its effortless style.

My husband says this is the most lovely place we have ever stayed! A private water taxi took us from the car park right to the Cipriani dock across the lagoon from St. Mark's. Cordial and private checkin with a glass of Veuve Cliquot! We were upgraded to a huge room with lots of storage, beautiful bath and with huge terrace overlooking the Olympic size pool! We enjoyed 2 lunches on the covered pool terrace and fabulous dinner at 1-star Michelin Oro. Service including the pool attendants was friendly, concierges were awesome. Cipriani's continuously-running private water shuttle docks in their dedicated slip right on St. Mark's Square making it super easy to tour the city. Need a Covid test before cruise and got it right at the hotel.  Beautiful grounds and facilities. Simply spectacular - what a special treat!…

Really enjoyed my stay at cirpirani and will be coming back. Spacious hotel with a lot of great amenities and beautiful grounds. The pool is great and the rooms are spacious and modern,the staff is jovial and attentive.

Perfect in every way - possibly the best hotel we have ever stayed in.  From the moment we were greeted at the airport, to the moment we departed, we loved every moment in Venice and on Guideca island where the hotel is.  Exceptional staff and service.

Wonderfull place , exceptional location but sooooo expensive that it cannot be bad …  Concierge at the top level, breakfast is amazing . Pool service is really below hotel standard (super slow , not organised etc ) . Unfortunatly almost impossible to smoke in the entiere ( almost ) hotel .  One of the Kind . Once in a life

My husband and I just spent two nights at the Cipriani in Venice . We had the most wonderful service and nothing was too much trouble . All the staff were polite and helpful but with a warmth and personal touch that made you feel very much at home and not just another guest  passing through the hotel . We will definitely be going back next year .

Having enjoyed some incredible experiences at other Belmond hotels, the Cipriani was the obvious choice for our celebratory return trip to Venice. We had forgotten that the city is so beautiful and we would definitely recommend the Cipriani for a special occasion. It was a perfect romantic oasis with some stunning views, whilst being located just a 5-minute ride from St Mark’s Square in the hotel’s private water shuttle. The service here was truly exceptional. We were treated more like old friends and VIPs from start to finish. Ahead of our stay, Tomasso was extremely helpful in booking private tours etc and our guide Teresa was one of the best. All the staff were welcoming and attentive, without being overly stuffy – a real credit to the hotel. The welcome bottle of champagne…

This is a gem of a hotel that improves every time we go there. The staff are exceptional, particularly the breakfast staff. We are made to feel incredibly welcome and will always return. If you want to get the best out of Venice this is a perfect launching pad.

This was our first stay at the Cipriani but cannot be the last as it's spoiled us for other hotels now . We've stayed in a few other Venetian five stars but the Cipriani just elevates the resort experience to another level.  It felt like a cocoon looking after us and when we did venture into the bustle of town we looked forward to getting back home to the Cipriani every time  It's often the little things.... always a guiding arm to disembark the beautiful shuttle boat, a plate of fresh peaches in the room to greet our arrival,  gifts from the turndown service like sweets and beauty lotions. A generosity of approach like endless mineral waters for the room , chilled water and Evian spray by the pool, wonderful Acqua di Parma bathroom products.  Then the big things, those must do…

Exquisite.  This grand old lady simply never fails to take your breath away.  You know from the moment you set foot on the private boat that ferries you from St.Marks pier to the Cipriani’s private pier. that you are a privileged guest and  part of something incredibly special.  An insanely  beautiful room with the terrace overlooking the pool area. Champagne on ice and Aqua Di Parma toiletries. All serve to cocoon you in a luxurious bubble. You feel as though you are a million miles away from the hustle and bustle,  that is Venice.  Cocktails at the Gabianno bar were superb,  Walter, the legendary icon, having worked there for over four decades, was wonderful. Service was impeccable.  We indulged ourselves in dinners at the Cips club. It is a culinary experience, as opposed to…

Highly recommended for the overall service level of the hotel and the quality of the restaurants, although Oro should demonstrate more flexibility by offering an à la carte menu. The attention, kindness and availability of the hotel staff are really outstanding. The accomodation goes beyond expectations. This hotel is a true gem in Venice.

For us, the Cipriani Belmond Hotel is the best hotel in the world. Since several years, we love to come this wonderful place with all its wonderful amenities: The lovely place with its superb garden, its terrasses, the pool, the pool bar, the extraordinary breakfast, the restaurants, the boat shuttle service to San Marco and the extremely friendly and customer-oriented service of all team members.

This was our 40th visit to Cipriani. It’s our special place. While it could use some refreshing. It is still magnificent. The staff is wonderful and the food is great. Don’t miss the breakfast on the terrace

Slight hiccup with our room but all sorted.  We had the most relaxing stay , everyone we encountered was helpful and charming. Special mention to the ladies at breakfast and the concierge team outstanding.  The property certainly needs updating in some areas ( bathrooms , pool bar ) but this is a unique hotel we have stayed at the Gritti  and preferred it here. Cant wait to return !

A perfect combination of truly outstanding service, perfect location, excellent food, splendid pool and gardens, and thousands of unique details. Your day start with a perfect breakfast on a spectacular laguna view and ends at Cip’d with another spectacular view, on San Marco. In between, flowers, gardens and pool- and Venice of course. wish I could come more often

What a trip ! 3 night stay to celebrate my husband’s 60th birthday. Firstly thank you to the hotel for the room upgrade, chocolate cake and bottle of champagne placed in the room all were fabulous. Room was large sufficient storage and spotlessly clean. Amazing Aqua Di Parma toiletries to slather yourself in. Only downside was they only had one key for the room but hardly a hardship.   Reception and Concierge extremely helpful when planning how to get to restaurants.   Hotel pool whilst pretty cold was again spotlessly clean and managed. Amazingly comfortable sun beds with glorious fluffy thick towels, complimentary water either still or sparkling  Great service in the bar, loved the guy with the hawk who has a tireless job keeping the pigeons at bay. Delicious bar food…

From the time we walked in to the moment we left everything was spectacular!  First of all, we got upgraded to a suite, which was very unexpected and probably not the best for my expectations at other hotels going forward. LOL. The room was over-the-top beautiful and glamorous. During our stay, we realized we had taken the keys from our last location in Spello. The concierge was great as he immediately told us “no problem” he would have them overnighted the next day. The only complaint was the fact that we were only there for one overnight stay before flying back home.   Overall it was one of the best hotels we have ever had the pleasure of staying.  Thank You

A 5 star hotel with 5 star service. Location is walking distance to the Fountain of Trevi, Spanish steps and a nice shopping mall.  The staff was very accommodating. The room was very clean and spacious. As a frequent traveler, I highly recommend this hotel.

Convenient location, helpful staff, and nice facilities. Special thank you to the concierge team who were outstanding. Recommendations were great. Thank you! Overall experience at the hotel could not have been better.  Definitely staying here next time we’re in Rome.

Great location on Via Veneto; a quick walk up the road to Harry’s Bar or the Borghese Gardens.  A short walk to the Spanish Steps and Via dei Condotti.  Beautiful old building with spacious, well appointed rooms.  What set the experience apart was the quality of the caring staff.  From check in to departure; the staff could not have been more accommodating.  Definitely take the time to have an Apperitivo at the Brunello Bar and Restaurant.  Best Aperol Spritz of the trip.

A beautiful hotel with luxurious interior. Excellent and very prompt service from all of the hotel staff, especially those on the reception desk. The guest rooms were beautiful and the standard of cleanliness was excellent.
